reviews: I love their food! Hot, fresh, clean bright flavors. I've eaten from them many times. I'd give a 4.5 if possible.Top picks: szechuan spicy fish fillet, beef and scallion, sauteed garlic bok choy. Their white rice is so good man, yes the simple white rice. Delivery is primo: fast and hot. Their lunch special deal is amazing: great prices and good portion size.When dining there, service can be hit or miss, but the food makes up for it.Had the chicken wings and the takoyaki once, disappointed, but what would one expect ordering that kind of food at a Taiwanese place lolThey are open late but the food quality is definitely hindered when ordering within the last 45 mins before close.> A friend who comes here regularly brought us here for lunch on a Saturday. They do not seat you until your entire party is here, but there was no wait for a table of four. We ordered the fish in paper wrapping in sour cabbage. If you plan on having any of the three "fish in paper wrapping" selections, make sure you put in an order for those as they take about 30 minutes to make. They also take up a lot of space, so you should try to finish your other entrees quickly. The staff will let you know in advance that your fish is ready and they will be at your table, trying to make space for the huge vessel that they cook the fish in. I believe it was Crucian carp that we had. It was super tender as it was cooked with the juices from the veggies and fish itself. It blended perfectly with a bowl of white rice. While we were waiting for our fish to cook, we also ordered their famous spicy beef scallion pancake. One of my friends who is from Taiwan said this is by far the best one she's had in the area. We all agreed it was really good. We also had mushrooms with Chinese greens, soup dumplings, and salty fried chicken. All big portions and worth the money.> DONT COME TO THIS PLACE!Very rude services!Poor service during entire meal. No water provided at beginning and you have to ask, when I asked, they gave only one cup of water to both me and my husband. ALSO they blocked me at the corner where I sat and COMPLAINED about tips, they literally talked shit and showed bitch face in front of us, and tried to push me to give them more tips, this is totally ridiculous!! Their poor service doesn't deserve any tips!I highly not recommend anyone come to this place! I'll never come back again.> I love the food here and it's one of my go to spots in Quincy as well as for Asian food, in general. I find the portion sizes to be smaller than your average Asian family-style place but it's also the perfect amount. Every dish is so well made with the perfect amount of flavor. I've brought friends and coworkers here and have gotten them hooked on some of my must-try's here, like sweet corn with salty egg yoke, twice cooked fish filet, and deep fried diced chicken. I've never had anything like the corn before and I have never seen it offered anywhere else either. Other dishes that I normally order include salty fish fried rice, minced beef with cilantro soup, sauteed spinach with minced garlic, shredded pork bamboo shoots with dry bean curd, and dry cook string beans with minced pork - all so so yummy too!No doubt the food here is amazing but I knocked off a star for the very long wait times (it's always busy... but I guess that's a good thing?) and nearly claustrophobic seating. Service can be 50/50 depending on who serves you but, generally, they just want you to be quick about your order, eat, and get out. Fortunately, food comes out pretty quickly after you order!> The four stars go entirely to their soup dumplings. I am so glad that there's a restaurant in Quincy that serves good soup dumplings so I don't have to drive into Chinatown when I want some. They prepare it pretty quickly too! I guess the other good part about the restaurant is that they have lunch specials where you can order 2-3 items for a certain price. It's a good restaurant for family style since you can order multiple different dishes that are inexpensive. There's a variety of vegetarian food as well. I don't recommend ordering fried calamari though because they are bland and not at all crispy even when you eat it in the restaurant. Try the scallion pancakes and beef stirred fry with broccoli, you can't really mess those up!

What an amazing place . Been open for about 6 months and this is my 5th visit ...better than KFC, and the service is so wonderful . The girls at the front are so friendly and they hand you the drinks with a smile that makes me want to come back for more! Yay!> 3 spice levels of fried chicken with sides like curly fries, cheese curds or sweet potato fries AND the ability to add Kung Fu Tea boba to your meal?  Believe it - it's TKK + KFT's wonderful marriage!  So healthy for the soul but maybe not so good for the diabetes/heart. That said - being a southern transplant up north it's been tough to find just a good ol' fried chicken but TKK fried chicken is awesome and surely hits the spot.  I never feel gypped by the size of the pieces and the amount of chicken and the quality seems pretty consistent. Service can be slow and when they first opened wait times were up to 45 minutes+ for a small order.  That said - as the hype has died down I haven't had to wait that long since but don't be surprised if you still end up waiting 10 minutes+. They're extremely generous with the sides - would recommend the curly fries or the sweet potato fries they have many other options that are good. Note that this is all street parking and on busy days you might have to park and trek over but typically on the weekdays the parking is wide open. Personal preference -  Two piece dark meat - spicy. (it's really not that spicy) and curly fries. And if you're feeling bougie - medium iced honey green tea - less ice.> I took my kids on Wednesday while driving back and grab some snack before dinner. Got the chicken tenders for them and some drinks. The kung fu tea drinks are typically pretty good. But what surprised me was the tenders. It was juicy inside and crunchy outside and very flavorful. My kids said it was best chicken tenders. They wanted More. So we went back last night to get some more for dinner. I got the kids more tenders and I got myself  some fried chicken. Once again the tenders are great. I got spicy chicken. Got two wings and a breast. The wings are very good, juicy and little crunch on the outside. Normally the breast piece is dry from other chicken places like KFC. This breast piece was juicy and flavorful all the way in. I see spices inside the meat. It was a little big on the spicy side, so be warned.Overall the chicken are great. Hey...U can get your bubble tea fix here too.> Chicken wings: they hooked it up!! Ordered 8 and got about 10. Lightly marinated. Some pieces are more salty than others. This one was made to order. It came out hot and crispy. These aren't the best I've had but since it was made to order(maybe it was the only time they made it to order?) , I'd get it again if I had a wing craving. Dark meat 1/4 combo: comes with curly fries, biscuit and a small side. This one came out faster than the wings. Curly fries were dry when I got home. Didn't get to try this chicken. Mild crispy flavor. My sister said there was a bit of honey flavor to it. Taro slush: really good creamy taro flavor. Love the sweetness in it. Almond milk tea: almond flavor is too light. Not sweet at all. I do not recommend this.> Side order of the wings... it is really fresh, juicy, and crunchy. The meat have flavor sauce too... my guess is that they marinated overnight... alittle spicy... way better than KFC fried chicken but somehow I still preferred popeyes fried chicken more.

I can go on and on about this place, but I won't. I'll just say this " Lobster stop" sets the bar, foolish me.Thinking I can Travel  to P town, Plymouth even Kennebunkport looking to enjoy great battered haddock, lobster roll.etc.Not so! Learned quick, "Lobster stop" is the place you wanna be for great seafood,don't look any further or you be wasting your time and money!There's no need to discuss menu items , everything here is a home run, trust me !Things you should know before heading over.Mon, tues closed.Also deep fryer is closed during certain months limiting your menu options.But that doesn't stop customers from coming.why?Because it never disappoints... nuf sed!> stopped in for a carryout lunch yesterday.  ordered a single lobster roll, clam chowder, onion rings, and fish and chipsi walked in to order and waited in the dining area with all its chairs up.  plenty of social distancing made possible.  i kept myself away from the cashier station.  about 10 minutes later, someone walked up to me with my food.went to a local beach to eat in the car with a view.  to my pleasant surprise, the containers for the fried food where perforated.  i love when restaurants take the time to do this.  the humidity vents, keeping your fried food as crisp as possible.  the plastic bag used was also not tied.  i love little details like this.  it shows experience and care.the food:overall the seafood was fresh.  lobster roll - it came with a bag of lays chips and pickle.  the lobster roll was good overall. it was a little more mayo than i personal like, but that's just a personal preference.  fish and chips - pretty standard.  a side of tartar sauce, pickle, and i think coleslaw came with.  i personally like a specific type of batter but that's a personal preference.onion rings - it's the flaky batter type, they were still pretty crispy despite carryout.  props to the restaurant again for the perforating in the carryout containers.clam chowder - pretty good.  it wasn't overly creamy, diluted, and tasted on par. this place is a good pit stop for me when i'm heading down to the beach somewhere nearby.  i would definitely stop here again.> A good place to grab a lobster roll after a long nice park walk. Looks like we were lucky since the place was not very busy when we turned in. We preordered food by the phone so the service was very quick. I liked lobster roll although this might not be the best ever one you will try but it is definitely a good one.> My last stop to , the lobster stop; today. 2 orders of double lobster rolls . One buttered and one lobster salad. I've had both a few times already. I wanted to get my lobster roll cravings out of the way before I took off. It's a lot better than legal seafood lobster rolls . Lobster rolls are super enjoyable . The fried foods can have too much oil left over. I use to get the fisherman's platter all the time. I would only eat a few pieces and feel full as f. Not a huge fan of their fried food. The fried haddock is good though.> A few friends and I came here to celebrate a birthday so we ordered a lot of food. I was expecting everything to be pretty expensive but it was all reasonably priced. We got some fried scallops, clam strips, whole clams, french fries, steamers, 3 lobster rolls, and lobster bisque. It all came out to be only 26$ per person for a party of 5. Food was crispy and fresh. Full of crunch with each bite. I especially loved the whole belly clams as it was juicy as well. Nothing seemed rotten or old. I felt like the lobster rolls were lacking in meat but they were still very tasty. Too our surprise, the french fries were amazing.

menu_dishes: Mixed Grain Salad, S&R Burger & Fries, Spinach Rigatoni, Winter Chopped Salad, Wood Oven-Baked Mac & Cheese, Roasted Clam, Margherita, Pepperoni, Mushroom, Fennel - Sausage, Eggs Bennie, Corned Beef Hash, Waffle, Omelet, Chilaquiles Verdes, Potato Pancake, The Burger, Seven Grain Toast, Onion Bagel, Cinnamon Roll, House-Smoked Ham, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Scrambled Eggs, Home-Fries, Grapefruit Juice, Orange Juice, Thatcher Farm Milk, Home-Made Chocolate Milk, Home-Made Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Espresso, Double Espresso, Cappuccino, Tea Pot
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: My wife and I have gone to Steel and Rye for multiple special occasions, and particularly love their wood-fired pizza, brick chicken, and delicious cocktails.During the COVID-19 pandemic, Steel and Rye has done an AMAZING job of serving the local community, while being thoughtful and thorough with safety precautions. We've already bought multiple family meals, which are well balanced, tasty, and last for multiple meals. We've also bought many servings of pizza dough to freeze which we hope to last for multiple weeks. When you call, you pay with a credit card over the phone and set a time to pick up your food. Upon arrival, you open your trunk and Steel and Rye staff leave your food in the trunk while wearing gloves (no physical contact). Just be sure to ask for a tip to be added when you provide your credit card!I can't recommend Steel and Rye highly enough and ask locals to continue to support this amazing restaurant during these difficult times!> If you are looking for a place to have some great drinks Steel & Rye is the place for you (and 100 other drunks that frequent the place). The food is just OK, and the ambiance is actually great. I have been to the restaurant many times (Milton is pretty dead otherwise, so this is the ONLY decent restaurant). We have hosted private parties there, and I have been invited to many functions at the restaurant. It is not a bad place to hang out and meet your neighbors, but I wish that the menu was a little more imaginative.The only think that you absolutely need to pay attention to is the people leaving the restaurant after they get hammered. This lady in a big black SUV almost killed us (me and my family) as we were walking to the restaurant (she actually floored it getting out of the parking lot, and drove onto the sidewalk across the street!).> I've been here several times for dinner and the food is always unique and exceptional. I've never been for brunch, but the menu looks legit and I can't wait to try it.I hosted my son's first birthday here, and the whole experience was incredible. Leah, the events coordinator, was impeccably detailed. I've worked in events, and she was above and beyond in her service. She anticipated every need and was incredibly helpful and accommodating leading up to the event and during the party itself.The atmosphere in the back room is tops--there's plenty of industrial touches without it feeling too cold or uninviting. There's a private bar too, and they'll serve up whatever libations you'd like. Typically, you're either paying for atmosphere or paying for good food, but not both. Thankfully at Steel & Rye, you don't have to settle! The food was amazing, and the portions were downright huge.All in all, Steel & Rye was the perfect place to host my son's first birthday. They took care of everything so that I could just enjoy the day. Many thanks to Leah and the team at Steel & Rye for making his special day one to remember!> Fantastic food for over 8 years now!  Dan and team also jumped into action to offer yummy family take out as Covid-19 grew. They also have been cooking meals for a handful families in need in Milton free of charge for the past few weeks as with schools closed these families no longer had access to a meal. Great community partner. Come out and support this wonderful place !  Let's show our support.> Steel & Rye is, without question, my favorite restaurant in the area. I have eaten dinner here countless times and even hosted a large party in the back. The menu is seasonal and constantly updated by the chef. The only constant items are the pizzas, hamburger, and maybe a couple appetizers like fried olives. Otherwise it seems that if a special is a hit, it sticks around and bumps out an older menu item. The cocktail menu is constantly updated as well!It is hard to identify particular dishes to recommended due to the constant menu refresh. Nonetheless I have to give a shout-out to the pot pie I had a couple years back. I have never tasted one that was such an all-around success. Every element from the crust to the chicken in the filling was delicious. The aforementioned pizzas are made in a brick oven you can see from the outside. There is a high-top seating situated in front of the pizza makers, so you can stare at them while you eat! Hooray! They also make some appetizers in that oven, like roasted dips.If you are interested in drinks only, there is a bar with a few TVs. There is a large enough cocktail, wine, and beer menu to keep you interested and the beers on tap rotate as well. They also offer dessert wines alongside the rotating dessert menu.Finally, I can recommend Steel & Rye for large parties as well. I organized a birthday party with roughly 50 people (I don't remember!) and it went off very smoothly. The only hiccup was that the particular pig that was delivered that day was overly fatty, so our pork dinners did not come out quite right. They were very apologetic and offered us a substantial amount of gift cards to make up for it. I of course immediately lost the gift cards at home but the gesture was still appreciated.To sum it up, if you haven't been to Steel & Rye yet, you should!

Hands down the best Indian food and THE BEST service. Started eating here in 2015 when I moved to Quincy, moved away for 2 years, came back and they still remembered me and my BF! His favorite is the chicken tikka saag and I love both the chicken korma and chicken makhani. Also can't leave without finishing the meal with a hot chai. Also thank you for providing takeout during COVID-19 and adding a special gulab jamun treat, you guys are the best> Love getting takeout from here! Things to order:Chicken KormaGarlic NaanChicken Tikka MasalaCoconut Korma> Went for buffet today and was left a bit dissatisfied with the food options. There was freshly made samosa and pakora which were good. The naan came at the table and it was soft and delicious. The veggie options were potatoes, paneer chole, navratan khorma, rice and daal makhni. The veggie options were all mediocre to say the least. Dal makhni had uncooked raw potato bits(?) which didn't make sense. I really would have liked some greens in the menu in the form of saag or some dry veggie and was disappointed to not see anything. Non vegetarian options were kept separate included tandoori chicken and sheekh kabab for appetizers and chicken tikka masala and goat curry.Chicken tandoori and seekh kabab lacked spice. The gravy in Chicken tikka masala tasted good but chicken itself was meh! Goat curry was okay. Gulab jamoon was warm and soft. Hoping to find a good Indian restaurant with buffet options that satisfies my palate. Unfortunately Punjab Cafe didn't make the cut.> Had dinner here by myself on a Friday night after meeting a friend for drinks at The Townshend in Quincy center. I was going to head to another Indian restaurant, but the bartender said this place was the best around. It did not disappoint! I was seated right away and made my (easy) decision to get the chicken tikka masala - my fave. I usually get it medium, but thought it would be nice to have a bit of extra spice. Hooboy! It was spicy without being overwhelming. I loved it! There was enough for me to take home, so I had it for breakfast the next day. I love me some good tikka masala. I would love to come back here for the weekend buffet to try some different options!> Great indian lunch buffet, probably one of the best indian food spots around Boston. It is pretty moderately priced ($13.5 inclusive of taxes) for all-you-can-eat meal.Impressive things:1) they serve fresh butter naans to each table, so you get to eat fresh naan instead of stale naan compared to other buffet places2) Vegetarian and meat sections are different3) Limited number of dishes, but they all are pretty great in taste4) Two desserts (usually I have seen only one at most of the places)5) great, quick and friendly staffMenu when I visited:Green chutney, boondi raita, sweet tamarind sauce, picked veggiesVegetarian samosaMix vegetarian pakoraSaag spinach (Best dish in my opinion)Daal tadkaShahi paneerBhindi masalaSteamed white riceChicken seekh kebabChicken tandooriChicken tikka masalaGoat curryGulab jamunRice kheer puddingI would definitely love to visit this place again soon, keep it up guys!

menu_dishes: Marinated Olives, Spiced Nuts, House Dips, Rosemary Fries, Hand-Rolled Arancini, "Long Cook" Cauliflower, Cheesy Baked Brocolli, Double Down Potatoes, Roasted Baby Beets, Fried Brussels Sprouts, Fall Harvest Salad, Point Judith Calamari, Steak Tartare*, Chicharron Colombiano, Gambas Rojo*, Moules Marinieres*, Roasted Bone Marrow*, Local Burrata, Townshend Burger*, Roasted Pork Loin*, Faroe Island Salmon*, "Loaded" Mac N' Cheese, Scratch Bolognese, Chicken Under a Brick*, Gulf of Maine Hake*, 8 Oz. popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Holy sugars. I am SO sad I discovered this place only a few days before moving out of Boston. Never knew a spot like this could exist in Quincy.If you love local craft beer, dope vibes and a great background playlist, on point  (unpretentious) service, refined and yummy menu with the perfect price point (the food quality and choices are spot on) - then you need to come here.I only had their house made dips chips and grilled bread, but trust, from what I saw and my neighboring bar patrons rave reviews, you cant really go wrong here.Great work Townshend, thank you. Your attention to detail, alone - is mouthwatering.> Brick over chicken: the flavors wow. Crispy deboned (except the leg or wing) juicy chicken over risotto. There was a touch of brown sugar on top. Sweet and savory. Calamari: tender and not over cooked ? Aoili sauce , nice touch. Some fried picked jalapeños in the mix. Worth a try. Nothing  special.Black angus steak and potato: veggies and mashed potato has the classic steak house cook. Steak was okay. Rather go to a steak house.Service was superb> Two weeks ago, I went here for brunch with my friend. We ordered the arancini as an appetizer and the breakfast sando and crispy fried french toast to share.The arancini came with 5 little fried risotto balls with marinara sauce, basil and parmesan cheese. It was very good.The breakfast sando consisted of a grilled croissant sandwich with sausage, egg and cheddar and a side of homefries with hollandaise sauce. It was delicious. I am immediately addicted!The french toast came with two large slices and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The french toast was very crispy. It was almost as good as the old Union restaurant in the South End.I also really like the iced bergamot black tea that they had. I really liked the smell of it and it was refreshing than regular black teas.I'm definitely coming back again.> I love the vibe at Townshend a ton. I've been here for drinks and most recently brunch and think it can be a good spot for multiple occasions. The brunch was pretty good. The potatoes in my dish were probably my favorite part. Sometimes that many potatoes can be a bit overwhelming but the staff did well at cooking them in a way that left you craving more with each bite.Four of us went on a Sunday so the restaurant was pretty full but the wait time wasn't ridiculous. Probably 15 minutes. The only issue I did notice was that our waiter was being a little pushy and impatient when taking our orders and towards the end when we were done eating. Didn't ruin the experience but it was a slight nuisance.> Nice spot in Quincy with friendly staff and delicious food. Came here for brunch and got the Huevos Rancheros. It was delicious! Would definitely come back here.

menu_dishes: Caesar, Greek, Arugula, The Quiet Man House Salad, Garlic Chicken Wings, Buffalo Wings, Chicken Sliders, Meatball Parmesan, Salmon Taco, Beet Bruschetta, Chips Dip, Soft Pretzel Bites, The Quiet Man Steak Tips, Meatloaf, Hanger Steak, Half Chicken, Pan Seared Scallops, North Atlantic Salmon, Spaghetti Meatballs, Double Cheeseburger, Lamb Burger, Traditional, Pepperoni, Mushroom, Fig Pros, Meatball, Sausage, Spicy Hawaiian, Cheeseburger, Buffalo Chicken, Pulled Pork
popular_dishes: Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, Yes, Yes, No
reviews: You will not regret coming here. We shared the chips and dip & beet salad to start and both were outstanding!! Portions are quite substantial for both. One of us had the chicken pot pie and 2 of us shared a pizza, half cheese and half mushroom with onion strings. So amazing! Both of them. We could not decide on the dessert so we shared the attached pics, brownie sundae and bread pudding. They make all their own desserts and ice cream, so both of these were so delicious. For drinks, we had a couple of awesome espresso martinis. The service was great as well. I like how they seem to be a green conscience establishment. Parking garage across the street is super convenient.> This place was a hit or miss for me. Sometimes it's good, and sometimes it's ... alright. I can say that it's better than most restaurants in Quincy. I like their sausage pizza and their dips. Other than that, I think most of their food was ok. The place is clean, and the waitress was friendly. What I would complain about is that heavy front door. I would this place if you're looking for a beautiful and chill place with fancy pizza!> You know you have done did good, when one of your closest and dearest friends, with the pickiest eating habits says, "it's all good!"I have been here several times- and finally decided to write a "review". Where do you start? The drinks, the food, or the service?!Let's start with the drinks...BASIL GIMLET all they way, (says the one who dislikes basil). I have never tasted anything like! The only downfall is that you can tell some of the bartenders are pained when you ask to make one (not Johnny).I came in today trying to order the usual, homemade chips and dip and the loaded potato sheet (YES...I LOVE carbs and POTATOES). Instead...I was introduced to the brunch menu. We chose the carbonara 1/2 sheet and the burger. DELICIOUS! And the service...exceptional! It says a lot when the owner takes pride and interacts with ALL of her customers. This is definitely one of the newest and hottest spots in Quincy!> Another great night at 16c in downtown Quincy! Stopped in here for dinner while it was snowing out and grabbed a seat at the bar. Our bartender Larry was quick to grab us waters and ask what we were drinking. I ordered a Montepulciano d'Abruzzo and my husband had a wine that was featured on their specials menu, a Spanish Rioja...delish! We started off with their Greek salad and shared but it was soooo good and fresh that I wish I had ordered one for myself. Then, I ordered their Salmon that came with roasted potatoes, asparagus in a lemon butter sauce...to die for! My husband had the short ribs which were also very tasty. No dessert because I on a 28 day healthy cleanse, but we did drink our dessert by sharing Amaro Averna. If you have never had an Amaro before, you are missing out. It is a dijestivo (in Italian) that helps digest without feeling full but tastes delicious too. Quincy is really making a great impact with restaurants and 16c should be first on your list to visit. Plus there is a new and gorgeous parking garage across the street so you don't have to worry about finding parking. Cheers~--> My husband would eat here every weekend  if I let him pick the restaurant.  He enjoys their Quiet man restaurant, a favorite from our Southie days. I have tried a few different things, usually go with their chicken which never disappoints, have switched it up for soecials, lamb burger, pizza.  We usually score bar seats.  Service is good and owner always stops by and says hi.

Loved it! Just ordered take out yesterday through their website and we had the chicken tikka masala, chicken muncharian and the date and apricot naan. Everything was delicious, would highly recommend! The tikka masala had tender white meat chicken in a creamy flavorful tomato sauce and the chicken muncharian was deep fried chicken pieces in a sweet and  tangy sauce, almost like sweet and sour chicken but with different spices. Loved it all, great comfort food with delicious flavor! Ordered online which was super easy. The online menu didn't show spice levels for the dishes but the chicken dishes were mild in spice level, but very flavorful. The online system was really easy to use and the food was ready in 15 minutes. Staff was nice and helpful. Can't wait to try more of their menu!> Food poisoning. :( Hate to be that person but this place is very, very dirty. And unfortunately even though the food tasted okay, we paid for it because we were all sick afterwards. Definitely do not recommend. Staff also wasn't that friendly. I don't know if they were just shy people, but they really didn't even make an attempt at speaking. We had to initiate all conversations. We were not even greeted when we came in. Disappointing.> I'll keep this short and sweet. I ordered Aloo Palak (a vegetarian creamed spinach and potato dish), and came down with severe food poisoning. I have been ordering from this restaurant for almost a year, and I haven't had a quality issue before now. Although their food has a history of being authentic and delicious, they have lost my trust.> The most disappointing chicken tikka masala I have ever eaten! It was sooo tasteless. Plus, we received stale garlic naan. Will not be giving this place another shot.> Best Chicken Korma ever!! We came by for dinner before heading to the cape! We ordered the shrimp samosas, garlic naan, peshwari naan, lamb tikka masala, and the chicken korma. All were delicious but the korma was to die for. Portions were good but not big enough for 2 meals, maybe 1.5. Prices were a bit high for dinner but as expected. We spent about $80 for 3 people and got 2 extra appetizer orders to go.I'd love to try out the buffet and get takeout next time I'm in the area. It's too bad it's so far away!

menu_dishes: Vietnamese Ham Spring Rolls, Fresh Spring Rolls (Oil Less) (2 Rolls), Shrimp Salad or Chicken Salad, Combo Salad, Chicken Vegetable, Chicken Ginger, Ca Phe Nong, Ca Phe Den Da, Trai Vai, Trai Nhan, Chom Chom hoac Mit, Che Ba Mau
