reviews: The dish I always have every time I visit here or Chinatown location.This place is more friendly service than Chinatown and it is close to my home.Thank> I ordered a delivery from Doordash.I personally wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone! First, the food doesn't taste good. I am not sure if it's because I ordered a delivery. I don't mind when I got it, the soup is warm. However, I saw a red raw beef on my rice noodle and apparently with this warm soup, the meat won't be well-cooked! Second, I had a ice coffee with condensed milk, which tastes super bitter. You might like it if you enjoy bitter coffee. But I got the coffee which is only half of the cup! Although I ordered it without ice, I don't think it should be that much different!> LUNCH REVIEWThis place is pho real. OK, now that I got that out of my system, the review can continue.I have come to Pho Pasteur a couple of times in between work meetings nearby and have been pleased both times. The setting is very unassuming and there is no fancy decor...this place focuses on the food, or rather, the phood. I have had both the rare steak pho and the chicken pho (pho ga)...both are delicious and not things I would even contemplate attempting to make at home. I love cooking and this is just something I admit I cannot make as good as the pros. The broth is just too damn good. I always get the extra large because I don't get pho often and I want to indulge but that is A LOT. The large, or the small even, is enough for most peopleBe sure to load it up with the basil and bean sprouts, plus fresh lime and hot sauce. BEWARE...the lower the broth level gets, the more concentrated the spice gets so if you don't think it's spicy when you add hot sauce at the beginning, it will only get spicier.Bonus points: great service and modern/clean bathrooms (a nice surprise)> Food is safe to take out at this time, the guy who is very friendly and makes drinks very good> 20 degree weather is back and what better way to warm up, then with a bowl of Pho. I have yet to be disappointed coming here. The broth is hot, aromatic and savory that satiates all 5 senses. Plus, their coffee is a strong tasteful buzz in itself, but save that for a mid-morning trip. Worth noting is their service; Steve and Helen are prompt, expedient, warm and inviting, which makes coming back often, a pleasant delight. Enjoy!

menu_dishes: New England Style Clam Chowder, Seared Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes, Fried "Rhode Island Style" Calamari, Albanian Meze, Sauteed Prince Edward Island Mussels, Alba Antipasto, Ahi Tuna & Avocado Tartar, Shrimp Cocktail, Charcuterie Board, Spiced Pork Ribs, Oysters On The Half Shell, Littlenecks On The Half Shell, Mixed Greens Salad, Caesar Salad, Beet Salad, Turkish Fig And Bufula Mozzarella Di Campania Salad, Butter Lettuce Salad, Grilled Pork Chop, 14oz Sirloin, Filet Mignon, Mustard and Coriander Crusted Salmon, Roasted 1/2 Chicken Under A Brick, Ras El Hanout Spiced Rack of Lamb, Bolognese, Long Island Duck "3 Ways", Roasted Chicken Tagine, Seafood Fra Diavolo, 30 Oz. Grilled "Tomahawk" Bone In Rib-eye, French Fries with Sea Salt, Potato Puree, Mac & Cheese, Cauliflower Gratin, Fingerling Potatoes Lyonnaise, Asparagus
popular_dishes: Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Best place ever !!!!!!!!!!!Good food excellent service !!!!!!!!!!!!Live shelling and the meat !!!All done very nice and fresh !!!!> Came here last night for a quick bite and was pleased to stumble upon this place.When you walk in the decor there is security and then through the double doors you meet the hostess. It was dark and a more intimate setting and even though it was full of people it was still pretty quiet.To start I had the crab cakes which I was very pleased with. The crab cakes aren't the typical deep fried texture and was more of actual crab meat. It was a bit zesty and the flavor was a bit too intense for my liking, but it was a good dish-probably just a personal preference.Of the drinks that I had, the spicy pear and a moscow mule, the ratios seemed off. I am a really big fan of these flavors, but the drinks were just not enjoyable. I had the first drink removed from the bill-which they were very receptive to, but the 2nd I didn't want to make a fuss about. If you are looking for a smooth blend in drinks that are a bit tart, I don't think this is the place.However, my friend had the Honey Vodka Martini and it was REALLY good, so I'd go with that one.For mains, we had the lamb with the couscous, Atlantic Cod w/ mussels, and the baked mac and cheese.The lamb was good and was cooked very well. Soft, practically melted on the fork and the flavors went well with the couscous. However, the flavor of the actual lamb just didn't do it for me.The atlantic cod was cooked perfectly and came out amazing! The mussels were also very good and the chowder this was all steeped in was tasty.The baked mac and cheese had a lot of potential, but alas it didn't fo it for us.Dessert- we had a lava cake which was very good!It was a nice experience and I would come back if I was in the area.Oh,Our waitress was very sweet :)> While visiting my friends in Quincy, we stopped in for drinks at Alba's rooftop bar. The space itself is cute. A large bar with tons of tables and couches around for seating. Our large group (nearly 10) put two tables together, which the staff had no issue with.The drinks were solid as well--but the drinks did seem to vary pretty drastically between bartenders. My friend noted that when she ordered the same drink a second time, it tasted like an almost entirely new drink.I'm also only giving three stars because our waitress was very rude and not all that attentive. I try to give people the benefit of the doubt. Maybe she was having a bad day, but her attitude and service won't make this a return stop when I'm back in Boston.> Stopped by the rooftop on a Saturday night. It was busy but not too crazy. Turnover was faster than expected. High tops and bar are first come first serve. Its been a about 2 years since i last visited. They did an amazing job renovating. The bar and dining area as so much more welcoming! SO and i started off with expresso martinis and they are amazing and perfect! We got sat in less than 10 mins. The cocktails were good. Oysters were good. We also shared octopus. It was okay. Flavor could be better. I had mussels for dinner. And it was mediocre. Not bad but could definitely be much more tasty.SO had a new york steak. For $45 the quality could have def been better. Same goes for the plating. It came with grilled asparagus and fingerling potatos. He said everything was bland. 4 stars for the improvements of the space and ambiance. And good bartenders! Will come back for drinks and rawbar apps!> Usually the food here is good. Went last night for Valentine's Day, and my fiancé was served an inedible chicken parm. I tried it. It tasted like it was previously frozen, and it was chewy. She didn't even get a chance to tell the waitress because the bus boy came to the table to remove the food before the waitress checked on us.

One of if not the best hotpot places to dine at around the south shore! If you live around Quincy or Braintree, this restaurant is a no brainer. The quality of the food is top notch and you can taste the freshness of the meats and vegetables. They also have specials from time to time such as conch which you rarely ever see from other hotpot restaurants. The interior isn't all that big so when they get busy, there is usually a wait time but its worth waiting for! They also have an outdoor patio for when it is warmer, however they do set it up during the winter as well with heat lamps. The service is also very professional and the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. Whatever you need just ask them and they will get it right away for you. Overall this is for sure one of my go to places around Boston that I would drive to for hotpot!> If I could be more precise I would rate this a 3.5 star but i'll be generous since i'm a bit spoiled when it comes to hot pot.Parking around here can be iffy but there's a free public parking lot around the corner (across the street from Taipei Cuisine).  First thing to note is that this restaurant is SMALL.  If you have a large group make sure to get here early otherwise you'll be waiting!We had 7 in our party and this is what we ordered along with the price as of 1/20:2 vegetable broth - $3.50 each 2 Tonkotsu broth - $4.50 eachSirloin beef combo - $24.50Fatty beef combo - $20 Meat Combo Supreme - $25Beef tongue (ala carte) - $9Sirloin beef (ala carte) - $16.50Fatty beef (ala carte) - $12Fish tofu - $42 Flying Fish Roe Ball - $5 eachAssorted Seafood Meatballs - $53 rice bowls - $2.50 eachJapanese Ramen Noodles - $4Overall the food quality was good especially for the meat with nice cuts of decent thickness.  Tonkotsu broth was also good with a nice pork flavor to it.  Service was decent considering how packed the place is.  Ventilation isn't very good so be prepared to have your clothing smell like hot pot until you wash them!So why the 3.5/4 star rating?  It comes down to the price.  We had to order 3 meat ala carte items with some more fish balls after our initial order as we weren't full so this is a place that can get pricey quick if you're starving.  Vegetables are fine but nothing of note.  The fish balls and tofu were frozen which is a bit disappointing since you can buy a bag of some of them for the price of a single order here.Overall if you want some good quality hot pot and aren't familiar with the cuisine then give them a try!  If you're well versed in the world of hot pot however then this place won't really offer anything that will blow your mind.> Tuesday night dinner buffet before the New Year's Eve. 5pm crowd almost headed in. $33 for adults and $16 for kids 10 and under. Eat as much for 2 hours. Try not to be wasteful. Angus ribs eye as my meat of choice. Not as marbled as prime ribeye. Seafood selection, huge. Shrimps were peeled. Service was okay today as there weren't many servers. We worked around it. They always try their best. My second time stopping here since I arrived 2 weeks ago. Thank you for the good eats.Haven't been here in about 4 years and prices have fluctuated. I remember when prime ribeye combo went for $21 . Oh how times have changed. The buffet is a good choice for different types of everything on the menu (except specialty meats).> I have mixed feelings about this restaurant; it was my first time here and the food was good, but the service was bad. Our server was in a sour mood the entire time and was basically no where to be found when we needed her.> It's been a while since I been here. They changed up the menu a little. They have all you can eat hot pot for $25 something and it was definitely worth it. The quality is definitely better then the other all u can hot pot spot. Service was good and price is about the same as other all u can eat hot pot places. Definitely, will be back

cusine_types: Desserts, Venues & Event Spaces, Tapas/Small Plates
reviews: Great food and cool desserts!  Cozy little place that girlfriend and I can both enjoy.  Will definitely be back again and again..> Very adorable and cute place. Unfortunately no ambiance. I get that they want to cater to the clientele but a projector for sports just sets off the wrong mood for the place. That lounge area just seems a bit awkward and off. Don't get me wrong, I am a long time client of Fratelli's bakery and absolutely love their pasta, red sauce, and bakery. I came here for desserts after a date night dinner with SO. We both got espresso martinis and they were made with no love. And you can really tell. The garnish looked like they just grabbed a bunch of beans and just tossed it on. The beans were sinking and floating away because they were no foam.  I late watch the bartender make another one and she literally shook the shaker 4 times. That explains there it wasn't cold enough and why there were no foam. The taste were right but the way it's made is just soooo important!!! For dessert we got brownie implosion and tiramisu. Tiramisu was nice and fluffy and not too sweet just the way I like it but it didn't taste original. Like it needs more coffee? Either way I love it and will get this is I ever have cravings and come back. The brownie implosion was cool. But I really got it expecting the brownie to be warm.... i was a bit sad about that because it didn't taste like brownie it just taste like cubes of chocolate cake. I wasn't a huge fan... This place has soooo much potential. And maybe I had a bit of high expectations walking in. But I really wish I loved it...> I had my baby shower here today.  They are such an easy venue to work with!  Emily is extremely responsive and helpful.  The food was delicious and the service was the impeccable.  When you host an event you reserve the entire restaurant.  It is spacious and comfortably holds 40+ people.  My mother and I have been receiving texts and phone calls from guests saying how much they loved the venue and food since we left this afternoon.  I couldn't have asked for a better day and worked with nicer people.  Thank you Emily and all the Sala staff.> Great place for a late nite sweet treat! Service was great too! Can't wait to come back for dinner. The avalanche is my #1 favorite! O> Four of us went last night for dessert.  My first impression was the music was too loud and really only appealing to a certain age group. It's an odd place, a cross between a bar and a fast food joint, no ambiance to speak of at all. The two men in our group both got desserts with a chocolate cake base and both thought the cake was too dry and one even going so far as saying the chocolate frosting had no flavor, half of that cake was not eaten. The two women ordered  a creme brûlée's and a tiramisu.  The creme brûlée's was average the tiramisu was standard. Portions were very big, but you pay for it. Now the coffee, this is where they really dropped the ball.  My husband got just a decaf coffee and it was "dishwater" and not even hot.  Someone else got cappuccino and had to send it back because it was cold.  My Italian coffee was just barely warm and tasted just ok. Overall, I gave it a two star only because of service.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive, and Apologetic about the cappuccino.    It was not worth the money and it will be a while before, if ever, we come back.

I've been here a couple times and Windsor is now my favorite dim sum spot in Quincy. Although there is a long wait, I think the overall quality of the food is well worth it. However, if you're worried about the wait, I would recommend to come here during the weekday. I came here on Thursday and it was not busy whatsoever - no wait for a party of 5. The servers are friendly and will suggest dishes upon request.They give you a sheet of paper to select your orders, along with a menu to help give you a better visual. We ordered D2 shrimp dumpling ($4.50), D3 pork shrimp dumpling ($4.50), D9 chicken claws black bean ($3.75), D37 fried shrimp chives dumpling ($4.50), D39 pan fried radish cake ($3.75), D44 pan fried sticky rice ($4.95), D48 HK style dough ($3.75) and D51 plain rice roll ($4.50). My all time favorite is the HK style dough! The dough was nice and crispy while the rice roll was warm and chewy.> There is always a huge line whenever I come. We had to wait around 30min before being seated as a party of 6. The tables were very packed together, but that was expected. We ordered the yellow sand buns, chicken feet, BBQ pork buns, shrimp dumplings, intestines, and shumai. The yellow sand buns (流沙包) were my absolute favorite dessert. My favorite savory dish was the shrimp dumplings (虾饺). I tried the chicken feet for the first time and I was pleasantly surprised! I was really happy with everything we got!The servers were attentive. It was sometimes pretty hard to get their attention, especially since the environment was very loud. But, again, I that was expected. I would definitely come back again - I LOVE dim sum!> LOVE going to this place! The Chinatown location is nice, however there's limited seating. The Quincy location has more places to sit, and it's down the street from the newly-opened 99 Ranch! We waited about 10 minutes  for a table for 2 to be cleared off. Right away carts with dim sim dishes were coming by our table, and we ordered a few things off the menu too. Everything tasted very fresh, and satisfied our dumpling cravings while grocery shopping! For 5-6 dishes shared between 2 people, we spent about $30 plus tip. We'll be back after another round of groceries!Not pictured: crispy shrimp and taro cakes and hot tea> I couldn't give 5 stars because service wasn't that great and they only accept cash. The food itself was amazing!! One of the best places for dim sum around! Reasonable prices and food came out pretty fast. Very good dishes! Expect a wait if you're coming on a weekend morning/early afternoon.> A more modern dim sum restaurant, but I think I like more of a mom n pop experience. They have dim sum a la carte and you use the paper menu to order what you want; no push carts. The food was average and dim sum is served in plastic/bamboo/metal steamers. They give you a carafe of hot water so you can top off your own tea pot. The place has higher acoustics so it was on the noisy side for my aging parents.

Thai Noodle Bar is the best place to get Thai food. Service is great and prompt. Compare to other Thai restaurants, Thai Noodle Bar never disappoint. My go to dishes are the papaya salad, yellow curry with chicken, mango sticky rice.> Absolutely delicious!!! Recommend the orange chicken and Thai basil noodles!! Soo goood!> You won't find many towns that can claim to better represent Asian cuisine than Quincy Mass. From Chinese to Japanese, Thai, Korean, Vietnamese and beyond....they do it and they do it well. Thai noodle bar is a smallish Thai restaurant sitting in a mini business strip. The service is quick and staff is pleasant. We tried the curry puffs, crispy pad Thai, crazy noodles, and Thai wings. The crazy noodles are packed with flavor and the wings are nice and crisp. Is it the best I've ever had? I wouldn't say that...but it is quality at a very decent price.> I have tried at least 10 Thai restaurants in Massachusetts and if I have to vote for a Thai restaurant with the best food, I would vote for this one!! Although it sets up more like a take out place with just a few tables, they are quite busy and the food is amazing, tasty and AUTHENTIC!!There are so many high rated Thai restaurants out there that are not authentic at all!! My favorite here is papaya salad with beef (more like Teriyaki beef), drunken noodle, and mango sticky rice!!!!> I'm a bit surprised by all the raving reviews about this place. Maybe we tried the wrong dish, but you let me know if I am missing something.chicken wings - I was actually really impressed by their chicken wings. Skin was super crispy but very moist inside. Very flavorful as well which I liked.crispy chicken pad thai - Crispy chicken was cooked well but I really did not like the way pad thai was prepared. It's as if they used ketchup or something it was sweet and color was strangely reddish. It really did not meet my expectation at all.indonesian fried rice - very disappointing. Again, it was as if they used ketchup or something the entire dish was red. They put some weird dry chicken pieces on top and not much went inside the rice at all. No veggies or anything. It was really disappointing. Egg was whatever too.Given the location, difficult parking, and mediocre food, I can't give this place more than 2 stars. Maybe we just didn't order the right stuff but I mean if you can't make pad thai and fried rice well, I can't imagine their other dish tasting any better. Very disappointing since I had high expectation for this place!

menu_dishes: Jambalaya Soup, New England Clam Chowder, Pick 2 Combo, Pick 3 Combo, Pick 4 Combo, Shrimp ( Head On ), Shrimp ( Head Off ), Clams, Mussels, Crawfish, Snow Crab Legs, King Crab Legs, Dungeness Crab, Lobster, Soft Shell Crab Basket, Oysters Basket, Shrimp Basket, Fish and Chips Basket, Calamari Basket, Wings Basket, Chicken Tenders Basket, Oysters Po'Boy, Shrimp Po'Boy, Fish Po'Boy, Calamari Po'Boy, Chicken Po'Boy, Sausages, Cajun Fries, Lemon Pepper Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Garlic Noodles, Corn on the Cob, Potatoes, Coleslaw, Steamed Rice, Funnel Cake Fries, Black Cherry, Natural Lime, Ruby Grapefruit, Sapporo, Sam Adams Boston Lager, Sam Adams Seasonal, Corona, Heineken, Bud Light, Blue Moon, Pinot Grigio, Moscato, Merlot, Chardonnay, Soda
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: I just want to say Wow! 1st. We called few days before we came to eat we had called to make a reservation, little disappointed that they didn't make reservations because we were a party of 13-15 People.2nd. When we arrived we didn't even have to wait for our tables to be ready! Great servIce, everyone was so nice. 3rd. The reason I am writing this review wasn't just because of the food! Which was great! But HENRY! Your are the man! We had a big group and little kids we were driving you crazy and you kept your happy face all night! You never gave us a bad face or any bad looks. You are the reason we will come back here and definitely ask for you to take care of us. Henry may God Bless you! Great example of Excellent Customer service!! Food was amazing, it was also our first time here great Place!> The Good:Capt Loui specializes in doing seafood boils - aka - seafood boiled/drenched in delicious sauce.  You put on a bib, gloves etc and dive in.  Maybe not the best place for a first date, but a fun 4th or 5th - for sure!  Capt Loui also   As far as boils go - Capt Loui holds its own (and might even be preferred) against the likes of Shaking Crab and Holly Crab. Capt Loui also has regular specials such as free and unlimited garlic noodles or free lobster/crab if you order up to 4 lbs of seafood.  Awesome deals!!! The Bad:That said - while their service is ALWAYS very kind - they seem to be short handed often and it impacts the speed and quality of service.  When you walk in - it's very typical to wait 5-10 for a hostess to even take your name down. There will most likely be tables that are not cleaned up long after people have left.  The Ugly:For a place that really should have soap for customers in the bathroom (outside of the normal hygienic reasons) - they're out of it ALWAYS. Please refill your soap - it's truly gross and horrible to visit the restroom to wash your hands after a meal and not be able to get soap.  If you come - simply make sure you bring some hand wipes for yourself.> 2/22/20 - This review is an update. You're only as good as your last review. I was very disappointed with C.L. There was a wait to being seated when we didn't have to be. In Braintree there is a huge area in the back, but they decide to put us back there after 15 minutes. Why? Main dining room is filled. Then OPEN the back!! We finally got seated. Our waitress took forever to ask for our drinks. By the time she came back with them, we knew our food order. 30 minutes passed before our food came out. Which really stunk because I'm trying I.F. Intermittent Fasting and 6P was fast approaching. I cant eat past that time. This time I ordered the Calamari Po'Boy and it was terrible. They were not seasoned well and very over cooked. How can they be so tough i kept saying. The Cole Slaw remains not tasty, to me.... I tasted one of my friends wings and they were fine. Too spicy for me, but for those who can tolerate them, I'm sure they will enjoy. I should mention that our waitress at this point has disappeared. I thought i was at a Vegas show. We saw the manager going in and out of the kitchen. He saw us trying to get his attention a couple of times, but he pretended like he didn't. Finally our waitress reappeared. We gave our Debit Card, signed and was so glad to get out of there. Would I eat there again? Maybe...... No........MaybeHappy Eats> Came here with a party of 3 at 9pm on a Friday, and we got sat down after 30 minutes.If you come on a busy night, be prepared to wait for an hr-1.5hrs for your food to be ready. We ordered sweet tea but the sweet tea had no flavor. It tasted more like... a very light tea with honey in it. When i use to get the sweet tea, its a very dark color, but it was a lot lighter this time. Not sure if the server heard the wrong order. food overall was great. The only complaint is the shrimp is not fresh. I know it is frozen shrimp, but i think the shrimp has been frozen for way too long, it was a bit mushy and very hard to peel the skin. Unfortunately the king crab leg meat was very mushy, wasnt into the texture at all (again, probably frozen too long). The flavor of the sauces is on point. I actually really like the garlic noodles a lot more compared to the ones in stoneham location. (More garlic and less cheese)PS: Don't pour the seafood on the table!!!! You gotta scoop your sauces from the bag> If you're looking for southern style seafood you gotta check out Loui Loui in Braintree! I've tried other places round Boston and found that a lot of those places left me feeling sick to my stomach after eating. I tried Loui Loui in Braintree and did not get that feeling after eating here. If anything it made me go back a week later for more. Now it's literally a weekly ritual with me and my friends. Prices are reasonable and it's always fresh. Mention my code: Thao10 to get a free order garlic noodles while it's still valid ;)

Pho Linh is such a cute Vietnamese restaurant. The decor is beautiful and the ambience alone has this kind of slight romantic feel to it (maybe it's because I went during dinner and the lights were a little dim haha). Not to mention the food here is great. For appetizers I usually order the spring rolls. The spring rolls are made tightly and the vegetables inside are always fresh and crisp. Just the way you'd want it to be. When I'm here I like to order their bun bo hue. This soup is so delicious here! I wish I lived closer to Pho Linh because I would come here all the time. The service here is also very good. They are very friendly and attentive to their customers. Parking: street Parking> Loved loved this pho place. It's a bit of a drive from my house to Quincy, but I would make the trek for good pho. The small bowl was the perfect size for me and they don't skimp out on the meat. The soup was delicious!! I could not taste msg (unlike other pho places) and not oily either. It was a pure beef broth with the perfect amount of onion and cilantro. We also liked the hot tea they served. Service was quick and no wait on a Saturday around 11:30am. Restaurant was very clean too. I wish the parking lot was bigger and more organized. Even though it had designated spots, cars seemed to line up wherever it could find space. I'll definitely be back for more pho, but also looking to try some of the apps or vermicelli bowls.> Came here early morning of New Years day! I was ordering for my friends, the perfect hangover cure and also perfect for the cold weather like today. As I like to say, it will touch your soul. And on the temp meter, the soup is def at the perfect temperature, its not "burn your face" hot, its just right.Came in and was instantly greeted and handed a menu. The guy was getting ready to eat his bowl of pho but came over super fast to make sure my order was put in! Appreciated that :) I ordered 4 phos and it took about 20 minutes. While waiting, more and more people started coming in, definitely the locals fave! I love the avocado smoothies here, if you get a chance, definitely recommend! Also recommend the pork spring rolls, game changer! To make take outs an easier/faster process, definitely call to order!Always good customer service and pho is usually served quicker, I assume its probably because I was one of the first patrons in the morning. 9/10 times that I come, there is no wait as the food comes out fast and people finish their meals fast as well :)> Pho Linh is ok in my opinion. The broth isn't as flavorful compared to other places I've been to. I ordered a regular bowl and they gave the perfect amount of both meat and noodles.> Average, maybe below average (?) viet food. I personally don't like eating here and would rather drive to Dorchester. But when me and my bf are lazy we go here lol (he drives). I wouldn't recommend the pho, it lacks flavor compared to other places. I've tried the bun bo hue (hue special soup? - idk how to describe it in English lol), bun rieu (crab noodle soup) and bun dac biet (pork vermicelli). Their bun bo heu is average nothing too special. My favorite on their menu is probably their bun rieu cause it's simple and you can't really mess it up. Last time I went I got the pork vermicelli. It was ok... I wasn't a huge fan of the vermicelli they used though. It was a bit too thin idk if they were being cheap on the noodles or not. But ya, like I said it's average (maybe below average) Vietnamese food. I feel like a lot of non Vietnamese people like the food here, but to Vietnamese people it's definitely not the best lol.The waiters were attentive tho (good job) food could just use some work.

this is the best sushi restaurant (and Japanese fusion) I've ever had in my entire life. The sushi is so fresh. And the food is delicious + savory. Highly recommend everything i ordered. I unfortunately am on a low carb, high protein diet so my food isn't that exciting (but they were so accommodating to my low sodium sauce needs), But my boyfriend got the duck and it was sensational! Also got the Marina Bay and it was out of this world!> I've been coming to Fuji for years and all the servers and past managers were great. Eve. At the 1546 location which was always packed and fun had good managers.  I have been going there thru so many managers and hostess and servers but never had such bad experience as I had couple of days a go with the new manager. His name is Don so I was told. I had a bad experience, so someone was walking and their coat bumped my table which was so close to the bar and kind of in the way. Instead of hi. Apologizing he was blaming the customer and saying they were clumsy.  I thought the table I was sitting shouldn't even be there, it was clearly in the way. He also said, "no the tables are fobe where they are and people sit here all the time. He told the server to offer me a drink which I rejected. He had a bad attitude a d handled this minor accident very poorly.Today, I walked in alone earlier than that night. There were no greeters he came he, Don came to meet me at the entrance, I said " hello, is it ok to sit by the bar?" He responded yes it fine" he didn't say hello nor welcome. Again,  I repeated hello, he didn't say anything. I had to say this. " I was looking for a hello first and he gave me a smirk. How rude is that... to be a manager you have to have certain. Criteria a d resume. Where is the key " customer service"???I have to applaud Ms Vicky for a wonderful welcome and great customer service and a pleasant server. Maybe she should be a manager...> First time trying and taking out food here! And I will have to say the food is meh less than okay, not as good as I hoped. But the big downside was the PORTION of the food they gave to me was considerably less than what I've expected. This is even less than your to-go-box at a restaurant! And here comes the crashing moment 17$?! For a food that doesn't tase good, it's rather on the dry and VERY OILY side and comes in a pretty small portion. Will not come here and order again. I will have to give a positive note that the aesthetics of the restaurants is very nice, well up to date, and modern.> Not sure why I haven't written a review for this place yet, because I am usually in here all the time! Fuji's is the ultimate best for sushi, service, drinks, etc. Whenever we walk in here, we are always greeted with a smile from the hostess. We usually sit at one of the bars, it typically depends on our moods (since the back bar is where all the action happens). The back bar you get a front row seat to the sushi masters, the ones that prepare, execute and design all the sushi dishes. Everytime we sit here, they usually give us an amuse-bouche, so we get to try something different or maybe something that we already had before. Either way, the experience is great! Whether you are looking for a new lunch/dinner place in Quincy and even if you aren't in the mood for sushi, go anyways. I know you will love it!> This place has it ALL RIGHT. I'm telling you if you've been looking for a sign to get sushi THIS IS IT! it's affordable because we all know eating out can be pricey but even if you do find it a little expensive it's worth it just give it a try if you haven't already.

This is hands down the BEST DIm Sum spot in Quincy quite possibly the best in MA. Yes, it's that good! I've been coming here for over a decade and it recently changed owners this year but the quality never went down. All the staff know my family and I and treat us really well. It's traditional push carts and they have other menu items like noodles that you can order. My faves are the Har Gaw, roasted pork pastry in filio dough, bean curd roll, pineapple bun with custard filling, the shrimp rice noodles. I've been to other spots in Quincy and even Malden and nothing compares to this place.> For the greater boston area, this is one of the better cantonese restaurants in town.  The reviews:Excellent garlic fried chicken- the meat was moist and perfectly friedThe peking pork chops could have had more acidity in the sauce but overall was deliciousThe rice fish stir fry with chive flowers was ok- the fish should have been more crispy but overall it had good flavorThe eggplant sardines chicken pot was very flavorful but a bit too greasyThe pepper sizzling steak was overcooked and not browned.  Almost felt boiledThe Mayonnaise shrimp needs to be crispier and more condensed milk in the sauceParking is difficult!I will be back to eat here if I am in the area!> My family usually goes to Winsor Dim Sum Cafe for dim sum but we decided to mix it up a little on New Years Day, so we headed to Eat Ocean Restaurant in Quincy. The place was PACKEDDDD. You had to put your name down with the woman at the front, and I believe we waited at least 30 minutes to get a table for our party of 6. We were finally seated after a few bigger tables left. Carts started swarming our table, and we were able to eat right away. I usually think dim sum spots with carts often take a long time since you have to wait for them to go around. However, that was not the case at East Ocean. Once they saw us sitting down, they rushed on over and gave us the goods.The food was all fresh, steaming hot and delicious. Real authentic dim sum; makes you feel right at home. I can't decide whether I like Winsor or East Ocean more, but they're now both my top favorite spots for dim sum. You can tell it's a good spot when all the Quincy Asian families decide to come here on New Years instead of the other spots in town. I highly recommend checking this place out!> DIMSUM FOR DAYS HERE. The food is authentic, the prices are good. I came here over the weekend looking for a table for 2. They told us that as long as we were cool with sharing a table with others then we could be seated immediately. If you're like me and cool with that, I think its still really comfortable to eat. The food comes immediately, you can order dimsum from the carts and from the servers too. Things like porridge and other vegetables are available per request. Because the size of the restaurant is relatively small, you'll definitely have access to all the carts all the foods so you don't have to wait long. Will definitely come back for more dimsum in the future.> Food and service has improved. I am satisfied with the timing it took for the food to arrive on a busy Saturday night and the waiters were attentative. The seafood prices (live lobster, crab, fish) is very competitive with their competitors, with some items a tad bit cheaper. I would have given 5 stars but the Vancouver crab I had was in the tank a little long and not as fresh. Also I suspect one of my crab leg was switched lol, as the texture of meat and shell was completely different from the rest if the crab. Overall the experience was much better than the last time I was here, when it was under old ownership.

The new location is much better as it is larger allowing a shorter wait time. At the former location, I've waited at least an hour and thirty minutes for a table. At the new location, I've waited no more than ten minutes for a table. My go to order is the blackened chicken pasta -- such a large portion. My boyfriend ordered the BBQ pulled pork sandwich and it wasn't good. The sandwich was drenched in sauce and the meat was hard to chew.  During a separate occasion, I ordered the lobster mac and cheese for take out. There were only three small pieces of lobster and the pasta was somewhat dry as it lacked in cheese.> This is a difficult review for me. I have been an avid Fat Cat fan since moving to Quincy in 2014. My wife is still obsessed with their Mac n Cheese and orders it regularly. Unfortunately, there's a reason why the Yelp stars have dropped significantly since their move.The pricing has also increased. I understand slight increases over time - but it really doesn't seem like the quality is in line with where it once was. Tonight we ordered dinner and got a side of fries. A "SIDE" of fries now costs $9.00 (it used to be $7.00 which i guess is a bit less nuts). This is a crazy price for what you're getting - a paper bag filled with fries that sits open until you get it home and it is normally nice and cold when you're ready to eat them. Tonight, our fries weren't even cooked - they were soft and soggy and inedible. I actually called to complain and believe they said they would refund me but hung up on me before i got any confirmation.The wings were my entree tonight. I'm not sure why they ask what level of hotness you want because they are normally bone dry. Tiny hint of sauce - which has been the way both the "bone in" and "bone out" have been over the last few months. Once I asked for extra sauce on them (I just want a normal amount of buffalo sauce) and was told I would be charged extra for the sauce. This is unacceptable.If I was writing this review based solely off the normal female hostess that works weeknights/saturdays it would be 5 Stars - she is awesome!At this point, I'm calling on the owner to step up and acknowledge what is going on with the quality of their food and do something about it and also be vocal about it. These price increases really don't represent the quality of food coming out of the kitchen lately. And no side of fries should be $9...unless they are part of another dish.Fat Cat is a staple in Quincy and I used to brag about the restaurant to friends and family and bring them there when they visited, but if it stays the way it has been going, I won't be returning. The Mac n Cheese is the only consistent item on the menu.> I was really excited to come here as the Fat Cats in the older location was amazing. Waiting was quick, this place is also popping. I had some friends who visited Fat Cats a couple weeks prior to myself going. I didn't believe them when they said it, but the quality of the food is just not the same :(We got seated in the back, near the kitchen. Servers/waiters kept walking into my chair... Our server was nice, she took our orders and gave us more info. We ordered a calamari and fries for appetizers. The calamari wasn't as crispy as I remembered, on the soggy side. The cheese on the fries weren't melted at all, they were just flaked on top of the fries. For entrees, I ordered a Grilled Ribeye. Visually, it looks great, but the potatos and steak weren't really flavored, the butter on it was great, but didn't really flavor the steak enough for me..the best thing about that dish was probably the brussel sprouts but that also needed extra salt and pepper. Would love a little more crisp on the outsides of the steak, but thats a personal preference. The OG Fat Cats is what made me love brussel sprouts.Here is the one that disappointed my whole party. One of my friends ordered a Linguine Alfredo....so the alfredo sauce was very watery, not much stayed on the pasta, you lift the pasta and the "sauce" drips down the join the white pool on the plate. The saddest thing, it didn't taste very garlicy...we all took turns trying that dish and 4/4 think it tasted a bit soapy....I used to love Fat Cats but its just not the same anymore.> I had such high expectations for the new location. Even with it being much larger than the old location, our wait for three people around 8pm was still around 45 minutes, which is whatever since they are known to be extremely busy. Our server was extremely nice, she was this little lady who was SO friendly! I ordered the lobster mac and cheese because that is known to be a staple at Fat Cat. My friend ordered ribs and my boyfriend ordered a steak. We ordered some wings as an appetizer, I honestly don't know how you can mess up wings. They were tiny and extremely dry. I know I ordered sauce on the side, but the wings were like they were thrown into a 400 degrees oven and forgotten to the point that they shriveled up. The time in between our food being brought out was quite long. When everything came out, the lobster mac and cheese looked good, thank god. The ribs were so-so. The steak looked like it was thrown on a plate real quick with some boiled greens and a slab of useless butter, it was extremely bland, so hard to even finish the plate. We couldn't find our server anywhere so we asked someone else if we can get an extra plate to share the mac and cheese. She was EXTREMELY loud and rude when announcing she'd go find us our server, then marches away. All the employees looked miserable, there was barely anyone smiling beyond the hosts. I think they also increased their prices? I may be wrong. But it was pretty pricey for a not so great meal. It was just a disappointing experience overall. I don't think I'd be returning, maybe just for the mac and cheese if it doesn't go downhill as well.> I've had better. Better service, that is.I was a frequent visitor of this establishment before they moved, and I thought well, let's go check it out.Visit #1: popped in here and sat at the bar with my friend and enjoyed some steak mac, calamari and cocktails. Good times. Visit #2: Had lunch with a friend and the strong smells of detergent wafting from the bar dishwashers were kind of annoying, but tolerable.Visit #3: Coworker wanted to hang out here on his last day and he wanted to come here and so we did.  We didn't know how many people were going to show up so we congregated in the bar/lounge area. A little later, some more friends showed up and we asked about putting some tables together and staff told us that we couldn't (and not in a nice way). Another coworker came and accidentally grabbed a chair from the bar to bring to a table and he was angrily told to put it back. We were not impressed by customer service.Visit #4: Friday night drinks at a bar. 6 of us were having drinks and apps and we were seated at a 6-seater. No big deal, right? We were told that if one more person comes then we can add a chair. Lies.7th person shows up and we asked for that chair we were told that we could have in case we had an extra person show up. Manager comes by and said that we could not have an extra chair because the table that we were at was already at max capacity. But it was okay for my friend to stand at the table at my side and then her drink and food orders were taken too, but yet she couldn't sit at the table.Food we got was not that great. Fries, fried pickles and mussels were good but the shrimp and fish tacos were not that great. Fish smelled old and the shrimp taco had oil dripping from it. I don't recommend these tacos.I also wouldn't recommend if you have a large party and want a space to drink and chill.

As an Arab (Jordanian) living in Boston, it was so hard to find really good and well-priced middle eastern pastries (Manakeesh) - but this place hits the spot. It's absolutely perfect, well-priced, and delicious. Arab pastries made by real Arabs? Sign me up.I tried the cheese Ajeen and the chicken Ajeen - both were really great. The dough was cooked to perfection and crispy on the edges, the fillings were rich and flavorful, and it's not too dough-y or oily. And the prices are similar to what you'd get in the Middle East too (yes a little more expensive but this is America, and it's amazing to find this food at a good price).The only downside I have is that the sweet Ajeen was filled with very little Nutella (it wasn't too flavorful) but other than that, this place is epic, and you should definitely go there for a snack if you're in the area. I'm still yet to try their Lahm Ajeen but I bet it will be amazing too. Keep up the great work, I'm super happy I stumbled across this place while walking in Allston last week, and now I hope to be a regular!> Great Lebanese flatbreads at a great price! We walked in during their soft opening, and were lucky enough to get some free samples before we picked what we wanted. Ended up getting the Zaatar and Mouhammara with a side of Baba Ghannouj. Both flatbreads were great, with plenty of toppings so they are definitely worth the cheap price! Baba Ghannouj tasted very fresh, definitely homemade. Everyone in there was happy to answer our questions! We may have to go back again today. They also give extra pita for free if you order a side sauce!> OUTSTANDING!  Welcome to Allston Rock City- you are so authentic- fresh fast and DELICIOUS! Great menu & a great price point!

I'll admit I spent a solid 20 minutes looking at Yelp reviews and the online menu before coming here and STILL couldn't decide what to order. The menu has such a wide selection of udon, rice dishes, and sides, so I pretty much wanted to try everything on the menu. I eventually landed on the wagyu udon with truffle dashi, which was so fragrant and delicious. The portion was truly massive, so I'd say the steeper prices are totally justified. On top of that, the service was amazing - my server took the time to run through the entire menu with us and was super attentive throughout our meal. The mood lighting and cozy feel really added to the ambiance and make this a great date spot as well.> 3 stars... Because one order is good and another is ... Rediculous. First order of Sukiyaki was full of meaty goodness, packed with great flavor. The second one... Curry udon with a single piece of small beef the size of a pinky nail, like serious. A single. Piece. Of. Beef. Not to mention, the beef was dry and tough, and I only live 2 minutes away. Overall my girlfriend enjoyed the meal... But I didn't, since the curry udon was my order. But at least the curry taste ok. Still overpriced for the quality.Update: they forgot the egg in the Sukiyaki udon. Lowered to 2 stars.> I heard from friends that Tsurutontan is opening a new location Boston aside from NY, so decided to check it out and it was pretty satisfying. There can be a few improvements, but it can slide since they only opeNed recently. I called for a reservation at noon for a evening dinner, but there reservation is full so we decided to walk in. We waited near the bar for more than 30 mins before being called. The waiting space isn't too big so it can get hot quickly. Good thing they have a coat check. The drinks we ordered at the bar while waiting (Tokyo Mule) is too sweet and lack alcoholic content. Would like to see them do better there. Once we were sat, the service was on point. He carefully explained the types of noodles, how it was made fresh in house daily, how regular and double size cost the same and his recommendations. We ordered the lamb chop for appetizer for 4 people, My friends and I ended up getting the wagyu udon with truffle and dashi, another got the wagyu sukiyaki with egg. It was very delicious and I slurped and drank all the soup. Overall it only came out to 35 dollars a person which isn't bad at all.To have the best experience, make sure to reserve ahhh and avoid the waiting. Maybe stay away from the cocktails for now and ordeR the wagyu udon it's a must try.> A solid udon place! I ordered the stir fry udon and it was a little oily but tasty. We also ordered a curry udon and another udon soup, which everyone enjoyed. They have the option for thin or thick cut udon and we all opted for thick cut udon. They also have the option for regular or large size for the same price! Large would just have more udon and soup, not more of the dish ingredients. Of course we had to all order large for the leftovers! The atmosphere was also very comfortable and modern. They have the two floors of seating and both are decorated nicely. Would return again!> A new udon spot in town! I have the opportunity to try Tsurotontan a couple of times since it's opening. This restaurant has locations in Hawaii and NYC as well. The restaurant is huge and I love the set up of this place. They have 2 stories so there is plenty of room to enjoy a delicious bowl of udon. I highly recommend the happy hour! This is available in the bar area only. You get a variety selection of their sushi and appetizers at a good deal! The sashimi was super good quality and fresh. I was super satisfied with a few rolls and appetizers with another friend. The only downside is that the udon is not available! I went back on another occasion for the udon. The udon is around $20 and seems pricey but it comes in a monstrous size serving bowl filled with delicious ingredients! I got the tsurotontan deluxe. You have an option to select the thickness of the udon. I like them extra thicc, so of course I went with the thickest option. The udon was super chewy and delicious. Each noodle was wrapped up with the delicious umami broth. Their udon is handmade in house and I can definitely taste the difference. The servers here are super attentive and helpful in recommending different options to try. There are so many lot different types of udons to choose from and I will have to come back to try other ones!

reviews: Maria's get 5 stars from our family. We had a family event on Sunday (Memorial Brunch) in the function room upstairs. Food was plentiful and our server/bartender Elizabeth delivered exceptional service with a gracious smile. Kudos to Fernando for all of his help suggesting how much food to order (when we were not sure how many would show up) and for making sure no detail was forgotten.We have had several family events at Maria's over the years (50th Birthday parties, etc.) and have never been dissapointed.> This place has a nice romantic old Italy feel to it. They bring out a complimentary bread. I ordered fried calamari which the waitress forgot about sadly. But in all honesty the portions are large and good so we probably wouldn't have ate our meals. I was really craving some fresh calamari though. My husband ordered the spaghetti and meat sauce and I got the seafood pasta filled with clams, mussles, calamari and scallops. Both our meals were yummy !> Food is really good... and the waitresses do an awesome job... but would it kill the big Lurch looking door man to show a little personality?  You walk in and he's lingering ....  it's like being seated by a rock.  If you know this place , the back room is like Chuckie Cheese.   Everyone In there's yelling over the next table ... so maybe it would be nice if Lurch asked where you'd like to sit.   But... Lurch brings it down a couple points.> This place is old school, really, really old school.  I remember coming here as a kid, and by their web page,(which is equally old) it's been around lot longer back than that.  Maria's it the quintessential, stereotypical Italian / American restaurant, complete with murals, faux brick and stone, and various statues, (I distinctly remember plastic grapevines strewn about when I was a kid but they're gone now).  The staff is always pleasant, they remind me of diner waitstaff in the best possible way.  The kind that chat  you up for a sec before taking your order then call you "hon" afterwards.  The bartender is without a doubt a vampire.  This man has looked exactly the same since the first day I walked into the place.  What's even funnier is he look EXACTLY like actor Tom Skerritt, (Viper from Top Gun for those that don't know) it's uncanny! That being said, he's very, very nice and makes a drink that'll knock your socks off.  You don't come or Maria's for fuffy takes on Italian, you come here for good old fashioned comfort Italian swimming in red sauces and smoother in melted cheese. Sure, you can get piccata, marsala, steak, or seafood but for me the red sauce is the star of the joint.  It's just a consistently good sauce, little salty, little oily, hits the spot every-time.  That being said they make one of the best sausage cacciatores I've eaten.  I've never orders an app because ever entree comes with a Greek salad and they literally give you a sliced loaf of Italian bread with dinner.  If you can manage dessert, the tiramisu is good.  Maybe a little different than most places because I swear there's a caramel sauce of some kind in it, but I'm on-board with that.  Back to old school for a sec, they have spumoni for dessert.  I've never had it, not entirely sure what it is aside from it being some old ass, "fancy" dessert.  Bottom line, good old fashioned Italian, nice people, been around forever so they're doing something right so check it out.> A colleague recommended this restaurant to me, and decided to give it a try. The soup was on the saltier side, but it was good - tons of chicken and rice in the soup. I ordered their Eggplant Parmesan and it was good. My sister said their Chicken Piccata was good, too. The portions were very generous for the price you pay... I had my Eggplant Parm for lunch the next day. I'll come back when I crave homestyle cooking!

Small establishment, big flavors. Feels very authentic right when you walk in. I decided to try the beef brisket noodle soup. It was definitely on the spicier side, but the flavors were pretty spot on. The broth was flavorful and aromatic, and the beef itself was fairly tender and slightly chewy. I also added a tea egg to mine - so yummy! Definitely recommend if you've never had one before. As a Taiwanese person, beef noodle soup is always one of my favorite dishes but it's usually difficult to find a good place. Everyone does it so differently, but I really enjoyed Lanzhou's version! The portion was huge, and the prices are reasonable. Service was just okay - not bad, not great. Overall, definitely worth a visit!> I had no idea this place existed until I checked Yelp for some places to eat around Allston. It's a pretty small place, so probably not a place you want to go to with a huge group. We were greeted and seated immediately. Looked over the menu and there are even pictures on the wall so you can refer to some of the dishes! Ordered the Lanzhou Beef Brisket Noodle Soup and the Cumin Lamb Biang Biang Noodle. Food came pretty quickly which is definitely a plus. The Beef Brisket Soup was pretty good, it's a very clean flavor and I feel like it could be a bit more flavorful. The Cumin Lamb on the other hand was very flavorful and I definitely recommend this dish! If you can't take spicy, definitely ask for less spicy. I would definitely come back to try their other dishes...but the Cumin Lamb is definitely calling me to go back!> I had to try the noodles for a place that has "fresh noodles" advertised in their front banner.The noodles did not disappoint. The cumin lamb noodles really hit the spot for someone who likes spicy food but cannot handle very spicy dishes. I had to take a few breaks in between to calm the spice level in my mouth but the noodles really had me wanting more the whole time. The lamb was seasoned well, tender, and cut into bite sized pieces which was nice so you didn't need to rip large chunks of it apart.The noodle soup was very good as well (although the dry noodles were my favorite). The brisket was tender but could have been cut into more manageable sized pieces. It was definitely less spicy than the dry noodles . A solid dish altogether.I was pretty disappointed in the scallion pancakes. They have pictures on one of the walls that made the scallion pancakes look so enticing but the actual dish was nothing like it. Very dry with not much to it other than dough. We had to ask for some dipping sauce because they didn't bring anything out with it and it was not good enough to eat by itself.Everything did some in healthy portions so you are getting your money's worth. It is CASH ONLY so come prepared. There is a Bank of America ATM very close by in case you do forget.Beef brisket noodle soup: 4/5Cumin lamb biang biang noodle: 5/5Scallion pancakes: 2/5> New favorite noodle shop in town! Note: cash only! Very solid Chinese noodle offerings plus side dishes and soups. This place used to a chinese burger place but I think these noodles will sell better. I got the classic namesake Lanzhou beef noodle soup. It comes naturally spicy, but you can ask for it without the spicy paste. I loved the noodles, but the broth was not the deepest flavor I've had, perhaps due to the spicy paste they put in. The bowl was huge with a big serving of chewy long noodles,  making the $11 price tag very reasonable. They don't charge tip! You order at the counter, pay, and then they bring out your food. Free hot water is provided - this is how you know it's a legit Chinese place when they bring out hot water instead of ice water as default. I would definitely try their side dishes next time, including spicy pig ears, as well as their tea eggs which are a little pricey at $1.50 each but considering there is no competition in the vincinity, what can we even do about it. One additional issue, I'm not sure if they have a bathroom - I suspect no, which is a slight problem for a restaurant with more than 5 tables serving huge bowls of noodles.> Food is good, service is bad. Tried to order food to go and I asked what's the difference between two chicken dishes. The waitress was impatient about my question and said they taste different. Of course right? Or why they are two different dishes? So I asked for more information, she said she didn't know what's the difference cause she's not the cook. So just ask the cook if you don't know, the kitchen is just two steps away.I was surprised by her attitude and then she said one of the dishes is bigger than another one. Ok, so far I have no interest to eat here no matter if the food is good or not.

A friend wanted to do a boba run so we popped into OneZo on Billings Street in Quincy.I was the OneZo newbie, so she told me that they made the boba inhouse.  That impressed me enough to consider including some boba in my drink.  Yes, I usually go boba-less because it is rather filling, and I don't enjoy it enough to pay a surcharge to include it in my liquid treat.This spot is one of those combo shops.  In this case, OneZo (a drink place) and Cheers Cut (a fried food place).  There's a Cheers Cut out in Allston/Brighton, but I have yet to make it out there.  But I had recollections of having seen pictures posted on social media of a large flattened fried squid on a stick, and was quite interested in trying that.  Fortunately my friends were up for it.Our squid, however, arrived in pieces in a take-out container.  Salted Pepper with Taiwanese Teriyaki dipping sauce.  Presentation was a bit of a downer given our inflated expectations, but it was actually pretty good - tender beneath the fry job, and so many tenacles!After mulling over the board, I also got myself a Taro Milk Tea ($4.25 Medium) with Taro Boba $0.75, with less ice and less sugar.  To my surprise, there was actual taro pieces mixed up with the purple boba pearls at the bottom of my clear plastic cup.  Yum!  It was a real treat!Counter service spot with limited seating.  Single unisex bathroom.  Bust your own table.> This review is for their drinks only as I didn't try their food offerings.The thing that caught my attention was the fact they have their boba made in house (see photo for reference)!I tried their brown sugar milk tea with less ice and half sugar and let me just say... Unless you have a sweet tooth go for quarter sugar. The flavor was great as the brown sugar really stood out but man... Even for me I thought the sweetness level was off the chart at half.... Can't even imagine what the full sugar amount would be like (probably tastes like diabetes).Wife got the original milk tea with a quarter level of sugar and half ice. The flavor was pretty good but it did taste a bit watered down. Could be from the ice (I always recommend getting as little ice as possible to not dilute the tea).Boba however was fantastic with a nice sweet chewy texture. Very pleasant. We got the white boba though the have A LOT of different toppings you can add.Overall it's a pretty good bubble tea place. Just be mindful of the sweetness!> Cheers Cut has finally made it's way into Quincy. No longer need to trek out to Allston for some good grub food!We ordered the fried squid combo but we didn't realize until we got to our destination that they gave us fried beef instead. I think the cashier misheard us because it was on our receipt :( Not a bad mix up but it just caused a moment of confusement when we opened up the box LOL.At $9.50 for a combo, you get a decent amount of food. We got the fried beef which comes with rice, curry on the side, a small salad, and a very tiny bit of seaweed salad. It's more than enough for a lunch for one person and the perfect pairing to boba. I can't say the fried beef is my favorite but quality and taste is as good as I expected it to be (like the Allston location). I'd definitely come back, especially since it's closer to me!> This was my first time getting food from here. My boyfriend came here with his friend and tried the food here and has been raving about it. We got 3 different types of onigiri; shrimp tempura, spam and eel. All were good and but the eel onigiri was probably the best out of the three. We also got the fried diced beef and it was soooo good and a must try from here> First of all- this place needs to TONE down their music! If you need to talk to a person right next to you - you need to pretty much raise your voice like you're at a concert. So my girlfriend and I came to check this new place out since they just opened recently but I believe this is a franchised establishment. (Since it's franchised- they shouldn't need much to work on but their staff) This is a counter service restaurant so order at the counter then seat yourself. We ordered the large fried squid combo (will need to order seasoning preference on protein and rice), fried chicken wing and a boba drink. Our order came out about 20 min later The amount of large fried squid pieces was the best part of the dish but the cooking and cutting it into bite size pieces- was a fail. ( they fried it but there was hardly any coating on it and) Fried chicken wings was a bit better. Little crispy(batter held up more than the squid) and hot, but that's about it. I ordered the salt and pepper version, but only tasted the batter. I guess the tiny sauce containers is what you're supposed to use to cover or dip your protein with. Girlfriend ordered a grapefruit drink and said it was pretty good but not the best shes had. I definitely will be back to give it another try but there is about 4 places within walking distance with similar items so they definitely need to up their game.

When I come here I typically go for the filet mignon (picture below). I have never once had any problems with this place (I can't say the same for The Capital Grille in Chestnut Hill which always over cooked my steaks). Anyways, I once deviated from my normal order and got the wagyu which was cooked and tasted beautifully. I 100% recommend getting the creamed corn, lobster macaroni & cheese or any of their potatoes as a side dish. For red wine, I recommend pairing your steak with the 2017 Orin Swift Machete. Otherwise, they have an extensive wine collection, so you will always find something great to pair with your meal. Their cheesecake dessert is also very tasty. The atmosphere here is perfect for a steakhouse with fantastic panoramic views. All of the seating is comfortable, both at the bar and dinner tables. The servers are very knowledge and attentive. This location's manager is also very kind and accommodating. I used to see him often at the Capital Grille. He made his transition over to Del Frisco's as a manager just as I did as a diner.> Myself and some co workers went to the seaport Del Frisco's for a retirement party in early February. We booked a private room for the 15 or so of us, which was a $2000.09 mOne of us was looking at the wine list and asked if there was a solemner working who could help to order. The woman sold him on a "magnum" which would be about 2 glasses per guest. No mention was made of the price point or what we were looking to spend on a glass of wine with dinner. When they began pouring he asked and found that the bottle was $2750.00. I feel as though this was underhanded, unethical and the last thing I would expect from a first-class establishment (which is what Del Frisco's portrays itself to be). Further, 2 of my friends had to send their steaks back due to being over-cooked. Needless to say I will not be back nor will I recommend the restaurant ti anyone looking for a steakhouse when in Boston. Spoke with Emily who told me someone from the actual restaurant would be contacting me. Has not happened...Still waiting to hear from restaurant. Lol Good stuff> Valentines Day FAIL!  For Valentines Day you would expect a romantic quiet ambiance. Here you get a head thumping club noise level experience. We asked for the music to be turned down several times but nothing happened. They put make shift tables up and had the chairs situated so when you went to sit down you smashed your knee into the huge table leg.  I still have a bruise on my knee a week later! The staff was nice. The drinks were good, but took forever to arrive. The filet medallions were good but it was a small portion.I think the "age steaks" are false marketing.  As they didn't have the flavor or texture you get from a dry aged steak. Also, they make you cut into the middle of the steak to check it's cooked right when it first arrives.  Shouldn't a steak house have better confidence in there cooking?  I also don't like starting my steak in the middle. The potatoes were way over seasoned with pepper. The Brussels sprouts were yummy. Since the dry aged steak seemed to have been misrepresented, and the ambiance was terrible, I would say the food was way over priced> I'd love to give 5 stars and if this review were solely on the food, it would be 5 stars.I've been in several times and spent $1000. + on meals. Food always good!Here's the bad: I've always had a reservation and I've always been offered very poor table locations. One of the reasons the place is great is the views.Once again on the day after Valentines Day (a Saturday) we arrived at our reserved time and were escorted to a table in a room that is a function room converted to regular table space for the expected crowd. We went into the room of 25 or so tables. Nobody else in there and I said this is unacceptable. I'd like a table on the main floor which had many many open tables. The hostess stated that our room would fill up very quickly and not to worry. I didn't care about the occupancy of the room, i wanted views and ambience the main dining room offered and had a ton of tables in. She stated that all of the tables were slotted and mapped out in advance and no changes could be made. Total BS. Our waiter arrived and apologized and also stated he didn't like working the room either but we'd have to stay. Service was good and we moved on and he was a very good waiter. I did tell him and several others that every time I come in I get a lousy table, spend a lot of money and don't think I'll return. Again, apologies abound and  during our meal, only 3 more tables filled the room of around 25 total tables. When we finished our meal and began our exit through the place, there were still many tables on the main floor open. I would think a manager would have paid my table a visit and apologized, offered another table, anything but couldn't be bothered.During the meal, the lights were lowered in this room and the lights simply flickered constantly. Staff couldn't fix it and apologized. A Fairly high end steak house should be better than this! They weren't and doubt I'll return.A shame because the food and service are quite good but spending a couple hundred dollars on a meal for 2 should include a table and location worth the expense.Management wasn't busy and really could've shown up. They didn't and that's unprofessional in this and any other business.> Top notch dining experience.View of the Boston Harbour, fresh air, fresh seafood,awesome service and great ambiance Didn't dine on one of their much ballyhooedSteaks, opted instead for Shellfish Plateau It's actually designed for 2 people but themanager said they could build it for just oneperson, fantastic!!! Not everyone goes to awell known Steakhouse to order seafood.The Plateau has King Crab legs, LobsterTail, Crab Claws and shrimp. I added Raw Oysters to the Plateau and had a side of Asparagus Spears. All of it was fresh and delicious! Washed it down with beer namedVIP and also some Lagunitas IPA. Enjoyedour waitress Caroline. She was attentive,knowledgeable and fun

menu_dishes: Hometown Hugs - Bonchon Bundle, Family Meal, Strips (Choose 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 Pcs), Wings (Choose 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 Pcs), Drumsticks (Choose 5 / 10 / 15 / 20 Pcs), Combo (Choose your size), Takoyaki, Gyoza, Edamame, Crispy Salmon Salad, Spicy Seafood Salad, Avocado Salad, Seaweed Salad, Spicy Pork, House Fried Rice, Bull Dak, Tteokbokki, Seafood Scallion Pancake, Bulgogi, Bibimbap, Kimchi Jjigae, Spicy Japchae, Bulgogi Stew, Nabeyaki Udon, Yaki Udon, Steamed Rice, Sushi Rice, French Fries, Kimchi (Spicy), Coleslaw, Radish, Coke, Diet Coke, Sprite, Ginger Ale, Nestea Ice Tea

reviews: I've been Bonchon all around the world, and I can tell you the quality definitely varies per store. I've been going here since it first opened in Boston, and it has the best tasting Korean Fried chicken for the Soy Garlic flavor!In terms of food, I would recommend the avocado salad and Half & Half wings/drums.  It's enough for 3 people, and some leftovers. Delicious  just thinking about bonchon wings has me hungry.> I had the worst experience today. I am completely mind blown and speechless. Never have I ever received this type of service/treatment for takeout. I work in the industry and worked at a competing restaurant (past) and I understand the process of cooking the chicken, and wait time.  I ordered on Yelp for take-out today at 3:45pm. I got the email and everything, and when I arrived to the restaurant my boyfriend went inside and said that they did not have my order (okay, no big deal we can figure this out), he then texts me that he sees the slip and the the employee had told him she had "forgot to send it" (okay, again, no big deal; i get it, when taking an order from these apps most places have to manually put it in). She then asks him does he want to wait and she can rush an order and "it'll be 15-20mins". He texted me and asked if that's okay, I said as long as it's not another 30 mins then I don't mind. We would have never agreed if she had said 30-45 mins. We were already waiting in the car for 20 mins. She said she'd give us a discount, which was not my intention but it was nice enough to offer since it was their mistake on their end. I'm sitting in the car, my boyfriend is inside waiting. The employees are well aware of his presence, but does not once alert him "it'll be 10 more mins" or even apologize for the wait. All we ordered was small wings, French fries, and the salmon avocado salad. I saw at least 10 people go in and out and grab their food with no issue. Quick go in and go out. Finally it's been at least 40 mins, and he goes and asks where the food was. The employee was confused. Then the girl that took the order had forgotten it behind the sushi bar... this whole time it was already ready..... be he was standing there when the time was up. And the girl was just too busy texting on her phone.He comes into the car with the food and tells me the story, I look in the bag, fries are soggy, no chopsticks, no napkins, no nothing. I go inside because I was honestly disappointed in everything. I go inside and asked them what the deal was. Why was this experience like this? What was the issue? I told them no utensils, the guy gives 1 chopstick. No napkins no wet nap or anything, and I think (but couldn't see correctly) I think he gave a single pair of chopstick. When I was talking to the girl, I explained her my frustration, and she proceeds to say "you cancelled the order" and I asked her why would I do that when I've been waiting in the car for almost an hour. If I was going to do something like that I would not leave my car running for that long for no reason. I showed her the email and said "well I didn't cancel it, it was you" and then I asked her so how come when my boyfriend was in here you couldn't even alert him about the time. She said "the avocado salmon salad takes a long time" it takes 40 mins for that salad?!? The double fried chicken wings takes about 30 mins between frying, and saucing, and packaging. How can a sushi appetizer take that long unless it was a hamachi Kama or hotate hokiyaki. She doesn't even apologize for anything and proceeds to blame it on me and the salad. There wasn't even a promised  discount on there to makeup for their mistake. So you offered a solution but didn't even go by it. I also asked her why did you tell my boyfriend it'd be 20-30 mins and her response was "I didn't I told him 30-45mins" she then just said I'll return the food and give you your money back. At that point the food was already cooled off because when it got into the car I opened up the fries to see and it was just 'warm' no crunch, no heat. I told her I would never have agreed to wait another 30 mins if that's what she had said in the first place. And why would my boyfriend lie to me when he didn't even want bonchon in the first place. It was me who wanted it, so he had nothing to gain out of waiting longer. So at the end of the day, total time wasted on bonchon takeout with no takeout was about 1hr 30mins, and still left hungry. First meal of the day, great way to start my day. I then called later to speak to the manager and asked for the girls name. The guy refused to let me speak to anyone or answer my question and responded to me with "uh why" I still have my email of grubhub that my order was sent, and that it got cancelled.> I have been coming to BonChon since I was in highschool. It's been the same, always a wait on Fri-Sun evenings (quicker lines on Sundays). Still known for the fried chicken. The wings come out super hot and crispy, drizzled in soy garlic sauce. The fries here I feel like are super under rated. They are thiccccck and crispy af. The bibimbap, my only complaint was that our yolk was overcooked :( but the dish itself was still amazing :) the okonomiyaki is still as fun as ever with the squid flakes curling.I've ordered the beef japchae here before and they were able to make that not spicy :) the budae jigae is fun, but pricey and comes out spicy hahaha unlike the camrbidge bonchon, this one has a drink menu! The sushi here is honestly not too expensive. I feel like I've had the same foods here for years now haha I really should switch to trying their sushi.> Good as usual. I haven't been here for quite some time because of several reasons: hard to find parking, long line and long drive for me. Today was an exception because not many people on the road. The crispy salmon salad was awesome! It is similar to their famous avocado salad. The chicken wings (spicy) is top notch. Nothing in Boston can compare to the sauce that this place uses. I think that is why they maintain their position after years. We got a stew with kimchi, meatloaf and beef. It was a lot!!! $19 and I think it's enough to feed 3 hungry people just with this stew alone. Definitely great spot in Allston!!> One of my favorite Korean Fried chicken places. Their chicken can be spicy so don't forget to let your server know what level of spice you would like. The fried chicken serving is good for 2-3 and even 4 ppl. Ambiance is good and the place is really good for fried chicken joint. Their fries are also really nice. Good food for money. Must try!

menu_dishes: Lobster Salad, Lobster Mac & Cheese, Regular Lobster Roll with Mayo, Large Lobster Roll with Mayo, Shrimp Cocktail, Crab Roll, Regular Lobster Roll with Butter, Large Lobster Roll with Butter, Large Crab Cake, Hot Dogs, Whole Cooked Lobsters, New England Clam Chowda, Lobsta Bisque, Fish Chowda, Shrimp and Corn Chowda, Double Stuffed Clam, Stuffed Scallop, Cape Cod Chips, All Beverages, Cole Slaw, Potato Salad, Whoopie Pies
