reviews: I AM SO MAD THAT THIS PLACE HAS BEEN OPEN FOR TWO YEARS ANNA I DIDN'T KNOW ABOUT IT!!!! We had what can only be called the perfect Sunday night dinner. The place is warmly decorated and spacious but intimate. The folks who work there treat you like they've been looking forward to you showing up all day. They take reservations. The food: we shared the romaine, very refreshing. I was so pleasantly surprised that they split it into two perfectly sized plates without us asking. We also shared the caccio e pepe and the gnocchi- both delicious, very different, so can't tell you my favorite. The portions are perfectly sized. We went for the red wine (the Chianti was excellent) and we'll definitely be back for the pizza and cocktails and mussels. See you next Sunday.> Went here for Valentines Day dinner. Was not blown away by the food but it was good. 3 stars because of the service. Our entrees came out less than 5 minutes after our appetizer and our waiter just shoved the app to the side and put our entrees down. Not enough time between the two. Then 15 minutes into eating our entrees (and still picking at our app) our waiter asked if we were all set and wanted to wrap up our food... We had forks in hand and were currently chewing... could not have felt more rushed thus couldn't enjoy our food or our evening.> Questo ristorante è favoloso! All pastas were delicious. The special with fennel raviolis, truffle, and sausage was fantastic! I tasted the squid ink pasta dish which was also very good. We had the bruschetta app (it had pesto on the bread) and it was very tasty.  I thought the warm bean dip needed more flavor. Basically, the food tasted like the chef had poured love into every dish!  I'd order anything on this menu.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. One of the best meals I've had in a long time.  BRAVO to the chef!> Vegans and vegetarians: they offer a special "Vegan" menu which has vegetarian options not available on their main menu. If you have dietary concerns, plan to obtain a copy of this menu when you are seated. However, the vegan menu has some cheese references while omitting other cheese references, so I do not know if it is strictly vegan or a liberal use of an hip word compared to 'vegetarian'. I started with a cinnamon toast martini, which was delicious. It was based on rum chats with fireball whisky and was garnished with cinnamon which made for a spectacularly smooth drink. The waitress was unable to hand me the drink directly. So, it was handed to my stepmother to daisy chain to my father and then to me. Assuming a tax would be paid on the booze regardless, I invited the handlers thereof to sample it on the way. For an appetizer, I ordered a vegan arugula salad. This was good but the concentration of the vinegar-based dressing with nothing to dilute it was too strong for me. I'd recommend going light on the dressing or adding it to the side. I wound up dicing up some bread into mock croutons to help absorb the sourness of the dressing. For an entrée, I ordered the vegan parmigiana. They made an utterly delicious dish out of an ordinary "Beyond" burger. They took the patty, breaded and fried it, then melted some mozzarella cheese on it. I don't know if this was a vegan cheese substitute or not. Then, it was served over penne with a flavorful marinara sauce. For dessert, I wowed our table guests by ordering an affogato. They poured a shot of espresso over a smooth, delicious scoop of vanilla gelato. An amaretto cookie was wedged into the assembly and it was a spectacular touch to the end of the meal. They served a spectacular meal and is someplace I look forward to dining at the next time I pass through town.> This is a nice restaurant. I heard all kinds of good things about this place before I came.  I am in fact glad I came. The food is delicious with large portion. The service is good. The ambiance is nice. I will definitely come back again.

menu_dishes: Garden Salad, Greek Salad, Mediterranean Salad, Grilled Chicken Wrap, Authentic Gyro Wrap
reviews: Everything's betta w/ a little feta and who knows feta mo betta than The Feisty Greek. Twice I stopped here while on my trip to Boston. The first visit was because of my ChicagHO bestie had recently been and his pics were making my mouth water. The second was because another local restaurant disappointed me. Looking back I think the second visit was the Greek gods speaking to me, lol. Ordering is pretty straightforward. You place your order at the counter and then they call your order out for pick up at the counter. You can either dine in or get it to-go. If you check in you get 10% off your bill. During my first trip I played it safe w/ their Chicken Gyro and lemon potatoes. The gyro was packed w/ chicken, tomatoes, fries and tzatziki. I opted to have the cucumbers left off. The chicken was freshly grilled and seasoned well. The bread and fillings were fresh and made to order. My next visit I would get a little more adventurous and try their popular Buffalo Pork Gyro. This gyro came filled with tomatoes, onions, fries, buffalo sauce and bleu cheese. Wow...I thought the Chicken Gyro was good, this blew the doors off of that. It was packed w/ so much flavor, all of the ingredients really complemented on another. If I had to choose between this and the Chicken one would be tough, good thing I don't because they will make this gyro for you w/ chicken. The lemon potatoes, aside from giving you coronary artery disease, are a must try. They are braised in a lemon-garlic flavored broth so they suck up all that lemony flavor. I enjoyed them so much that I got them for my side on both visits. Service was great, they were quick, friendly and made you feel (as an out of towner) like you were family.> at least once every other week my husband says, "you know what sounds good? the feisty greek." this is infuriating given the fact we moved back to the west coast LAST SUMMER, but nonetheless, he's not wrong. when we lived in the area, the feisty greek was our favorite weeknight dinner joint. my absolute favorite was their kabob plate with grilled chicken, lemon potatoes, and either the rice or a side salad depending on my mood. their feta fries were also to die for. on our way out of town (and yes, i am being quite literal), we parked our u-haul out front and had one final meal in the state of massachusetts. to this day, and to my great despair, we haven't found a greek restaurant in california that quite hits the spot like this gem.> So this is the second time ordering from TFG and now my last time. I ordered online and went to pick up my order of a Middle Eastern Wrap, handcut fries, and the eggplant salad (Melitzanosalata), which was not ready when I arrived. I gave them two stars because the guy did locate my order in a sea of slips and made sure that it was being prepared. First off, I'm so disappointed with how soggy everything was! The fries especially needed to be drained and were so heavy because of all the additional grease.  The falafel sandwich was super soaked and dripping out the bottom. I ate 1/4 of the sandwich before I even hit one of the three falafel balls. Even the additional pita that came with the Melitzanosalata tasted off. The eggplant salad was super oily and loaded with garlic, so I suggest if you are having lunch and have to go back to work and interact with people, you may want to stay clear or have a toothbrush and mouth wash ready for after you eat this!Honestly, for 15 dollars, I felt bummed I had given this place a second shot.> Oh so good. Had chicken orzo soup, spanakopita, pork gyro with side of rice and rice pudding. Staff was friendly. Place was clean. Food was great.> My favorite place to eat. They have great food and service. Been here numerous times and am never disappointed. I have felt extremely comfortable taking my coworkers here knowing I won't be embarrassed by their food or service. TFH does not disappoint!!!

menu_dishes: Loaded Wings, Vegetable Quesadilla, Burrito, Guacamole, Chips  Salsa, Taco Salad, Chopped Salad, Rice Bowl, Avocado, Braised Short Rib, Chicken Bacon Ranch, Crispy Carnitas, Fried Shrimp, Carne Asada, Baja Fish
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, Yes
reviews: If you're looking a for a young, hip, and busy bar. Look no further.Great drinks, great food with seafood accents (the crab guacamole - very nice!)But come here for the deals too! You will find me here every Monday for $1 Oysters, I'll let you all figure out what the other specials are!Hint: book a day early or you won't find a tableOverall:Great, simple taqueria with fun drinks and specials!> Date night for taco Tuesday. Unfortunately we found that only 5/10 (roughly) tacos were actually discounted and the discount was only about $1 off each taco. With that said, tacos were very flavorful. I got the Carnitas Tacos which were filled with flavor. Haley got guacamole tacos which she enjoyed. We started with chips and guacamole which were good as well. For drinks, we both got margaritas. Mine was on the heavy side, didn't care too much for it (seeing that it was $11 was a downside as well). Overall, been to this restaurant multiple times and will go back. Next time, probably just stick with (and recommend) the beer.> 3.5 rating - Had dinner plans for my belated birthday with my best friend and stumbled upon this place after I found out my original pick was closed this week.  I was excited to try something new after deciding to go here as the next option because who doesn't love tacos?Walked into a beautiful restaurant with pretty hanging lights, a vibrant crowd, music and lots of smiling faces.  Large bar set up in the middle with tables on the sides and front.  Table for 2 was quick and easy at close to 7pm.Things you should know that I didn't..-If you go as a party of 2, go as a date because you will get squeezed inbetween first dates and overhear life introductions for the entire duration.  Seating is far enough for personal space but you can't unhear things either haha-Tuesdays is 1/2 price tacos.  Didn't realize until we saw a tiny slip of paper on the table to order oysters.  Check out the info and ask questions to get the scoop.  The scoop doesn't come to you.-If you don't drink, you have no reason to come.  Drive bys happen often here.  I wish I could have several shots of tequila and rack up a tab for you dear but I am breastfeeding an infant.  I only have 2 hours to snack for dinner, catch up with my best friend about life stuff, including life as a new mother of 2 with no time to herself, and run home to my husband who is watching 2 kiddos and waiting for me.. I am leaving soon right after this story............-The oysters were yum.  Try some.-I liked the baja fish taco the best.  Fried chicken was delish too.  -Fried chicken taco is spicy.  Don't say I didn't warn you.Overall, I recommend checking it out if you are in the area and want a drink and snack.  I need to get out more.  Maybe I picked the wrong spot and night out.> Loco deserves the hype it receives for being a great food and drink destination in an otherwise lacking part of Boston. The tacos are bomb, the oysters are delicious, and the margaritas have been solid. They also do chips and guac right, with healthy portions of each to share (one order filled two of us up comfortably). And, while it's not cheap, the menu won't break the bank, so it's a good option for a weekend or after work meal.So why four stars? The NOISE. It's so incredibly loud inside this restaurant. Add live music to the fray on the weekends, and you can barely hear the person across the table from you. I love the space, but wish they'd do more to separate the more energetic bar area from the sit-down diners.> Loco is a trendy taco joint serving up bites and drinks to the young professional crowd in Southie. If you walk in after work, or on weekends, you're likely to find a crowded establishment with well-dressed patrons set to the backdrop of twinkly lights, a wrap-around bar, wooden accents, and an oyster bar! I decided to be adventurous and order their coconut margarita. It had a coconut flake rim and was sweet and creamy. We also got chips and guac, which were solid but a little overpriced ($11). But, oh WOW. I ordered a veggie quesadilla with chicken added and it was probably the best quesadilla I've ever had. Flavor. Explosion. For those sour beer lovers out there, the Two Roads Lime Gose was also notable.

The food here was awesome! Shared the mac & cheese stuffed pepper, the burger and the chicken & waffle cones. All three were delicious and did not disappoint. The service was exceptional, especially considering it was only their second night open! Also, it is BYOB! Definitely will be returning to this place.> So excited for the opening of Food for Thought and we had an amazing meal on opening night! We had the Shrimp Bang Bang, Plantain Chips, Glazed Donut Tomato Soup, Shrimp Mofongo, and Carrot Cake donuts. I highly recommend all those dishes and especially Shrimp Mofongo if your fan of some real spicey sauce. We finally have an all around original and delicious restaurant in the Harbor View area and you can expect to see us here weekly. Can't wait to try the brunch.> This place is amazing!!!! Living in the neighborhood there aren't enough good food options and Ma does this place kill it.  Everything we had was delicious we just couldn't pick what to get.  The cotton candy was awesome the wings were probably the best wings I ever had and the burger was toooooo good.  Prices are very affordable, we will be here all the time, welcome to Eastie!!!> Fun and exciting in an old school deli. Food is unique snd pushing the box. A wonderful addition to a neighborhood with few sit down restaurants.

reviews: Jazz | Wings | BarJazz: my friend Gil and I arrived at 7:30 and they had a live jazz trio (bass/chelo, piano, singer). The music was classic jazz as well as some original pieces that reminded me of Diana Krall. Overall, the music really added to the vibe and made the overall experience super enjoyable. Wings: I had the Teriyaki Wings. There are 6 in the order. They have a savory glaze with a crisp exterior. They are the perfect small bite or shareable plate for a date. I was looking for something to hold me over and absorb the drink we had, and they hit the spot. Bar: the bar is small but well staffed. There were two individuals behind the bar and the shrink menu was pretty deep. I had a simple glass of Prosecco because it was a celebration of a new RFP My friend closed.  Pro tip: like most of central square There is no parking so definitely walk or Uber. Pro tip: make a reservation between 6-8:30pm. Pro tip: if you don't make a reservation there is a bunch of turnover at the bar so if you are a group of two, you can probably roll through.> I love going to Monkfish for sushi, great thai dishes and excellent atmosphere. I got grubhub delivery as I am trying to support local businesses during this time of difficulty.  However, I am not sure why restaurants are literally ignoring the notes and or not providing proper food. I ordered a yellow curry with chicken, with specific directions for "no bell peppers and extra spicy."  I got a curry w/extra bell peppers and super sweet. Anddddd they sent me pork as the protein--not sure how you screw up so badly?   I REALLY REALLY want to support our community, but am not sure why they feel they can simply just ignore the actual order.> Approx. Date/Month of Visit: September 2019No. of people: 7Reservation Recommend: YesLive Music/Performance: Yes, on some daysCuisine: Asian FusionService: Could have been better. We had to wait to get our checks for almost 15 minutes.Must Try:Tom Yum Goong Magic Teriyaki Wings Don't Try:Coconut Curry Fries> I really wanted to like this restaurant. It has a nice ambiance, cool decor, beautiful ceramic serving dishes, surprisingly delicious cocktails, but unfortunately sub-par food.I got the Penang curry with seafood. I know, given the fact that there's "seafood" in the dish, it's supposed to smell fishy.. but man that dish smelled real fishy. Also the curry didn't have enough actual curry so I was basically eating dry rice and vegetables with seafood about halfway through. I will say though that the vegetables were cooked well.My friend got pad Thai which I thought tasted disappointing, but my friend enjoyed enough. Other friend got the vegetable tempura udon noodle soup and it was a little bland, but still decent. We got coconut fries to share, which I thought were really good!> Unfortunately I did not love it here. Was really excited to try their sushi but it was just alright. The rice seemed to have a little too much vinegar and the texture of it was a bit off, like it wasn't fresh. The fish itself tasted as it should but i just wasn't impressed. There is definitely better sushi nearby. I will say that our service was great and the place looks really nice. Maybe I just came on an off night, but again I was a little disappointed that we spent so much on what wasn't very good in my opinion.

reviews: Listen to the words coming out of my Yelp mouth: the $50 Dinner for Two deal is now available Sunday through Wednesday, for curbside take-out, and it includes the bottle of wine.Two entrees, one starter and a bottle of house vin (we usually get the Kato savvy B) for $50. What a steal! I strongly suggest the shrimp scampi primavera, the chicken parmigiana or one of their pizzas - all are really decent quality and excellent values.The calamari is excellent when eaten fresh, and it does suffer a bit during longer rides post-takeout. The only mild weak spot - seriously, put BHB on your "stay in, support local" short list.> Boathouse Bistro has the most delicious pizza you can imagine all fresh ingredients a superb wine list and the appetizers are perfection walking - you must try if ever in the Hinghan shipyard area!!> I just can't, we loved this place and ordered there multiple times and this is something else.> This place is absolutely gross if your a foodie avoid.1st dish served cold2nd dish blah3rd gross> If you actually want a good meal, don't go here.  Service is good, ambiance okay.  But every dish we got was terrible, even the calamari somehow. Avoid any fish dish.  I'm sure the pizzas are okay.

Small place. 4 tables . 2 table for 4. 2 tables for 2 .Pad kee mow with chicken : thought it was suppose to be crispy chicken but it wasnt. Lightl flavors of Thai and basil. Mild is a little spicy.Thai sausages: different textures. A little chewy. A little plain. Has a snap to it. Comes with ginger salad. Duck fried rice: duck is more tender than chicken. Flavors remind me of a basil fried rice. Better flavors than the kee mow.  Nice wet rice texture with a good bite. Would come here to maybe try other dishes.> This is one of the best Thai food places I have tried.  The food was super tasty and fresh.The service was courteous and food delivery very fast.> Food takes a little time but it's authentic. The soups are very flavorful and delicious. I had the chiang mai beef stew. Literally the best i've had in Boston. Side note: the soup is spicy> Came here for a quick dinner to satisfy myThai food cravings and really liked my pad see ew! I got it with tofu and it had a solid amount of fried tofu pieces. It was flavorful and the portions were the perfect size for me! It was around 10 dollars so if you're looking for good, affordable Thai food in quincy, I would recommend it!> I come here every time I am craving a Pad See Ew because it's soooo good. They've mastered this dish and really I have yet to have a bad dish since coming here. The portions are gigantic and if you grab a meal before 4pm it's cheaper than if you bought the meal at dinner time. I have also had their sweet and sour chicken which is pretty good. I will continue coming back here for their food and maybe try something completely new next time. While they are next to other restaurants and parking right in front is hard to come by, there's plenty of residential spots where you can find 2 hour parking Monday - Saturday and free parking on Sunday. PS they have a $10 card minimum.

reviews: We love the view and food options of this place. The food is not the best we've had and the service is always lacking but you can't beat the location! Sitting in the marina. Best in the summer.> My coworkers and I were here for dinner on a week night. The place was fairly empty so we were seated pretty quickly. The inside of the restaurant was your beach-side vibe. Our waitress was super nice and personable. My coworker and I shared some raw oysters. This was super tasty but then again, unless the oysters aren't fresh, it's kind of hard to mess up raw oysters. I also had their clam chowder. The chowder was forgettable and wasn't the best I had during my trip to Boston. It was more watery than I experience at other restaurants. We also split a lobster risotto and a scallop risotto. I forget which one had the truffle oil in it, but both were quite disappointing. You won't find much lobster in the risotto, but it'll fill you up because of the amount of risotto you get. I got a surprising amount of scallops (6), which is double what I usually get when I order a scallop dish, but the risotto in this one was very bland. This is a pretty pricey restaurant for the quality of food you get, maybe it's so expensive because you get a great view?> I have been here several times, and the food is good, but after walking into a Trump watch party on Super Tuesday, forget about it. People should be warned ahead of time that the Red Hats are going to mass in an area,  Also, I refuse to patronize any business that does not keep their policitics to themselves> First off, we went here thinking it was Captain Fishbones, a super casual, family place. We walked in with our toddler and immediately felt out of place since it was mostly singles. They have high chairs for the kids, but no kids menus, or kids cups.  We probably would have walked out if not for our server, Michael who made us feel so welcome. He immediately asked our toddler her name and made us feel comfortable. He went out of his way to make chocolate milk for her in special cups he created. So awesome. The food was good, my husband started with clam chowder and I the beet salad. So yummy. The décor is so beautiful and rustic. I would definitely go back her but not with our toddler. :)> I got a Chicken Caesar Salad here for $16 and it was the most bland Chicken Caesar Salad I have ever had in my life, and it hardly had any chicken in it. How do you screw up Caesar Salad with chicken? For sixteen dollars I got something that tasted like it was made at McDonalds or Wendy's at five dollars a salad. This location used to be Captain Fishbones, which was closed down and reopened as Victory Point by the same ownership. I had always liked Captain Fishbones, and it had always been packed in the summer when I went there. On this visit to Victory Point where I got my overpriced McDonalds salad the place was mostly empty. It appears Coke's switch to "New Coke" a few decades back is now the SECOND worst management decision by a food or beverage company.

popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: I was there for a private event upstairs. The banquet room and view were amazing.The servers and bartender's service was top notch. Very attentive, accommodating, and friendly.The food: Butternut squash soup, Chicken Piccata, marinated flank steak, and eggplant rollatini all were prepared perfectly and very tasty.I would recommend anyone planning an event to check this place out. We will be back in the summertime to enjoy the outdoors and dine at the restaurant.> Great views and a great location. Unfortunately the food I have to say isn't worth going out of your way for or the price. For "Sticky" Korean wings they were incredibly dry (I had to order extra sauce) and the calamari pieces were fairly small and didn't have much flavor. The one good thing was the incredibly friendly bartender. The martinis we had were strong which was the best part but most of the options were incredibly sweet. I'd come here if I wanted to enjoy a drink on a summer night with friends but I don't think I would consider this a restaurant worth coming to.> Great spot for very casual dinner and drinks. Their sangria pitcher is awesome. Awesome options and satisfying portions,> More like a 3.5 but upped to a 4 because of the waterfront views and delightful server we had.   Came here on a Sunday afternoon looking to grab a couple drinks but landed a whole brunch meal instead. Food - solid 3 stars.  Lobster Benedict was quite good but the eggs were slightly overcooked (not at all runny like it should be); the English muffin had a nice crunchy texture and was pretty tasty though.  I felt pretty much the same for the fish tacos as well.  It was "okay" but nothing a fresh few dashes of Tabasco sauce didn't fix.   Overall a passing grade but nothing super memorable but hey, we came for the ambiance which was priceless.  Who can say no to those pretty bay views?I couldn't think of a better way to have an end of summer al fresco brunch :)> Walking along Quincy Marina and ran into Port 305. We stopped in because the views were so great overlooking the water and boats. They have indoor and outdoor seating. The cocktails are all really unique and refreshing. I had the "I didn't call you, Tito's did" which consisted of Tito's, soda, limoncello, and fresh strawberries. They also have a nice selection of beer and wine. I ordered the veggie burger which had avocado, chipotle aioli, arugula and tomato. It was really tasty and came with some yummy sweet potato fries. The service was pretty good and the food came out so quick. There's a couple other restaurants/bars nearby directly in the marina as well so it's a fun place to spend some time. Definitely recommend the visit on any nice day.

This was my first time going to Ganh Pho, and I can't wait to go back again! 5/5 on service and food, and I imagine everything is even better when you can eat in (right now only take out is allowed because of everything going on in the world).Service was very friendly and on point! With everything going on, they brought our takeout order to the car so we wouldn't have to go inside and the food traveled very well. We ordered the bowl of rolls (5 fresh spring rolls and 5 fried spring rolls). I thought they were very generous with the amount of sauces for each of the rolls. The fried spring rolls were tasty and still warm by the time we got home. The fresh spring rolls were the real winner here though--probably the best spring rolls I've ever had. We got them with grilled chicken and shrimp, the shrimp was cooked perfectly, the fresh basil in the spring roll also really stood out, and the chicken was so good I have decided I will definitely order a grilled chicken dish when I come back next week!We also got the crabmeat and tomato soup--I really liked the broth but I was super jealous of my fiancé's beef and tendon pho. We've eaten at many Vietnamese restaurants in Connecticut and around Boston, but we both agree that this pho is the best we've had. The broth was rich in flavors and there were nice pieces of thick tendon (I feel like other places usually have like two tiny baby pieces of tendon, but this was not the case here). I forgot to take a picture of the bag of basil, lime, jalapeños, and greens that were included but it was also a nice amount!We were also generously given some complimentary items--dessert and two spring rolls with meatball, which had very tasty pickled daikon and reminded me of a banh mi in spring roll form. And best for last, we were also generously given a dessert I've never had called xuxe cake. SO GOOD!!! It was coconuty and I loved the mochi like consistency.Can't wait to come back--I'd recommend Ganh Pho to everyone! By> During this pandemic times and social distancing, you truly learn to appreciate the local businesses around you that still provides a hearty meal. Ordered the pork chop rice plate and the process was super easy. Plenty of parking in rear made the pick up pretty quick. The meal can feed a family of 2 (plus a 2 years old).  It was so good, I could've finished the whole plate myself! Portions were huge. My family definitely enjoyed the rice plate. We can't wait to try the other dishes that they offer. I hear good things about the pho. I guess I know what's next on my list!> The food was delicious. This restaurant is a hidden gem. The food is nice and fresh and the presentation is fantastic.> The beef noodle soup (Pho) is the best in town if not the best in the Boston area.  I have visited Vietnam many times in the past and this Pho is as authentic as it can be.  I had a little trouble to understand the server but she was extremely nice and helpful.  The service was excellent.  The atmosphere was very friendly and I felt like I was eating at home.

First time trying this place and we ordered a total of 5 items. The total came out to $65 with tip. Prices are reasonable. Service was good. Definitely would comeback -Hokkai yaki - more on the spicy side but it's still really good and goes well with lemon juice. This is the first place I've been to that gives you a side of lemon with this dish-Beef yaki udon - pretty salty, not that much beef was in it. It was good but I wouldn't order it again -Snow mountain roll - standard snow mountain roll, pretty good. -Super caterpillar - really good roll too, all the flavors went really well together -Volcano maki - this roll was soooo good, literally melt in your mouth. The avocado inside was so creamy. Definitely was my favorite roll and would order again.> Dude.... this is so annoying.I like this place, their food is delicious but literally EVERY SINGLE TIME I CALL THEM, it's like they hate having customers. They want you off the phone faster than anything and they're so rude while retaking your order. Like CHILL. I'm just trying to place an order. God forbid you pause for a second trying to place your order or else they'll hang up right in your face (which has happened to me before). One time I was rushed of the phone so fast that I came to pick up my food and half the order was missing because they weren't paying attention and hung up so fast. It's rude and insulting. Just look out for that, other than that the food is great and I hate that I'm even typing this right because it's a waste of my time.> This place is soooo good.Must try: Hokkaiyaki (ate it so fast couldn't even get a picture)The maki are so good. Everything is so decently priced that there are no complaints here. They do have a lunch special. But I came specifically for the hokkaiyaki everytime and I have yet to be disappointed. Please come give this place a try. It is street parking so it's ehhhhhhh but so worth it. Also they have a beer and wine menu big plus!> My family's favorite sushi spot in Quincy. We often order big platter to takeout. Their platters are great for special occasions .> Came here for a quick lunch. Ordered from their lunch menu - Scallop Bento & Sashimi Combo. Food was good and price was very reasonable at under $10 per item.

cusine_types: Pizza, Salad, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt
reviews: Always loved Bravo Pizzeria! The pizza always tastes so fresh and hot and they have an excellent menu to choose from. I grew up not too far from here so it always reminds me of my childhood when I am around the area. Plus, there is a liquor store down the street so you can grab beer first and then pizza after, which is always a win in my book.> Place look like any other pizza shop . Lady ringing us up was new. We got the burger and pick chips not fries and on a wheat bread. The sandwich was underwhelming the burger was same in size. The wheat bread was just slice bread . Paying $9 something for a small burger and chips was disappointing. Going to try it again to see if this was just a one time thing.> I needed some food to go to celebrate Dad's birthday with him, so I called Bravo.  25 minutes later, I picked up a large pizza, 10 wings and a caesar salad.  I think the bill was about 35 bucks.  Good food. Got the job done!  Thanks, Bravo.> We order Bravo almost weekly and have never been disappointed. The pizza is always excellent and the chicken tenders are very crispy without being greasy. Everything we've tried on the menu has been excellent (except the jalapeño poppers but that was a personal preference issue not a quality issue-too much cream cheese!) The time we ate in the restaurant the service was fast and very friendly. The owner was very personable. Highly recommend!> Orgasmic.... and Homer drool worthy! This place is impeccably clean. The owner is very funny and informative. They make everything from scratch and I haven't even ate yet, but I'm excited!

I attended a food market in Chesnut Hill and noticed that MoMo cafe was a vendor. I specifically got the matcha and black sesame donut -- it was yummy! The donut offers the perfect amount of sweetness and fluffiness. Price point is average at $2 per donut. However, I ordered a dozen for $21. I called a week in advance to place the order for a dozen donuts and the employee was very helpful. They don't usually open until 9:30am, but the order was ready at 9:15am.They offer a couple other items such as, cake, cake cone, cheese tart, drinks, etc. The cafe was very clean and organized. The donut display is great -- clear visual and labeled. It's certainly easy for kids to pick what they wants because it's eye level and easily displayed.> I stopped by MoMo cafe at the Dealmoon festival because of their presentation. I'm not a huge fan of donuts but if I do want a donut I'll normally go to dunks. I'm actually a big fan of matcha so I decided to give this a try. I liked that it wasn't too powdery but it was really blan. This is pretty pricey considering the quality of this really sucked. Also their "ice cream cone," was awful. It was advertised as ice cream but it was straight up cream of some sort. The strawberry pocky sticks really toped it off with their presentations. Great presentation but the taste is definitely not there.> This little cafe is a tad bit on the pricey side for the quality and size of their donuts. I came here on a weekday and it was empty. The display was clean and organized with everything labeled. There are a variety of unique flavors to pick from. However, the donuts could've had more flavor. They tasted pretty average. Unlikely that I would be back again as there are better tasting donuts else where.> Visited Momo around 730PM on a weekday. They only had a few donuts out at that time so I did not try out their pastries due to limited selection. The display seemed clean and the donuts they did have looked good. I was hoping to try some of their cheese tarts though. Instead, I ordered a mango fruit tea with mango jelly. I was surprised that the tea was 1. So expensive and 2. Had the consistency of a mango slush. It was heavier than I anticipated and I can't say that I would order it again. I really appreciated their cup and I think that's what makes the drink so expensive, but I think if I were to return I would try something different. Overall, I don't think I would go out of my way for this bakery or recommend it ocer other places (for the drinks).> Love Momo Cafe! The cheese tea is my favorite with the black pearls. The pearls are different from most bubble tea places, in my opinion it tastes way better. I can't drink the regular pearls anymore I really like the cups they give bc I can reuse them! Overall, this place is super cute and I would definitely recommend if you like bubble tea and want to try something different.

This is a great little place if you're in the neighbourhood. I came here with a friend when we were hungry. Our order: Seafood spicy lime soup, wonton soup, crab rangoon, and 2 pad thais: one with chicken, one with duck.Spicy seafood lime soup: This was delicious. Definitely spicy and warms you up. What's weird is the precise amount of seafood: 1 shrimp, 1/2 scallop, squid piece. Not a problem, just weird. Nice portion between a cup and a bowl.Crab rangoons: You can never go wrong. I have a pic of them, but note that it's missing 2 since both my friend and I ate them before I remembered to take a pic.Pad thai duck: A very good pad thai option for not too much $. What set this apart was that it was not dry- something that's way too common with most pad thais. I loved it. fair portion of duck too.I did not try my friend's wonton soup nor her pad thai with chicken.General: all of the seats are close to the window. We went during winter, and had to keep our coats on since it was cold. Language barrier seems to be a small problem when communicating order add ons, etc. however please note that the food did come correctly as ordered. Friendly service.Would I come here again? Big yes.How far would I drive for this? likely 20 mins or so! The pad thai was *that* good.> 3.5 stars. Don't really see, from the reviews here, what the hub-bun is all about. Kind of mediocre Thai food in a city inundated with Asian restaurants. Ordered up apps: Tom yum soup, dumplings, scallion pancake. Soup was good spice and heat wise, but very greasy.  Dumplings were good, small in size though... like half the size of traditional Chinese dumplings. Scallion pancake seemed to be pre-cooked and stiff, and not fresh-flexible at all. Sauces were good.  Parking is a mess as it is in an odd ball location. Staff is nice. Clean yet small eating arrangements. There's better out there. JAN2029> I would give this 3.5 stars if that were an option.I was craving curry rolls so I decided to try this place instead of my usual neighborhood spot which sadly doesn't have them.  The curry rolls at Little Duck are really good.  Everything else was pretty much the same as my usual place except Little Duck is more expensive.  The duck noodle soup had 8 thin little slices of duck.  It was definitely not worth $11.  I will stick with Pad Thai Restaurant on Hancock Street which has the same quality food for better prices.  It's also within walking distance so I don't have to pay for UberEats either.> Amazing staff and service. It's small yet so cozy. A must try. Their spice levels are on point. Please go try out their foods when you get a chance to go out again. Or do delivery! Their services are always great!> Got takeout- super solid option. Good food, good price! I wish the parking were a bit easier to make the pick up easier but that's certainly not their fault!! Will definitely be back.

Space is not limited at this very large, we'll lit, newly furnished restaurant. This place is great for large family gatherings and for people who don't want to spend 30 minutes trying to find a parking spot. The price and service is typical for a Chinese restaurant.($$ and not the best service...)The food is okay.The 4 times I have been here has been hit or miss. Some dishes were good, while others were too greasy or saucy and lacking in flavor. The portion sizes are good and you will be full. Ultimately, if you are looking for a place to have a banquet or big family reunion this place will definitely accommodate you while providing you with decent dishes.> Very disappointed with the lack of service. There is just not enough waitstaff for the restaurant size or they are just good at staying away from their customers. Food was ok not great and definitely so not worth what we ended up paying per person.  Usually a large group eating family style at a Chinese restaurant is not that expensive but for some reason that was not true here.  It wasn't like we ordered expensive dishes. Who knows.> The Restaurant itself is nice bright and clean. They have a really nice setup on the live seafood tanks.We went for dim sum and it was about 12:30 and the restaurant was pretty empty at the time.But within 15 mins the dining was starting to fill upBut it was not packed.So the dim sum was decent some selection was available that I haven't had in a while at other places.The basics was good, I thought the beef and shrimp rice rolls was okay not the best but better than some others.The har gow was good, the shu mai was too soft in texture, the dumpling did not hold up well.The steam beef ball was more of a rubbery texture but the flavor was good.The honeycomb tripe was really good, tender and tasty.The barbecue pork roast bun was really fresh, nice and warm out of the oven.My favorite was the large shrimp and chives dumplingsNice chunks of shrimp with Chinese chives.This would have been a 4 star review, but due the lousy service the waitresses had provided I had to hold a back a star.The ladies who was pushing the food carts around the tables were great, but the waitstaff are lazy and I should have held the tip as well as the star.> Review for dim sumThe skinny: mediocre dim sum but a large space for big parties. Atmosphere: probably the largest area for dim sum in the Quincy area. Large space inside and a huge parking lot. Cart style dim sum (ppl go around with carts of food and come to the tables asking what you want)Food: was looking forward to trying this spot because of the ease of parking etc that can be more difficult at other spots in the area. Overall was a bit disappointed. The food was pretty bland and the bao we ordered was actually cold. None of the dishes seemed to wow me, all in all, just okay. We did get there a little late around 130 so could have just been the timing. Also ordered a pan fried noodle dish, which was okay but was lacking the variety of ingredients you would expect ( just noodles, beef, and choi)Price/value:$$ a few dishes that are normally considered small (and cheaper) were classified as larger ones. Though to be fair dishes are a bit larger than typical. Would I come back: probably not given there are so many better dimsum places around. I have heard their dinners are better so would be willing to try that, especially with the easy parking which means a lot for us.> Recently opened Ming's is working out the new restaurant kinks like the amount of waiters out and about. Tons of parking since it's located in a big plaza that formerly featured Big Y supermarket.Food was on point and cheaper than expected. $120 pre-tip for seafood soup, seafood hotpot, golden crispy fish, bitter melon and spareribs, calamari, green beans, and fried milk. Everything ordered was delicious. Though it took forever to get the check, we did wrap the meal up with complimentary tea jello! I can definitely see this place as the next banquet location in Quincy. Beautiful and modern decor. Clean bathrooms. Make sure to call for a reservation or arrive early to get a big table! Majority of the tables here are for large groups too.

restaurant_name: The Fox & Hound Wood Grill & Tavern
menu_dishes: Bowl of New England Clam Chowder, Caprese Dinner, Tuscan Salad, Fox & Hound Wedge Salad, Jazzed Greens, Classic Caesar Salad, Rocket Salad, Kung Pao Cauliflower, Wood Grilled Bruschetta, Chicken Fingers, Garlicky Steamed Mussels, Lollipop Lamb Chops, Spicy Calamari, Skillet Fried Crab Cakes, Blackened Sampler, Shrimp Cocktail, Margherita Pizza, Cafe Pizza, BBQ Chicken Pizza, Potato Skin Pizza, Buffalo Chicken Pizza, Sausage, Pepperoni and Onion Pizza, Blue Plate Meatloaf, Roast Turkey Dinner, Weinerschnitzel, Penthouse Steak Tips, Grilled Pork Chopped, Haddock Florentine, Fish & Chips, Harvest Ravioli, Vegetable Curry, Sesame Seared Salmon, Fork and Knife Fried Chicken, Satay Chicken, Smothered Steak, Chicken Pot Pie, Crispy Roast Duck, Gnocchi with Mushrooms, Macaroni & Cheese, Salmon Burger, Wood Grilled Burger Dinner, Baked Haddock Dinner, Mashed Potato, French Fries, Jasmine Rice, Sweet Potato Fries, Onion Rings, Coleslaw, Steamed Broccoli, Vegetable Medley, Green Beans Almondine
popular_dishes: Yes, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Lacking Halloween spirit, Barbara and I escaped by taking her sister Brenda to the Fox and Hound for a long, leisurely dinner -- not only long and leisurely but also a truly excellent feast, as it turned out!Wedge salad, onion rings, lollipop lamb chops, mac and cheese, oysters Rockefeller, crispy duck, skillet-fried crab cakes, mixed berry tart à la mode, hot caramel sundae  -- it's no wonder that we had a large tote bag of leftovers to take home. The mac and cheese alone would have easily fed three. Every single item was of high quality and properly prepared. To top it off, our server, Alex M, was also perfect: friendly, professional, and attentive without ever hovering.> Great spot. Nice drink selection and good food. I wish I could remember our waiters name so I could give him a shout out. He was super attentive and friendly. Highly recommend.> They run specials for double lobster rolls for $15. It is all broken leftover lobster meat (i.e. lobster legs). Checked it out but won't be going back.> The Fox and Hound is one of my regular spots with sis for dinner and most recently, their brunch. When you enter the restaurant, the bar is to the right with more seating, then you have more of a dining area to the left. I love that there's a private room to hold functions and another dining area that seats a family or more than five. The staff are all friendly and attentive when it comes to service. There are times where you'll have to wait for a table because it's a Friday night or Saint Patty's Day for example, but no more than 45 mins from my experience. Moving on! For appetizers, I have tried their wood grilled bruscetta, calamari, crab cakes and blackened sampler. When I had the bruscetta, I felt it was slightly soggy with everything piled on top (tomatoes, spinach, bacon, apple, garlic and balsamic syrup. The combination worked, but I didn't get the crunch I was looking for. I love a good calamari app, but the lemon-scallion mayo was a bit over the top for my taste. I think if it were on the side, it would work so people could use it as a dip. Their crab cakes are cooked to perfection and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. It's a good size for an appetizer and the chipolte aioli compliments the crab cakes 100%. My favorite, hands down has to be the blackened sampler. It comes out piping hot on a cast iron skillet with juicy steak, chicken, shrimp with peppers and onions. It's done just right and not over cooked for it being blackened. Sometimes, I will get that with a side of white rice and veggies as my main course.Brunch is decent and worth the price for $18. I like the assortment of fresh food, pastries, bacon, sausage, eggs, home fries, pasta with chicken, baked chicken, salad and French toast. However....I really do wish they had a waffle maker, omelet station and pancakes!!! Drinks are priced fairly and they make damn good ones! I have had hot toddy's, mojitos and rum and cokes. I enjoy their beer and wine selection. For dessert, bread pudding and their lava cakes are good. I personally enjoy the bread pudding more because the lava cake doesn't have the crust over it due to it being like chocolate mousse. I will always come back to the F&H. It's a cute and cozy restaurant so close to Quincy Center T with a bus stop going both ways on Sea Street which is a plus. Convenience is a must :)> My Sis and I went here on a Friday night. I am so glad we did cuz I finally got some bread pudding which I had been craving for some time. But let me start with the service; AMAZING from the Host to the wait staff. Extremely interactive, inclusive, attentive, and fun! My waiter was 1 month new to F&H, but not new to the game. He was I think Brazilian. Loved the accent!I had the Caesar salad and then swordfish for my entree and OMG so yummy and not overcooked. I had plenty left over. It was still nice and tender even after I nuked it 2 days later! That's saying something. I think it's now my favorite fish! At least there  :)) anyway. My mashed potatoes tasted fresh, but I'm not a big fan of them overall. 1 piece of feedback is be more flexible with your side dishes. I would have loved to try the mac and cheese in place of the mashed. My Sis started with the clam chowder which was sooooo rich, creamy and super delicious! I was glad she allowed me to indulge in a couple of spoonfuls. Her entree was the ribeye med rare, but she was so satisfied with the amount of clam chowder she received that she couldn't eat her steak, which she said was also delicious. She mentioned that her mashed potatoes lacked flavor yet her steak was cooked exactly the way she likes it. We topped the meal off with delectable walnut bread pudding. It was perfectly baked, crispy on the top and edges, and not soggy in the center. We were so full that we collectively could only eat half however, we did order another to go because it was just that good! My Sis is a chef and I'm not, but we were both pleased overall.

I've been coming here since they first opened about 15 years ago at the other location. The food has always been fresh, delicious and plentiful. Last week we had Falafel King cater a party for about 40 people. I could not have been more pleased. Everything was delicious, people loved it and the price was an amazing value. Even the people who'd never had middle eastern food before just loved it. The chicken and rice were so good people were comfortable trying the excellent stuffed grape leaves, baba gnoush etc.If you need catering this is just a fantastic choice, try them for a meal and see. It was delivered fresh and exactly on time.> Came here for lunch and I was actually pretty impressed by the food. Chicken tasted very moist and cooked perfectly. Tasted like they actually took the time to brine the meat and season it well. Lamb was also cooked perfectly. Store was very clean and well maintained. Worth the try if you are j. The area!> Food is okay and dissent.  I still like going to Clover for their fafalel.  Sometimes they give me way too much lettuces and not enough rice.> I really enjoy getting food here. I've ordered the chicken and lamb shawarma when I have gone. The meat itself is well seasoned and tender. The overall plate doesn't feel too heavy afterwards either. I was able to eat this and not go into a food coma when I finished unlike some of the other Mediterranean places I have gone to. This is definitely a place I'd recommend if you are looking to eat dinner at home one night or just want lunch in Quincy. They take orders over the phone but are pretty quick about getting you your food if you end up ordering in-person. Definitely a fan!> Really surprised by all the good reviews.  I guess in Quincy there's no competition so people can't compare.  But the falafel king downtown tastes better.The rice was dry, had unusual flavor.  Even my husband who never  wastes food didn't finish it.Hummus has unusual texture, shiny and not matte like every other place I've been.  I'm  from the south and  there are tons of Lebanese restaurant.  And there's a place in the Braintree  mall food court that tastes better.Lamb was chewy and dry.Maybe they had an off day?  But will not try again.

FOOD: 10/10SERVICE: 9.5/10AMBIANCE: 8.5/10RECOMMENDATION: Alaskan king crab + twin lobster tails + corn + sausage + quail eggs + mushroom tips, Seoul Sauce,Medium SpiceMAJOR KEY ALERT!!!!! If you've never been to shaking crab then you're missing out on life. This place is straight popping if you like seafood. If you ask me, my favorite would definitely be the Alaskan king crab and the twin lobster tail. So far I have tried their "Shaking" house Cajun sauce and their Sweet Chili "Seoul" sauce which were both bomb af but don't forget to ask for medium spice if you like a little kick to your food. But please, If you can't handle your spice, do yourself a favor and order mild so you don't have to send your food back. In addition to the seafood, they also have a bomb selection of fryer and shakewiches. Being their #1 customer, I have tried everything on the menu so here is my ranking from best to least favorite: lobster roll, fried lobster tail sandwich, lobster cheesy fries, fried chicken sandwich, shaking burger, fried scallop basket, fried soft shell crabs.In addition to the food, they also have a wide selections of drinks that I also enjoy. The strawberry mojito here is straight schmacking. Every time I come here, I have to order at least 3 MINIMUM and I advise you to do the same. I also see a lot of people order the VS passion, fisherman's mug, and life's a peach so that's probably bomb too but I will never know since the strawberry mojito is so good that I don't want to order anything else. Overall, this place is probably one of my favorite restaurants to go to. I'm practically here at least three times a week. That should tell you a lot about this place.> My family and I dined here on a Monday night. It was pretty quiet in here, but maybe it was just that Monday. I had been craving some crawfish and shrimp for weeks, so I was delighted when my aunt asked me to join. Unfortunately, my crawfish and shrimp was okay. The shrimp was good, but the crawfish had this certain taste to it. I'm not sure exactly what it was about it. I could've just ordered the shrimp by itself.Everything else about the place was fine including a nice waiter. It really was just the crawfish that wouldn't compel me to return.> So, a few months ago I ordered crawfish, in season, so they were supposed to be live, but I think they served me previously frozen crawfish. About 10% was not edible. How do I know? Overcooked, shell is squishy, dry, not juicy.The gumbo was an average minus. It was a bit too salty to compensate for the lack of flavor.New England is known for seafood, but the south is known for crawfish boils.$54 wasted.> I just wanted to make an updated review just to show that this restaurant is consistent in what they do. They actually have new items on the menu and new specials as well! Every single time I've come here this summer, I would always end up ordering three dozen oysters just to share between two people (along with other food of course). The oysters have always tasted fresh and I have never ever eaten one that was dead or tasted sandy due to uncleanliness. As for the seafood, my go to is still crawfish or snow crab legs. New items on their menu that you should definitely try would be the soft shell crab, lobster quesadilla, and lobster tail burger. I HIGHLY recommend the lobster tail burger; it's a fair lobster tail paired with chipotle mayo. It's honestly a great way to have a burger with seafood. If you want to order the lobster quesadilla, make sure you order it when you eat in because it might get soggy if you do take out. A drink that I've been OBSESSED with would be Life's a Peach with strawberry puree. I know, sounds weird to add the strawberry, but I love it. End your meal with some beignets too!> I didn't want to come here. I wasnt impressed with all the idea - I'm usually disappointed when it comes to seafood spots. This place wasnt that bad. I initially wasnt happy about the price either, but I have somehow been here at least 6 times and I order take out cause I like to be fat at home. (8/17 Saturday hours says closes at 11pm. Came here last night and dude says they're closed. He said that the website says 11, but they stop seating 30min prior to 11. Look at the clock and it was 10:33p. He shrugs, offers to grab the manager to explain this to is. I told him not to bother. He also said that he was off the clock and ready to go.)I never have an issue with this place, service or food. Just a tip.

We love this spot for date night! Great food, love the hummus appetizer and fab wine options. Service has always been good. Pricier location in the marina Bay Area, but it's worth it.> Was here for an event hosted by one of our business partner cum friend. The food was pretty bland. The chicken piccata was so dry and had no flavour. The meat pasta was kind of okay however felt like no salt dish. The sauce had nothing to remember and felt like the restaurant either used cheaper canned tomato or used the regular grocery store Roma tomatoes. The pasta in itself was soft and perfectly cooked though. I had a dry manhattan and 1 old fashioned and both were very very strong and heavy on alcohol. Thought they make anything whiskey strong however I tried a few other drinks from my friends and all of them were very high in alcohol. It was open bar so maybe they didn't want anyone to order more and made the drinks strong. If it's true, it's definitely not a good practice. We all wish for this when we were in out undergrad years or at the start of our career. The service was great though and the servers were constantly checking on everyone even though there were around 60-70 people. Will not be back as it doesn't have that kind of view which commands a premium price. Move on.> Great place at Marina Bay.  Food  always consistent.  Only disappointment - bartenders very judgmental!!!!!!They should s not be taking about their customers.  It's beyond unprofessional. Management needs to pay attention.> After dinner drinks on a Friday evening and surrounded by beautiful views of Boston, Siro's is the place to be! As far as the service goes, not so much! Siro's would be my go-to restaurant, but hasn't been for a long time. There are just so many other new and hot restaurants to go nowadays, that Siro's is not at the top of my list. But, it does make for a nice after dinner spot. The couches outside are pretty nice, but the bartender seemed pretty frustrated and rude. My friend ordered the red sangria which was pretty tasty and fresh! I just would not be running back there anytime soon!> Filthy...Very rude staff. Can't handle the place even though it's half full. Tried to give me food that they accidentally delivered to other people first and they touched it and I said I think that's mine the bartender still tried to give it to me. I spoke with who identified herself as the General Manager and she could have cared less. I asked to have the owner was but was told I could not have her name! Apparently she is too important. Left messages for her with no return call. Stay away from this filthy place.

Awesome banh mi sandwiches and satay. Staff and chef are incredibly friendly and helpful.> Hands down the best food in Marina Bay.  A hidden gem!First, the "bad" ... this is primarily a "pick up" kitchen instead of an "eat in" restaurant, although they do have a few interior tables and some basic patio tables outside, which you should use when the weather is nice.  It is essentially the inverse of every other restaurant in Marina Bay, which are all huge and have great seating / ambiance / views, but mediocre (or downright bad) food ... this place is tiny, but has great food (regardless what you order), and it's up to you to find priority seating with a killer view of the Marina or a Boston sunset.  Luckily, there are no shortage of benches / tables scattered around the Marina that you can use during the non-Winter, so with a little creativity you'll have the best of both worlds.Also, despite the hours being posted as "open until 9 PM", they last food order actually has to be in by 7:30 PM.  As this is primarily a pick up establishment and not a lounge, I'm not sure why they don't just make the posted hours reflect the time the kitchen is open ... but you've been warned.  Also, as they prepare everything fresh, it takes a bit of time to make ... I advise calling in your order ahead, then heading over based on the ETA they give.With that out of the way, the "good" far outweighs the "bad" ... the food and market! Everything we've had from the kitchen has been great, which off the top of my head includes:Steak Bomb SandwichSteak Tip SandwichSpring RollsShrimp Summer RollsSaigon Style Barbecue Beef Noodle SaladGrilled Lemongrass Chicken Jasmine Rice PlateScallop Fried RiceChicken Stir FryScallop Noodle PlateMarina Bay Bahn MiBarbecue Beef Bahn MiAll of the above are highly recommended!I haven't yet tried their pizza / cold subs / salads, but I have no reason to doubt that they would be excellent.Also, there is a comparably no frills "market" attached where you can grab a six pack, some wine, or even single beers out of the cooler if you so desire.  It's super casual, but fairly priced and a great way to add some drinks to your meal, without being gouged by restaurant prices.  They used to be closed on Sundays (I think), but now they are open 7 days a week! The owner(s?) Gavee / John are great, super down to earth people that I am happy to give my business to.I highly recommend you give Gaveston Cafe a try while it's still nice out ... Pick a few items to try, grab a beer or two from the cooler, and go sit outside at the Marina somewhere to enjoy the feast overlooking the waterfront!> Gaveston Cafe is really excellent. Great food, really nice folks and splendid outside view of the Marina. Love the Peking ravioli, the pho ga, the pizza as well as the sandwiches. The Italian and the steak bomb sandwiches are especially wonderful; so too the Vietnamese ban mi. Updated: in addition to the excellent pho ga, the ox tail pho is absolutely incredible. So too the stir fry noodles and stir fry rice. The bread for the sandwiches is excellent French style bread, that we just cannot find elsewhere. The owner "Gavi" is absolutely charming, if you come when the place is not too busy, ask him about his life experience. A wonderful and heartening story of strength and perseverance in the face of adversity as a refugee.> First of all. The banh mi is the best I've ever had. I mean wow!!! At first this place may not look like much but the food is phenomenal! Had the beef banh mi which was great (although I'd ask for it extra spicy next time). The shrimp summer rolls were super fresh with a great dipping sauce. The vegetarian noodle soup also had a great flavor although I'd ask for extra veggies because I love veggies. Can't wait to try more things here. Also the owners are super friendly. AND you can get wine and botta boxes. What more do you need??? Love it!> Updating my review here: Since my last review (3 stars)  was a while ago, I have since tried more of the menu and I am impressed, the fried rice is amazing, the 2 people who work there are fantastic as week, really nice. The only kinda bad thing about this place is that it's slightly overpriced and that's it, besides that it's a great local shop with good food.

Claypot rice outshines the cheung fun (steamed rice rolls)Came here for a food adventure with some people.  Clay pot rice is rare in Boston area so we decided to try.  Started out with the honey w/ salty lemon drink.  It is such a confusing drink.  It is salty and sweet at the same time.  Didn't know what I was expecting, as it is in the name of the drink.  It's definitely an acquired taste.  Next time, I would stick with a tea.Cheung funs are next and we got the beef brisket and shrimp w/ egg.  The rice rolls are thinner than what are typically served in other places so the idea is you get more of the flavors from the sauces trapped in the rolls.  Generally, I am not a big fan of cheung funs but the people I am eating with are and they liked both these steamed rice rolls, so kudos.Watercrest with preserved eggs came next.  I liked the watercrest but not a big fan of the preserved eggs.  Aside from the preserved eggs, this is a good veggie dish.And finally, the stars of the show, we got the frog clay pot rice and the Chinese sausage / bacon / preserved duck clay pot rice.  Although I am not a big fan in the idea of eating reptiles, the frog clay pot was good.  I rarely eat frogs but it is just as I remembered: the chicken taste with a fish-like meat texture and soft cartilage bones.  The frog was cooked very well and the sauce was great for the frog, the rice, and even the crunchy rice crust at the bottom of the clay pot.  The Chinese sausage / bacon / preserved duck clay pot rice wasn't bad either.  I wish there was more of a sear on the meats, like a little bit of burn on the edges that would give a flavorful crunch to the meats and a more good smokey oily taste to the rest of the rice and down to the rice crust.  This isn't bad though.  Overall, a good little spot.  Not a lot of seating inside so the wait for a seat can be long.  Street parking.  Get a clay pot rice!> My search for rice rolls led me to Big Fun Cafe. The restaurant is known for their Cheng Fun (steamed rice rolls). I would say second to this popular dish is their clay pot rice. My family went on a weekend before Chinese New Years during lunch hours. Street parking on Brook Street was much easily than the busier main streets in Quincy on any typical weekend. The restaurant is located next to Fairy Cafe and very close proximity to the Wollaston T train stop. The restaurant is very tight. Upon entering, all tables were full so we waited for approximately 15-20 minutes for a table. There really is no standing room inside of the restaurant so my husband took our daughter to the car while I waited for our table. Each time someone entered or exited the restaurant, I felt bad for the table closest to the door as a cold blast of air came in each time the door opened. There were two families with children  having lunch in the restaurant and about three couples, five tables. A review of the menu reminded me a lot of another restaurant that serves rice clay pot, Clay Pot Cafe on Kneeland Street in Chinatown. When I asked our server if the two restaurants were related somehow, he responded that the owners are his friend and that they came from the same town in China.  There are a lot of similar dishes, however, what I would say sets Big Fun Cafe apart is their steamed rice rolls. There are several varieties of steamed rice rolls to try. The waitress recommended that we try one with added egg. We ended up ordering two kinds a we ordered the shrimp rice rolls and the roasted pork rice rolls with egg added. I would have to say that the added egg essentially changed the texture of the roll and of course added extra protein to the dish. I also recommend you try one with and one without eggs. I enjoyed both rolls. Honestly, nothing  beats getting your steamed rice rolls fresh from the kitchen to the table. The rolls were thin as they should. We ordered the pork belly, Chinese sausage, and duck clay pot rice. The clay pot rice typically takes 15 minutes to prepare because they have to get the rice to burn (crisp) along the inside of the clay pot. The restaurant did a good job. I can't tell if the duck pieces was fried or smoked. Think tiny chopped up pieces of smoked duck with bone attached. That's what you are getting. I wished I had ordered the Eel clay pot rice with added egg since pictures look amazing. However, we also ordered a beef chow foon, which was just okay, and had plenty of food for two. The advertised fresh hot soy milk was room temperature and the waitress offered to add ice if we wanted it cold. I would stick with the herbal tea from the can instead. There are two sauces on each of the tables; one for the rice rolls and one for the clay pot. They are labeled so no fear! I do wish the sauces were a bit more flavorful. Other than that, no complaints. I recommend you come and give this restaurant a try if you are in the area. I would not make this a destination trip. Try to go early to avoid the line and also there seems to only be a limited amount served daily (50lbs rice flour). Service was all around great. See my pictures.> The best rice roll I've ever had... This includes the one I had in Hong Kong. I ordered the beef, the meat is tender, the rice roll is thin and very smooth.  The only down side of the rice roll is the rice roll soy sauce, too salty. Hubby ordered the salty hock feet pot/rice. It only took 15min. The flavor is tasty but the pork can use more cooking, not tender enough. The rice is really good, not soggy. You can taste each and every rice. Good stuff.Customer service is excellent~~ the lady come to check on us twice to make sure it's to our liking.This is the first time we tried this place... Will come back for sure!! Next time I might order takeout and have their sauce on the side so I can make and use my own rice-roll sauce at home> Came here on a early Saturday morning and oh boy it gets packed here because of how small the place is. There's about only 5 tables so I definitely don't recommend coming here with a big group because it's a very tight squeeze. I was excited for this place to open up. The quality of the rice noodle is probably the closest thing you would get to being HK authentic and fresh. But some stars were dubbed off because the soy sauce they use wasn't the sweet one like in true HK rice rolls. The curry fish balls weren't even cooked in the curry sauce it tasted like it was just microwaved to be honest so I was pretty disappointed in that. The lemon tea was so watered down it was just water with lemon. I would honestly just order the rice rolls to go pour my own sauce over it. But other than that everything else on the menu was pretty meh. I would say if you want HK food to go over to Saigon corner!> I came back from NYC recently after trying Joe's steam roll and was interested after seeing this restaurant nearby Boston! First off, this place is small and cramped. I do appreciate that it is newly renovated, different than the old run down Chinese restaurants in Boston Chinatown. However, with only 4-5 tables in the restaurant and a mixture of chilly weather, there were many people hovering over my table while I was eating and a lot of cool breezes that blew over my styrofoam bowl every time someone opens the front door. Yes, this restaurant serves with styrofoam bowls and take out chopsticks! This restaurant features Chinese steam roll, clay pot rice and noodle soups. I ordered the beef steam rolls and clay pot to try. The clay pot takes over 20-25 minutes to prepare, which is a bad mixture for a small restaurant. The steam roll takes only 5 minutes to come out. So I devoured the steam roll which got me super hungry and had to eat for days for my clay pot to come out! I do have to say that the steam rolls were super delicious. However, the clay pot rice was aright. Not really worth the wait. The most important thing I want to comment is the soy sauces for the steam rolls and clay pot rice. Traditionally, these soy sauces are distinct from each other. I commend that they made the effort to have that at their restaurant. However, the soy sauce appears to be watered down and lacks depth of flavor. The essence of the clay pot rice AND steam rolls is really the soy sauce. But they totally missed the mark. It was watered down yet salty when it should be thick, savory and sweet. And on top of all that, I was super upset that we were not given spoons for our rice! I mean, my chopstick skills are ok, but I would appreciate a spoon for my rice dish, even if it was a plastic spoon.

My husband and I were taken by surprise by the rating for Cielo since there's bare any good restaurant in Braintree. So we went in to see this hyped-up restaurant. The restaurant was eccentric and fun. The food was delightful and Yannis, our awesome waiter, really went above and beyond. Make sure to order their guacamole. They make it fresh in front of you!5/5 stars, would recommend to everybody! Keep up the good work> Very solid Mexican good considering the location is Braintree. We were served complimentary chips and salsas (4 kinds). For my main dish I got Flautas  ($8.99) and a Jamaica ($9) with a sugar rim to drink. My father got a Mexican burger ($9.99) with a Coke. For an appetizer we split "Tamales" ($6.99). I put it in parentheses because there was only one. My flautas were delicious and my father really enjoyed his burger. We both agree the "tamales" was not worth it. His Coke was fine but I felt like my Jamaica was pretty small and not really that tasty. I probably wouldn't order it again. The service was friendly and very quick. The restaurant itself was very clean. I hope I can come back soon to try more of their menu. I would definitely recommend this place to anybody in the mood for Mexican.> Used grub hub. Called after an hour to check on order. The person on phone told me that he could see my food being bagged. 25 minutes later the Grub Hub driver told me food was still not ready. I get being overwhelmed but don't lie to customers.> This was already my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Boston area, but now that I tried their wings I'm a bigger fan or even more reasons. Never in a million years would I think that the best wings I've had on the south shore would come from a Mexican restaurant, but boy was I wrong. Being a Sunday and with all this coronavirus negativity surrounding us I figured let me treat myself while also contributing to a local restaurant that may be feeling the hardships during this time. My wife and I got our usual California burrito, fried fish tacos, and guacamole appetizer... excellent as always. On top of that I decided to get the wings as well on top of that and so happy I did. Crispy, decent buffalo spice but not too much, and perfect amount of sauce and flavor. Try them! You'll end up going to cielo on football sundays for your wing orders I promise you!> Nice atmosphere, good margaritas & yummy food!  The chips are served fresh and warm along with 4 different salsa's to choose from.  All good in their own way!  The entree's were really good and I loved the fact that you could choose plantains as a side instead of beans!  The plantains were SOOO good!! The portions are generous and the prices are more than fair!We started with Margaritas at the bar while we waited for a table... Jalepeno Margarita (Jalapeño infused tequila, fresh jalapeños, lime juice, agave nectar, Tajin rim)Morita Margarita (Fresh blackberries, lime juice, agave nectar)Yucatan Margarita (1800 Coconut, a splash of pineapple juice over our traditional margarita)All the drinks were very good!!I thoroughly enjoyed the Chori Pollo (Grilled Chicken, Chorizo, Pineapple, Queso Dip, Rice & I selected Plantains..Served with 3 Corn or Flour Tortillas) The flavors were amazing! My husband had the Cochinita Pibil (Slowly cooked pork in Achiote Marinade, Black Refried Beans, Rice, pickled Red Onion, Jalapeño, Served with 3 Corn or Flour Tortillas)  and he absolutely loved it!  We will definitely come back here again the next time we are in the area!  Definitely worth checking out!!  :)

Stylish Restaurant with good food and welcoming staff. Went here for dinner on a Monday evening, place was pretty empty. Our Server Dawn let us sit anywhere we wanted (this alone is something that sets the tone for me.) Great customer service on her part throughout. I had the Surf & Turf (photo attached.)All in all a very nice restaurant, will definitely return.> Simple review:It's the best flatbread I've ever had in my entire life. I was completely floored. I was a pizza chef for 2 years. Flatbreads are typically janky, cheap excuses for pizza. Can't say enough on how much I enjoyed the fluffy crust, flavorful sauce and fresh mozzarella. (Additional note: my gf notes her crispy chicken salad was the best she's ever had.)> Favorite bar to get a drink. They must have a really good connection with the breweries because they have the best rotating drafts. I'll be drinking trillium to vitamin sea one week to Widowmaker and kcbc the next. It's always great. Food here is amazing as well.  I have not been disappointed over the past gazillion times I've been here to eat dinner. Service is always on point as well. The waitress spilled a few glasses of ice water from her tray on me the last time I was here but she was very apologetic and even comped me a beer.> I've been here a few times when it opened, but haven't had the food again until recently. I ordered take out one night and ordered the cheeseburger with fries, crispy chicken wings, seafood saute pasta, and short rib and potato flatbread. What amazed me was how fast it took. They said it would only be 15 minutes and they were not kidding. The only downfall was the fact that they forgot the mustard and pickles on the cheeseburger (which was a pretty big disappointment..so I was really tempted to only give them 4 stars due to this). I didn't get to try the crispy chicken wings and seafood saute pasta (my cousin ordered it), but he said it was delicious and they were very generous with the seafood portions. He's a huge food critc so I'll take his word for it. The cheeseburger was cooked medium rare just the way I liked it and the fries were good. The buns were on the soggier side, but we showed up 10 minutes later than the pickup time so it's probably our fault. I had to save the best for last because the short rib and potato flatbread was AMAZING. I wouldn't think to order this, but my boyfriend made me try it and my standard for flatbreads has not been the same. The braised short rib was tender and juicy, but what i really want to talk about is the potatoes in it. The mashed potatoes with the cheesy flatbread is heavenly. The rich creamy flavor from the potatoes paired with the gooey cheese and the crispy flatbread is a brilliant combination. All I have left to say is..you have to try it!> The food in this place is trash. Bottom line. I can here with my daughter today and ordered the Curry chicken and she had a breakfast plate. Her bacon arrived burnt to a crisp (we sent it back). The chicken dish was poorly seasoned and the rice was greasy. The only thing I ate was the naan bread. Service also was not remarkable at all. Our food took forever to come out and our server was just...indifferent. I will not come here again.
