popular_dishes: No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Came here for a early dinner thing on a Sunday! Finding this place was a journey but fun! While driving in, it looks like all you see are houses, then if you keep driving, it becomes a giant parking lot of boats! This restaurant is properly hidden at the end of the line of boats!Love that the inside was very bright, had nice dark wooden tables and walls and large windows overlooking the water. There is a dock outside as well! Planty of large fish tanks inside the restarant. There is a lunch menu and dinner menu depending on what time you come in. I ordered a salmon from the lunch menu and it was thick, cooked perfectly. We had 2 people at our table who ordered the baked stuffed lobster and it was such a worthy meal! I'm definitely getting that next time I go! The swordfish skewers were perfect as well! Overall, it was a great experience and the food was great!> Definitely one of my top 5. Their food was fresh and they gave very large portions. Service was great even with a large party. A hidden gem that was featured on phantom gourmet.> Today my mother in law and I went for lunch and got lobster rolls. They were AMAZING and stuffed full of fresh lobster! You know they are fresh, when you ask for no mayo or butter and they can do it! Plus, our waiter was very friendly and was there for whatever we needed!> The Inn at Bay Pointe has probably the best outside deck (or patio for that matter) in the entire South Shore. A great atmosphere for a summer evening meal, overlooking the boats and docks.They also make an outstanding Mac & Cheese, one of the better ones around. The only negative I would comment on is that they really need to remodel the interior of the restaurant, it feels very dated and out of style in there. Thus if you can't sit on the outside deck, such as during the three seasons other than summer, it's probably not going to be your first choice when deciding where to eat that night.> The atmosphere is what drew us to this restaurant, specifically the outdoor waterfront dining area, which was clean and sunny. Upon arrival, we were welcomed by a crisp and nautical interior, complete with giant aquariums. Outside when seated, we enjoyed the view of boats and docks, and enjoyed a delicious meal served by Melissa, our lovely and efficient waitress. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a pleasant afternoon/evening meal.

One of my go-to places for AYCE hotpot & sushi. Big plus: parking!!ATMOSPHERE // casual place that attends to both large and small parties. There wasn't a wait and we got seated very quickly which was a plus. SERVICE // our server was really attentive and polite. I've never had any issues with the service here, the staff has always been friendly and professional. FOOD // We usually opt for just AYCE hotpot and we go for the kimchi & Royal special broth. The food comes out very quickly and FRESH. My favorites are the meats because I usually don't expect much from AYCE places. 10/10!> I came here for the first time for AYCE sushi and I was really excited. We came on a Saturday night and this place was packed. The moment we walked in we were greeted by our host and server. A lot of people were doing hot pot and we were actually debating if we should switch up and do hotpot as well haha, but we stuck to sushi. Our server was really nice and came over multiple times to check up on us. The moment our sushi came to our table I was actually really disappointed. The sushi did not look great at all. It was stuffed with a lot of rice and little to no avocado, meet, fish, etc. Big plus was that they have FREE parking! Casual attire is fine. When you walk in you're hit with the hotpot smell haha. When we left we all smelt like hotpot even though we got sushi. Not sure if I would be coming back for sushi. Hotpot? Probably.> Hands down this is honestly my favorite spot to get hotpot. I'm a sucker for AYCE (all you can eat) hotpot and this is the place to go to for all my cravings. They also have AYCE hotpot & sushi so that's a plus! But I normally just opt for AYCE hotpot because that is so much as it is. Broth/Soup Base: I usually order Garden Tomato or Szechuan Mala. Their tomato broth is legit to die for. It has that tomato based flavor but slightly sweet and I am living for it. Now their mala broth is really good too. I love how spicy it is and it just makes everything you add into that broth so so much better. Veggies: I love adding broccoli, spinach, taro, watercress, & Napa cabbage. They serve enough vegetables for two people but you can always order more if you want. Meats: I order choice rib eye and angus prime rib. Those are my two favorite meats when it comes to having hotpot. They cook so fast in the pot as well! I also like to add in tripe as well. Meatballs: I love fish tofu, fish balls, and beef balls. Drinks: I've had a few of their alcoholic drinks like their beers, mixed drinks, soju, and sake. I have no complaints whatsoever because they have all been pretty good. Dessert: I did try their fried ice cream. (This doesn't come with the AYCE menu.) I'm usually picky when it comes to fried ice cream especially how the batter is cooked. I probably wouldn't say it's the best place to get fried ice cream but it isn't bad either. It's personally just not how I like it. But overall for what you get for AYCE this place is amazing. They have a variety of options and that's what makes it so worth it every time I come. The service is always great here. They have wonderful waitresses and if you do go during dinner hours, there might be a wait but it's soooo worth waiting to eat their hotpot! Price wise: For two people for AYCE hotpot, I usually spend about $70-$80. Parking: They have a parking lot & there is street parking.> Royal is a good choice for AYCE sushi and/or hotpot! We came on a Saturday during dinner time and was expecting to wait; however, I was surprised that we were seated right away. Our server was very attentive and friendly! We had a baby stroller and she offered to place it behind our booth to give us more room. She constantly checked on us to make sure we were satisfied and cleared empty plates when necessary. We paid $29.95 per adult (excluding tip) for AYCE hotpot. Keep in mind, do not over order; any food leftover, you will be charged $10 per person.> Came here for a birthday dinner. They only seat full parties, so make sure you have everybody here. We tried to avoid having 8 people sit in the booths...but we ended up there anyways. Parking is easy, just make sure to read the signs before leaving your car. There is also parking right outside of the lot if you'd like to stay closer.We ordered so much food, but the first round of food didn't come with everything we ordered. When we ordered it again, we finally got it. I like that when we order too much food, they leave the cart with us so that we had more space, much appreciated. The waitress asked whether we were celebrating anything and we told her it was a birthday. At the end of dinner, she brought over a dessert surprise.

I love Indian food in general. I especially love good tasting Indian food. And where can you get excellent tasting Indian food? At Tumeric House in Weymouth! I went there multiple time and have not been disappointed. The food is delicious with the right amount of spices and seasoning. The staff is friendly and warming. They'll answer any questions you have about the menu. The staff checks up on you throughout the time to make sure that you are 100% satisfied and that you are taken care of. They have a few dishes that you can't find at other Indian restaurants in the area.Entrees I highly recommend: Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Mango Curry, Chicken Jalfrieze, and Goat Curry.Don't forget to order Naan especially the garlic naan. Appetizer I definitely recommend: The Bombay Tandoori wings! They're good and does not disappoint!> YAY! Some more good food in Weymouth :)This place will get more popular I imagine -- good food, tasty dishes, friendly staff and nice decor.A little pricey but Honesyly not that bad, thanks for opening up Tumeric House!> Excellent Indian food. We didn't try any of the Nepalese dishes as there weren't many and they seemed very similar to the regular menu. I don't usually give 5 stars but the food was delicious. Best I've had in this area. We ordered the chicken 65, chicken Tikka masala and Malai kofta. The chicken 65 was great. Small app, but tasty. We also ordered onion naan and onion paratha. I would say the paratha was not good. Very oily and soggy. Naan was perfect. Go with the naan and not the paratha. The chicken Tikka masala was perfect. Plenty of chicken with delicious gravy. The Malai kofta was equally as perfect. 4 large koftas in gravy. The restaurant is nice looking inside but my only real concern was that there was no one dining inside. I asked how new the place was and the waiter said 4 weeks. maybe they need to advertise more. Hopefully it sticks around. About $50 for two with an app.> Very nice buffet. Used to be where another Indian place was, the Indian Delight on Route 53. Great chicken dishes. Tandoori chicken which  was perfect. All of the sauces were rich and thick. A wonderful variant on Tikka Masala  called Jalfrise which packed a little punch. And one dish which Resembles Chicken 63/65/69 - had a nice flavor to it and thick sauce. Fresh naan. Nice salad selection; typical tomato, cucumber and carrot for a Cuchumbar Salad. Plenty of side relished and chutnies. Drinks galore: cardamom tea for buffet, full bar and the regular litany of sodas. The place has been redone and cleaned. Very new, open and nice. Icing on the cake... a wonderful Gulab Jamon with a heart sweet rose syrup. Very gracious staff and host.> Turmeric House is open for takeout and it's such quality and amazing food!! HIGHLY recommend! Go support this great new business in the area!

popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Love this place! Flavorful and fresh... it's become our favorite pizza spot in Quincy!> Had a hankering for good pizza and being new to this neighborhood, decided to google. The business' name is what got me to look at the menu. Offering homemade Brazilian food and American fare so I decided to give it a try. I tried the Pratofeito, roughly translated as "Blue Plate Special." Protein choices are chicken & pork, steak or tilapia. OMG! I had the steak version and it was wonderful! The dish consists of rice and beans, flavorful grilled flatiron steak, fried egg on top, side of crispy fries and small salad. My tastebuds are still doing a happy dance. Also ordered was the BBQ burger, which is also very good but had a tad too much BBQ sauce (that's just my preference). They deliver via GRUBHUB. The downside is that their drinks are missing from the online menu and I had to call the store. I'm assuming that error will be corrected eventually; however, they offer the usual sodas in the can, but the only 2 litre size is regular Coke. Definitely a keeper!> I have eaten at Hungry Tummy on three occasions. Food was quite good. I had a bacon cheese burger that was flavorful and cooked right. Pizza was very good, bar pizza style. They also have some Brazilian dishes topped with egg that look bomb.  Family run joint and highly recommended.> Awesome food great lol sub shop that serves dinners too.  I go there for the steak and cheese. There the best in quincy> We got a slice of cheese pizza and the crunch in the bottom of the pizza had a great crunch to it and the cheese was flavorful and stringy. The crust at the end of the pizza was not as flavorful as I would've liked and was pretty dry. Overall, a good slice of pizza!

I got take out the first time and sat inside for ramen the second time I've been here. Both experiences were great. This is a small ramen/sushi spot but was not disappointed at all. The food comes out relatively quick which who doesn't appreciate? Because I sure do! The sushi was nice and fresh as expected when I got take out. Their ramen was a pretty decent size. I got R9 which consisted of pork based broth soup topped pork katsu, black mushroom, egg, bean sprouts, bamboo shoot, and spinach for $13.95. I also added a side of corn for an additional cost. The broth was not bad. The chicken katsu was really juicy and crispy at the same time. The service here was great. Server was nice and friendly. The only down side is its located on a busy street so it's hard to find parking.> I went here for dinnertime on a weekday. My boyfriend and I were the only patrons there. We ordered the R2 and R10 ramen, which were alright. It wasn't bad but it isn't amazing either. For a couple dollars more, you could go to Santouka, which is better tasting, higher in quality, and they provide sides! Here, you'd have to pay a few dollars for each additional side, so not worth it IMO.Their eggs are also slightly overcooked to the point where part of the yolk begins to grey. Most ramen places I've gone to give you a soft boiled egg. I could've overlooked this but my boyfriend and I each only received half of an egg, which I thought was strange and honestly kind of cheap.The pork was alright. I received a generous portion of it in my R2, but the R10 only had two slices.The customer service was below average for me. After the server gave us our dishes, we were never checked up on again until we were finished. Even then, I think they only came over and saw us because their phone rang so they were getting up anyway.It's a bit pricey for what you get. I would probably only come back if I was craving ramen really bad and didn't want to drive into the city, but I would stick to take-out.> I'm usually not the biggest fan of ramen, however, I've reconsidered. My sister and I ordered R2, R6, butter corn and a caterpillar maki which were all delicious!The service is great and very quick. It gets busy and customers end up standing by the door (even outside) making it uncomfortable to eat because they're glaring at your dishes haha!> I've been here a handful of times and it's an okay place. The food is good but it's not anything to rave about. I feel like the price for their food is a bit pricey for what you get. They also have sushi burrito and its super over priced! For the quailty of the food its not worth it. This place is worth a try but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.> I've only ever gotten Ramen here, usually the R8 Hakata Teriyaki Chicken Ramen, and I like it spicy! This place has yet to disappoint me! The staff is friendly and the ramen is delicious!!!

This is a very nice place, a bit tucked away from the main drag. I was expecting a small restaurant, but it is sizable with a full bar and a well-decorated dining room. It feels clean and modern with an Asian flair.The lunch specials were well-priced with plenty of options, Japanese or Chinese. My pepper steak dish was tasty with a good sauce that was not overly greasy or sweet.The service was good too, with our waitress promptly offering a refill.One of the tables next to us ordered a sushi boat and that was huge and very impressive.I would definitely go back and try other dishes as well as takeout, although I doubt they deliver to Dorchester There is a parking lot on the side which is a nice bonus.> Not a bad spot! Has a huge variety of cuisines on their menu so it's a good place to go if you're not sure what you're craving. Convenient location with a parking lot, street parking and plenty of space inside the restaurant. Pad Thai noodles are good but the shrimp was kinda bland. Udon was tasty, lots of flavor in there and the beef was cooked well and wasn't too chewy. Sushi had a good ratio to it. Overall, average food. Employees are nice and polite here but unfortunately the service is quite slow. Maybe try come at a slower time.> One of the best places for beef teriyaki! I love beef teriyaki so I usually order some and some of the places are a major disappointment but here it's usually still tender and flavorful. My sister likes getting the sushi. Elyse, Snow mountain and the summer scallops are the ones she always orders. Servers are key friendly as well which is very surprising since Asian restaurants aren't too known for that.> This is my go to place for Chinese food in the area. Living the Quincy area, I've pretty much eaten at all the Asian cuisine spots. However, had never tried Fusion even tough I passed it all time. It was not until my wife was craving sauteed pea pod stems that I had a reason to check it out...and glad we did.My go to place to order pea pod stems is in the North Quincy area but when I got to the restaurant to order, it was packed and seemed like it was going to take forever to order food. So, I did a simple Google search and Fusion came up. So, decided to give it a shot. We were pleasantly surprised. The first experience set the tone as the space itself was quite nice and well decorated. The owner was very kind and greeted everyone with "hi friend." The price was typical and nothing out of the norm. And the food was tasty. Well seasoned, sauced and not overly oily. Since then, we only order Chinese take-out from Fusion. We haven't tried the sushi or dined-in, so can't speak about that. But, take-out is very solid and have had only good experiences since that first unexpected trip seeking pea pod stems.> Been craving sushi a lot lately so I decided to order from here. Overall good was pretty decent, good enough that I'll probably come back. Just wish the lo mein had a little more flavor to it though!

We just got our first delivery of Micro catering and it's amazing- absolutely enormous portions and just as nice as they serve it in the restaurant. We will definitely be getting take out regularly during the next few weeks while everything is shut down for social distancing. I applaud the owners for looking out for their community by closing the restaurant but making delivery and curbside pick up available. They also said on Facebook to let them know if there's a person in need of a meal and they will provide chicken, rice, and a veg. I really happy to support a business like that!> Soooo good! Fresh as can be and cooked perfectly every time. The owner is the best, she found out it was our anniversary and gave us a champagne toast on the House. The staff is great, and food is amazing. Definitely with a trip any day of the week. Edit: one year later and I'm back to update. It's been bugging me for a while the way we were treated upon revisiting what we thought was a true gem amongst crappy places all around. We went here on a Saturday evening, looking for the usual friendly service and super yummy seafood we came to expect from true north. Upon entering the establishment, there was no one to greet us at the door. Not a big deal at all, maybe they had a call out or were just a bit understaffed. Whatever. But when the owner came over, we said hi in a friendly "we remember you and you're awesome" kind of way, and expected, oh I don't know, her to tell us what the wait time is like a normal person?Nope. She frantically came over with her iPad, asked us what we were doing there and whether we had a reservation, which we didn't,  and showed us a map of all the tables, and which ones might be available at some point, and which ones were seated recently. When my wife asked how long the wait might be, her response was "like I just showed you, it's gonna be a long time, unless you can sit at the bar, but that doesn't look promising, does it!?"Okay. For about twenty minutes she trolled around the restaurant with her iPad, (looking at the table map I guess?) and never came back to tell us anything while we awkwardly stood at the hostess booth and waited for an update on a time frame, which she never gave us. Guess they didn't want our business after that. Two stars for the good, but inconsistent, food.> Good Riddance, Kelly's Landing!  The people who have erased that dump and turned it into True North deserve the key to the city.  I've been here a few times (lunch, dinner) and the food has been outstanding.  Fish tacos, calamari, Beef short ribs, True Burger have all been delicious.  The owner (or GM, not sure) was very friendly one of the times I've been there.  Cocktails are reasonably priced ($10 average) and very good.  The bar set up is far superior to what it once was, so it wouldn't be a bad place to grab a few drinks/apps.  I've seen/heard a few locals complain about the prices, but I'm not sure what those boomers want.  Five dollar plates? The Sandtrap is down the street.> Solid neighborhood spot. Cocktail menu was tasty and the brunch was awesome! Highly recommend for brunch!> I saw a lot of great reviews on this place so my buddy and I made it out this past Wednesday. Service was amazing throughout our time there. Our waitress was attentive and spent more time then we deserved offering recommendations and explaining what her favorite part about multiple dishes was. I ordered the Seafood Puttanesca which comes with salmon, shrimp, and scallops within the pasta. Tons of seafood by the way. Basically had something in every bite. I thought the pasta could have used a little more spice, but I am still happy with what I ordered. I wouldn't have expected to find a place like this in Weymouth, but am happy that it's close and easy to get to. This is a great place to check out if you're looking for something a bit nicer than your causal bar or a good date night spot. Will be coming back for more dinners in the future and possibly some brunches on the weekend!! Tip: Wednesday Nights are Italian Night, meaning you get a starter salad, entree, and glass of house wine or beer for $25.

reviews: One of the top Thai food spots.  I don't see any other Thai spots topping this place anytime soon.  Go for it.  You won't regret it.First off, have to park on the street.  Clean exterior & interior.    We started off with the papaya salad, which was delicious.  The right amount of spice served with grilled shrimps.  It was the best salad I've ever had.  Recommended!Then the golden bags were the best I have ever had.  All other Thai restaurants cannot compare.  Very well made.  Cleanly crispy and works well with the sweet sauce.  The chicken, shrimp, and corn mix inside looks good after a bite in.  Recommended!Fiery Pad Thai was also amongst the best pad Thai I have ever had.  Love the spice.  The noodles are a good elasticity.  Right amount of sauce with good flavors.  The proteins are very well cooked.  The ground peanuts and crunchy sprouts adds a great dimension.  Not my first time having pad Thai but this specific dish is a whole new experience.  Recommended!Pad Ki Mao is delicious also.  I love the spice with the flat noodles and minced chicken.  Very well cooked.  Recommended!Duck Choo Chee was good.  Roasted crispy duck on an excellent curry over veggies.  There is more veggies than duck but it was a good dish.  I loved the curry.  Have it over rice.Mango fried rice a great filler dish.  I love the ingredients and quantity of non-rice ingredients they used.  I've had a lot of fried rice in my lifetime and I gotta say this one is amongst the best.The one thing I was not impressed with was the drink.  I usually get non-dairy Thai iced tea and it was good in other Thai restaurants, especially ones that mix the Thai iced tea with lemonade as a substitute for cream.  This place kind of water down the tea too much.  Nothing special about the drink.  It is the one thing I feel they should work on.Overall, this is the best Thai restaurant I have had.  The food is delicious.  You can tell they emphasize quality without being stingy.  The vibe in the restaurant is good.  Everything is clean.  Friendly waitress.  I may have to become a regular.> Two months ago, my brother and I dropped by this place for dinner. I liked the wooden decor of the restaurant. It felt cozy. For appetizer, we got the curry triangles. It came with 5 pieces. They were filled with minced chicken, mashed potatoes and a hint of curry. It was crispy and good.For an entree, I got the chili chicken. It came with crispy chicken with pineapple, baby corn, onions, and peppers in a chili sauce. I thought the chicken was a bit dry and the sauce was a tad too sweet.> My go-to thai spot! Perfect location, but the parking and wait can be a little difficult to navigate around. Still very much worth it. The place itself is also decorated beautifully. I'm a sucker for the cozy and aesthetic vibe. Been here a couple times and the service is always so consistent. They are the nicest people, always filled with smiles and wanting to give people the best experience. They are also very attentive to your specific preferences. I know sometimes restaurants tend to forget if you dont want something in your dish but they are pretty good in this aspect. Food comes out pretty quickly here too. Tried a variety of their dishes and never had anything to complain about. Everything is flavored nicely and comes out nice and hot. Favorites are the golden bag appetizer, fiery pad Thai, and the panang curry (portions are perfect for sharing)! Definitely think it's one of the top Thai spots around.> Got some TogoPad kee mow: bigger portions when in house it seems. Crispy chicken fried rice: would pass on this. Chicken doesn't have flavor nor is it juicy. Crab Rangoon: sauce is too watery.Beef noodle soup: soup has good flavor. Taste like pho . Would recommend.> We were craving for some Thai food so we decided to try this place out for dinner... and we were so satisfied!! This place was super cute and cosy!! We ordered the Papaya salad, Tom Kha Soup, Thai Satay, and Royal Duck. The food was so fresh, flavorful, and non greasy! We did not feel heavy when we were done. It was very yummy! The food came out very fast and that was great because we were both starving from our smoothie diet this morning :) We highly recommend this place!

Best hot pot in Boston for sure. Very authentic chengdu style hot pot and what's more the dishes are so creative and delirious !!!> KOI provided an average hot pot experience. We went with two broth options, one being tomato based and the other was a kim chi broth. The menu had a variety of veggies, meats, and seafood options which we were all pleased to have so much variety. A standout off the menu I'd recommend was the shrimp paste, which puffed up into delicious shrimp balls after bouncing around in the hot broth for a little while. Beyond the shrimp paste, you'll find most hot pot staples on the menu. As I mentioned, KOI was an overall average experience. The broth was good, menu items to add to the hot pot were good, and the restaurant decor / vibe was ok. I wouldn't go out of my way and recommend KOI for hot pot, but I'd also be fine returning at a different point in time.> The KOI Japanese Cuisine is located in Quincy, Wollaston Square in the location that used to be Barry's Deli. They have totally redone the facility and it has nearly doubled in size.  Parking is brutal and very limited in Wollaston Square, so be prepared to park a distance away and walk. Not the. I eat area either, so I would not go when it is dark. The food is "ok - ?" I mean there are about 5 other sushi places in the square, but these folks really seem to phone it in and provide less than adequate food.  Over-priced and small portions. The place smells kind of fishy like couple day old fish. Find better.> Everything was overpriced and portions weren't very big. For a table of 2, our bill came out to be $100 (including tip). Please also note that we are not big eaters so... yeah, expensive. We got the split hotpot - mala and mushroom. The mushroom broth didn't taste nor smell like mushrooms. Instead it was more of the herbal broth...it was a first time experience. Would not visit again.. OH and you have to pay for sauces which wass never mentioned to us until we found out on the bill> I didn't comment on eating at the outside restaurant, but this hot pot restaurant really made me angry. I've been eating this hot pot restaurant. I've been licking the toilet for a night. I'm diarrhea several times. I'm going to collapse. It's too scary.

Updating my review 4 years later? Yes, it's just that good. It is really difficult to find really good udon in Boston with the right amount of chew and integrity to handle both thick and light soups. Trust me when I say, they came a long way from when they first opened and they are super great. The menu has expanded with additions of fried options for your noodles and more noodles such as egg noodles, pho or even vermicelli.Another great thing about this place is that they have so many different appetizers all are which soo good. I have tried almost everything on this menu, even the updated items and I don't regret my food baby. The ultimate pairings especially on cold days are their popular coconut shrimp and dumplings with your bowl of noodle soup, along with a fruity tooty smoothy.> This place is hidden farther in Quincy, but definitely worth the troop if you're looking for some affordable and decent Asian selections- plus it's a really short walk from the Wollaston station!I got the TOM YUM SEAFOOD NOODLE SOUP. I was pleasantly surprised with how much seafood I got in my bowl. It was filled with different things like shrimp, chunks of fish, mussels, and more. The size portion was big too! I  had to pack some to go because I didn't want to waste it. They had lots of different things to choose from, many different sides, apps, and entrees, but the noodles stuck out to me because you could choose whichever noodles you wanted (love that!). I normally commute by T so I wouldn't mind commuting there again since it's right by the T station, especially for a warm bowl of noodles. I see why so many of my friends go here!> I've been to this restaurant before and after a little while of not being here, I noticed that the store have expanded. They only had like 3 booths before but now they have a whole section/area on the other side of the restaurant. I think the menu has also improved. The prices are noticeable cheaper then the usual restaurants around the area which is really good. The food is really good as usual. They also do hotpot but so far I haven't tried it before, maybe next time when I go again with some friends. So far I had good experience dining there and I would recommend it to other people.> Ordered scallion pancakes, soup dumplings, and spicy miso vegetable ramen. Scallion pancakes were just as expected. Soup dumplings had a nice flavor! Unfortunately, the ramen really lacked flavor and I had to add a TON of soy sauce to it. Nice staff and well priced Sapporo.> Gem alert! Quincy is the Mecca of great Asian cuisine in Massachusetts. To be honest, Quincy probably stands up to some of the best the country has to offer. And within this Asian paradise, I may have just found my fav...so far at least.Fairy cafe hit...that...spot! A small restaurant tucked away in the middle of what seems like an entire blocked owned and operated by Asian businesses. The staff is warm, helpful, and attentive. FoodSalt and pepper chicken- crispy, juicy, packed with flavor you want. There is not a single thing wrong with this dish. I only wish there was more! Scallion pancakes-  These are probably the crispiest version I've had. I do prefer a little more chew, but that's just a personal preference. You can't really mess up scallion pancakes can you?Chinese sausage fried rice- yes please! Authentic Chinese fried rice is very much different from the Americanized fried rice we're used to. This rice is fragrant and stocked full of delicious chopped eggs, scallions, cabbage, and corn. The slightly sweet Chinese sausage brings a great balance to the dish. This is everything fried rice should be. Stir fried ramen - Are you kidding me? Where has this been all my life. I'm almost ashamed that it took me this long to find stir fried ramen. This is the kind of thing that causes you to rethink your life...And among all the Chinese regional specialties, Cantonese definitely stands superior. I can't remember the last time I had good Chinese food this good. Can we talk about this price point?! Chinese food in general is not pricey, but this is insanely affordable. Both my stomach and wallet are doing a little happy dance. How soon is too soon to go back?!

I have never written a Yelp review and signed up just to say I ate here last night and without a doubt had the best Fish and Chips that I've ever had.I usually get the Fried Chicken dinner, which is also amazing but the Fish and Chips were unbelievable.  They have the perfect batter there and you cannot go wrong with ANYTHING that is fried on that menu.  Will be back as soon as I can to taste that fried haddock again.> Ordered take out and found a pube in my French fries. I'm not sure if this place has grumpy cooks but definitely will not be ordering again.> Several fake negative reviews floating around.    The prices have steadily drifted up , and portions down, that is true.  There are zero rude staff members.  Most are friendly, some are a little businesslike but certainly not hostile.      Even in their shunken and expensive state, the buffalo chicken sandwich and the steak and cheese are still very tasty. Some menu items are knee slapping guffaw expensive, don't know what he is thinking there. If you want to strap on the feed bag, order the chicken parm sandwich, which he hasn't gotten around to shrinking yet.    I have never seen anyone loud at the bar who makes regulars uncomfortable, this sounds like a work of fiction.  It just isn't that sort of place.  Among the other reasons this would not be a good place to act up like that is that many Quincy Police and various DPW and other civil servants frequent the place, so there are better venues to perform in than here if one is a trouble maker.    Good Keno situation with enough screens, but if the bartender gets busy it can get difficult to get a bet in.> We stopped in yesterday after house hunting and everything was SO good!  The food, the ambiance, the people...  the bartender was also excellent!   I would come back solely for the French onion soup but the people, the locals and the ambiance has me sold!  I would recommend to anyone in the area looking for a good meal and excellent company!!!> I love GW.  Grumpy is what you expect from a neighborhood restaurant in the Boston area,   feisty waitresses, keno and a lottery machine in house for your scratching pleasure.   You will see people old and young eating chicken parm subs,  seafood platters and burgers oh my!  They have a diverse menu and great cocktails.  They have cozy old school style booths, two bars and outside seating for the summer months.  Just great New England style favorites.  Plenty of parking in the lot.   I suggest their burgers and salads.  Yummy fries too!

My favorite lunch spot. Great everytime. Nice staff. Fresh and just the right portion.> I have updated  my review.  The last three times I have eaten there, I have had a different experience than previously.  The flavors are not as good.  I am a vegetarian and eat Indian food regularly.  The veggie curry seemed like mostly froZen veggies I a very mediocre curry sauce.  Certainly NOT worth the money! I will not be returning. Too bad!> We visited on Friday night. I had the chicken vindaloo and they made butter shrimp for my fiancé which was wonderful since it wasn't on the menu! Highly recommend this place. Our food and service was wonderful. Great prices. We'll see be back!> This is the best Indian food within 30 miles of Boston. The staff is also extremely friendly and efficient. My only hesitation for giving a five star is the additional traffic it will attract to a place i eat at several times a month lol> Ordered take it, portions were large! The quality of food was good.  We like our food spicy asked for it super spicy and it was made perfectly! Ordered chicken curry, garlic naan, and saag paneer. My food was ready in 15 min. I'm so happy we found this hidden gem! Will defiantly come back.

My go to is the chirashi bowl which comes with assorted sashimi, eel, tempura crust and mango+crab meat wrapped in salmon. They have upgraded their menu to include pokebowls. They also have rice and noodle options that are not raw. The portions are also packed to the top and definitely worth the buck! You can get seated once you order and they will bring it to your table. You do need to throw it away yourself at the back where the utensils are after you're done.My favorite drink is the thai tea slush without boba. I've had boba here that tastes frozen, but the drink is great by itself. This is conveniently located with a short walk from North Quincy station with easy parking at all times. They do a lot of take out and I've had it to go as well. It's also really quiet and perfect to bring a friend along!> Just okay.I got the spicy tuna / California roll combo which was $10.50 and came with six pieces of each roll. It wasn't particularly special in any way, and the each piece was tinier than I expected. Did it satisfy my sushi cravings? Yes, but don't expect anything spectacular. Spicy tuna has tempura crumbs in the mix, and they use half a piece of crab stick.> Really affordable for the quality of food you get. I usually order delivery from here and the food transports well delivered. I've tried:- chirashi 5/5 highly recommend. It comes with a very generous portion of assorted sashimi with sushi rice. The fish tasted really fresh and the portions were big. - chicken teppanyaki 4.5/5 great value deal! - eel bowl 4/5 for some reason the portioning seems off and I always seem to finish this in half the time it takes me to finish the other dishes> I've tried their chicken teppanyaki and I found it ordinary and comparable to the mall food court chicken teriyaki. I really enjoy their watermelon lychee bubble tea! The large size is about $6.30 (including tax), which is average in my opinion.> Since my last review, B Cafe has updated their menu, eliminating some of the items I normally bought. They no longer offer the noodle soup with pork in it, no longer offer the chicken & beef or beef teppanyaki (only chicken is available) and they've eliminated the ice cream. How stupid is that?
