popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Had a very yummy tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwich here. The bread was perfectly brown and crispy and the cheese inside was creamy and hot. The soup may have been a tomato basil; it had a creamy smooth richness that paired really well when I dunked my sandwich in it!  Service was good and waitstaff was attentive and kept our drinks full.> Well, this was disappointing, taste/food wise (for the most part). My partner and I came in since this looked appetizing based on the pictures, but once we ordered we found out that either items were not on the menu anymore or they did not look or taste as appetizing as we thought they would be. To start, the short rib risotto is no longer on the menu, since this is what I was curiosu to try, this was a little unfortunate. Anyway, I ordered a pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries. Sweet potato fries were good, and onion rings tasted fresh, but the pulled pork was not good. They give you a lot of pork, but it is very sweet and the pork is slightly glazed in BBQ so it looks a little sad. It came with a pretzel bun which was a little burnt, but I decided to take it home anyways as to not be wasteful. However, I ended up throwing it out anyway, I could not salvage it no matter how much Stubb's I threw on the pork. Then we also got the pulled pork mac and cheese which was slightly bland, my recommendation would be to either add more salt or pick saltier cheese to add some flavor. Again the sweetness of the pork was not the best. However, the 6 pieces of shrimp in the spicy/sweet shrimp appetizer was good. I could have probably liked this better if there was a shrimp entrée version, just a thought. And I will say the server kept checking in so definitely appreciated that.> I was really looking forward to trying 110 Grill out, but I ended being really disappointed in the food.Service was average, our waitress never refilled our water. However I liked how she asked if my girlfriend and I was sharing our food and asked if we wanted to split the plates for each dish. If it wasn't for that the service would've been pretty badSo we ordered 3 things. Pulled pork mac and cheese, NY strip, and the cure burger.Pulled pork mac and cheese was the best out of the 3. I would give that a 4/5.The NY strip was probably the worst steak I ever had. The steak was tender but bland. No flavor at all. I wouldn't be surprised if they did not season the steak at all. The Cure burger was pretty much the same....no flavor.> I have come here a few times & it seems like it's gone down hill from previous years & not sure why. They used to have more veg*n options on their menu. They have a good variety of things on their food & drink menu though. The place is pretty damn big too so there are always people there & generally no wait during the week. I don't understand why folks decide to do dressing on the side, I find that to be silly. I don't want to do the work & it would be messy as hell to try to do that. So why would it come like that? I didn't ask for dressing on the side. Kind of like lemon w/ water. I didn't ask for that so why do it automatically? So hit or miss, take your chances.> My friends took me here for lunch while I was visiting my hometown for the weekend. They knew I was just starting a vegan lifestyle and they said that the restaurant had a lot of good selections and catered to food allergies. On a Saturday afternoon, we had less than a 15-minute wait. We opted to grab drinks at the bar (they were delicious) and were being called to our table before they were even made. The waitress was very busy so took a little while to come see us but the manager kindly addressed the issue and was nice enough to buy us a round of drinks for the wait. We ordered a sampler appetizer plate which I (the vegan) could eat a good amount from. My friend also ordered the soup on the special menu which she said was good and she split wings with my other friend. By the time we got our entrees, we were stuffed. Everything was great, including the rest of our service.

A small family owned business that is located down the street from Wollaston Station. The owner is very nice and patient when we took our time ordering. The prices are really cheap and filling. Perfect if you want some inexpensive, authentic Chinese food. The portions are really big and I usually eat half and take the rest to go. The owner was also have us curry fish balls on the house as it was our first time there. They are able to adjust different types of noodles and very accommodating to what you want to add, you just have to ask! They also have limited cold soy milk that is made fresh daily and sold out very quickly! If you would like to get some, be sure to call and reserve it in the morning. I've gone multiple times before 2pm and they were already sold out of soy milk - no kidding.> Yummy is a great place for some Cantonese staples. If you need your fix of a warm rice place and herbal tea (for your yet hay). A mom and pop shop that greets you with a smile.Cash only!> I come here probably at least once or twice a month. It offers the perfect home away from home comfort food, is cheap, and they generally give a decent portion sized amount of food. I find myself going home with leftovers often! You can tell how well-liked this place is because the owner seems to know everyone who comes in and there's usually a small wait (also because it is a tiny shop). Honestly, I don't think I've disliked anything I've tried here.My favorites/usuals include: honey lemon tea, beef chow fun (w/ gravy - not on the menu but can be asked to be made this way, AKA "sup chow"), salted fish fried rice, spicy salted chicken wings, and any of their beef brisket noodle soups.Note: Cash only and closed Wednesdays!> This is a cute and cozy restaurant serving hong kong style dishes. The popular dishes here are the "cart noodles" or che zai mian. You have the option to choose the type of noodles you want (egg noodles, rice noodles) and the number of sides to pair with you noodle soup. They also have some appetizers, rice dishes, lo mein, fried rice and chow mein entrees. The curry fish balls are on point! It reminds me of the ones I get in HK. The fish ball is nice and bouncy, perfectly seasoned, and the curry sauce is delicious. I got the cart noodles with beef stomach, curry fish balls and radish with lai fun noodles. The soup base is delicious. I added the chili oil that is at the table. It made it nice and spicy. The noodles were soft and chewy. It soaked up all the delicious broth. The sides also paired well with the noodles. I also tried the pork belly and pork intestine noodle soup. The pork bell and intestines were perfectly seasoned and flavorful. The down side to this place is the milk teas were disappointing. Otherwise good food and good service! Keep in mind this place is cash only!!!> This plAce is such a gem! I  always forget they are closEd on Wednesdays and then im left with the biggest craving for duck on rice. This place is amazing! Cash only! Excellent wonton! NO too crazy about the mini juice dumplings. Tasted like  the frozen kind.  But everything else is superb!

Pho Country Side is one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in Quincy! My go-to order is the Pho Dac Biet (special combination noodle soup with eye round steak, flank, brisket, tendon, and tripe). Very spot on with broth flavor. My boyfriend ordered the Mi Xao Don Bo (deep fried egg noodles with mixed vegetables and beef). We didn't enjoy this dish because the noodles were very dry due to very limited sauce. Additionally, there were only three pieces of beef and a ton of mixed vegetables. The restaurant is newly renovated and seats twice as many customers than it previously did.> This review is strictly for the drinks I got from Pho Countryside!I was at Kam Man and suddenly my friends and I wanted boba, but we didn't want to go all the way to North Quincy, so my genius mind remembered that Pho Countryside exists and sells drinks! ;)We ordered Durian Smoothies and a Thai Iced Tea. I had the durian smoothie and it was amazing! Super cold, creamy, and very durian flavored. Durian is really something you either love or hate, if you wanted to try and aren't ready to commit to a full cup of it, I would suggest trying a sip from a friend's cup!I have eaten here before, it was literally the day after I got my wisdom teeth out and the pho here really touched my soul T_T just couldnt eat the meat hahahaIf you're around Kam Man and want boba, Pho Countryside is a great if you don't want to go too far :)> The broth here is how I imagine crack would be.I love this place for Vietnamese food. I have never had a bad experience. Servers have always been attentive but I come here all the way from my house (30 mins away) because the broth here is SOOoOOOOO good. Did you hear me? SOoOOOOOo good. Maybe I have lucked out everytime I have come here but the broth is always spot on. You can taste all the spices and it tasted like it has been cooking for days. That flavor would be my spirit animal if it could be a spirit animal. Other restaurants, broth is good one day and shitty the next. Here, it is consistent. I haven't ordered rice plates here in a long while because I always want the pho. Will keep you posted on that. If you want delicious, comforting soul soup, go here.> Though a little out of the way for me to get here, but if I'm in Quincy, Pho Countryside is my go to. Place is clean and looks modern compared to many Asian restaurants in the area. Most importantly, food doesn't disappoint. It's ranked #2 of pho restaurants in Massachusetts for me.> The food is good, but the service provided from the hostesses has dropped the rating of this place.First, the food is authentic Viet food. I like to get the egg rolls, the bo luc lac (egg fried rice with shaking beef), and the bon bo hue (spicy beef noodle soup). My favorite has to be the egg fried rice. However, they aren't always consistent with the egg fried rice. Sometimes the fried rice is on the spicier side (which I like) and other times they don't put enough beef on top. However it tastes good nonetheless. The bon bo hue is equally good and I like how spicy they make it. The only drawback is how fatty the meat is that they give you. I personally don't eat a lot of meats that have noticeable chunks of fat on them so I wasn't a huge fan of that, but the type of beef meats that restaurants put in this noodle soup really varies anyway. Onto the service, the hostesses (I'm assuming the daughter and wife of the owner) stated that the wait would be five minutes..twenty minutes later I asked how long it would take and one of them stated it would take another fifteen minutes. After I waited a total of forty-five minutes and decided to tell her we were going to leave instead (as a common courtesy so she would take us off the list) she urged us to stay and that we would be seated right away. That was pretty crazy to me. Not only that, but what really bothered me was that they wouldn't even let me put a small ice cream cake (that ended up being extremely melted) in their freezer as we waited. Food: 7-8/10Hostess service: 2-3/10Waiter service: 7/10 (I didn't mention anything about this, but it can be a hit or miss depending who you get. Overall, I've had an okay experience considering it's a typical Asian restaurant)

After living in Korea for a year, I struggle to find  Korean food that hits the spot like my old haunts did in Seoul. This place is everything I could ask for.  The food is fantastic and resembles exactly what you'd find on a typical Korean cafe menu. Try the kimchi jiigae, bibimbap, chicken wings, ddokboki.> We love Korean grille. I lived in Korea 5 years and this place has never dissapointed in giving you that warm soup feel. Portions are decent and we always leave full. Although, decor is horrendous, and slow service is the norm when its crowded ... This place always deliver on food. The chef is from busan and she knows how to cook. She has a specific style that has hearty ingredients and a very soulful feel to her cooking. Other places' jiggae can have a water downed taste. Korean grille always hits the spot. Honest to god, even places in allston dont compare. I only take a star off because the decor in there is wtf...> I ran out of this place. I left $10 for my beer. I was the only customer but the service was appalling. The two serving ladies were carrying in supplies from a truck outside and both then handled my food without washing their hands. It was literally the worst restaurant experience I ever had.> The owner is unethical charges price different than what is on menu. Food is not great and service is average (depends on your order value). A total skip.> What can I say? This was one of those meals that you just don't forget because of the food, as well as the company.  The ladies in this restaurant were very friendly, and quick to get our menus and orders.  Our group of 4 was in and out within an hour or so with full bellies of delicious, authentic Korean fare. I am sad that we were all in such a hurry to eat and get back to our class that I didn't get much time to stop and savor the tastes. I will be back! :)

Walking in here the ambience was really comforting. It's very cozy and gives off the vibe of my tita's dinning room complete with the background sounds of the "TFC" channel while you're eating. For those of you like myself who've had a lack of home cooking and that atmosphere it's a welcoming comfort. Coming here with my bf was his first introduction to some dishes and he fell in love with their sinigang. I really regret not ordering some to go for home after. After eating more than half of my halo halo, we had to go next door to the grocers and get ube ice cream for home because he needed that flavor in his life.> I'm sorry this is an absolute joke. You don't often see Filipino food in MA and I was wicked excited to try what they have. You can't go wrong with pork belly from any cuisine it's what I ordered and paid $9 for this!!! You can get Chinese BBQ 3 meat roast for that price. It didn't even include rice. Such a high disappointment because I saw what other people were eating in the restaurant looked really bomb. I should of just asked for the sauce (which was pretty damn good) and take it with me to have Chinese BBQ. Can't agree with this robbery.> When you travel 2 hours on the T to get here from the city DAS WHEN YOU KNOW!!As a Filipino living in Boston, the cravings for filipino food hits hard because there are literally no other filipino restaurants in the area (* sad face*). Luckily, there is one place in MA that sells filipino food and I just had to get my butt down here to give it a try... and I'm so glad I did because it truly reminds me so much of home. Menu changes every day (depending on what is being served) and I was lucky that a lot of my favorites were being served the day I went here (adobo, bistek, sinigang just to name a few!). My friend and I ordered bistek and sinigang with pork BBQ and lumpia. So as all Filipinos knows, your parents' home-cooking will always be best but I was surprised at how good and authentic the food at JNJ was. & of course, you can't end your meal without having some good ole halo halo, which was the perfect ending to a truly satisfying and heart warming meal.  I loved my visit here and will 100% make the 2 hour trek again when I want a little taste of home. OH and don't forget, they have a filipino supermarket right next door so make sure to stop by so you can stock up on all your favorite filipino products! They have everything you can think of...filipino snacks, baked goods, spices, and food. I felt like I was transported right back to the Philippines. Salamat JNJ-- i'll see you soon!!!> I can't even put this place in words! The food may not be always "insta worthy" but it makes my stomach happy and that's all that matters. The Pork Adobo is sizzling hot and is my favorite dish here. I can't pronounce most of the names but this is the type of place to come and be open minded and adventurous! Everything I had was delicious so I would recommend trying anything and everything you can! The BBQ pork skewers were amazing and who would've thought Vinegar is the perfect sauce! I would come here again and again and the staff is small but do not lack in professionalism and catering skills. I felt like I was in the house of a loved one, very laid back and all smiles. Thank you for everything!> Feels like home. Literally. Food's great. Prepare to make friends. This was home away from home in Massachusetts.

First time here !!! Small but amazing !!!! Pizza was bomb!! And omg DRAG QUEEN BINGO WAS BEST THING I EVER ATTENDED !!!!!!!!! Must attend you will not be disappointed and the entertainment is a comedy show singing laughs I can go on and on but I'll let u go and decide for yourself Next bingo October 16 must gooooo> I have been to Maggies about a half dozen times.  Each time has had a theme.  One time random musicians walked in and jammed.  First Wednesday of the month you can play Bingo, or Blingo, for Swarofsky crystal jewelry and I recently attended Drag-queen bingo for adult toys.  I've seen they have a comedy night.  Their pizzas are decent.  Ample beer choice, but their wine is awful, wish they' get better wine choices.> The bar pizza deals are great and they have a great drink selection. We love coming here and enjoying some good tunes to go with the food and drinks.> Came here for a comedy night show. Pizza was good but very thin! Almost like NY style pizza.> Damn good dough for not a lot of dough.1/2 priced pizzas from 4-7 every day, huge beer menu, plenty of drinks, fun atmosphere...my kinda place for sure. I was surprised by how good this pizza was! Blown away, actually. The dough is perfectly chewy, sprinkled with just the right amount of cheese and sauce. A bit greasy, but delicious nonetheless. The soft pretzel was not tasty but my husband didn't complain about it. To me, it tasted like it was from a freezer. Tables are wobbly too. But other than those 2 negatives, everything else was great. During their generous happy hour, it was about $30 for two pizzas with toppings, 2 beers, and 2 sodas. You cannot get that anywhere else. I left with a full belly and wallet.

menu_dishes: Fried Calamari, Steak & Cheese Rolls, Coconut Shrimp, Chantey Shrimp Cocktail, Mozzarella Sticks, Chicken Fingers, Chicken Wings, Soft Pretzel Sticks, Basket Of Fries Or Waffle Fries, Crab Cakes, Basket Of Onion Rings, House Salad, Caesar Salad, Greek Salad, New England Clam Chowder, Soup Of The Day, Baked Haddock, Steak Tips, Chicken Broccoli Ziti, Grilled Turkey Tips, Catch Of The Day, Fried Clam Plate, Fish & Chips, Steamers, Fisherman's Platter, Steamed Lobster, Scallops, Rice Pilaf, Chef's Vegetables, French Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Cole Slaw, Waffle Fries, Onion Rings, Cheese, Pepperoni, Pepper & Onion, Bbq Chicken, Fried Buffalo Chicken, Chantey Lobster Roll, Chantey Burger, Meatloaf Sandwich, Pastrami Sandwich, Chantey Grilled Chicken Sandwich, Buffalo Fried Chicken Sandwich, Chicken Parmesan Sandwich, Fried Haddock Sandwich, Grilled Cheese Sandwich, Chicken Caesar Wrap, Chantey Blt, Kobe Beef Hot Dog, Tuna Melt
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Great local place that's been around for many years. Everybody I know loves. Simple and warm atmosphere. I have been here many times and never had a bad experience with the food. It's always fresh and Good.> Small place with decent pub style food. Can get crowded. No hostess. A free for all to get a seat . Pretzel app was very good. Big soft and very hot pretzel sticks with a honey mustard dipping sauce. Would have liked a cheese sauce better. I got the hot pastrami with fries. pastrami was ok. Just a lil chewy. Fries were very good.Similar to Wendy's or McDonalds .Skinny and not overdone in dirty oil. Best part of my meal. Tuna melt I'm told is very good. Waitress was very attentive and pleasant. In Marina Bay but has no views of the water. The Parking is horrendous in Summer months. There is a lot but it's like a block or two away.> Hello Im sending you this email because I can find the email to the owner of the water works pub and Shanti pub located in marina Bay Area I just left there a few hours ago and I'm still pissed off what I just went through. My name is James Clark and I'm currently employed with the Boston Police Department Earlier this Thursday I was attacked basically by three individuals who are employed (bouncers)by the pubs.I'm a black male 23 years employed Police Officers.  I went on a work cruise in the marina with 40 Police Officers that we have once a year.After the cruise we exited the boat and proceeded to continue my great night with my colleagues going into Water Works. I had a drink in my hand when I arrived to the pub and was approached by an unknown white male and was told I cannot enter the pUb with a drink so I immediately put the drink down and attempted to go into the pub with my friends. The bouncers then surrounded me and became very verbally abusive towards me. I then told them I didn't want to come into the pub due to there actions towards me So I along with my colleagues 30-40 officers who were astonished and upset went to the Shanti Pub and continued to enjoy our night. While I was inside the second pub the same bouncers must have followed me and  came to the shanti pub and approached me and told that I had to leave this pub as well. Before they came in I ordered a glass of ice water and grabbed a keno slip to play the game while sitting at the bar. The bouncers approached me at the second pub and told me to get out of the pub. The 2 bartenders at the second pub that gave me the water and the keno slip couldn't believe what they were doing as well. My colleagues who are also Boston Police Officers were very upset  at the bouncers actions towards me.  I was not drunk and was very respectable during both interactions with the bouncersI'm only emailing you because I can locate the owners email and would love for u to pass there email to me so I can express how horrified I felt by there employeesI never been kicked out any establishment before in my 48 years on this planet. I used to be The mayors driver and bodyguard and I'm currently assigned in the Boston Police Fugitive Unit. Please respond with anyone's Of the father and sons business email so I can express my dismay and feelings towards them about their business If they treated me this way I can't imagine how they treat other humans beings that they deem  not suitable to enter there business. I did ask for a manager to come and speak with me and they ignore me. This is 2019 and there is no way anyone should be embarrassed and demeaned by anyone in USAMy 23 years in law enforcement I never ever would treat a person like they treated me and my friends. None of the employees could or would tell me or anyone else why they didn't want me inside either place Quincy Police did respond to the scene and advised me to reach out to the owners with my complaints. Officer James ClarkSent from my iPhone> A solid go to in the marina. Definitely nothinn fancy and some items can be hit or miss. For me, the chicken Caesar wrap is always a solid choice. The fish sandwich is good. The pretzel sticks appetizer is also a yummy sharing appetizer.> Nice looking place. Affordable-simple-delish. We like going during the week for dinner when it's a little slower. The dishes we order are always 8+ out of 10.Pretzel bread/Pizza/salads/loaded Tots! And a great chocolate cake dessert. Staff is very attentive - friendly and not obtrusive.It's not one of those trendy places just a good local place. After 20 years I've never had anything less than a good experience.

I ordered an iced almond milk latte and it was 10/10 a little pricey but it's along the beach and you can watch the sunset from their patio. the inside is nice and a good place to chat with the homies. stop by for ice cream at night and good coffee all day.> I really wanted to like the food! They have such a cute cafe and it's obviously family-owned. Maybe I would have enjoyed it more if I ate at the restaurant. When I said I ordered on Seamless, the woman at the counter informed me that I should have ordered on their app in a slightly disapproving tone (apparently the prices are cheaper). I was excited to order because it was brunch, and I was looking forward to a yummy-looking sourdough panini and some french toast. I took it to my sister's (I live out of town) with a coffee and a latte. The sourdough panini was pretty good, but I ordered it for my sister (vegetarian) and they put bacon on the sandwich (which was not in the list of ingredients). I think they also forgot the steamed milk in the latte. The coffee was quite burnt. The French toast was dry and bland. A little disappointing.> What an awesome place!! We stopped by for ice cream. Well, who wouldn't like ice cream after a 3 miles walk at the beach? We had a dog so I was waiting outside while my man came in to get ME some ice cream!!! Then one of the staffs waved me through the window and told me feel free to come in with our little dog!!! Score for her friendliness and welcoming!!! When we got our ice cream, the staffs told us they have special ice cream for dogs topped with a cookie!! OMG!! Our dog was so happy and she finished the WHOLE THING!!! Another score for their dog friendliness!!!I also learned that they have breakfast, lunch, dinner and pizza!!! They have a nice patio setting to sit outside!! Imagine yourself sitting in the patio looking out to the beach with yummy food and ice cream!!!> My first experience at CM was a nice one.  The frozen custard was delicious.  Not many places around here offer frozen custard so that was a nice treat.  Their menu is diverse from pizza to paninis there is something for everyone at CM.  They offer smoothies, Peet's Coffee and other delish treats.   Ample seating outside and inside.  Great views.  Try their breakfast sandwiches!> Location with a view!! I absolutely loved their classic breakfast panini. Most noticeable flavor were the grilled sweet cherry tomato fused with the delicious cheese! Every part of the sandwich was just perfect. No leaky yolky mess, chewy cheese, crispy yet moist sourdough bread, and the bacon amount was perfect! Their coffee selection is something you can find at any coffee shop but one thing that stood out more in this place was their customer service. Although it was a tad bit busy, she apologized, acknowledged me, and recommended eating in with a view despite being busy (in the process of moving out). I sat down and she brought me my coffee instead of calling out my name or number. She brought out my food and seven minutes later asked how it was and she adored that I thought this was the most amazing thing ever. I can't express how much that means in today's world to provide great customer service!

cusine_types: Tacos, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Seafood
reviews: The most delicious taco!!! My husband and I were both super impressed! We also got chips, salsa and guac and they were delicious!!! The view of the beach is beautiful and it wasn't expensive to dine here, plus if you're still hungry, they have lots of ice cream flavors!!!> Dude!  believe the hype, man!One of my good work friend that's been trying to get me to try this place too long, after a couple of trips to Wolly Beach I finally made it in here,  and I can see why he spoke so highly of this place.   are these the best tacos I've ever had? No,  and alas, my search for the perfect taco continues,  still this distract you from the fact hands are seriously freakin' good!When I was indecisive Beef Barbacoa and Pork Carnitas,  my server recommended the Carnitas,  so Carnitas it is!.  Let me tell you:  they do not skimp on the meat!  there's a generous amount there,  but not so much that the taco falls apart at first bite.  The meat was cooked well and just the right amount of juicy.  However, my critique is that while the toppings and sauces did a nice job complimenting the taco I would have liked a little more seasoning in the meat, although to be fair there is S & P available if you choose to add it.The toppings complimented the tacos superbly, they added just enough flavor to give the tacos some pop, but not so much as to overwhelm.   they added some freshness, some creaminess,  and the onions added a little bit of crunch. My only criticism here is that I would have liked just a tiny bit more onions.  I like more crunch and bursts of freshness offered by onions, but I realize that this is somewhat of a personal taste.Still, I was not expecting this level of quality especially from a small shop like this.  There is limited window seating available inside, and there is some outdoor seating.> Really enjoyed my first visit here. Good size tacos. Prices is a dollar or two high but still worth it. Flavors are super yummy. My favorite was the chicken tinga taco. Also the Baja shrimp was very fresh and tasty. The beef barbacoa is a classic. Great ice cream selection here too. Overall a great spot right on the beach with a solid, no frills and delicious menu> I have been here three times, twice recently. Thankfully they fixed the chips. They are made there and great! But, the last time I was there they were not crispy. Just a bad batch. But, quality control is the main issue here and the reason for 3 instead of 4 stars. Last night I was there and it was slow for a summer evening because it was cloudy out. So, the three teens working didn't move from their seats at the window for the 45 mins I was there, even though the trash barrel was overflowing and the counter seating area needed to be wiped down. Hey, I was a teen working a summer job once. I get it. It only gets fixed if the owner sees this post. Otherwise, this is hands down the best taqueria outside the city. Flavors, price and presentation is top notch.> I got the Baja fish tacos and was pleasantly surprised that the fish itself was a pretty decent size. Sauces were good and the fish was crispy but for $8, you only get two tacos. This place was worth the try, decent tacos, but a little too pricey for me.

It was Sunday, pouring out, we wanted breakfast but too lazy to cook.  We secretly hoped the inclement weather would deter others from going out.  Maybe that was the case for some establishments but definitely not the case with the Wheelhouse.  It was packed and for good reason.  This place serves stick to your ribs kinda comfort food at great prices.  Although this place is tiny and looks like a whole in the wall that's frozen in time, this is a favorite spot locals go to for breakfast.  They have a really small parking lot but there is street parking.  If all else fails, there's always parking at the shopping plaza right down the street.  Enter through the right hand side door of the diner and exit through the left.  There's a method to the madness since people who are waiting for available seating are waiting on the right hand side of the diner.  The staff here work hard!  It's practically non stop busy! I am obsessed with their corned beef hash so I got the #5, which also comes with toast, eggs and home fries.  My friend got the the Lumberjack with a side of pancakes and another got the same with a side of French toast.  The coffee is decent.  I would have taken pictures except we were all too hungry by the time we were seated. The portions are big so I didn't have to eat dinner until almost 9PM.  The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because the home fries are always a little blah.  It's greatly improved because at least now they are no longer on the raw side but it's still not as crispy as I would like them.   Oh one last thing to know, breakfast is free on your birthday as long as you show your ID.  Yum.> I got delivery from here this morning and it was just not good at all. Part of my order was wrong. I paid extra for Irish soda bread, one of the main reasons I actually ordered from here because I love that bread and they sent me Raisin Toast. I ordered Texas style French toast, the only Texas size about it is the amount of cinnamon they use. It was so dried out and that was after loading it up with butter and syrup it was still super dry. The sausages tasted like they were cooked yesterday and reheated this morning. The hollandaise sauce was like water as well. I normally don't write reviews but this was just so so disappointing to get after waiting extra long as well to receive it. The Irish White pudding was good though as well as my Raisin toast. Sorry Wheelhouse but this was definitely a first and last visit from this customer!> This must be the most original diner I've ever been too. The whole place is the size of a shoe box making it very cozy. Where other places can you sit at the bar top, chatting with the cook while he's making your omelette? To top it off, the chocolate milk was NOT from Hersey's chocolate syrup! I'm soo ready to go back.> Like any usual lazy Sundays where my boyfriend and I don't have work early, we woke up around 1pm and was really craving some breakfast food. Everywhere around Quincy was going to close at 2pm, so we looked up this place, we've always seen it (almost every single day as we drive up and down Hancock). But I've just never gone in because I never trusted these types of diners. But this place closes at 3pm so we decided to give it a try. We were able to park in the little parking area they have in front.Walking into the diner, we found the first booth to be empty so we just sat down; should have probably picked a table closer inside since half way through our meal it became pretty cold since they have the door semi open - probably to let the smell and air out to ventilate. Our server was this lady who was VERY sweet, I believe her name was Paula. She went behind the booth to makeus bacon herself when we told her that our side of bacon hasn't come out. Every time she spoke to us she sounded so sweet, from apologizing that our food is taking long to grabbing us more napkins, we left her a big tip because she was just such a sweet and hardworking lady.As for the food, we're benny people. I ordered the Irish Benedict while my boyfriend ordered the Presidents Benedict. The Irish Benedict had corned beef hash and the Presidents Benedict had shredded beef, it was super flavorful. I loved both of them. The homefries that they came with were flavorful with burnt pieces that added such great flavors. I was extremely surprise that our food was so great. I would definitely come back here another time since we live so close. The only thing is, you're definitely going to smell like food afterwards since the food is made out in the open.> Came here for the first time yesterday. Good diner breakfest big portion! I will be back if in the area. Got the steak omelette next time I'll try the pancakes.

I had a very pleasant experience for my first time here. Usually at other Chinese bakery, things can be chaotic which is most likely why the staff may not be as friendly. The staffs here were very nice and helpful. The buns were good. The egg and pork congee was standard. Wish there were more eggs in it)The price was awesome. I had 6 different buns and 2 congees for about $9. Overall highly recommend this bakery.> Tiny little hole in the wall.Not what I was expecting to find, almost like a back street at the end of a neighborhood.They were pretty much out of the items I was interested in getting.They only make a certain amount of each item for the day and what sells out they may not be able to put more out.I got there about 3:30 and the was no more pineapple buns, or the baked roast pork buns, nor the curry beef buns.I had to settle for some egg custard tarts, fried sesame balls, shredded coconut buns and was able to convince The owner to make 3 orders of the beef rice rolls.They were totally sold out of the shrimp rice rolls.The pastries was spot on. Great textures.The beef rice rolls was pretty good heated up later in the evening. Not bad for the price of $3.50 and there was 8 rolls to an order.That's the deal of the day!I must get back to see if I can get some of the roast pork buns in the future.> Service was friendly and helpful. The pineapple bun with red bean pastry was generously sized, filling wasn't too sweet. I also had the salty egg and lotus paste pastry - really good balance of salty and sweet; not too oily. Will be back to try the rest of the menu.> I'm a fan of the pineapple buns here. It reminds me of the old days in Hong Kong and even now the tastes and texture in Hong Kong and other bakeries here is long gone. The bread there at Mei Mei is chewy and dense - super heavy! Who wants bread with air pockets inside that can't fill you up?? I also tried their cheung fun today - they provide enormous portions - 8 pieces vs. 6 pieces elsewhere! I do have to mention that not everything there tastes great, so I'm trying out everything at the beginning so I know what to order next time.> I really want to like Mei Mei, as competition in Quincy is good for everyone here. Plus this keeps Crown Bakery across the street on its toes. However, I've realized that this is a quantity spot rather than a quality one.The pineapple bun is enormous and is decent in terms of taste. The sweet crust above is passable. Their egg custard tart is fine, with a smooth filling and okay pastry crust.However, the modest positives here are outweighed by the glaring negatives. The wife's pastry melon cake, while also large, is underwhelming as the crust is not flaky and the filling inside is bland. The worst was the walnut cookie, as the cookie tasted like ammonia. I had to toss it out after a bite.I'll stick to Crown Royal in the meantime, but hopefully this spot can get itself righted.

We love this place! I say to everyone I tell about this place that if I could cook this good I could be vegan. Awesome to have them so close in Four Corners> I came here once on a whim because i just heard about it. I got some red lentils with cabbage and i fell in love. The food was delicious the people were so kind and the prices were reasonable.If you are looking to sit down a bit small for that but definitely a good tasty place to grab some good vegan eats around dorchester. Check it out!!!!> What a gem. Kind of a trek to get here, but so worth it. Not only was the food delicious (I had a plate with grains, Ethiopian lentil stew, korma, veggies, and sweet potatoes), the service was so kind and helpful. I think it was the owner who talked us through all the options, explaining the recipes and ingredients, and advising us on what to get. Love the care they show their customers here.The portions are also ENORMOUS! A small plate would probably have been enough, but I wanted to try everything--the large plate lets you pick four sides, but ends up being enough food for two or three meals. Good prices, too. I'm excited to come back!> Great food horrible customer service Waited 45 minutes for my food only to get half the order> Don't miss this hidden gem. Vegan options galore. I wanted to order several things, but landed on the falafel wrap and the medium plate (grain, stews and veggies). Both were delicious! Wish I lived closer because I would eat here for every meal. Fresh ingredients. No animals harmed. Kind staff. Compost able to-go packaging. Street parking. Can't wait to come back again!

menu_dishes: Wings, Buffalo Fingers, Chicken Quesadilla, Calamari, Buffalo Chicken Rangoon, Shrimp Cocktail, Buffalo Chicken Nachos, Nachos El Grande, Burger Sliders, Fours Triple Play, Potato Skins, Steak & Cheese Egg Rolls, Spinach and Artichoke Dip, Today's Homemade Soup, Homemade Clam Chowder, Southpaw Texas Chili, House Salad, Caesar Salad, Super Taco Salad, California Cobb Salad, Bleu Cheese Wedge, Fours Chopped Salad, Grilled Salmon Salad, Arugula Beef Salad, Baby Spinach Salad, BBq Burger, The Frenchie, Gorgonzola Burger, The Works, Create Your Own, Johnny Kelley, The Yaz, Bobby Orr, Larry Bird, Jack Nicklaus, Bobby Riggs, Doug Flutie, Ted Williams, Ray Bourque, Robert Parish, Joan Benoit, Boston Scrod, Salmon, Haddock Nantucket, Fours Seafood Saute, Fish & Chips, Steak Tips, The Fours Steak, Teriyaki Steak Tips, Turkey Tips, Ribs & Tips, Surf & Turf, Free Range Organic Chicken, Fish Tacos, Mac & Cheese, Meatloaf Dinner, Chicken Enchiladas, Pasta Primavera, Mussels Fra Diavolo, Chicken, Ziti & Broccoli, Chicken Parmigiana, Chicken Piccata, Margherita Pizza, Pepperoni, Steak Bomb, Mushroom & Onion, Buffalo Chicken, Cheese, Steak Bomb

reviews: Stopped to pick up my FAV sandwich to go with a house salad.  I got take out only because I am recovering from some surgery recently.... otherwise, I am all in for sitting and enjoying a martini before my meal. I ordered my favorite sandwich, the Bobby Orr with fries (love the side of beans too!) and had a house salad with their in house dressing of lemon walnut vinaigrette. Can't wait to visit again real soon!  Everything is fresh and so delicious...I wanted to also comment on new parking garage set up - I am handicapped and am thrilled the parking is easy again - huge improvement for this part of the city.  Thank you!> tl;dr: Meh. Sometimes you end up at The Fours.I'm not sure why people come to The Fours a second time. Okay, I have some ideas -- like maybe they've been to the other places in the neighborhood (two of which I've rated very low). Maybe Fours is the only option? Maybe it's convenient by public transportation (a 7-minute walk to the Quincy Center stop on the Red Line). Or it's easy parking (there's a lot somewhere nearby).The decor is cool. Photos of old sports legends, a full-size crew shell from the University of Pennsylvania, stuff like that. It's large enough, with a big two-sided oval bar that runs the length of the restaurant, separated from the largest part of the dining area by a half-wall. I've never been downstairs, but it appears they also have a function room on a lower level. The TVs, while smallish and very high up, seem to offer a view of whatever game is on, at least from the seats in the middle of the large dining room. (I can't speak to the view from the bar or booths.) If I was going out to watch a game, though, I'd find a bar with larger televisions. As it was, I was there for something else so being able to surreptitiously watch the game while apparently engaged in conversation was a benny. Go, Bruins!The food is just okay. Just "American" grub, although everything seems to have a twist. An awkward twist. I've heard that people like the sandwiches but everything I've had seems to be weird: oversized and overpriced and a little bit off. My wedge salad had (old mushy) diced tomatoes on it. The only reason you'd use diced tomatoes on a salad is if you use the same tomatoes for everything else. Anything that calls for tomatoes gets the diced tomatoes. Diced onions, too? It's like no one at Fours has ever had a wedge salad. It was also twice the size of any restaurant wedge salad I've ever seen. There was no "wedge;" it was half a head of lettuce. It's fine, I suppose, but in order to offer such gargantuan portions, they up the price. I've never paid $14 for a wedge salad before, even at high-end restaurants. (For example, the last restaurant wedge I had was at Del Frisco's steak house: $12.) Fours also inexplicably plates it with balsamic drizzle. Huh? I love balsamic but it doesn't go on a wedge. The servers are always good and hardworking -- no complaints at all with the servers in the dining room or the bartenders. They've always been attentive to re-fills and bussing the table and friendly. If I could, I'd bump it a star for them, but ...The older blond lady at the hostess stand is another story. The idea of hostessing is to welcome people and seat them. To pretend like you're overwhelmingly busy (when there are three of you and I can see that the dining room is 2/3rds empty), or that there are corporate rules about who can sit where that would prevent you from seating me while I'm waiting for the rest of my party when I've sat with the same party in the same place many weeks in a row, well, it's ridiculous. Just welcome me and offer me a seat. If you accomplish that, I'll be happy. Instead....> I like sports bars, so walking into The Fours, I had high hopes! First of all, the decor and memorabilia around is cool, and there ample TVs for whatever game you could imagine being on. I came for dinner with a friend on a Sunday and the service was very poor. Despite there being very few patrons in the restaurant, we had to proactively flag down a server (any server!) every time we needed a drink or even wanted to order. We enjoyed the Buffalo Rangoons but were sorely disappointed int eh burgers, which arrived with soggy buns and little flavor. I do not plan to return to the fours for a meal, but would not be opposed to getting a beer at the bar.> I was a little disappointed in this place. I ordered my meal to go, but the inside of the restaurant was pretty great. It was basically a tribute to the history of sports in Boston. It would have been great to eat inside to spend more time looking at all the cool sporty items they had on the walls. Staff was also nice and gave us some history on the restaurant as well as the area. The food is where much of my dismay fell. The burger I had was a little too rare on the inside and just lacked flavor in my opinion. The bottom of the burger was really soggy making the meal less enjoyable. I also ordered the fried calamari and it seemed like we received more fried peppers than we did actual fried calamari. This would be a good place to grab a quick bite with friends, but I think there is probably better bar food one can get from another place nearby.> Not kid friendly at all.  Someone told me it was ok to bring kids here. Got dirty looks from the host, the waitress and a good deal of the patrons. My kid made a tiny cry  and I took her out. On the way out the grumpy host made and noise at me and rolled his eyes. I was glad to leave the place was dark and dirty and the food looked gross

If I'm ever craving for wonton noodle soup, this is always my go to spot! I've been coming here for YEARS and not once was I disappointed. My favorite items on the menu are the curry fish balls, fried wontons and the beef stew wonton noodle soup. It's always busy during lunch time on the weekends as there's very limited seating. It's also cash only! My philosophy is that if a restaurant looks like this with no frills, the food is always amazing.> A small business in in Quincy that serve cheap, Chinese food. I came here on a Saturday night and it was empty, so I was a bit skeptical, but we decided to try it out anyways. There's about a handful amount of tables and menus posted on the wall. No public restroom and it's a cash only location. I ordered the fish ball noodle soup and my friend ordered wonton dumpling noodle soup. The service is fairly quick as it doesn't take too long to prepare noodle soups, but we were glad to see the restaurant fill up as we ate our meal. The variety in fish balls were good, but a few of them were really hard and just didn't taste right. The wontons were packed full of shrimp pieces, which was definitely different than the standard typical meat I was expecting. The soup broth was oily, but you do get a few veggies. We saw a few people getting takeout while we were dining, so maybe their other options are more suitable than their noodle soups.> I have never ever had the experience of going into a restaurant, eating the food and immediately being flooded by memories of my childhood. This hole in the wall/ mom& pop has a special way of making the food so authentically, it brings back so many childhood memories of home-cooked meals or trips back to Asia. 5/5 for authenticity and being able to reminisce with your friends as you eat all the best comfort food together.> Authentic Hong Kong style "soup-noodles" and HK fast food style rice plates.  Food is fresh and tasty, love their fried wanton - shrimp inside the fried wanton has a fresh sweet taste (仲有埋蝦子）.  Their noodles are Springy.  HK style Peking noodle is also a must try, has that original authentic taste (有麥文記風味。）HK Milk tea brewed smooth and strong.  Basically, if you like HK style Wanton noodles soup, and like the rice plates from Café de Coral, you will love the taste of Saigon Corner.  Love getting their takeout.  Everything taste delicious and authentic!> This whole in the wall restaurant has delicious Hong Kong style food for an affordable price. My favorite is the white sauce with steak and eggs over rice. Last time I went, they didn't have my usual so I decided to try the baked tomato sauce with steak and eggs over rice. The baked tomato sauce was good, but I like the white sauce a lot better because of the mildly flavored creamy consistency compared to the tomato sauce which has a stronger ketchup-y flavor. Additionally, I love getting the curry fishballs as an appetizer to start. Lastly, their homemade fried dumplings are delicious and a must try! Overall, it's a great place to stop by for a quick homemade quality meal.

Very good Hong Kong cha chaan teng with all the standard breakfast and lunch items! Egg sandwich with ham was fantastic, wonton noodle soup was good, too. Milk tea was perfect. Service is quick and the staff is nice. Cute and clean restaurant, but very small. Come here if you're craving Hong Kong food!> Being the only HK style cafe around the area, you would  think it'd be easier for them to set themselves apart from the surplus of the small Chinese eateries on Hancock street. Not only did they not do HK cha chaan tang specialities right, but the flavors were over-simplified to the point that you could tell exactly what they used and could probably make better at home. Hong Kong style milk tea - I don't know where the Hong Kong part was in this black tea + evaporated milk beverage 2/5Preserved egg in chili sauce - preserved egg, dash of chili oil, overload with sesame oil, garnish with cilantro; flavors did not go well with one another 1/5Concubine chicken - over-cooked, slightly too chewy 2.5/5Wonton and brisket noodle soup - wontons were homemade and pretty good, soup was plain broth with little to no brisket flavor 3/5 Ma po tofu - pretty sure they use a store bought sauce packet because I've made ma po tofu at home that had the same flavors, nothing memorable 2/5I don't see why anyone would choose to come here over Yummy cafe across the street or any other Chinese eateries in Quincy.> My bf and I spontaneously came here hoping to just get some wonton noodle soup to warm us up from the brutal cold. However, we were surprised to see that there was more to the menu. It's an assuming, inexpensive, no frills, small hole in the wall however cozy and clean. They serve mainly Hong Kong style comfort food with some popular Sichuan/Hunanese dishes. The servers were very friendly, smiley, prompt, attentive, and quick to fill our hot teas. We had the Yang Chow Fried Rice and the shrimp in it was bouncy as well as de-veined which is always a plus. Thumbs up on the Preserved Egg in Chili Oil. There was a perfect balance of spiciness so that it didn't overshadow how refreshing it was. I loved that it came with cucumber salad too. Lastly, we ordered the Mala Soup in which you can customize so we got spinach, beef, potato, tofu sheet, & ramen noodle. The soup was good but I can tell it was a modified version because it wasn't robustly flavored like the typical authentic Mala Soup. To be expected since this place isn't mainly Sichuan. The potato was a bit undercooked too and the ramen noodle was definitely instant noodle-style ramen vs the fresh kind. Besides that though I would get it again for a quick cheap fix because the total for everything was a little over $30! Pretty good for the price if ya ask me. :D> For 9.50 you would think u get some good food portions. It was dead when I arrive. I got beef and scramble eggs and the beef tasted like it has no hint of flavor. Too much rice and daily soup is just pork broth. Might use it to make some noodles. But I don't see this place lasting long. Owner should sell business. Never be in the food industry. Folks in there have no motivation. Rarely hints of egg too idk this place is not recommended. Hong kong tea is bland. Rather lose $14 to this place than eat here twice. I wanted to sit and eat there but they made it to go. Bad spot for cafe no wonder it's dead.> Very unimpressed with this place. They have potential but need lots of work. If you come here, don't expect to get your entree the same time as your friends. They come out whenever they come out. I got my appetizer after I was almost done with my lunch. The drinks came around 10-15 minutes after ordering. The lady is running the front by herself and needs to hire one more person to help out. For a cafe, food and service was way too slow.Food was just bland and not good for the price. The noodles inside the beef brisket noodle soup was all broken. The soup was bland. The concubine chicken rice plate was small for $9.00. She claimed it was their best chicken, tasted like steam chicken with ginger and scallion sauce. Nothing special. There are many other options in Quincy for better cafe style food.

This part of South Bay is surprisingly nice.  Made reservation for a table of 6 for 6:45pm.  Parked in the free parking lot across the street from the restaurant.  Showed up 10 min early and was seated right away.  - Ordered the ultimate all you can eat - Waitress was great (constantly asking if we wanted to order more food, changed the grill plate, refilled drinks, adjusted temperature of grill, etc.)- Apps and meat came quickly and was good (although some items were a little bit on the salty side, such as the zucchini) - Did not feel rushed at the 90 min mark> Had to wait for 40 min even when they had tables because I went there alone, not a big party. The concept is nice, I ordered the all you can eat premium and you some of the items in the menu. It's not a good idea to go only yourself, obviously you have to take care of the things on the grill and you don't plenty of time to eat while cooking all what they serve you.It takes time to received the first order but you have 90 min to eat all what you want. A little bit pricey but still good> I've been here a couple times and Gyu-Kaku food never disappoints! I definitely recommend the South Bay one than the Brookline location as there is a huge parking in South Bay. It's usually better to come with a group so you can try a bunch of different apps and meats. Definite must get apps are the addicting cucumbers and (just found out yesterday) the suki-yaki bibimbap. For the meats, give the Umakara ribeye a try. It is super tender and marinated perfectly. I haven't really had a disappointing dish from here, so just give everything a try!The only issue I have is the service. The waiters and waitresses are wicked nice, but there were a couple times we had to ask where a certain dish was as it never came out. When we came it wasn't even that busy, but stuff happens.P.S. They don't skimp on the alcohol in their drinks.> Love this place for some bbq. Especially for the all you can eats. My favorite is toro beef & kalbi chuck rib. If you're huge on meat - like i am - go for the all you can eat. If not they have happy hour deal for regular dishes. If you're planning to go for dinner reservation is a must. You may have to wait for quite some time if you don't have a reservation. Also since the place is quite busy expect your orders to take longer to come out.Also get their app so you can get points - they pile pretty quick and gives you discounts or free items from the menu. You can also make reservation through the app - this place is mostly very hard to reach through phone. I cannot remember the staff's name I believe was nikki? - is a really great server. She is so enthusiastic, bright, and so kind. I'll have to post an update with her name.> My friend brought me here when I came to visit her in Boston back in January. It was my first time and I thought it was so cool. We got a bunch of different things to try and then ended with smores. I want to go to a location close to me soon.

Stopped in for a quick lunch while in the area.  I got a Chicken BLT Rancher wrap.  The chicken is served hot in the wrap and it was amazing!  Best wrap I've had.Definitely recommended if you are in the area.> Went here for a quick lunch with a friend. The place is nicely located where you can find plenty of street parking. There are also a few tables outside so you have lunch out there. The staff are nice and accommodating. Ordered one sandwich to go and one to dine in and they switched which one I wanted to eat in but both were great so no complaints here. It's a sandwich cut in half and I'm thinking it wouldn't be too filling but I really wanted to take a nap after lunch. The really great and unique names of the sandwiches are awesome but I can't recall them so I will just leave it in the photo. I will definitely be coming back here as it is just minutes away from my job.> Great place. This place has been around for a long time. I've gotten paninis here multiple times before to go. The other day we decided to get some coffee and breakfast but actually ate there. It was very pleasant and the food was good. We stayed for a few hours just talking with no one bothering us.> Came here for lunch on a Thursday between some work meetings in Quincy. I had read good things online so I decided to give it a try. It's a cute cafe with a counter where you order and a chalkboard menu to order off of. You will find many options for Italian-inspired sandwiches plus homemade baked goods.For my first time at the Italian deli, I had to order the Italian sandwich, which comes with Italian meats, cheeses, pickles, tomatoes, and jalapeños on ciabatta bread. Look at the picture. LOOK AT THAT CROSS SECTION. If that doesn't make your mouth water than you need to get your salivary glands checked! The bread was fresh, the meat was delicious and all the veggies provided a great textural contrast to the whole thing. I can't wait to come back and try one of the other sandwiches.> This little hole in the wall is absolutely ridiculous. I just experienced the best meatball on the planet. Put it on ciabatta bread toast it with mozzarella and marinara and you have the world's greatest meatball sandwich ever

menu_dishes: Ahi Tuna Arrabbiata, Fried Calamari, Mussels Marinara, Garlic Shrimp in the Pan, Spicy Shrimp, "Exploding" Little Neck Clams, Baby Eggplant, Risotto Caprese, Wild Mushroom Risotto, Brasato, Lamb Lollipop, Mimmo's Baked Meatballs, Risotto, Peas, and Prosciutto, Gnocchi Al Forno, Palermitana, Penne Capricciose, Penne Gorgonzola, Puttanesca, Baked Mushroom Rigatoni, Calamari and Mussels, Spaghetti with Little Neck Clams, Frutti Di Mare, Tonno con Pesto Siciliano e Fusilli, Carbonara, Crazy Alfredo, Sunday Macaroni, Rollati di Pasta, Calamari Salad, House Salad, Simple Arugula Salad, Olive Oil Ahi Tuna, Risotto Milanese, Sauted Rapi Greens, Ziti with Tomato Sauce, Sauted Rapi Greens and Chicken, Sauted Spinach, Sundried Tomatoes, Calamata Olives, Pan Roasted Chicken Breast, Pollo Cardinale, Stuffed Center Cut Pork Rib Chop, Pan Roasted Filet Mignon

reviews: Make a reservation or else you won't get to eat here. In fact, make a reservations weeks in advance! Carmelina's is a small restaurant in the North end with amazing Italian food. I've been here several times and have always been pleased with the food. There is a TV screen in here too if you want to watch sports.I love the fried calamari, its the perfect appetizer to share with the table. Its not overly covered in bread crumbs which is nice. I have had the frutti del mar past which comes with a generous amount of seafood. I also really enjoyed the Tonno con Pesto Siciliano e Fusilli- fussili pasta with tuna steak on top. I know this is a rather unusual dish but it was so good, sort of like east meet west in your pasta dish.Its also conveniently located close to Mike's Pastry so you can go there for dessert!> I thought the food here was just okay...definitely didn't live up to the hype.Rollati di Pasta : I enjoyed the al dente pasta on the dish, however, everything was way underseasoned.  Being that I generally eat on the less salty side, that's actually saying a lot. Frutti De Mare : The flavor on this dish was good, and the seafood was fresh, however, I couldn't get over why all the mussells on my dish were cold.  They could have at least heated up the mussells before throwing it into the pasta.  Maybe we came on an off night because we left quite disappointed.  3 stars.> AMAZING FOOD!My go to place in the North End. Small and quaint with an open kitchen and super friendly staff!Scratch cooking with everything they offer. Your palate will be so happy for the fresh ingredients. Everyone has to eat here!> Late flight (less than 50% full) arrival from SFO, looking for dinner, got a great referral from hotel and Yelp. Walked over, 10 PM, kitchen still open!A few people at the bar, quick service, loquacious Italian server. Ordered branzino, and wife had amitriciana. So nice to get piping hot food. Servings, as usual in the north end, too big, branzino was well prepared, maybe a little too cooked, could have been firmer, pasta delicious. Nice bottle of elio Grasso 2018 Dolcetto. If we go back, we will be splitting the main, so we can try some antipasti.> Carmelina's is the number one restaurant in the North End for a reason.  Every time I go the food is perfect.  My family was in town this weekend and it knocked their socks off.  This is no easy feat since we are full Italian!  Everything is made from scratch, even their stocks they cook with.We started with the Risotto Caprese and it was fantastic.  This dish is basically caprese in risotto form. It was fresh and light and packed a ton of flavor!  For our main dishes we ordered the baked 4 mushroom rigatoni, carbonara, Sundaymacaroni, and the penne capricciose.  The hit of the dinner was the hit of the dinner!  The sauce it came in was creamy and sweet, probably one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had.The food comes out whenever its ready and steaming hot!  Our waiter was friendly and offered menu item suggestions based on our preferences!  For drinks we ordered peach bellinis which was refreshing (and heavy on the champagne)!  I will be coming back here because Carmelinas is a DREAM!  Make reservations a couple weeks ahead of time because it fills up quick!

La Paloma is the best Mexican in the greater Boston area, possibly the whole state. Delicious, affordable and unique. I love the sweet shredded beef and my wife wheats gets the pollo arroz, which she absolutely loves! Friendly staff and quick service make this place one of our favorites.> We were sat right away. There was a hostess. The specials are not really that special or much of a discount. The waitress was attentive & fast. I wish they had hot sauce on the table with the salt and pepper. The food was filling and delicious. They give free chips which is always a plus. The menu is pricey. The waitress also told us that there were no draft beers.> We went to La Paloma today for my friends daughters 16th Birthday for lunch.OMG it was absolutely amazing and so delicious. We had everything it was our first time for us all. My friend and her Daughter got an appetizer QuesadillasYou had to put what you wanted in the tortilla and it came with a side of fruit from Mexico.They also got a Burrito platter yummy.The French Fries were the best I ever tasted. I could have had my own order of them for there and one to go.My granddaughter had a Chimichanga it was amazing and I had the Paella it was so good I ate half and brought half home for later. I just wanted it to last.I can't wait to go to La Paloma again.The waitress was so good not hovering but near to ask for something or see how everything was. Amanda was awesome> Been coming here for years, prefer to bring it home. My kids love it also but they like it spicier. The best deal is the combination plates. Husband loves the steak fajitas I love the combination plates esp number 6. They have done specials for each night, check out Thursday's.> Family friends told me about LP years ago. Finally I made it there and enjoyed very much. It was an early dinner. The restaurant wasn't busy. Boy did that change in a short period of time. We ordered Chicken Quesadillas for appetizers and when the waitress delivered, she told us to hurry and put in our orders because the kitchen can get backed up. We did so. I ordered the Shrimp and Steak Fajitas. I can't remember what "T" ordered. A two breast cheese and rice dish that came with tortillas. That too was great. For dessert i ordered the Key Lime pie. PASS!! It's store bought and not pie at all. More like a pudding. I'll never order that or any dessert again because they all are probably store bought. The atmosphere was nice. Dimly lit with a touch of Mexico on all the walls. The Hostess and Staff was older in age which tells me that they have been there for many years because they love what they do also offered suggestions to their guests and that this restaurant is good to them. It showed in their pleasant smiles and demeanor. It actually felt like home in a way. Yes, i will be eating here again.Happy Eating :)

cusine_types: American (Traditional), Dance Clubs, Venues & Event Spaces
reviews: Place has a great view, good appetizers, and fun drinks (including a bucket of beers - Corona/Corona Light or Bud/Bud Light)! I've been here a couple of times and haven't been disappointed yet.Music has been pretty good. Also, I will say the crowd both times was late 20s to 40s/50s, closer to the older crowd around 6 to 9 p.m. ET on Saturdays. So, I'd say more of a relaxing spot. I haven't been here for the late night crowd, so I don't know how crazy it gets. However, it looks set up to turn into a club later in the night. Beautiful spot for a sunset, fellas, to take a girl for a date (wink wink). There are attire rules, but I'd call them more reasonable guidelines (think it said no sneakers, no baggy shorts, etc...aka, don't look like a sloppy mess).> Food was decent. Service was a little hard to find. When we first entered it was super loud but then we walked down to where there were tables to eat and not at the bar and it was much better. Paradise island drink literally was amazing. It had the same amount of alc as a Long Island, but did not taste like alc at all. Highly recommend trying.> At capacity with 20 people. No thank you, go somewhere else for a drink at marina bay> This is a fun place to go on a beautiful day. The staff is friendly and attentive. The drinks and food are good. If you're looking for a good hangout spot with friends, this is the place to go. I will definitely be back now that summer is right around the corner> Service was great this evening. I got the salmon over rice. It was delicious! The only thing is that it didn't come with a vegi! It came with quinoa.  I think next time I will ask for vegetables instead of quinoa. Besides that, it was a fun place with great food. I'm glad we chose WaterClub on the boardwalk.

menu_dishes: Jambalaya Egg Rolls, Bang Bang Shrimp, Bang Bang Cauliflower, Chicken Satay, Wings, Pulled Chicken Slider, Brisket Slider, Salmon Slider, Chicken and Waffles, Shrimp and Grits, St. Louis Ribs, Louisiana Gumbo, The Dot Ave Sandwich, Smoked Banh Mi Sandwich, The Po Boy, Buffalo Chickpea Burger, Vegetarian Burger, Quinoa Bowl, Chop Salad, Kimchi and Collard Greens, Cauliflower Mash, Honey Fried Cornbread, Sweet Potato Fries, Crispy Fries, Asian Slaw, Pepsi 20 oz, Diet Pepsi 20 oz, Grape Crush 20 oz, Orange Crush 20 oz, Hawaiian Punch 20 oz, Schweppes Ginger Ale 20 oz, Lemon-lime Seltzer Water, Black Cherry Seltzer Water, Raspberry Lime Seltzer Water, Mountain Dew 20 oz, Pure Leaf Ice Tea Sweetened, Pureleaf Ice Tea Raspberry, Pureleaf Ice Tea Peach, Pureleaf Ice Tea Lemon, Pureleaf Ice Tea Diet, Dole Kiwi Strawberry
