reviews: As frigid as a Saturday night could be to deter one from leaving home, I was blessed enough to find new warming beacon of comfort in my journey. I had read an article on a new establishment on dorchester Avenue that was black owner and a fresh new spin on southern cuisine. As one of my favorites I had to go try out the new eats in the neighborhood. Finding the place was not hard as it is directly across from the T and plenty of street parking so it was already a plus. Walking into the establishment your nose is hit the invitation of subtle spices and tender feelings. The sound of laughter and black excellence. I felt as if I had just stepped into home. I ordered what I thought to be a simple pulled chicken and fries with slaw that turned to be one of the most immaculate meals I have come to devour in quite a while. The bun was fresh and mouthwatering, the pulled chicken flavorful with smoky brown sugar barbecue coating, caramelized to perfection. Hints of crisp onions strings each falling onto the pallets in an utopian way. The fries crisp enough for a crunch and soft enough for them to be a pleasurable addition. And the slaw ? Oh the slaw. Shredded to perfection and prepared with apparent love and affection. The plating was aesthetically pleasing. I have never seen a Styrofoam set up as something to be pictured on the cover of O magazine with the service that meets you with a smile. I came here to say, 50kitchen, thank you for giving me one of the top five most euphoric feelings I have had in my years of life. If you get a chance, any moment take some time support  black businesses, fill your stomaches with a hearty atmosphere ,succulent dishes and exquisite  service this is your place. This is definitely a new fan favorite and I will be back for more of the piquant styled foods that you provide. A great addition to the strong historic nature of Dorchester. Welcome family, the next cookout is DEFINITELY on you!> Over the past several months I have passed this place  a thousand times, waiting for it to open.Finally  it open this week. So on a early evening g I decided to go and try it out.I decided to get takeout, there was a small line at the counter and some people waiting to get their order. This was about 7:40pm I looked at the menu and decided to get something I thought was  pretty straightforward  Louisiana gumbo for 17.00The counter waitress was extremely pleasant and I actually liked her vibe. I asked what was in the gumbo, if it was seafood or just chicken and sausage, she stated that it was chicken, sausage and shrimp. Si I am placed my order, now it's around 7:50pm. So i found a seat and waited, i notice at that time there seem that there were a number of people waiting for their food.My gumbo did not arrive until 8:45 , that's ok new place ,their working out the kinks. I get home to enjoy my 17 dollar gumbo, first of all when I opened the container all I saw was a brunch of rice with a couple of pieces of chicken and shrimp Very little liquid,  this was not a gumboOk....I said let me taste....it was horrible Dry and flavorless,  I was truly disappointed and wanted to take it back but I threw it outLove the concept but the kitchen needs help> Great new spot in fields corner - southern food great addition to dot ave area. Shrimp and grits excellent with creamy grits, gumbo had good amount of heat. Honey fried cornbread delicious and could be starter, side or appetizer.Big portions, friendly service, fair prices, strong 90s R&B soundtrack - will return, often.> I don't think I've ever had the specific combo of Soul-food-Asian-fusion. But it's super appropriate for Fields Corner and our large to-go order at the beginning of this COVID-19 shutdown hit the spot. Owner Anthony is incredibly friendly/responsive and I'm rooting for his team during this pandemic.> Really really good food. Lots of southern American staples juxtaposed with east Asian flavors. We had the chicken & waffles, shrimp & grits, collards, and deep-fried cornbread.The chicken & waffles was well executed. Chicken was fried simply without a ton of extra batter. Usually I'm all about the extra crunch, but I think it's smart to keep the breading light given that you're eating this fried chicken with a thick waffle. The highlight was the apple butter, which was a fantastic addition to the plate. The fruit and cinnamon worked perfectly with the maple syrup and the texture of the crispy chicken.The shrimp & grits was a great dish as well. Shrimp were perfectly cooked and the grits were nice and creamy with no lumps. Everything was topped off with a buttery sauce with a lot of garlic. Fantastic rendition of a southern classic.The collards were good, and the addition of kimchi provided a little sweetness and funkiness to each forkful.The deep-fried cornbread made me raise an eyebrow at first. $3.50 isn't much, but I only get 3 little pieces of cornbread? Looks can be deceiving, though. It was so rich from the fryer that I don't think I would have eaten more if I could. With a super crunchy exterior, but a soft interior, it was delicious. The cornbread would have been good even before being friend and drizzled with honey. Perfect way to end your meal.Small dining room for eat-in, but awesome friendly counter and kitchen staff make you feel almost like you're eating in their home kitchen. 50Kitchen looks like what every neighborhood needs: a solid local joint where the food is accessible but not boring and reliably good. Great story, too, if you want to google it. I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu and continue supporting this business.

I'll make this quick and start off with the good. Coop's is one of, if not THE best place I have found to eat in Quincy. The food is great the portions are large and the service is fast....... and usually friendly. However, I recently ordered a take out and did not have a good experience. I called to order and they tell me 20-25 minutes, fine not a problem. I get there to pick up my food, and it had only been about 15 mins so I was sure it wasn't going to be ready, not a problem. The problem came in with the service, a woman walked over asks me if I was all set and I told her the order I was there for. She went back, checked with the kitchen and told me it's almost ready. In the meantime she rang me up and I handed her $20, in her hand. She proceeds to get my change and put it on the counter and just walk off. Now, the counter is not that big so for her to reach up and hand me the change back in my hand wouldn't have taken that much effort, and it's just rude. After waiting another 10 mins. She comes out with my food and literally places it on the counter on her side of the bar, while my back is to her,  and says "here's your burger" and walks off. She doesn't even give me time to ask for the ketchup that I needed. I call out,"excuse me", and either she didn't hear me or she ignored me, but at this point I'm going to go with the latter. I had to ask a separate employee to grab some ketchup for me. Now, I get that people have their off days and I respect that but I didn't feel right about the interaction with this woman. It made me second guess patronizing this establishment again. For some that can read between the lines in this post this feeling I had will be understood, while some others won't think it's a big deal.> Would have been 1 star but the BBQ steak tips were fire... mashed potatoes were runny and the onion rings were barely even fried. Such a shame because they're usually on point!> I have been here on one occasion and the food was great.There are entrees and appetizers available and I picked an assortment of appetizers. My favorite thing that I got was the potato skins. They were cooked just right and had an awesome flavor to them with just the right amount of cheese and bacon.There is a bar area as well as a regular dining area off to the side in case you prefer not to sit at the bar or in the area of the bar. I opted for the dining room since I felt it was quieter there.The server that I had was friendly and willing to answer questions about what was on the menu. The food came out fast once ordered and the others in my party all enjoyed their food when it was brought out to our table. Five stars all around!> The Cook Black Handsome Gentleman. Great smile brought my dinner too me..i liked the chicken grill sald italian dressing fries..Awesome> Large portions, strong drinks, free popcorn and reasonable prices. A favorite spot of mine in Quincy for a low key, quality and affordable night.

menu_dishes: Arugula Salad, Pollo Arrosto, Roasted Tomato, Ham & Cheese, Tritato, Campanelle, Fettuccine Primavera, Spaghetti, Linguine Carbonara, Gnocchetti, Margherita, Soppressata, Americana, Uovo, Pollo Arrosto, Piquillo Pepper, Prosciutto di Parma, Funghi, Salsiccia, Nutella Pizza, Bindi Strawberry Cheesecake, Bindi Espresso Tiramisu, Homemade Cannoli, Bindi Chocolate Mousse
popular_dishes: Yes, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No
reviews: When I moved to Chelsea, I lamented the fact that I had lost a close, delicious pizza spot nearby. I had nothing to worry about. Ciao! Pizza & Pasta is one of the best pizza places that I've ever been. The crust is thin and smooth, and the pizza is just fabulous. The people there are the best too! They greet you like you're their long lost friend, and like they're super happy that you've come to visit. My mum and I got takeout after a long day of moving, and then we decided to sit outside in their little porch area, the waitress noticed, and she brought out plates, water, napkins, and silverware. It was a little thing that wasn't necessary, but it was much appreciated. Last time I visitied, I got cannolis too, and they were a delight. I highly recommend Ciao! And I can't wait to try their other endeavor, The Pasta Box.> Hands down BEST NUTELLA PIZZA I've ever had!We found a great new place to eat tonight! A hidden gem!LOVED every bite of the pizza, and the waittress was super friendly!To complement the place the music they were playing made me want to get up and dance!I'll be back with friends for sure!> I traveled an hour to try the pizza. We sit down, the waitress delivers 2 pizzas to the table next to us. 1 loaded 1 margarita. The customer says we didn't order a margarita so she takes it back to the kitchen. A couple minutes later she takes our order, I order a margarita my wife ordered something else off the menu. 2 minutes later the margarita shows up 6 minutes later my wife's pizza shows up. My margarita is warm at best my wife's is steaming hot...... Doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out I got the pizza that was sent back from the table next to me....I would have been fine with getting there pizza as long as it was immediate and not brought back to kitchen and brought to me Luke warm at best. A good fresh margarita pizza need to be fresh out of the oven.> This place was recommended to me by my sister who claimed this is the best pizza in all of boston metro.  i was like, pfffff, sure it is...so i drove up to the place and had a hard time finding it in the dark.  a really small parking lot adjacent to ciao is for both ciao and dunkin.  i ended up parking a block away.put in an order for a funghi 14 pie (not sure if new england calls it "pie" but you get it, you iz smaht.  it was earlier in the night so the wait was super quick, less than 15 minutes and i was out.  dining area is small with limited tables, i want to say i saw maaaaybe a dozen tables?  walking out to my car the aroma of the spritz truffle oil was intoxicating.  middle of winter, i'm opening up a box of pizza, grabbing a slice, trying to manage eating it while opening the car door.  it was THAT intoxicating.  that first bite was everything.  the crisp of the thin crust, the balance of flavors, and all the textures combined made for a solid legit pie.a week later i was in the area again on a monday, tried to hit ciao's but for some reason, they were randomly closed for that night.  no signs no nothing.  i was jonesing bad.  the hours said they should have been opened but... idk.yea i'm going back when i'm in the area for sure.  give yourself some time for the parking situation if you're dining in.> Place is small but there is some seating outside. Street is busy so expect some noise. Pizzas are delicious(and this is coming from a former New Yorker)Hidden gem in Chelsea. Funghi pizza is a must! We get pizza at least once a week from here. Go have a pie- you won't regret it!

cusine_types: Sushi Bars, Cocktail Bars, Tapas Bars
reviews: 3 weeks ago Purple Shell opened at the Broadway Redline T stop in the space formerly occupied by Stephanie's. I order the shrimp tempura and a side of edamame. My dining companion ordered a veggie platter and a gin and tonic. Everything was prepared to perfection and was delicious. Service was attentive and friendly. During the Coronavirus curfew, the restaurant will be open for takeout and delivery.> Girlfriend and I were so lucky to make it in here today.  As most people know Boston is temporarily shutting down dine-in at all restaurants so we made it in just in time.  The food here was AMAZING!  Literally everything we had was good.  We've only scratched at the surface of the menu and it's a shame we can't come back until further notice but I have no doubt in my mind that WE WILL BE BACK.> Asian fusion restaurant with primarily Japanese cuisine, but a large menu with a few Thai, Chinese,  and other Asian inspired cuisine. PROS:  Nice space.  Feels spread out enough that tables aren't on top of one another.  Fire Salmon:  very cool presentation to have the salmon draped over a base of flaming coffee beans.  However, once the fish gets even a little cooked,  it immediately flakes and falls onto the flaming beans.  This presentation works within most meats, but not Salmon.  Good taste though.Great service!  Very attentive to our group.20% for grand opening special,  before 630pm.Signature cocktails and interesting dishes.  Bottles of wine were very reasonable.  CONS:  The food overall was good,  but not great.   A few standouts were the sushi and fire salmon. I really enjoyed the sushi offerings. The Purple Shell maki was overpowered by the egg and potato.  I wouldn't recommend it. Shrimp tempura was very salty and overcooked. The tartare was severed with very sweet crackers and a handful of toppings.  While I tried it,  I prefer the tuna alone. OVERALL:  Worth a trip. I think the restaurant doesn't feel like it has its own identity yet. There's 2 sides to the space and they feel very different.  The menu is robust,  but also maybe too big.> This was an amazing restaurant with beautiful decor! Drink was great too! Loved it! Sweet with a good sour combo and a dash of cinnamon.> Great crab Rangoon, spicy tuna/salmon/yellowtail combo, basil lo mein, veggie gyoza,and spicy edamame! We got it delivered directly from purple shell and it was excellent! Thank you Purple Shell for delivering during this crazy time!

Came in New Year's Day. The restaurant was slow, but it was still a very comfortable environment...The Mac n' Cheese and Shepard Pie we're both delicious. Our server was polite.We WILL BE coming back.> I've eaten here in person and it's been fine. I ordered the fig pizza and wings through grubhub. Horrible. The wings were super undercooked, like pink. And the pizza was still uncooked raw dough. So I called grubhub and they told me that "food orders can sometimes be rushed and may need re heating." So.... ok first of all no. But I hate to complain so I set my oven for 410 and threw the pizza (wings went in the trash), for 20 minutes. Still fucking doughy. Like this pizza was not cooked at all.  Not trying to eat this. Called again. No refunds available soooooo. I spent 30 on food and enjoyed 0$ of itAnd now being told my order doesn't exist.> We went for lunch, the place has a comfortable feel & commendable space layout.Sat next to front window, felt like we were peering out into a small town setting ( even it's in Dorchester). Very quaint!The Server/ Bartender was Genuinely Engaging,  & was actually Interested in our meal & banter.Had the Bacon-Wrapped Scallops, enough to ignite the palette with a melange of freshly crisp packaging solid shellfish meat....with accompanied tangy aioli.The Mac & Cheese was cascading richness & homemade appeal!Will definitely return to shop around Industry's Menu again. !!Yes!!> Service was good The place was empty I went around lunch time on a Saturday. I had steak tips with asparagus. Everything was very tasty! Sooo tasty I was full and couldn't stop eating My date had the fish and chip. I was told it was really good, and the fish was very fresh.> Overall, unimpressive. The hostess was nice. The waiter seemed confused. The menu was not large, which made me think the chefs perfected a small menu, but instead, the food was bland. The filet was overcooked (medium, not medium rare, it happens) and it was completely unseasoned. It needed lots of salt and I mopped up every bit of the sauce on the plate. The mashed potatoes were awesome and smooth. The string beans were blanched well. The vege burger was just okay. The mac and cheese again, just okay. Everything needed salt and/or sauces to make them better.The view out front is an auto body shop.The bathrooms are plain black and multi stalls.It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great. We won't be back, as there are a plethora of other places to try in the area.

Service was fast and friendly.  I was sad to see that a past seasonal favorite drink was no longer on the menu but the bartender said she could easily still make it for me minus the garnish, and I very much appreciated the offer.  Ordered the steak tips with two sides - Caesar salad and garlic mashed.  Oddly, the Caesar salad came out as the same time as the entree, so I had to ear everything together or allow the steak tips and mashed potato to get cold.  Tips are cooked perfectly and both salad and potatoes were good as well.  Would be 5 stars if salad were  served ahead of the entree.  Have eaten here many times and always good food for good prices with friendly service, definitely give it a try .> Went there for the first time.  Very pleased with the bar service and menu selection.  We shared a few things including a meatball calzone special and duck tacos and food was very good.  Learned that they have themed trivia nights so will definitely check that out.> This bar has Family Feud-style trivia which makes it extremely difficult to not get at least one right answer. During the holidays I tried the boozy and creamy Gingerbread Man which was well worth the calories.> Went in for a late dinner with three friends on a Saturday night to celebrate a birthday. It wasn't busy. Our server Brian made our experience really positive. He was very friendly and made recommendations for items on the menu. Also gave honest opinion about the menu items. He even gave us an appetizer on the house for the birthday boy. The homemade Big Mac eggrolls were good, nice dipping sauce. I ordered the ranch fried chicken soft shell tacos with sweet potato fries ($12) and really enjoyed it. Great fries, fried to perfection, good balance of crispy and soft. Drinks need a little kick, but tasted good. The price is reasonable. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. Would go back if I'm in the area.> Would give zero stars if possible. Five minutes in to the Super Bowl, Lin the bartender told the crowd to go F themselves  and used the actual word because people were loud since the audio was in Spanish and they couldn't figure out how to change it to English. The audio isn't a big deal and people thought it  was funny, which is why I was shocked at her unprovoked reply. Unacceptable. She was rude coming to the table and clearly didn't want to be there. The other staff were great, but for my first time here  it's the only chance they'll get from me.

I had a brunch date here.  It was not crowded at 10:30 AM.  When my date arrived, I ordered a Golf Ball - great drink.  The real reason for five stars :  best waffle I've ever had in my life.  Seriously, it was delicious. Service was good too.> I wanted to really like this place, the interior is beautiful, the atmosphere with the golf course adjacent adds something else, but the food was just average.I got the Buffalo Chicken Mac & Cheese. Now I am a connoisseur of Buffalo Chicken M&C, and the first rule any kitchen should observe with this dish is if somebody wants BC M&C, rather than just M&C, it's almost certainly because they want the little kick of Franks Red Hot whacking their taste buds as they eat their meal. Yet this was the most mild BC M&C I have ever had, they may as well as named the dish "Chicken Mac & Cheese". While the meal wasn't bad, it also wasn't what it was supposed to be, which is hot and spicy.> One of my favorite places to go when in the Boston area is The Tavern. It's a treat from my parents by choice. They started going here when they realized that you don't have to be a member to dine in the restaurant. The view from this place is magnificent view of Boston. It was amazing to watch the sun go down last night over Boston while enjoying dinner. There is indoor and out door seating. They have valet parking at no cost but tips are appreciated. We started our meal with drinks and warm bread and butter. Off to a fabulous start!For appetizers we share a ceasar salad and shrimp cocktail. I am not a fan of shrimp cocktail, but this was very tasty and perfectly cooked. Huge slivers of parmesan cheese in the salad but a little shy with the croutons. The crisp lettuce and  delicous cheese were a hit. There are a variety of soups, burgers, steaks and seafood items available. I was dining with vegetarians and was pleasantly surpised by the good choices available for them. I enjoyed the mushroom and brie pizza. Crisp thin crust covered in mushrooms over brie with fresh herbs was amazing!  My friend enjoyed the mac and cheese,  very nice blend of cheeses with just enough crunch on top. My other friend enjoyed the clam chowder which I imagine was delicous because he clammed up when it arrived and said nothing until it was gone. A superb summer dining atmosphere.> My go to spot every time!!! I always order the Roasted Beet Salad because it's THAT GOOD!!!! Great food, reasonably prices, plenty of parking and valet, and views of Boston you cannot beat!!!> I hate to do this especially with the fact that the Tavern has some of the best views of Boston you could wish for, and the food is pretty good too, but, on a recent visit for lunch i was sitting at a table and next to me in a booth was a lady with a dog sitting next to her. Now this wasn't a service dog, it was the small long haired "pocket book" size dog that some people insist on taking everywhere they go.It was certainly obvious to me so i'm guessing it was certainly obvious to the server.I like dogs, my family has dogs, i had a dog for a while until i discovered i have an allergy to both pet dander and the saliva so double whammy for me.Being allergic to dogs makes this a little uncomfortable for me, sure i could have asked to move, but any restaurant that allow's animals in the dining room is no longer worthy of my patronage.

I ordered a Sizzling Beef with rice in Hot plate with Brown sugar milk tea + Crab Meat mushrooms capellini in Truffle cream sauce + Strawberry Yogurt soda + a Shake shake chicken + Prawns Linguine in sundries tomato cream sauce with Cajun seasoning for Appetizer. Taste great, Good portion, great price. Staff super friendly.> This place is definitely overpriced and sub par for a small cafe. They have pastas and baked rice dishes along with some appetizzers like shake shake chicken or fried the menu is pretty small, I don't think I i would recommend coming back here a second time. There's street parking here only.Dishes are around $15-$20 for something that's not worth your money. Majority of the seafood are from frozen so they don't taste fresh. The cream sauce used in every dish is the same and feels super heavy after you eat it. The Portuguese baked rice is definitely not your traditional HK food instead this honestly looks like a American baked casserole especially if they added frozen/canned peas and carrots. It looked like a microwave dinner. The taste of it was too sweet and didn't have much curry flavor to it. The shake shake chicken was way too salty and over fried so it was hard to bite into. The sizzling tuna was probably the only decent thing on this menu. Other than that don't really have much of a great impression on this place. Staff was nice and attentive.> Excited to try this new restaurant in the area! The restaurant has an Asian fusion vibe. I appreciate the nice interior design and ambience. This is definitely better than most Boston Asian restaurants. I learned from the employees that the chef used to own a restaurant in Hong Kong. Being from HK, I definitely appreciate this type of cuisine!They have a variety of appetizers, pasta dishes, noodles, and sizzling rice. I tried the prawn linguine and sizzling chicken rice. The food was delicious. The pasta is on point! I do wish the portion could be a little bit more. Being a new restaurant, the service was a little slow but all employees were super friendly and helpful. I look forward to visiting the restaurant another time. I saw other tables ordering the fried chicken which comes in a paper bag that looks super interesting! I definitely have to try this next time. I also look forward to trying other things on the menu such as baked pork chop tomato fried rice!> I was scrolling through Yelp for places to eat and came across this place which opened a week before my visit. I was excited to try this place because it seemed to have an interesting menu with Italian/Asian fusion cuisine. I was even more eager to go because they had fries and boba (my two favorite combos). My friends and I ordered milk teas with boba, cajun fried chicken, cajun fries, sizzling beef plate with rice, pork chop with pepper sauce over rice, and cheesy noodles with chicken. The fries were delicious. They gave us the seasoning to pour on top which I appreciated because we could season the fries to our liking. They were crispy, fresh, and hot. The fried chicken was okay, but nothing to rave about. The milk tea was probably on the lower scale of decent milk tea. This one had a weird flavor that I can't put my finger on. It had the right amount of sugar and milk, but all I can say is the flavor is definitely off and I would not get this again. The waitress accidentally gave us a medium milk tea instead of a large, but I wish I didn't correct her before taking a sip of it because it was not worth however more cents it cost. The sizzling beef plate was definitely good. I liked the sauce on it and the beef was cooked to perfection, but they didn't add cheese on it like in the picture we saw on Yelp. This makes me think they are inconsistent. I definitely don't think this dish is worth $16 though. The cheesy noodle with chicken is a huge disappointment. I'm not sure what kind of cheese they use, but it wasn't flavorful or creamy enough. The cheese smelled like a weird off brand cheddar, but (again) it was hard to tell what type of cheese was actually used. Thus, adding shredded chicken and overly soft noodles to the mix made the dish even worse. The pan fried pork with pepper sauce was also a tad of a disappointment because the pork chop was dry and the sauce was underwhelming and lacked flavor. I definitely won't be back because of the underwhelming yet overpriced dishes, but the customer service is decent.> I was visiting the Farmers Market then passed by this new restaurant and decided to give it a shot. I had the sundries tomato prawns with linguine and chocolate lava cake for dessert. First, the linguine was amazing and full of flavor. It had a true al dente feel and the shrimps were cooked perfectly. Second, the lava cake was oozing and chocolaty the moment I cut into it. I would definitely come back again to try the vast array of other dishes they had on their menu. I have certain food allergies and staff were very friendly and accommodating. They noted everything and made sure my order was perfect. This place is certainly worth a try if you are in the neighborhood!

Awesome healthy bowls and frozen yogurt. Nice staff who takes their time preparing your food. Great seasonal specials (autumn warm bowl is really good). Highly recommend!> First day: ordered warm burrito bowl with extra cilantro and lime. Jon made the best bowl and had a smile on his face during the fast take-out process.Second day: brought my better half and ordered a fig pizza. Again, Jon served us a fresh dough with half prosciutto and half chickpeas pizza - arugula, fig balsamic, and caramelized onions. Delish! Also, had soft serve dairy-free pineapple with toppings - amazing.> Weird, aesthetically sterile, cold dining room.  Different "stations" to order different things at the counter. So I had the bahn mi salad;  it was made with way too much jalapeños! Even a traditional bahn mi sandwich doesnt have anywhere near this percentage! And a sandwich has the bread to help blunt the heat of the jalapeños which a salad does not.  So u should probably order it on the side because otherwise it was a good salad...> Consistent utilitarian food, prepared while you wait. There is plenty of parking, and during traditional meal hours the place really fills up. There are three restaurants within the one building. One is healthy meals, counting calories and actually not bad; they also have a fro-yo bar with unhealthy toppings. The second is the large eatery that offers turkey and meatloaf dinners, roasted chicken and other comfort food.  The final place is a pizza/pasta joint. All are decent in their own right. The downside is, the tables and chairs are filthy. Plan on washing your own table. It's gross. The bathrooms are very gross. The place is reminiscent of the large rest area on 95 NB in New Jersey before the GW. Nasty. Get your food to go. 3.75 star for food. 2.0 stars for cleanliness. 3.5 stars for service.> ***updated***I am updating my below review as the manager was kind enough to clarify a few things I had observed with the menu. The restaurant orders fresh vegetables every week and the texture I observed in the chicken was actually from a tenderizer. Additionally, they have worked with an online platform to create their health-conscious menu. Perhaps I am a bit picky and specific with my protein/veggie/starch ratio. I do indeed think they have room to grow and I will continue to come here and look forward to their specials. -Original review- I hope this review serves as helpful criticism because I really love the idea they're shooting for, as fresh and nutritious options are lacking in this area. In my experience, the food and vegetables served here are not fresh. It appears to me that the chicken, specifically, is reheated from some sort of ready-made packaging, given the texture, and a lot of the vegetables seem frozen or not fresh. For these reason, the ingredients are generally lacking in flavor. Additionally, I think they may benefit from working with a nutritionist to improve the menu. The bowls feature hefty portions of rice, it seems to be about 2.5 extra servings of rice than would be typically recommended, but not a lot of protein. I'm skeptical that menu items like this are actually under 500 calories. (I should stress that I believe it's more important to eat a nutritiously-fueled meal that your bodies needs rather than to let a caloric count or an elimination diet to determine "health"). However, other menu items, like the entrees, only come with one side, so you must pick between either a vegetable or a starch. Overall they would benefit from guidance to feature nutritionally balanced meals that provide adequate and lasting fuel. They have a great starting point and I'm hoping that the establishment improves their ingredients and pairings. The staff here are so kind and as helpful as possible, but I agree with the other reviewers that they are not well-acquainted with the menu and unable to answer some questions or clarify questions about some of the ingredients or ways they are prepared. Rooting for you, Healthy Kitchen!

menu_dishes: Boneless Buffalo Fingers, Crispy Potato Skins, Nacho Grande, Wing Dings, Our Fowler House Sampler, Spinach Dip, Basket Of Fries, New England Clam Chowder, Soup Of The Day, Homemade Chili And Chips, Fresh Garden Salad, Greek Salad, Caesar Salad, Grilled Shrimp Caesar, Antipasto Salad, Caprese Salad, Pollo Limone, Chicken Parmesan, 10 Oz. Grilled Chicken Breast, Veal Parmesan, Garlic Veal, Baked Or Fried Scrod, Sea Scallops, Seafood Baked Trio, Baked Stuffed Shrimp, Seafood Fra Diavlo
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Looks like they got rid of the new staff who was not good. Now it's back to the way it used to be, good food, solid service and the place looks great! They are back in our regular rotation> We went here for dinner last night and were very disappointed. Our waitress was terrible, very inattentive and rushing is when she did come over. I got the special "blackened chicken broccoli and ziti in a bread bowl" there was nothing blackened about the chicken there was no char on it like there should've and it was dry and flavorless. My husband got buffalo tenders on a Greek salad. Salad came out without tenders. Once he got them 10 min later they were lukewarm. Won't be back again. Good bar atmosphere just eat before you visit.> It a neighbor hood bar with tons ofTV's at the bar and nice food ! the bartenders are very nice . It I great spot to watch the game.> Haven't been here in years. I like the huge bar area with big screen TVs. Great place to watch a game and have a few beers.Four of us showed up on a Sat nite and found seats at the bar. Our servers were awesome. Super attentive and friendly. Bar pizza was ordered crispy of which I'm not a fan of so I really can't comment but we also got the steak and cheese egg rolls. Insanely good. With a chipotle aioli. They were huge ! A meal in themselves. I split a grilled Rueben in dark rye that was very good. The others ordered Buffalo Mac and cheese they say was incredible. Overall this place was memorable and i highly recommend . To top it off the Bruins won the 2 Nd game in the Stanley Cup playoffs against the MapleLeafs !> Great neighborhood pub with delicious pizza!  Service and dining area is always perfect.

menu_dishes: Chowder, Onion Dip, Meatballs, Salt & Pepper Wings, Chopped Salad, Chickpea Bowl, Rice Bowl, Beyond Vegetable Burger, BPH Burger, Grilled Chicken Sandwich, Classic Hot Lobster Roll, BBQ Chicken Flatbread, Spinach & Artichoke Flatbread, Half Rack BBQ Ribs, Fish & Crispy Chips, Chopped Salad, Chickpea Bowl, Rice Bowl
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: We came to Bostonia last Saturday for brunch, and we had such a fantastic experience! Megan was a big help in setting up the reservation, and even when we had to change the reservation time due to my primary guest's flight schedule changing Joe was really helpful over the phone. Our server Devon was so sweet and very attentive, but not in a hovering sort of way. She gave us plenty of time to enjoy our Ultimate Bostonia Bloody Marys and did not rush us to order our entrees. I've eaten at Bostonia plenty of times, but this was my first time being a guest for brunch. It was wonderful! The live acoustic musician was so talented, and it was nice that they had the technology to connect him through the sound system so that all guests could enjoy his music throughout the main floor as well as the upstairs. Everyone in our group got the Ultimate Bostonia Bloody Mary. We were all competing to see who could make the biggest garnish (I think I won). We really enjoyed our entrees very much. I got the breakfast sandwich with maple sausage, and other meals to write home about u clouded the stuffed French toast, north country bacon frittata, the Eggs Benedict with Canadian bacon, and the "skillet hashes" (my guests that had the pulled pork hash and the smoked chicken hash raved equally about both). We finished the meal with the glazed sweet potato donuts- delish!!Thank you Bostonia for providing us with such a great experience!> Was visiting Boston during the holiday season & found this restaurant just a few steps away from the pier.As expected it was crowded but, we got a seat in 10mins!Good food, nice sandwiches (lobster roll was greaaat) & drinks and, good service as well!> When going around Boston, my girlfriend and I are always looking new places to try. We found Bostonia Public House and decided to give it a try. We quickly got a table and were greeted by our server who told us about the specials and made recommendations based on our tastes.  We ordered our drinks and food and were very surprised with the speed and quality of the food. I typically shy away from ordering lobster at restaurants since some places skimp on the portion while still charging a premium, but this was not a case. The lobster was plentiful and tasted amazing. As per our server's recommendation, Get the Benedict on a biscuit, you won't be disappointed! My girlfriend enjoyed her sangria and was very pleased with her Eggs Benedict. When you visit, you have to order the sweet potato donuts. They were flavorful but not too dense with just the right amount of warm icing.For tourists and out-of-towners: Add this spot to your list of places to eat. Not far from Faneuil Hall and other known Boston attractions.> I came here with a friend (true blue local) as part of our Christmas exploration of downtown Boston. Bottom line - it was a super-delightful and very hearty true blue Boston-feel experience (I mean as much as it could be in downtown). What I loved about this place.1. It definitely had this neighborhoody feel without being too fake about it (so basically, not another run of the mill downtown restaurant). 2. The food was hearty and well portioned (but not too ridiculous Texas-sized). I had the lobster mac n cheese - it was full of large chunks of fresh-tasting of lobster.3. The oysters were also delightful - and tasted local (as in similar to other Mass oysters I have had in the past - less briney and more nutty). 4. Oh and yes... location location location...5. Still affordable (while being classy) in downtown Boston6. Lovely service - funny, attentive and caringWhy it didn't get 5 stars1. The menu could have been a bit more creative (like twists on trusty Boston steadies). 2. Great for:1. 5th dates2. Small gatherings3. Friends from out of town4. Easy breaks upsBad for:1. 1st dates2. Hard break ups> I came here for lunch after a conference and wow it was packed. They accommodated us as quickly as they could, which was much appreciated. The decor inside is nice, like a dark pub as you would expect. The wait staff was super friendly.Big fan of their cocktails (their barrel aged Manhattan is quite good). We shared the tater tot poutine - which was good. The gravy was a bit overpowering. The clam chowder was good as well. Star of the show was the classic lobster roll - so good. And highly recommended! If you come here for anything, this and a nice cocktail - it'll really hit the spot.

Excellent food Excellent service and Excellent beer. I will continue to stop when visiting Boston.Can't stop thinking about that Lobster Roll!> Solid place - great decor, industrial and rustic....I love Fort Point for that.Everyone was nice.  Bar seats were comfortable.  Clean, service oriented, organized.Food was good...above average.   Seasonal oysters were great.  Tuna crudo a bit heavy on the salt.  Fish tacos weren't memorable.Burger w fried oysters - this was outstanding. A surf and turf burger - how novel.  Great flavors, cooked precisely, nice pairing of somewhat different textures.  Among the top 10 burgers I ve ever had.Overall, an enjoyable experience - would recommend for casual night out.> A friend recommended coming here instead of Island Hog and I left the night feeling meh about the decision. We made a reservation and showed up a bit early but ended up being seated 30 minutes before our scheduled time so the service was very on point. The restaurant specializes on fried fish plates, fresh fish entrees, and oysters so I ordered the fish to get a taste of what they're known for. Surprisingly, the burger that my friend ordered was much better than my fish. Unfortunately, a lot of our plates were also extra salty so we actually sent back a couple of them. I never am one to send back but my friend really couldn't handle the salt so felt compelled to ask for a replacement. The server was very accommodating and even gave us some snacks to nibble on as my friend waited for her replacement but it was hard to get rid of the lingering salty feeling. It was still a fun experience and I'd come back but I'd probably get the burger next time...> There really wasn't anything I disliked about this place except for the relatively high prices. All of the seafood was great though. Out of all of the great stuff we ordered, I liked the calamari and the delicious seared fish the best. The calamari was delicious, especially in the orange dipping sauce (I have no idea what was in it) and the fish was cooked perfectly for my standards. It wasn't dry or hard at all, but moist, easy to chew, and flavorful. I almost forgot to mention the decent service we received too. After all of this said, if you're willing to spend a bit more on a meal, then come check this place out!> This is 100% my favorite stop in Boston! Possibly my favorite on the east coast?! The food is always fresh and well seasoned without being overly rich. I could honestly just come and order 5 tuna crudos (black garlic aioli is worthy of a poetry tribute) but the talented staff always helps me put together a meal that's far better than that! My most recent visit we had Gabe as our server and he helped us decide on a bunch of share plates instead of getting entrees (in my opinion this is THE MOVE at the restaurant too many good raw bar options and apps!) We went with the tuna crudo, salmon poke, brussels sprouts, fried calamari, scallop ceviche and some oysters topped w caviar because...why not add the caviar! As always the tuna was a total stand out and the scallop ceviche was a surprise second, plantain chips...I never knew I was such a fan! The pieces of apple in the ceviche are super refreshing and crisp, I ended up dipping calamari in the left over ceviche juice because it was too good to let it go!! My friend loved the brussels sprouts and was still raving about them the next morning. The calamari was seasoned well but compared to everything else, it was just....fine. That togarashi aioli tho, so good, there's someone on staff that knows their way around an aioli for sure. Gabe helped my friend pick a wine that she loved and helped me get my hands on my favorite beer, Orval, even though the computer said they were out of it. Truly saved the dayyy. We had the apple crisp for dessert and it was just ok, I'd probably skip it next time in favor of one more beer from their extensive list. You do need a reservation pretty much any night of the week to be sat in a timely fashion. We came in a little early hoping to slide into an open table and the hostess (I think her name was savannah) was super helpful with getting us on the waitlist and letting us know she would give us a text while we got a drink around the corner. Super helpful. Super delicious. Have yet to have an even slightly disappointing experience after 6 or so times dining here.

So I never usually Write YELP Reviews, although I should considering how much I use them. This place inspired me to write my first because it is such a nice place, that more people should know about. West Indian Style cooking made by the owner and his family. It is also a Market which I'll touch on.  First off the food is always great probably being made as you walk in.  If the owner is working, he ll make your dish however you'd like and more likely than not, he ll let you try a thing or two if you are unsure. Stew Chicken, Ribs, Steak, Oxtail... Fresh sauteed veggies, rice, sweet plaintains and much more. I also enjoy the Market. They make various smoothies and juices with ingredients that I bet you ve never had before. The owner swears they boost your energy and is great before a Saturday night out on the town! haha. Please do yourself a favor and give this local business a  try, spread the word!> Make sure to try the yellow sauce with your jerk chicken if you go here. It tasted like a mix between spicy honey mustard and barbecue sauce. I got the small jerk chicken plate and my husband ordered the curry chicken plate. Both our plates came with fried plantains, mixed veggies, and rice and beans. The mixed veggies had broccoli, onions, and peppers. The rice tasted like brown rice and I've never tried a Caribbean place that used brown rice for their rice and beans but I thought it was pretty good. We ordered our food through Grubhub in the Yelp app and it came about 15 minutes before the earliest time they said they would be there. Awesome! I just wish there were some options of drinks on the grub hub app like some coconut water or Kola champagne. :( I also received a call about 10 minutes after placing my order from someone from the restaurant letting me know that they were running low on curry chicken. He said they would be happy to substitute the other half of meat for half of another meat. I think he could tell that I didn't know what to pick and he told me he could give me some of the turkey, jerk chicken, and the curry chicken as a mixed plate. I really appreciated that since we got to try most of their main meat options. Our two favorites ended up being the jerk chicken with the yellow sauce and the curry chicken. The curry chicken was flavorful and juicy and the jerk chicken had a mild spice to it and a really nice charred meat flavor. Also, the guy from Grubhub who dropped off our order was super friendly. I would be happy to order from here again. :)> My daughter and I are visiting from Atlanta by way of St Louis. We ordered through GrubHub $32 worth and it wasn't worth it... She had the curry chicken which was good, however, the jerk chicken seemed old & not fresh. I ordered extra sauce and both sauces were not very tasty... they tasted weird. The jerk sauce did not taste like authentic jerk sauce & the curry sauce tasted like barbecue sauce. The veggies that came with were squash onions and peppers which is not original to the islands and I was disappointed and the rice and beans tasted dry.  We were disappointed although the curry chicken was better overall it wasn't a very tasty experience.> Great quality, taste and quantity. Exceptionally good customer service. I have lived all over the Caribbean and it won't get better than this. Thank you.> My friend and I came in here for some good authentic food it looks like a small mom-and-pop type place but the owner was unbelievably friendly so sweet. We told them we wanted to try a little of everything and what we did fresh avocado well made plantains oxtail was to die for marinated and slow cooked turkey jerk chicken grilled and baked it tasted like mom's cooking like it had been cooking for hours and hours I absolutely highly recommend this place you have to go in and try the grilled chicken and the steak it is so good look at my photos they don't lie

Come before noon on the weekends because that's when they serve their brunch menu, delicious. They have a number of their regular menu items for a fraction of the price! I got the brunch burger and it was delicious. I love the potatoes that come with it. It can get super packed so you might have to wait  a bit, especially during the summer. Waiting is easy, you can put your name and number and just walk  about the Pru while waiting to be contacted that your table is ready.> My first time heading into Earls and you feel almost like in a dream walking up the stairs towards the main dining and bar area.I really enjoyed the wide variety of food choices...I never thought i'd be able to get bipimbap in the same place as a s'mores cheesecake. The Black Tea Peach Sour was just the right kick of whiskey and bitters.> Previously, my husband had experienced wonderful service and meals at The Earls Assembly  Row location and was very disappointed with evening as was a  special occasion that we coming to town, and staying  overnight to attend the ballet.My steak was smeared with a salty sauce that was called "peppercorn," and was prepared well done, rather than the medium I requested. It was my understanding that the peppercorn was more of an accented taste rather than it being soaked. It ruined the steak, and my husband then split his steak with me.  Our server was nowhere to be found to explain the situation.Eventually, we reported to our server my displeasure with my meal + she responded to let me know if I wanted anything else from the kitchen. I did not, as my husband split his steak with me and we were on a tight schedule, as we were headed to the ballet that evening. My husband also ordered a beer after our appetizer was served and it did not arrive until we were done with our meal.  Both the steak + beer went to waste as we had to make the ballet in time. Both, our server and the manager knew we were on a tight schedule, as they asked if we were celebrating anything. Husband and I were very surprised  + very disappointed to see that neither the beer or my steak was deducted from our bill and we ended up paying $160 ($131 + tip)  for one entrée, one app, one glass of Prosecco, and one beer. Unfortunately we did not have time to dispute this as we needed to leave and didn't want any more of a damper on our evening. We won't be returning. I left a message with the manager and they have yet to respond.> This spot is located inside Prudential Center. The restaurant was large, with plenty of seating. They had a bar up front near the entrance, and another bar in the back with several TV screens for sports fans. A bad thing about a restaurant on a slow evening is that the service can also be slow... It took a good while for a server to come over to our table with their menu. We decided to order a small items to share. First item was Korean Hot Wings. I really like Korean wings, and they have done a great job here! They were tangy with a nice little kick, packed with flavor! Second dish was Truffle Fries. The fresh ground pepper was really nice. The fries were thin, soft and potato-y, soooo good! Third dish was Dragon Roll. The rice was undercooked or dry, causing them to be a bit tough, which was disappointing. We also ordered one entrée item to share. We chose Scallop Risotto. The kitchen staffs separated the risotto into two plates for us without us asking for it. How nice! Scallops were huge, plump, and tasty, nice dish! We had Sticky Toffee Chocolate Pudding for dessert. Toffee was warm/hot in the center, nice size, moist and dense. Ice cream was perfect with it. Candy snap was way too hard. Not really edible which was disappointing... We had a nice dinner here. There were few negatives, such as the service being very slow, and the temperature of the restaurant was too warm to the point it was kind of hot and uncomfortable. Other than that, we enjoyed ourselves at a roomy and comfy booth. I don't think I will order the sushi again, but everything else was quite good.> If you have any sort of food allergy please avoid this place. I have a severe peanut and tree nut allergy and asked our waitress three times to ensure my food was safe to eat. The salad was brought over with nuts on it as I reiterated to her three times if it was okay. The salad was brought back for the second time and I mixed it and noticed there was bits of nuts in it. It took the manager over 15 minutes to come over, as I am panicking over having a reaction. He took away my salad and didn't even offer to bring anything else out - not that I would trust the kitchen anymore. The most horrendous service I have ever experienced. A vast majority of our population has food allergies, and beware your health is not taken seriously here.Also, horrible service. My waitress NEVER refilled the water pitches and left them empty in front of me all night. I had to go find a water pitcher and empty glass vase and refill my own pitcher!

As an Arab (Jordanian) living in Boston, it was so hard to find really good and well-priced middle eastern pastries (Manakeesh) - but this place hits the spot. It's absolutely perfect, well-priced, and delicious. Arab pastries made by real Arabs? Sign me up.I tried the cheese Ajeen and the chicken Ajeen - both were really great. The dough was cooked to perfection and crispy on the edges, the fillings were rich and flavorful, and it's not too dough-y or oily. And the prices are similar to what you'd get in the Middle East too (yes a little more expensive but this is America, and it's amazing to find this food at a good price).The only downside I have is that the sweet Ajeen was filled with very little Nutella (it wasn't too flavorful) but other than that, this place is epic, and you should definitely go there for a snack if you're in the area. I'm still yet to try their Lahm Ajeen but I bet it will be amazing too. Keep up the great work, I'm super happy I stumbled across this place while walking in Allston last week, and now I hope to be a regular!> Great Lebanese flatbreads at a great price! We walked in during their soft opening, and were lucky enough to get some free samples before we picked what we wanted. Ended up getting the Zaatar and Mouhammara with a side of Baba Ghannouj. Both flatbreads were great, with plenty of toppings so they are definitely worth the cheap price! Baba Ghannouj tasted very fresh, definitely homemade. Everyone in there was happy to answer our questions! We may have to go back again today. They also give extra pita for free if you order a side sauce!> OUTSTANDING!  Welcome to Allston Rock City- you are so authentic- fresh fast and DELICIOUS! Great menu & a great price point!

I haven't been here in years but I am so glad I came back for breakfast this week! Walked in around 8am and there was plenty of seating, also a lot of open spots in the parking lot. I ordered a mermaid mimosa (regular mimosa + midori) and a hot chocolate - both were good and went well with the meal. For food, we got the avocado and bacon benedict and the Brewer's corner. There were actually a lot of items on the menu so you are bound to find something you like. I personally love that there are so many Benedict options, most places usually only have 2/3 types. The hollandaise sauce was rich, creamy and not overly oily. Avocado was nice and fresh and the eggs were cooked perfectly. The same goes for the Brewer's corner breakfast, everything was cooked so well. Bacon had the crisp and crunch you look for, sausage was flavorful and the potatoes were seasoned nicely. On top of all that, the staff here is really friendly! Must be hard to be energetic and welcoming in the morning but they created a very relaxed and cozy environment.> + More like a 4.25 and one of the better breakfast spots that's close to where I live.  They serve all sorts of Eggs Benny combos (about 25 different kinds on my last count) and if you're in the mood for something boozy in the AM, this is the place - full bar with a very creative mimosa menu.Fits the bill both in variety and cost.  Ambiance in the morning was much better than the packed sardines situation you usually get in other diners.  There was no hostess in front but we received a super cheerful greeting from the servers as they told us to seat ourselves wherever we wanted. Food ordered:*Pancakes with bananas and chocolate chips - Yay rating! Super fluffy and great portion size. Plenty to take home and my daughter had it for breakfast again the next day.  (5/5)*Crab cakes benedict - Tasted pretty good but had a tad too much breading in the crab cake mixture for my taste. (3.5/5).  However, I shall be back to try their lobster varieties as I know it'll be even better.As a mommy-daughter date to catch up on all life's trials and tribulations, I couldn't have chosen a better spot for a relaxing hour in my day.  They have many options to suit everyone's taste buds, so if you're local, you can't go wrong!> This place was busy. Service was fine. The food was just okay to me. I got the blueberry waffles and it came with whip cream. It just felt like a normal waffle that I could get anywhere. The everything breakfast sandwich look pretty small in protein size. Look like it barely had anything in it. Bacon was undercook and they were cheap on the veggies. Won't be back.> Always a great breakfast at the Granite Street Cafe. Even on a Sunday, snowy and all is available and the food is excellent. Great service. Great food. Great bar. No negatives whatsoever.> Not sure why this place has 4 stars, service was fine. My home fries was over seasoned so I peeled the skin off of them. My French toast came out cold, syrup was not good. I'm used to real maple syrup. The Fruit was not Fresh.

This was a perfect stop for two parents with a young kid. We sat immediately, got kid food quickly, and got to enjoy a drink to boot. So let's get right into the adult frappe of choice - birthday cake. Ice cream, whipped cream vodka, fluffernutter, sprinkles. Did I need it? Nope. Did I love it? YUP. Only drawback is that it looks appetizing to children so stay vigilant!My fiesta burger was just spicy enough and packed with flavor. An order of onion rings on the side went down well too. They are very thin and was not what I expected. But it was all good once I took my first bite.There are a few local drafts on tap to choose from. Nothing crazy but all quality.Also there is plenty of parking in a huge lot behind the building. The front has a few street spaces with a time limit.You probably already know about Wahlburgers but if you have not, this one is a fine location for your first experience.> Amazing place and food was outstanding. Thank you to Paul's manager for giving my daughter a swag bag with a shirt, socks and a sweet treat for after our meal. We are from new York.  We stopped in for lunch on our way to her post op appointment at Boston children's hospital.  She was so excited to meet such amazing, friendly people. She wanted to make friends with everyone. We are making it a point to come back to the area just for your burgers and great staff. Thank you all so much!> I had a less than stellar experience and reviewed. Wahlburgers commented on my review requesting that I email customer service. I followed up and to my surprise the location manager Renee reached out, apologized for our experience and offered to send a gift card to give them another try AND said to reach out and she would save us a table! (We live in RI so it's a bit of a drive). It says a lot about the company's integrity and shows they truly value their customers as well as our time.So here's my new, and improved review folks: We were seated immediately. Our server Corrine (sorry if I'm misspelling name) greeted us and took our orders. I let her know my son had a peanut/treenut allergy. She acknowledged how important it is to know. It's always reassuring when a server understands food allergies. Our food came out quickly and everything was amazing. Did you even know there was such a thing as sweet potato tots?! Me neither!!! They have them here and boy they are tasty! I ordered the 1/3 lb burger with pepper-jack cheese. My hubby and oldest got the double decker. All burgers were cooked as ordered and made with love. The boys got tots and fries and polished them off. My little guy ordered a smahlburger and tots. It came out with a little allergy toothpick which made me feel safe. I always get a little bit of anxiety eating out with him so this was amazing. He eats like a bird so had half his food and was full. He said it was good and didn't die! Winning. The two big boys finished their fatty party with frappes. My son sucked down a chocolate malt, hubby mint chocolate.Renee also came out to greet us and apologized in person for our previous visit. She later checked in to make sure all was well. This was incredibly nice. Overall we had a stellar experience. Our server was fun to chat with and listened to us. While the burgers aren't the best I've every had, they're still pretty good. The customer services definitely one of the best!> Road trip to MA and before continuing our trip to Boston and Fenway park we decided to stop at the original Wahlburgers.Watching the show for a few episodes we had to visit, and taste it for ourselves. Hopefully we also would get a glimpse of Donnie, Mark or Paul (we didn't).The restaurant is located in a busy and beautiful area. The service is very friendly, and the menu gives you enough choices to contemplate for a moment what to get. It was a nice day and we were able to sit outside enjoying our orders.It was not only a cool experience, but the food didn't disappoint either. Thanks Wahlburgers for the hospitality!> We went out of our way off rt 3 to finally try walburgers. I was sceptical because the reviews aren't the best but I have to say it was well worth the trip. The prices are reasonable and the food was delicious. Kids got a hotdog/sweet potato tots and a burger/fries each about $6. Hubby got a double "our burger"  with bacon and mushroom which he enjoyed. I got the fish sandwich which was also good but nothing special about it. However the onion rings are a must try!!  We would go back again even though it's about an hour drive for us. They have a fire outside for cool nights (was too cold in February ). I have to say our waiter which may have also been the bar tender was amazing! His personality was awesome and he made it a great experience! He served a fruit happy face to the kids which they just thought was the best!! Five stars to our waiter!

Where did this place come from? A phoenix rising from the ashes of a ne'er-do-well Margaritas, Ocho Cafe gace the space and the menu a glam up.Housemade salsas, ranging from tomatillo with fresh avocado chunks, to chili arbol, to a creamy pineapple number (trust me, it's money), are available at a self-serve bar for your complimentary chips, as well as pretty much everything on the menu.But there's one thing you should try on your initial visit: the combination, or as they say en espanol, el combinación. Pick one enchilada, one bursting taco, and one quesadilla, with rice and beans, for $17. I went mole, al pastor and steak (respectively), and the food was exquisite! Nothing lard laden and heavy on the gut, just clean, TexMex flavors that were instant hits with the whole family.Really looking forward to heading back when all is open again - Ocho is a total winner.> We've been here twice in recent weeks and have had good food and great service both times.This used to be called Margarita's but now is under new ownership and management. The interior looks similar but the menu appears refreshed.The first time we went we were waited on by Sergio who we were told is the owner's brother-in-law.  He was helpful, friendly and efficient.He promptly brought out a basket of fresh and tasty tortilla chips and salsa that comes in a cruet.  You pour the salsa from the cruet into individual dishes...one for each diner which is especially great if you're eating with anybody who tends to be a double-dipper.  In addition to the salsa that comes with the chips, there is a salsa bar where you are free to go up and select as many of the various salsas and dips as you would like to try.  We especially liked the mango salsa.  This is a fun touch.To drink, I had a regular margarita which was strong and delicious and thankfully not overly sweet. I was asked if I wanted a salted rim and I said yes.  There is an elaborate tequila menu so if you have a special tequila that you like, chances are they have it. My husband had a draft beer.He ordered  pork carnitas enchiladas which he thought were delicious.  I had the chiles rellenos which were excellent! They are beer battered roasted poblano peppers stuffed with Oaxaca cheese and covered with poblano queso sauce and cilantro crema.  This is one of my favorite Mexican style dishes and one I love so much I have made it at home.  This version did not disappoint.  The flavors of the peppers came through nicely which means they weren't overwhelmed with cheese and sauce.We were quite full so when Sergio returned to ask us about dessert we declined so I can't say that I've seen that menu.After this pleasant lunch-time visit we returned a few nights later after work just for a drink and an app.  My husband and I met at the bar.  I again had a salted-rim margarita and he again had a draft beer. The chips and salsa were brought out and again we tried a few of the salsa options from the salsa bar.For our appetizer we got the taquitos. What arrived were 3 mini-tacos which were actually quite substantial not to mention quite delicious. They were crispy corn tortillas stuffed with roasted poblano peppers, corn, potatoes, caramelized onions and a mix of melted cheeses.  They are served with slaw, pico de gallo, avocados and cilantro crema.   We chatted with the bartender Carlos who moved here recently from southern California at the request of the owner who wanted him to work at her restaurant.  It seems like this is a "friends and family" enterprise and that spirit of  "we are in this together" shows in the kindness and attentiveness we have received twice now from servers and the host at the door.We are glad to have had two very good experiences at this restaurant and we will happily return soon.  Mexican food is in short supply in these parts and really good Mexican food is even harder to find.  I don't know how authentic this food really is, but it tastes great and the atmosphere is pleasant and convivial.> I'm vegetarian and messaged them ahead of time to see what I could order from their menu.  I got a very prompt response.I had the vegetarian enchiladas, which came with white rice.  I'm normally not a fan of white rice, until...OMG...I don't know what they seasoned it with, but it's the best white rice I've had in my life.  And the enchilada was huge and delicious.I told my husband I'd def be taking leftovers, then looked down a bit later and...it was all gone, LOL.Atmosphere was good and our waiter was excellent.  Very quick service and food delivery.The chips were awesome.  The salsa was a little weird, but it was okay.Very good value for the money.  We will be going back!> I was honestly hesitant in trying Ocho because it looked like your typical generic Mexican place. The inside of the restaurant proved that right but the food certainly proved me wrong. I placed a to-go order for two different entrees. My entree was the pulled pork carnita tacos (see picture below). I freaking LOVED them. They were super flavorful. It came with rice, refried beans and a Mexican type coleslaw. It WASN'T your typical meat-out-of-a-can Taco Bell tacos with plain tomatoes and lettuce on it. The meat was tender and juicy, the ingredients put inside the tacos were fresh and very much appreciated. The rice was cooked well, along with the beans (wish I had more!), and the coleslaw was something unique for sure. I don't know how to explain it but it was a creamy/ranchy type flavor and it added to the meal so well. They also included tortilla chips (they have to have been made in-house, they were that good) and the salsa is some of the best I've ever had. It was SWEET and TANGY. I'm not from around that area (we had taken a long drive up to Hull to walk along the beach), so I'm not sure if this is a chain of restaurants but the workers definitely seemed and acted like family. It was a great atmosphere to be surrounded by, even just sitting in the front waiting for our take-out food to be ready!> OMG!! Visiting from NorCaliThe Food and The  Hospitality Was AMAZING ! I was very  Impressed I will be back!

menu_dishes: Coffee, Black Tea, Green Tea, Turkish Coffee, Herbal Tea, Bowlawni, Banjan, Kaddo, Bowlawni Kaddo, Aushak, Mantu, Bowlawni, Banjan, Vegetarian Aushak, Bowlawni Kaddo, Vegetarian Kaddo, Vegetarian Aush, Shorwa Soup, Mashawa Soup, Aush Soup, Salata, Shor Nakhod, Qabili, Sabzi Challow, Aushak, Mantu, Korma Challow, Kofta Challow, Mourgh Challow, Trout, Lamb Lawand, Mourgh Salata, Qabili, Chopan, Seekh Kabob, Dopiaza, Sabzi Challow, Aushak, Mantu, Chapendaz, Tikka Kabob, Korma Challow, Kofta Challow, Mourgh Challow, Mourgh Kabob, Mourgh Salata, Trout, Lamb Lawand, Vegetarian Kourma Challow, Vegetarian Sabzi Challow, Vegetarian Aushak, Banjan and Kaddo Challow, Vegetarian Special, Bamiya, Sabzi, Laghatac, Lentils, Challow Rice, Pallow Rice, Feereny, Sheerberaing, Bucklawa, Sheerehk, Pudeen, Fresh Fruits, Pineapple Cake, Bottled Water, Soda, Chopan, Seekh Kabob, Dopiaza, Chapendaz, Tikka Kabob, Mourguh Kabob
