reviews: Ariana is my family go to for delicious unique dinner out especially when my grown kids come to town.  Ambiance is lovely with cloth tablecloths, low lights and great service. The owner often comes to the table to welcome his patrons.  The food is always perfectly presented  and not rushed.  Nice wine list too.  It's a large restaurant so will appear  empty but when you are seated it lends itself to a very relaxing meal in an imitate setting. We love the many dishes with squash and pumpkin and the meat  dishes are spiced just right. Don't let the empty tables distract you, it's a wonderful change from typical Italian, American and  steak places  we tend to choose.> First time trying Afghani food and it was wonderful! Servers were very welcoming and offered suggestions on what to order. They basically just said everything was good but they were not wrong.Ordered one of each of the appetizers and we were not disappointed by any - each had their own flavors and they were really delicious. I don't have pictures except one because we ate everything so fast.Had beef, chicken, lamb, and vegetarian entrees and everyone was happy with their order. I ordered the Mourgh Challow and it was a simple dish but  had a lot of flavor. Had some of the Chopan which was especially great and I am not usually a fan of lamb. Would probably order that next time.> The place was delicious, the spices, the aromatics, the flavor - these guys just cant be beat.  If you have an opportunity to visit them, do it, you will not be disappointed.  The place is good for date night.> In the past few years, I've heard that Helmand had sadly gone downhill, and Ariana had moved from its outpost on Brighton Ave.What I had not realized was that Ariana had planted itself on the ground floor of a new construction on the block before Brighton Mills Shopping Center with its McDonald's and Spring Shabu Shabu.  The new space is larger than the old, with a greater depth, and nicely decorated with bright and cheery yellow walls.  It is located directly across from the Shield System Car Wash.  Parking is non-metered street parking only, so read the signs.When it ain't broke, don't fix it...Yeah, I ordered up their Kaddo appetizer $6.95 (pan-fried baby pumpkin seasoned with sugar then baked and topped with ground beef sauce.  Served on garlic yogurt sauce.) to go, and it came in a decent sized portion in a styrafoam clamshell with 3 pieces of their flat bread in a plastic bag.  Yum!I was well satisfied not only with the sweet soft orange gourd with the savory meat sauce and the tangy yogurt sauce, but with the generous portion.  I was also surprised by the bread, but I made good use of them by consuming them along with the soft sweet appetizer.  I was happy and content.I also went back for another order for my parents to sample.  The portion was still quite good, as was the taste.  Oddly, however, it came with 2 pieces of the bread vs the 3 I received the first time.> My favorite restaurant in Boston and one of my favorite restaurants I've tried period. Ariana has unique, delicious dishes that you really won't find elsewhere. My favorites are the pumpkin with yogurt and beef sauce (this is so unbelievably delicious it's too hard to describe), the manti (dumplings in yogurt sauce) and eggplant in yogurt and tomato sauce which are just off the charts. Even their bread and sauces they provide before the food is unreal. I haven't fully explored their main dishes to the extent I'd like to but I certainly will in the future. I've had Afghani food elsewhere in the US but nothing compares to Ariana. The prices are also incredibly affordable. You really won't have a better meal in Boston.

Best subs in Quincy !   Always very fresh tastingDecent pizza, and Italian dishes from scratch One of the best ham n' cheese sandwiches Anywhere !  The eggplant parm is excellentAnd the meatballs and the lasagna specials Are fantastic !  Outstanding food.> Definetly the hidden gem of Quincy. You could call me a pizza snob, I went to college in New Haven, where it all began. If you want good pizza it has to be a thin crust with quality ingredients, end of story. Carmines has it. Their grinders are out of this world. The best Italian I have had outside of my family's own. Chicken parm and eggplant parm are perfect. The sauce is quality. It's cash only and no delivery so you know it has to be good. Highly recommended.> This place is great. I got the eggplant parm, and oh my gosh, it was so good! The bread was light, and the eggplant was soft and the sauce tasted very authentic. Along with the cheese it went together perfectly.I also had to get one of the huge, homemade, chocolate chip cookies that was resting on tray nearby. This also did not disappoint.There was a lot on the menu, so I hope for the chance to come back here again. The vibe was great. It had a bright atmosphere, and the workers were friendly. Everything felt very authentic. I'm pretty sure it's the only place to get food in Squantum, but it's not a bad option.> Great sub sandwiches! He now has ice cream has a service window. We have stopped by a few times while walking our dogs during the summer. It is nice to sit at the outside table having ice cream and watching the people go by. But the menu inside is Great also. Everything is made fresh everyday with a few specials as well. You can even pick up cold cuts and salads too! We have been going here ever since Carmine bought the place. It's great to see that he is still there and doing well. Carmine is now a part of the Squantum Community now that he bought the property.> Best place for home cooked Italian meals and pizza to go. And great prices. You must check out his homemade chicken pot pies it's beyond the best around. I been going to carmines for many years. Foods always fresh. And he gives back to the community with his find catering to functions in and round Squantum

This review is really more like 3.5 stars. The wife and I had some late night cravings for Island Creek oysters but we did not want to make the drive to Boston so we stumbled upon Trident Galley. To our delight, they had a special after 9PM every night BOGO oysters. We didn't order any entrees but opted to share a few small plates.Dozen oysters on the half shell - Island Creeks are one of our favorites and to get them at half off is even better.Clams 3 Ways - Best dish we had, rustic style clam chowder topped with chunks of deep fried clams. The fry of the clams was well seasoned and did not feel heavy.Roasted bone marrow - Bone marrow topped with shredded beef and a sunny side up quail egg. We really wanted to like this dish but felt like it just missed the mark. The marrow seemed to be just undercooked and didn't spread nicely. Instead of spreading like butter, it felt more like spreading crumbled cheese. The flavor was nice and the portion was descent. Patatas Bravas - Fried potato wedges...Saffron poached shrimp cocktail - We didn't taste or notice any saffron flavor, the shrimp was a descent size but it tasted just like any other shrimp cocktail.Smoked trout deviled eggs - This was okay, the deviled eggs did have a hint of the smoked trout flavor. I don't think we would order this again.Baby kale Caesar salad - Standard Caesar salad but replace the romaine for kale and top it off with some white anchovies.The drinks were okay, but nothing special. I would recommend sticking with beer and wine. It could have just been an off night when we went because there was only one guy behind the bar who also was taking our order.> I don't know too much about Trident except that I absolutely love the dollar oyster deals they have. Monday through Thursday from 4pm to 6pm and then every night 9pm until closing is plenty of time to enjoy a dozen or more oysters at prices not usual for the East Coast. If you go to New Orleans, you can find amazing Gulf oysters just about anywhere at any time for a dollar a piece but here in New England where oysters are just as plentiful, that is not the case.  You can spend upwards of $3.50 per oyster which in my mind is simply crazy.  So this deal at Trident is a great draw.  Depending on the day, you get a different type of oyster.My husband and I showed up a little after 4pm yesterday after a day "off" although made busy by a host of house and garden chores that we had to get done.  What a wonderful respite it was to show up at Trident, find two seats at the bar and enjoy two dozen (yes, we are raw oyster gluttons) oysters.  Yesterday's choice was Wellfleet oysters...they were delicious but not my all-time favorite oysters.  Nonetheless we were happy, me with my glass of prosecco and husband with his craft beer...I think it was called Nite Lite.Of note, my husband and I are not fans of craft beers and that is the only kind Trident sells.  It's hard to know what they taste like until you try them and then, you may dislike the one you've tried.  There are so many! Impossible to know.  The lovely bartender taking care of us gave my husband an nice-sized sample of one of the beers she thought he might like...alas, he didn't care for it.  She suggested another one and he liked it well enough so got a glass of that.It would be great if Trident offered a couple of non-craft beers too.The rest of the menu is inviting with an array of seafood dishes and interesting appetizers.  One day we will actually go for dinner. Sitting at the bar however with those dollar oysters and our drinks on a nice summer late afternoon was pretty heavenly.  Nothing more needed.> When you're looking for craft cocktails, an amazing oyster selection and great service, Trident is my favorite place in Hingham! This is the perfect spot for dates, day drinks and unique small plate combinations, or a nice dinner. Every time I come here I try something new and always leave more than satisfied.> Boy, do we miss Trident!  Moved further down the south shore and just don't get up to the shipyard area often. This was our "go-to" spot for date night for a couple years. Awesome beer menu and great selection of tapas - love being able to try different foods we wouldn't normally! Bartenders and servers are always friendly and helpful. Great ambiance being next to the water and nice patio during the warmer months!> Unlike what REM would lead you to believe, It's not the end of the world as we know it. I feel fine. I'm not an extreme thrill seeker but I do enjoy a challenge. Hard be it for me not to miss a chance to broaden my horizons when the opportunity presents itself. I'm not talking parachuting and bungee cord jumping here. That being said. Thou shall'nt be timid when dining with me. Sure Trident Galley and Raw Bar in Hingham had regular people food, but why? We ( quite King-like ) started with oysters from Chatham and Wellfleet. Then more from the west coast. Big and Salty vs. Delicate and Sweet. Daringly we tried the Daily Ceviche ( seafood cooked in citrus) which had scallops shrimp and octopus. Tender and lemony with a slight kick. The Duck Liver Pate came next. It was creamy and came with a sour apple sweet topping to schmear on quality toasted bread. Then out came the Cajun Shrimp with Grtits. The cheesy creamy grits chilled out the heat on the shrimp. The best was saved for last. Definitely not for the faint of heart the Roasted Bone Marrow with pickled vegetables and fried quail egg.was scrumptious. It came with a garnish of short ribs and more quality bread. I was able to precariously balance portions of all said ingredients onto every bite.   It's not the end of the world as we know it. ... I feel fine.

Order the skinny salmon. Go at 12pm and get the beet salad or go at 8pm and order the Chicken Saltimbocca either way you'll enjoy it all and will be back to try the whole menu. Every time I've been there I just love the vibe of the whole restaurant and service is fast and SO good.> This restaurant is on the same block with Starbucks and they have a parking on the side of the building. The restaurant is nice, spacious and has an open kitchen concept. They also have a nice bar with a lot of options for beer and cocktails. They also have a nice, cozy private dining room if you want to book small event for family/friend or corporate. We enjoyed our food although it's a bit pricey for the portion. Customer service was good and very attentive. Our waitress checked in on us several times throughout our meal. The powder room is clean which is a plus for a restaurant. You can either dress up or casual. I'd recommend this place if you live in South Shore and don't want to deal with Boston traffic.> When you come here, check out Pat! He is soooo nice. We came for dinner and ended up with a free glass of wine thanks to the manage Jason! He was so kind to get us that since our food took forever and a day but it was fine since we had good company. Food was delicious, waiter was super friendly so we will definitely come back to try out different food items. We each had the salmon rosina and omg, cooked to perfection! The crispy cauliflower wasn't as crispy (more oily) but it was just ok. My friend had the tiramisu and she said it was scrumptious! So we will be back and hopefully Jason and Pat will be just as nice!> Brian G. is amazingggggg! Not only was the food & drinks delicious but the service was great and that's a rarity nowadays. Can't wait to go back!> Phenomenal  neighborhood restaurant.  Great food and drinks.  Staff , bartenders and management are friendly and professional.

A nice quaint restaurant with tasty food and great service. Adequate parking provided free of charge.White tablecloths make the place ideal for a romantic meal.> I go to this place quite often and I honestly can say I have never been disappointed with any of the fish I have ordered. It has has all been fresh and tasty. I will say I am not a fan of their cornbread and I ordered green beans as a side and they were a little too crunchy for my liking. However, I love how they have so many options for seafood!> My husband ordered the seafood chowder and baked stuffed shrimp. I ordered the clam chowder and Caesar salad. Both of the chowders were delicious and we would both order again. My only regret was I ordered the cup instead of the bowl. The butternut squash served with the baked shrimp was scrumptious and went great with the shrimp. The stuffed shrimp was perfect although the crab was not easily detectable. Our server was friendly although she did not refill my tea or water. She did refill my husband's coffee so not really a huge deal. My husband and I agree that we would definitely recommend this restaurant and eat here again if ever in the neighborhood again. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food.> I have been going to this restaurant for over 20 years now and it has always been great. I had lunch there this afternoon and I got the baked stuffed shrimp. It was very delicious and the two people who I was dining with got the clam chowder and both said it was great. The service was great and I really enjoyed my lunch.> What a difference a day makes... Two visits, two experiencesThe first night was so good, we went again two days later.  This restaurant is a kind of throwback to an earlier era... real tablecloths and cloth napkins, and a perfectly set table.The bread and the corn bread were very good as was the  salad.  I ordered baked stuffed schrod with mashed potato and corn.   The veggies were pretty good, but the schrod was COOKED PERFECTLY, as well as I've ever had it.  Portions are large, prices are reasonable and the service was very good.Two nights later... the schrod was overcooked... and another in our party ordered it on my advice, and hers was also overcooked.  Service was not nearly as good, in fact it was just fair.

We went here for dinner and drinks this past Friday night and everything was amazing! Cocktails were perfectly balanced, reasonable priced, and full of character. The food was off the chain. Cornbread nice and sweet; Gumbo appetizer both quite large and tasty; Jambalaya and shrimp etouffee both amazing. And ice cream with beignets so delicious!And our server, Jonathan, was awesome and gave us great suggestions around the food and drinks. Will definitely be back here once all the covid stuff calms down one day.> Popped in today for a few cocktails and apps on a rare kid free afternoon. Had a great time. Sat at the bar and ordered two of their NOLA inspired cocktails. We ended up splitting the BBQ shrimp, crawfish & Tasso fritters, fried oysters and the red beans & rice. All were good. Personally, the oysters were my favorite. They were fresh and crisp. Prices were very reasonable for the neighborhood. Service was attentive and the restaurant was clean. We'll be back the next time we're craving a taste of New Orleans.> I was very excited about this place opening but left disappointed unfortunately. First, we almost past by this place. The frosty effect on the doors make it seem like its still shut down and the banner sign doesn't stand out enough to ground attention. Our service was extremely slow and very unattentive. We went on a Saturday afternoon and were 1 of 3 tables in the whole restaurant, so you would think we would have seen our server more than 2 times...nope. Our order was put in incorrectly, took forever to be corrected, no check ins in between, and then the "corrected" food was still wrong. The food itself was subpar. I ordered the fried oyster poboy which was too greasy, luke warm, and had barely any spicy mayo on it. My fiance ordered the muffaletta which was nothing more than a basic deli sandwich with added olives (yes we knew what it was before ordering it). The crawfish and lasso fritters were okay, but consisted mainly of batter. There is another eview that mentioned a lack of actual cajun spice in the food and I full on agree just with the limit (and very basic) items we ordered. I wanted to be blown away with flavor and sadly was left looking for it in store bought cocktail sauce.  Unsure if we'll go back again.> J U S T  G O! Im from the Alabama, trust me. Why trust me, I come form the second largest state for obesity, and do you know why we eat so much food? Because it's so got darn good...So, I've lived in Boston for about 7 months now, and have been consistently let down by beantown's "southern" food, but there some bangers such as, milkweed. Although I did like those restaurants, they each left me in search for "southern" food in Boston. Well no more quotations b/c I've found the jackpot, and it's full of traditional Cajun dishes and tastefully crafted cocktails. I don't have to tell you how good my food was just go try it, your taste buds will thank you later. However, the taste of the sauce on the crab cakes made my soul leave for a second...good God, it was so good. Side-note: I got the pickled green beans and they were cold, which I didn't like but I'm sure someone will, just not me.> The ambiance gave it a Bourbon Street vibe. I ordered fried oysters and shrimp + grits ($38). The food was delicious, portions were filling and the drinks were strong. The friendly staff enhanced our experience. No complaints, not overpriced. Parking is tough - meter and garage only*

I went here on a Thursday for dinner. The place was packed. Service was very quick and efficient. We got the gongura paneer with garlic naan, chicken 65 and chicken boneless biriyani. Portions sizes were huge. Everything was very flavorful. We asked for mild and thoroughly enjoyed the food. This is not a fancy place, but the food is truly delicious. Thanks for a good experience!> Decent curries, but more of a fast food/take out place.   Plenty of parking and a decent selection... the place used to be like a KFC or something. Solid 3.5 stars. Nothing bad but nothing unique or better than most.> First time hereThe host was short and impatient I asked about tikki masala ( the only Indian dish i ever had and remembered). He said he didn't know what it wasNo smileA little annoyed We asked him about a few dishes and his response was " read it right here" while pointing to the menu. Very unfriendly and almost rude- why?I noticed him smiling and chatting it up with a couple of customers that came after us.  There was another guy who was really nice and also helped with our order. We asked for juice and he suggested a mango drink. He was kind and very helpful (Subbu) Anywho- I got the chicken vindalooIt was DELISH!!! Super spicy Super flavorfulMy LTEP ordered the chicken biryani which we absolutely did not like. The rice has a unique flavor and the boneless chicken was tough, crispy very different from any chicken I've ever had. The mango lassi that Subbu suggested was a creamy mango/yogurt drink that soothes the spice, cleaned the palate and was soooo yummy!!!  So so soo goodI enjoyed my dishI'll be back.> NAUSEATING!!!! The "chicken"  is ABSOLUTELY not chicken, but a rubbery-type substance. I LOVE Indian food and if this were my first time, I would have been very turned off by it. I could not eat it, ended up ordering from Sher-a-Punjab in Quincy Center and bringing the dish back the next day for a refund. NASTY!!!> Mayuri (aka, Bheema's) is one of the few Indian restaurants in the area that serves South Indian food, which is certainly on the spicy side. Some people on this site have said that this is a fast food restaurant. Not so!  It is definitely a sit down restaurant, but with a very casual atmosphere.But let the casual, sub shop style vibes fool you not! This is the tastiest Indian food I've had!Some of the other Indian restaurants in Quincy may have a more elegant vibe, but Bheema's has the tastiest food.  I really enjoy their biryani, Punugulu, and their several styles of dosa.Incidentally, I learned about Bheema's from some Indian colleagues I work with, so this restaurant serves authentic Indian cuisine.  If you're used to the North Indian cuisine that's so popular in this area, and you want to take a walk on the spicy, savory side, give Bheema's a try!

I've been wanting to try this place for quite some time and finally got the chance to order take out today for lunch! We got the Creamy Bean Paste Rice Noodles (D1), River Vermicelli (D6), Coconut Jello (E1), Yunnan Zongzi (E4) and they also threw in a free order of Winter Melon and Sweet Basil Seed Jello (E2)! Everything was delicious, especially the River Vermicelli and Jellos! The woman that we spoke to on the phone and when we came in to pick up was so nice and helpful and willing to answer any questions about the menu and provide recommendations. Overall, this place provided a great experience, even through just take out and I am looking forward to the chance of dining in when I can!> We had to ask where this little gem was situated! Turns out it's inside of the market area. We ordered some hot noodle soup's, which were delicious enough... And the manager offered us some samples of other items. The portions were very generous and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience.  I can't wait to go back and try other items. We tried the mushroom soup with noodles and the tomato broth soup with noodles. You can't go wrong with this place.  Delicious food and very

Duck. Scallop. Pork belly. What more could you ask for. All exactly the way they should be. Chips and salsa are good, prefer spicier but still great. Drinks are spot in. Music fit well. Vibe was perfect. Organized seating despite the smaller space. Don't give up trying to find parking, it's well wroth the effort.> So yummy!I came here with a friend on Saturday evening around 6:30pm. It was packed!We luckily got some seats at the bar after waiting about 20 minutes. We ordered 3 tacos each, and the chips and guacamole and were satisfied. My favorite taco was the scallop one, SO GOOD! My least favorite was the carne asada, it was a bit salty.In total, our bill was about $70 which included the drinks, guac and tacos. Not too bad.I would be mindful of parking and wait time as the place is very small.> Tried to dine here on a Saturday at 9:45pm. Was told by the front host that it would be 30min for a table for four. Since the restaurant was small we left to wait in the car. We waited 45 min and then returned to ask how much longer. She told us another 25min maybe. Honestly, super annoyed. Don't give us a bogus estimate or if it was beyond the time quoted you could've let us know so we didn't have to waste our time waiting only to be given another bogus time estimate. We left and went to the Lower Mills Tavern and got seated immediately. Please get your front host to estimate the time better and not waste our time.> Stopped by on a Friday night around 6 and waited an hour for 2 seats which wasn't too bad since we were able to leave and get a drink at another bar down the street. The restaurant is cozy with some cool decor. We ordered a variety of tacos including the fried fish, goat, and short rib. They were delicious and packed with meat. The goat was the only one that was slightly dry. We also ordered drinks that were well balanced and presented nicely. Can't wait for the South End location to open at the old Lions tail spot!> Great atmosphere from the moment you walk in. Very small not great for group but great for a relaxing chill day with a friend or two. Time of arrival, 6 pm, there wasnt a wait, but afterwards there was. Menu, food and drinks is very different from any other Taqueria but in a good way. We tried couple of different margaritas but Mango was the best so far. Daily Fish taco and Mezcal Shrimp tacos were great but my favorite of the night was the Duck Tacos! Nice portion of protein, crunch and freshness in every single bite. The Salmon Crudo is like well seasoned sashimi. The waitress was always checking on us and was very helpful with the menu.

Came in before the lunch rush. I ordered the Bun bowl.  The veggies are cut up very finel, extremely fine compared to other Viet restaurants I've been too.  Their fish sauce has a little more kick to it, which I didn't mind because I like spicy food.  Very happy with the food,  and the Viet iced coffee I had.  Will come back to try other items as well!> I wanted my Pho fixed today so I Yelped the closest one. I found this place, so I ordered and made my way there. I got there in about 10 minutes after I ordered and I checked the status of my order and it said it would be ready in about a half an hour.Instead of waiting I walked in and see how long my order would actually take. To my surprise, in about 5 minutes, the waiter came my food. I was impressed. I was on my way home and I received their phone call letting me know they forgot the broth for my Pho, which is the most important part.Luckily I was about only 10 minutes away. I drove back and had to wait another 5 minutes to get the broth. When I was actually given the broth, it was cold and although it's easy for me to heat it up in one of my pots, I shouldn't have to warm up food I just ordered.Overall, the food was really good but the service was questionable. The place was packed, but they should be able to handle traffic from pick up and dine in's. Instead of trying to get such fast service with food, make sure all items are there before the customer leaves. Would've love to give this place a 5, but today, they earned a 3.> I had to stop by Pho 98 after reading the awesome reviews on yelp. Their food and service is amazing. Definitely coming back when I come back into town.> The place wasn't to busy. Service was fine. Food came out fast. My mom got the Bun bo hue. She killed it. I got the broken rice with pork chop which came with shred pork, pork egg custard, fired egg. Everything tasty fine. Price was fairly decent. Probably, guess it another try.> This place has so many options on the menu, actually seems like it has at least a hundred things to choose from maybe even more. If you're looking for Pho this is the place... and should be hence the name lol... 3 different sizes to choose from. Very good and made fresh. Service also was very attentive, which is always a good thing and the prices are better than most Pho places that I've been to.

Pulled over to do some safe texting:Save a life.Don't text and drive.You know what it is...Anyways, smelled BBQ.Got caught up in the rapture of love.Had to investigate.Got A-Plus service from Todd.Met Bryce and Mindie.And the baby back ribs were like that!Yup. Yup.:)> SOO expensive! The food was alright. I got the Brisket, pretty good, mostly. Real hit or miss seeing as half of it was tough. The Love In A Cup was soupy, mac and cheese tasted like soft pasta & salt. The Saint Louis Ribs & BBQ chicken were pretty good & the corn bread was AMAZING & the cole slaw was a 6/10. Probably won't go back, maybe once for a sandwich. Maybe I listened to the hype too much> New place that popped up a month ago. Got the smoked beef brisket sandwich and the Jumbo wings. Also got the house BBQ and Mustard sauce.The service was great. Welcoming and nice employees and although there were some items that they ran out of, the things I did get (right before they closed) were moist, nice touch of smoke and tasted great. Would recommend and will definitely go again.> Space is dirty. Food is gross. All smoke, no flavor. Squishy overcooked Mac and cheese. Sold a "dog bone" that gave my dog a bowel obstruction (even though I took it away when it cracked like they instructed.) He spent 2 days in the hospital and it cost $1700. I hope they've stopped selling those. DO NOT GIVE YOUR DOG THEIR BONES.> I picked up ribs and poutine,both were terrible, nothing redeeming , smelled and tasted wrong, I have had lots of bad bbq but def the worst.Would have been nice Quincy needs good bbq

Authentic and real Turkish cuisine at its best! Was talking  with chef and oh boy! This guy can cook traditional Turkish fare like no other. Great job every time, now with a new Ali Baba in Charlestown and free parking!! Love it.> Ali Baba is a Turkish restaurant that is a bit off the beaten path at the edge of South End.  So it wasn't too surprising that it was quiet during our weekend lunch visit.Since the chef wasn't scheduled to arrive till noon, their version of pizza -  the pide - was out of the question, but everything else was available.  So, six of us shared the following:Falafel appetizer $7 for 6 crispy flat piecesKotfa Kebab $15 reg plate (Turkish meatballs) 4 hunksChicken Chops $16 reg plate (chicken thighs) 3 flattened portionsLamb Shish Kebab $18 reg plate (cubes of lamb) 3 skewersChicken Shish Kebab $16 reg plate (chunks of white meat chicken) 3 skewers+hummus $2+babaganoush $2(a max of two dips for $2 apiece could be added to a plate:hummus, tabulih, babaganoush, spicy vegetable dip, labni - save your bread for this)Kunefe $7Their entrees come sized in small or regular, served with bulgur, salad and homemade bread.  Ours were all regular portions, since we would be sharing, and we happened to order just enough for our appetitesEverything was good, but I preferred the dark chicken over the white, and the kofte a tad over the lamb cubes.  We felt the meats to be more strongly seasoned over the chicken, in a good way.  The falafel was good here with a nice crisp crust.  Though it would have been better with a flatbread, but still I enjoyed the two spreads we picked with ripped pieces of the homemade bread.The kunefe took 15 minutes, and was sweet, yet not overly so, with the honey water.  The savory cheese was mild yet added a nice tenderness in contrast to the crisp phyllo strings.  We were full, so a bite apiece was just about perfect.Service was pleasant, even though we kept interrupting her for water, for another plate, for spoons, etc.  And she ran after us in the rain to return the credit card we had accidentally left behind.> Are you hungry, but it's already midnight and Boston is shutting down? No worries! Ali Baba is here for you (until 3:15 or 4:15 am, depending on the day). AND, it's food you would want to eat no matter what time it is (unlike a lot of those other late night eateries). I've had a few different things here and they've all been incredible. Fresh and perfectly cooked. I highly recommend the lamb kebab (split between two people if you get the regular size). It comes with a fresh salad, delicious bread, and a flavorful bulgur (grain kind similar to rice).  There's some seating inside if you'd like to sit, or they also have relatively rapid takeout and delivery options.> A really cute family owned business with delicious and reasonably priced food! We got the Adana Kebab and the Doner, with papaganoush as a side. Both were absolutely delicious! The meat was juicy and flavorful, the rice (we asked our waiter what it was but I forgot) was hearty, and both even come with a roasted pepper that was quite an adventure (if you like spicy). I recommend stopping by if you're looking for great Turkish food for cheap!> Super delicious food, make sure you order the lamb lamachun and the chicken mixed grill. This place is perfect after a night out drinking since they're open until 3:15am. Hands down, one of the best places I've eaten at in Boston.

Clean place, friendly service, and great food. My go to hangover food. Def best dumplings and wonton in this area> Got the pork belly rice for lunch. It was good and flavorful but not $12 good. Compare to the ones in Chinatown, it's on par in terms of quality but not the quantity. I would value my order to be at $8 overall and maybe $7 should there be a lunch special offer. The service was great however, the owner, Jenny I assume, was very nice and ready to help. The prepare time was fast. It's a nice space, so I would recommend it if you want to find a decent spot to eat and hangout with friends or if you are craving for Chinese, otherwise it's not worth it.> Excellent new spot with spectacularly updated interior, comfortable seats, clean tables and great service.The lanzhou beef noodle soup ($10.99) is a bowl of fiery beef broth. It comes with a soy cured egg. Cold beef shank slices are presented neatly atop a pile of springy la mian noodles. Plenty of cilantro and chili peppers garnish the rich, deep brown broth. Flavoring is decidedly rich with beef flavor but complex with other proteins as well.The pork belly buns ($8.99) are two to an order. The soft rice buns hold a thick, extra crisp slice of luscious pork belly. Sliced cucumber and a dollop or plum sauce make each mouthful succulent.The menu has a selection of dumplings, ramen soups, cold appetizers and other noodle dishes.Absolutely worth seeking out this tiny new addition to the Quincy food scene.> Place is kinda cute, but the food was just okay. Price is average but nothing really stand out. Service is good, the server is nice. We will come back couple months later see if the food improved.> very clean interior and tasty food. I got the soup dumplings and they were very good. The beef and onion dumplings were very crispy and juicy as well. The beef vermicelli had the perfect level of spice and the drunken chicken had a very good flavor. The Dandan noodles were also very tasty.The lady boss was also very friendly and helpful. Total came out to around to $37 which is very good given the amount of food. 10/10 would come again!

reviews: I'll admit I spent a solid 20 minutes looking at Yelp reviews and the online menu before coming here and STILL couldn't decide what to order. The menu has such a wide selection of udon, rice dishes, and sides, so I pretty much wanted to try everything on the menu. I eventually landed on the wagyu udon with truffle dashi, which was so fragrant and delicious. The portion was truly massive, so I'd say the steeper prices are totally justified. On top of that, the service was amazing - my server took the time to run through the entire menu with us and was super attentive throughout our meal. The mood lighting and cozy feel really added to the ambiance and make this a great date spot as well.> 3 stars... Because one order is good and another is ... Rediculous. First order of Sukiyaki was full of meaty goodness, packed with great flavor. The second one... Curry udon with a single piece of small beef the size of a pinky nail, like serious. A single. Piece. Of. Beef. Not to mention, the beef was dry and tough, and I only live 2 minutes away. Overall my girlfriend enjoyed the meal... But I didn't, since the curry udon was my order. But at least the curry taste ok. Still overpriced for the quality.Update: they forgot the egg in the Sukiyaki udon. Lowered to 2 stars.> I heard from friends that Tsurutontan is opening a new location Boston aside from NY, so decided to check it out and it was pretty satisfying. There can be a few improvements, but it can slide since they only opeNed recently. I called for a reservation at noon for a evening dinner, but there reservation is full so we decided to walk in. We waited near the bar for more than 30 mins before being called. The waiting space isn't too big so it can get hot quickly. Good thing they have a coat check. The drinks we ordered at the bar while waiting (Tokyo Mule) is too sweet and lack alcoholic content. Would like to see them do better there. Once we were sat, the service was on point. He carefully explained the types of noodles, how it was made fresh in house daily, how regular and double size cost the same and his recommendations. We ordered the lamb chop for appetizer for 4 people, My friends and I ended up getting the wagyu udon with truffle and dashi, another got the wagyu sukiyaki with egg. It was very delicious and I slurped and drank all the soup. Overall it only came out to 35 dollars a person which isn't bad at all.To have the best experience, make sure to reserve ahhh and avoid the waiting. Maybe stay away from the cocktails for now and ordeR the wagyu udon it's a must try.> A solid udon place! I ordered the stir fry udon and it was a little oily but tasty. We also ordered a curry udon and another udon soup, which everyone enjoyed. They have the option for thin or thick cut udon and we all opted for thick cut udon. They also have the option for regular or large size for the same price! Large would just have more udon and soup, not more of the dish ingredients. Of course we had to all order large for the leftovers! The atmosphere was also very comfortable and modern. They have the two floors of seating and both are decorated nicely. Would return again!> A new udon spot in town! I have the opportunity to try Tsurotontan a couple of times since it's opening. This restaurant has locations in Hawaii and NYC as well. The restaurant is huge and I love the set up of this place. They have 2 stories so there is plenty of room to enjoy a delicious bowl of udon. I highly recommend the happy hour! This is available in the bar area only. You get a variety selection of their sushi and appetizers at a good deal! The sashimi was super good quality and fresh. I was super satisfied with a few rolls and appetizers with another friend. The only downside is that the udon is not available! I went back on another occasion for the udon. The udon is around $20 and seems pricey but it comes in a monstrous size serving bowl filled with delicious ingredients! I got the tsurotontan deluxe. You have an option to select the thickness of the udon. I like them extra thicc, so of course I went with the thickest option. The udon was super chewy and delicious. Each noodle was wrapped up with the delicious umami broth. Their udon is handmade in house and I can definitely taste the difference. The servers here are super attentive and helpful in recommending different options to try. There are so many lot different types of udons to choose from and I will have to come back to try other ones!

The "rolls" here are superb.  Fresh and the light seasoning allows you to enjoy the exceptionally quality of the lobster. Not overwhelmed with mayo at all. The bun is lightly toasted with a buttery taste.Even the complementary water is Brita filter and chilled. That is a class touch I have not seen.  A must when in Back Bay.> Busy working lunch - needed a good go-to option for quality to-go ordersLukes was a simple click away and my team was well taken care of by the crew at Lukes Lobster Arrived for the pick up and all was ready to go !!The team enjoyed !!!> Really cute place! Came here to get the classic lobster roll, and it was pretty good! Well toasted bread, butter, and fresh lobster. We also got the combo and tried both the lobster bisque and the clam chowder. Both were decent, but I liked the clam chowder better. The service here was really great though! I also liked how the combo came with cute drinks (I got a blueberry wildflower honey lemonade). I feel like definitely a staple for the Boston experience.> Really really good lobster roll!  I stopped in for a quick meal late evening just before they closed. Not busy, walked right up. I went for the Luke's Trio with soup. It's the combo of threee mini rolls and a cup of soup. Shrimp roll, crab roll, and a lobster roll. The meat was so sweet and delicious. The rolls slathered in butter and oh so perfectly toasted. I went with the cup of clam chowder (lobster bisque also an  option) and it was amazing. Creamy, delicious, and loaded with clams. The trio came with a drink and will usually just pass on the drink and opt for water I did indulge this time. Craft bottled root beer. Rounded out this simple yet absolutely delicious meal. Not cheap but not out of line for seafood, the trio was $29 and $31 if you had I it with the chowder like I did. I will be back for sure!> One of my to go spots when I'm in Boston, they are good quick and delicious. Every time I have visited Boston I come to Luke's. They don't disappoint. They have a good atmosphere and centrally located. The quality is really good as well, and the staff is amazing, sweet and helpful! If you're looking for a quick bite but also something that good and very delicious this is the spot. I usually get the hot lobster roll because it's buttery and delicious and my boyfriend likes the cold lobster roll which is also mouth-watering. Their clam chowder soup is also one of my favorites with a side of chip I am in heaven, writing this review is making me crave them and want a roll. Soon I will be back!

reviews: Amazing service, delicious food, big smiles.  Loved ordering from this place.  I am based in our NYC office but needed a catered lunch while working in our Cambridge office this week.  They were on time and everything was sooooo good.  Curry vegetables/veggie delight was my favorite but everything was delicious.  I called them and asked them to bring take out containers and the delivery guys had already left, but they drove back to the restaurant to get us a bunch so we could take leftover food home.  Really recommend.> I went there for the first time today. I had the oxtails, rice and peas with sweet plantinans . The oxtail were okay but the beans and rice left an after taste in my mouth, I think it is an acquired taste. It may have been the cloves which I do not like.   They are also stingy with the oxtails and added dumplings to the oxtail. It makes you think you have a decent portion of meat when there are actually dumplings hiding under.. A size large dinner will give you enough rice and beans for two people, but the meat will fall shortThe food was okay but not for me as I am someone who easily get overwhelmed with the taste of cloves.> Clean place. I sat inside to eat.  I like that it's  not just a takeout place. I ordered a medium jerk chicken. The rice and peas was delicious.  The chicken was good, but it came straight out the oven and didn't have time to rest. I think it will be better next time. Price was very reasonable.> Waited 2hrs for a delivery of curry shrimp and white rice with salmon and veggies. We live about 10 minutes from the place so thats already an issue. On top of that, they claimed to have "delivered" the meal to my address, but we did not receive a phone call telling us delivery was here. So they gave our food to some dickhead i assume. And this is the second time ive ordered from here just to not receive any food. I'm not fucking with this place, that honestly turned me off but if you do be careful with your card. I would rate it a 0 if i could.Update hours later: the delivery driver left the food on the porch so i had 2 cold ass plates of food sitting in 30 degree weather. Fuck these people, honestly.> I'm writing this review as I await for them to open. Their breakfast is... *chef kiss*. I usually go for the dumpling, yam, ackee n saltfish breakfast and it's nothing short of delicious. In our community, you'll hear funny antidotes about Caribbean food service , especially those from JA but here those unfair stereotypes definitely do not exist here.  Service is quick, clean, orderly and served with a smile.

Came here for dinner on Sunday and enjoyed everything we ate. Unfortunately the lighting was too low so I was unable to capture any of the food but more than happy to tell you what we ordered:- Brussel sprouts ( AMAZING!!! ) you have to order these, not sure why but they reminded me of the taste of lettuce wraps but I was obsessed - Fried Chicken ( Delish! ) not my favorite dish we received but they were tender and the sauce they came with was finger licking goooood- Prawns with curry ( By far my favorite ) it comes with vegetables on the side, slightly spicy if you are unable to handle spicy but my goodness the flavors were to die for!- Pad Thai with shrimp ( fabulous ! ) since we were sharing the plates and they knew that one of us could not handle spicy they put the chili peppers on the side. Very accommodating and it has lots of beans sprouts which I loved!- Pork ribs  ( spice galore ! ) I think I finished four glasses of water to get through the pork ribs but they were fantastic they fell off the bone they were tender chef Gordon Ramsay would come back for these. Finally for dessert we tried their pumpkin custard which was one of the bartenders grandmother's recipes and let me tell you it did not disappoint. It wasn't sweet but it wasn't savory it was the perfect amount to finish the night. I will definitely be coming back here with my boyfriend!Of note you can't make any reservations and there's a limited seating so get there early and bon appétit!> Food was great! Actually some of it like the pork belly dish was mind blowing! Cocktails were exceptional as well. I would have given this place 5 stars (if I am a person that normally writes Yelp reviews that is). I mean everything was amazing. Except for the bartender who claimed to be the owner. For context, I would like to educate people about my current immigration status as well as  information about federal IDs. I used to be an international student (go ahead, ignore this already, I don't care). I used to be on a visa called an F1 visa that you can convert to a work permit. When you do so, you get what is called an Employment Authorization Card or an EAD. It turns out an EAD has your picture, your birth date and more information than your driver's license can ever have. For this reason, airports use this "federal ID" as an ID to let you into..you know..domestic airplanes..which is probably a bigger deal than getting a drink at a random new bar we happened to chance upon that night! But the bartender who also claimed to be the owner claimed there are "state laws" prohibiting use of IDs that are not state ids. For reference I am 29 so I am flattered but also pissed because this is a federal ID I use at airports. I said him so and he dismissed me by saying "I have been a student and I know what goes on. I would like to follow state laws". State laws still mandate that you accept any "federal id". If you don't know what a federal ID means, I guess this review is a lesson. If you are a racist, I guess I cant do anything about that. Oh btw for readers, I did manage to get more than one drink here that night. It was because I showed an EXPIRED state ID (because I am lazy to renew my state ID when everyone accepts my EAD card). This guy didn't even check that it was expired. I think as a conclusion I would like to say: Know the state laws, know what a federal ID actually means, stop saying you were a student once.I guess I was really offended because I have never before written a Yelp review for the best of the best restaurants I have been to and this doesn't fall into that for sure!> Drinks: Thai infused Sazerac onand a honey drink on the right(forgot what spirit is in there). But both cocktails were delicious. The honey one is sweet with the perfect acidity and the sazerac is like Thai tea and old fashion with bitters in a perfect proportion. Also got the Thai tea: AMAZING! Food:Pork Ribs | delicious, with hints of lemongrass and great flavors of spicy, sweet, and saltiness. Crab Curry | The flavors reminded me of the best curry I had in Thailand. Delicious. It's spicy. Might be a bit too spicy for some people so maybe ask for adjusted spicy level if you can't handle heat. Grilled Calamari | This was mehhh. The calamari wasn't really grilled, there weren't any charred marks, not enough smoky flavor. Tastes more like blanched. The sauce was pretty good though. Parking/ Transportation :Parking might be a bit challenging. There are metered parking on the street and a parking lot close by ( Kent/Webster Place: behind the barbeque restaurant). This restaurant is right by the brookline village T stop. Very convenient for people with no cars. Service/Ambiance:Very nice people. Got a seat for two in 30mins on a Friday night when they first opened. Seems like they are all Thai. The space has a sense of funky vibe with upbeat tunes at night.> Newly opened spot in Brookline village. Artful cocktails and thai food.  They have a list of signature cocktails,  and also Leo and Singha beers. PROS:  Unique tapas of delicious Thai dishes. While they have the staple Pad thai,  it's not the version you're probably used to at the local thai place.  It's much better! Pad Thai:  It came with 3 large shrimp perfectly cooked. Great flavor. A little bit of spice. Beautiful presentation.  You will mix it yourself to get those flavors nicely combined.  Bean sprouts,chili, ground peanuts. And I think green papaya. Beef Tartare:  definitely spicy!  So good. Great mixture of raw beef and what I assume were thai chilis.  It's not for everyone.  If you don't like raw beef or spicy food,  this isn't your dish. Crab Curry:  deliciously creamy and spicy with chunks of sweet crab.  This is a "must get" dish.  Again,  it has a bit of a kick.  CONS:  Tough parking in the area. The restaurant is a bit small.  Not much information online about it yet.  Not sure if they take reservations.  OVERALL:   You should absolutely come to this place.   It's awesome.  Great food,  friendly staff.> I feel a little bad for the 1st less than stellar review here, but maybe my expectations were hyped a bit. I first heard about the opening on an Eater article and was very excited to try. The location and ambiance: Its mainly street parking, but I had no trouble finding a spot on a Wednesday night. The inside was dimly lit and a perfect setting for a cozy date night. The restaurant was relatively small, I'm guessing 8-10 tables all together, but this adds to the cozy date-night feel. We didn't have any trouble grabbing a table, but shortly after us, there was a small wait. The servers were all very attentive and accommodating, our water glasses were never empty. The food: A full bar, with lots of wine and beer, but only a handful of cocktails on the menu right now, I'm guessing more will be added. I dint get a chance to try the drinks but they sounded delicious. My main concern was with the pork cheeks and the fried chicken. Both were flavorful, but seemingly overcooked. The pork cheeks were a bit hard, and difficult to chew. The fried chicken was slightly drier than I expected for dark meat. Overall, I think this is a cute spot for a date if your'e grabbing drinks mainly, and maybe 1-2 plates to share, but I don't think this will be a regular spot for me.
