reviews: Orinoco has been a neighborhood staple of the South End for at least the 5 years I've lived here. Authentic, delicious Venezuelan food, with the traditional staples, and some more creative dishes.  No need for reservations on most weekdays, which combined with the reasonably priced fare, delicious food, and excellent service has made Orinoco my favorite local spot.> Yum!Came here for lunch with 5 of my coworkers and we were well fed. Two of us got salads, and the rest got sandwiches that came With  plantain chips. I got the remolacha con cabré salad, and it was SO good! That and an appetizer left me satisfied. (The tequenos are delish!)From from my coworkers said, the sandwiches were AMAZING. Can't wait to try one. If you work  in the area, it's a great place for lunch.> Pretty darn good. Ordered the Parilla Caraquena sampler platter on a dark, rainy night.Definitely hit the spot. The seasoned strip steak was tender, the chicken, guasacaca and chorizo were flavorful, and the hot sauce was incredible. Just kept pouring it on even though it made me sweat up a storm.Great spot to celebrate an occasion for sure.> Empanada trio sampler was very good. The Carne asada and cheese one were my favorite. Service was good. Neat hidden location with a nice interior ambiance. They have 2 other locations. Arepas were a bit cold to where the cheese wasn't melted and the guacamole cold cooling it even more. The plantein could've been a little softer to my taste. My mother's Venezuelan and makes better arepas than this. 'It aint like mama fixed it.' Bathrooms were clean. $36 for 3 of us with waters.> Haven't had better latin food in the Boston area until now. Orinoco did everything absolutely right for me. Went here for brunch recently, but I came across this place for the first time during a food tour of the Southend. They're bacon wrapped dates and sweet plantains will leave your mouth watering for more. The eggs and arepas were both on point! The beans were probably more flavored than I would have expected and the shredded pork did not disappoint. I also would recommend their red sangria. 5 stars and a must do in the Southend. I think this is a great place for dinner, lunch, and brunch. Basically all of the above! The seating area on the inside is a bit small, but on a Sunday afternoon they aren't too crowded. Also, the SoWa market is like a 16 minute walk from the restaurant so if you're looking to make a day out of this you'd definitely have options.

Amazing tacos! We got the grilled chicken, carne asada and the chorizo (multiples of each). Definitely some of the best I've had around Boston. The guacamole was fresh, refried beans were yum and meat was juicy. Would surely recommend and come back for more!> After getting out of the 1917 showing at AMC south bay, my tummy roared and told me to feed it.  It was after 9pm and not much was still opened.  I found Chilacates closing at 10pm and asked WWVDD?  (What would Vin Diesel Do?)  He would make it as did I.Drove up and past it looking for street parking, had to go a block down to find a spot.  The place is small, bar style that seats about a dozen in total.  It reminds me of coughchipotlecough, the way they're set up, but smaller, much much smaller, but much more authentic (of course).  As i approached the food bar I saw the proteins were a bit dry since it was nearing closing time.  we ordered a burrito de lengua with salsa verde and guac, one (1) fish taco, and one horchata, which totaled $24.  the couple items i added to the burrito really added things up quickly.  the burrito was really on point.  the salsa verde and guac with the lengua was a legit combo and Chilacates' flavors did not disappoint.  i didn't get to try the fish taco but it was made to order with the fish freshly fried.    the horchata didn't disappoint.  they didn't skimp on the cinnamon, it wasn't watered down like some places i've been, and it wasn't pumped full of sugar.  instead, it was a nice flavorful thick not too sweet horchata.overall i definitely come back but would watch what i tack on as they really add up quick.> Coming from CA where the Mexican food is plentiful, this place doesn't impress taco wise. But compared to its competition here in Boston, it earns its hype. The tortillas are soft, and they give lots of meat (a necessity to be great imo). I've also had the burritos here, which are small compared to my West coast burritos. Especially at the price point. However, I do love love love the tortas. Pretty hefty portion, and super tasty. I got it with the chorizo con papas, yummmm. I'm definitely coming back for more of these. I saw that they had breakfast foods too! Something to keep an eye out for as well.> After an amazing tour at the Samuel Adams brewery, we were hungry. Chilacates was just around the corner and was the perfect food after a day of drinking. It's a small place with not much seating available. There's just a bar area with stools. Not great for crowd, but great for a small group. I got their three taco plate. You only get one choice of meat. I made the mistake of thinking I could do more. When I got my food I realize why I couldn't do multiple meats. The tacos came deconstructed and you would basically need to make it yourself. The tortilla was a bit thicker than I thought it would be as well. The carnitas was good. Very flavorful. The side of pineapple salsa went amazing with it all. The taste of sweet and savory...delicious. The rice was good, but the beans wasn't my favorite. It was lacking some flavor. Love this place.> Great, fresh tacos. Not quite LA, but we're not in LA! I love getting the lengua (tongue), fish, and al pastor tacos. The horchata is really refreshing and tasty as well.

I've been to the Orinoco in Harvard Square a handful of times, but never to the Brookline location. I stopped in to have a late lunch with some friends from out of town after we visited NETA. ;)We chose Orinoco mainly because they serve wine, and the red wine they recommended was quite tasty. The food is always delicious, and the menu at this location is the exact same as the Harvard square location. We had an order of the bacon-wrapped dates, an order of taquenos, an arepa, and two orders of beef empanadas that each come with a FRESH tasty salad. (The salads here are seriously amazing - their dressing has the perfect amount of sweetness and tang). We could not choose what we liked best because it was all so good. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. I'd definitely be back to eat here again if I was in the area!> I decided to write my review after my third time at Orinoco, and I'd say it's been an up and down experience, so I'm settling on 3/3.5 stars. Would most likely come back at some point, but it's not somewhere I'd go out of my way to return to.Food: The food here is good. It's not great, but good. The Arepas are just okay and I would skip them (I get 2-3 to share every time I've gone, only to be disappointed by them). It didn't help that the last time I went they definitely brought the wrong one over and I only noticed after biting into it (wrong cheese), but wasn't going to complain. The entrees are overall pretty good, but they again vary depending on the entrée. I had the FIS on my list visit and while it was overall pretty good, the mission fig/brussels sprout slaw was very disappointing. However, I've had a good experience with the costilitas, and the asado negro (the plantains here are good). Drinks: I haven't had much of an experience here with their drinks, but have heard from friends that their sangrias taste fairly watered down/off. Their cocktail menu (in Brookline) hasn't intrigued me much.Service: Service has generally been one of the weaker points here. Whether its been bringing the wrong Arepas to the table, or not bringing items at all (yuca fries, which are generally pretty good when they do come).Ambience: The décor here is pretty cool and is unfortunately one of the better points. Overall will maybe return at some point, just definitely not in the near future.> Wow! What a dinner we just had at Orinoco. The restaurant had been on my list to try for like ever and I don't know why we waited this long to dine it. The place is cute and the service is spectacular. We started off with non-alcoholic drinks- Guayaba (Guava) and Guanabana(soursop). Both we were told are freshly made at the restaurant and tasted fantastic. The soursop was our favorite, and unlike the name it wasn't really sour haha.Most of the dishes are tapas style. Our favorites were- -Cocas del Dia: Spanish flatbread Guayaba with guava preserve, goat cheese, arugula, fig glaze.-Cachapas : corn pancakes stuffed with cheese-Maracuchitos: queso Paisa wrapped in sweet plantains -Yuca fries,-Verde Empanadas: stuffed with mushrooms, piquillo peppers and Manchego cheese; with a fresh greens salad.-Jardinera Arepa: Guayanés cheese, sweet plantains, guasacaca-And the cherry on the cake was their Torta fluida Dessert, which is served in this unassuming disposable foil cup. The first bite will take you back to when the simple things in life made you grin from ear to ear. It is decadent, not overly sweet and is a must order if you like anything related to chocolate.Cannot wait to go back!!> Food has always been predictably good, but service is the worst. I called ahead and put our name down to ensure our getting the table because we had to drive to town. Arrived, but the host (sonya) gave the last table to another party of two (why did we even bother to call).After waiting for a while, they sat us at the booth right by the door that was extremely cold because people keep coming in and out. It was freezing even with my jacket on. I asked the host to sit us in the other booth, also open, exactly the same size and type, in the back. And she said, "no, because that booth has to be for four people." So there we were sitting in the cold. Full jacket on and such. And two minutes later they sat TWO people on that booth we asked for. Absolutely no care for their customers.Also, when you arrive, look up to the ceilings and the light fixtures. It must have been years since they last dusted this place.> Get the beef! The beef in the pabellon Criollo had a really well balanced flavor profile and was absolutely delicious. We also really enjoyed the peach jam in the polvorosa de Pollo. The salad was incredibly fresh. While at first we thought the prices for the dishes were a little steep, we were surprisingly stuffed at the end of our meals and thought it was well worth the price. We came for lunch and the restaurant wasn't too crowded, had great music and friendly service.

menu_dishes: Tofu Soup, 1. LA Kalbi, 2. Spicy Pork, 3. Mackerel, 4. Seafood Soybean Pancake
reviews: So yummy! And top notch customer service - They forgot to send us a notification when it was our turn in line (checked in on Yelp) - we spoke to a nice lady about the situation, they checked with their system to confirm, and seated us at the next possible table! You can tell they really value customers. Food is so good too.> i've never had any form of tofu stew before and never been to any of the other tofu houses around so this was my first experience. came here on a pretty busy day but the line was quick. tofu stew and rice were great. the tofu was excellent but i tried looking around to figure out how i'm supposed to eat it with the rice and got no good answers. i ended up asking for a separate bowl, putting a scoop of rice in there along with some stew and just eating it that way. the side dishes seem to be what everyone is raving about but as someone who didn't eat half of them, it was hard to get in on the hype. loved the kimchi and loved the cucumbers. i don't eat fish and don't like shrimp with a head, especially when it's raw, so that was 2 that i couldn't eat. i'm reading the other reviews now and realizing the side dishes are unlimited? had i known this, i would've kept going back for more kimchi! the portion size was good, i ate most of it. the meal was so hearty. the staff was super nice and understanding when i couldn't understand how to order since it was my first time. i would definitely be more excited about this place if i liked all the side dishes. i wasn't planning on coming back but armed with this new knowledge about unlimited side dishes, i'm considering future trips!> FOOD + SERVICE 5/5!!!! What I got:TOFU SOUP- Choose your toppings, I got sausage! Each soup comes with an egg and you get to customize the level of heat you want. It was PERFECTLY MILD just the way I like it. It had the perfect amount of tofu too, like I didn't have much soup to tofu ratio left over like I normally do at other places. I upgraded my rice to NUTRITIOUS RICE and it was soooo worth the additional $4.95. It's purple rice with TONS of vegetables and other garnishes like sweet potato, mushrooms, chickpeas, pine nuts, etc. When I take a scoop of the rice with the soup, you can taste a sweetness each bite, it's hard to explain but you have to try it for yourself. SO TASTY. The OYSTER RICE (also additional charge) was also really good with generous amounts of oysters. This meal itself definitely fills you up, but of course I tried other things too. LA KALBI- Literally melts in your mouth. Each piece was meaty and grilled just right, tasting sweet and tender. It's a great amount of short ribs for the price you pay. You can even taste the subtle smokiness each bite. This was such a highlight. MACKEREL- lightly seasoned, not too salty. To be honest I was afraid I wouldn't like this dish because I'm picky with fish dishes, but it was really good and caught me by surprise for sure. Once you pinch some lemon, mmmmmm so tasty. And there's little to no bones at all (A PLUS). ALSO, the banchan is UNLIMITED. You're not getting a bunch of random side dishes, but quality and fresh ones. The raw soy marinated shrimp was something I wasn't used to but so glad I got to try. You start your meal with fresh made tofu and soy sauce, and end it in a traditional Korean cinnamon drink that cleanses all the flavors after. From start to finish, you're seriously in for a such a treat. The food was tasty, and the service was FANTASTIC. Everyone was super helpful and informative, always checked in to see how we're doing and even offered more banchan (which is pretty rare if you ask me). I absolutely can't wait to go back!> This is my favorite Korean restaurant in Boston. Kim's Tofu, keep up the great work! Several nice little surprises throughout the meal. I left feeling very nourished and well-fed. They focus on quality ingredients, and it feels like home cooking. What really won me over are the extra little things that come with the meal that were so well done, which were the banchan (side dishes), tea, and dessert drink. The banchan: My favorites were the fried fish and raw shrimp. My friend really liked the kimchi. You also get tofu in an interesting consistency and a paired sauce. The fish seemed freshly fried, still crispy. The main course: My favorite was the upgrade to nutritious rice which has beans, mushrooms, sweet potato, and ?potato with purple rice. We got the seafood soondubu and seafood pancake. The seafood pancake dough was a little grittier instead of smooth because it's made from ground soybeans. I think it made it less oily. My palate is not refined enough to detect the difference in soondubu compared to that of other restaurants; it was very good! Ended with a complementary small cup of a cinnamon-ginger drink.The atmosphere: new and quite large restaurant for Allston. Ample seating and busy on Saturday night.The service: Very friendly! When we asked for a refill on one of the side dishes that were out, our waitress gave us a new delicious side dish we hadn't had yet (my best guess soy sauce eggs with beef). Definitely check it out if you're into Korean food!> First time here. Came around 5:30, the seats were empty. Service was okay. Environment was just ok. Let's talk about the food. The kimchi tofu soup was average although the tofu was fresh. The soup was good when it was hot but after awhile it became a Little salty. The oyster rice was definitely not fresh(of course I meant the oyster wasntthe fresh). We also got the beef dish galbi, which was definitely overpriced and not worth it because it was too dry. Not gonna come back.

This is one of the hidden gems in Quincy. If you don't know the location of this place, you can easily walk right past it. Me and my boyfriend comes to this spot for food every weekend. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. They offer quite a selection of authentic Vietnamese food and Banh Mi, desserts and drinks. They sometimes get quite busy, especially in the morning. We came here around mid afternoon, so it wasn't too busy. We decided to get the Shrimp Spring Rolls, Banh Cuon, Banh Canh Tom Thit and Milk Tea. It was quite cold outside so the Banh Canh Tom Thit was a great selection for this kind of weather. It's a noodle soup with pork and shrimp. The noodles looks like udon noodles, but these are made with a mixture of tapioca flour and rice flour. Their milk tea was amazing and one of the best I've had so far. This place is great for when you want to grab a quick bite, by food to go or just sit down and eat. if you don't see a menu, you can ask them for one. Everything on the menu is a must try and so far, I havent been disappointed woth anything. Love stopping by here for food every weekend.> My go to banh mi in Quincy. For a no frills $5 banh mi, this is the place to be! I usually get the cold cuts with everything minus jalapeños. They have a $10 min for using card so I usually grab two and save one for later. They also have noodle soups and Viet desserts on the menu that I have yet to try!> Lee Han has become my go-to for banh mi and one of my favorite takeout spots for food in Quincy. Everything that I have tried here has been delicious and reasonably priced. I also love that they open at 7AM daily - it means I can stop by before work if I ever forget to make lunch the night before!I'd recommend any of the banh mi's, the bo kho/beef stew (!!), and the green steamed layer cake (unsure of the name) they have on the counter. Their drinks, like the milk tea with grass jelly and flan, are all good too but they go heavy with the condensed milk/sweetener so be warned.The one "negative" thing I have to say about this place is my experience calling in for a pickup order twice within the same week. I called a couple of hours before closing one day and asked if I could order two banh mi's... and they were sold out! I was both confused and sad because I was craving banh mi for a while and I was wondering how a banh mi shop could run out way before closing lol. So, since I was still craving it, I called back another time the same week for pickup. This was about 30 min to an hour before closing. I made sure they still had banh mi available and the lady said they did, so I started placing my order and then she said something along the lines of "oh... we are closing soon... but you can still order and pick up if you come in within 15 minutes ." Okay, that wasn't an issue, I was nearby anyway so I continued my order - "oh actually we don't have any more banhmi." Bro wat. I'm pretty sure she just didn't want to take my order.I won't let the little incident deter me from going back though because the food is delicious and my in-store experiences have been fine. I'll just make note to not phone-in any orders anymore!> What a gem! You would make the mistake of walking right past Lee Han's if nobody told you about it. But you're making a mistake because this place is good. Really good. Like get in my car and drive "all" the way from Somerville good. My partner and I come by here once or twice a month and just order everything. I'm not lying, if I try to get her to stop there's a fight. Enough personal problems.  I'm not gonna know the name of everything I've ordered- but I'll do my best to describe it. Banh mi sandwiches are second to none. I would recommend it with the Vietnamese deli meat and pate. The spring rolls are always so good- even if you grab one in the middle of the day. The rice wrapped shrimp paste with spring rolls and meat is also really good. Love all the different textures and it tastes so fresh! The triple dessert is also a blessing- super tasty! They always have a bunch of different stuff going on, so I suggest trying a few classics and something new. I've been here at least 10-15 times and haven't had a bad meal. Also great to get a quality lunch for 2 under $20 (unless you're us and get everything). Love this place- highly recommend you give it a try!> Whether you're a girl or a manOr getting a sex change if you canIf you have a V or a DYou'll adore this Banh MiSo come get a sandwich from Lee HanNot to be confused with Luke Han, which are two dudes that saved the Starfleet and stuff.Of the three little spots I've tried within walking distance in North Quincy, this was the only one where I got some food. The Banh Mi sandwich here was excellent. It's a good sandwich, and still held up as a good sandwich the next day.Cheep and large (like your mother, I would know), hard and thick and long (like your father, I would know)... definitely a place I'll stop back for a sandwich next time I'm in the Quinnito.

I am in my 70s and have been eating at the Clam Box since 7Es closed many decades ago. I have been to pretty much all the seafood stands and restaurants north, West, and South of Boston including those "famous" Essex restaurants that were the very worst clams and scallops I have ever had anywhere. The Quincy Clam Box has, by far, the very best fried seafood around Boston. Tony isn't even close. Do yourself a favor and try the fried scallops.> Disappointed to write this review, more disappointed in my most recent experience. I have been a loyal customer to the clam box for years. My entire family near and far enjoy this spot throughout the open season. In the midst of the quarantine, I was happy to find them open for take out. However, after receiving my not fully cooked seafood platter , I am not a happy camper. Because of my loyalty I felt the right thing to do was call the owner and make him aware as this is a major health hazard. The owner simply said ok, no apology or offer to make it the situation right. L> All the talk about which place in Quincy is better and for the money, you gotta go with Clam Box. Just $19.95 for a clam plate w good hand cut fries and slaw. Clams were a bit over fried but tasty and for $8 less than Tony's down the street, I was happy. The lobster roll was also $7 or $8 less and instead of chips, you get a choice of any two sides. The onion rings were awesome and the roll was over flowing with lobster. Clam Box for the win.> This is my first time at the clam box since I usually go to tonys. I don't really see a difference . I ordered the clam strip plate that came with french fries and cole slaw. It was decent, nothing wow about it. I wish the cole slaw was more cold, but the workers plate out cole slaw on plates ahead of time so the fryers could work faster. It's good for efficient but leaving cole slaw out like that is gross and makes it warm, especially around the heat. Also expect a wait, the line and wait was pretty long but it is understandable since I came on a really nice day.> I can never understand why of the two Wollaston Beach fried seafood restaurants, The Clam Box and Tony's, most people consider Tony's to be the better one. I suppose if you want to base that on the furniture, Tony's tables and chairs are a little nicer, both inside and at the outside patio, but if you want to base it on the food served there's no way Tony's is better the The Clam Box.Look, I like both restaurants and have gone to the both of them more times than I can count. And I've gotten Fish & Chips, scallops, clams, and chicken fingers at both restaurants numerous times. And there's one thing I've consistently noticed, those food items I mentioned above taste nearly identical at either of the restaurants, they both do a great job cooking up fried seafood and chicken. But the one difference I've observed over and over is that The Clam Box serves you MORE FOOD for your dollar. For Fish & Chips they charge about the same prices but the Clam Box gives you more fish. Same for scallops, clams, and chicken fingers.Why people consider Tony's to be the better of the two is a mystery to me, unless people really care about the look of the interior of the restaurant more than the amount of tasty food they are getting for their dollar.

menu_dishes: Brussels Sprouts, Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Piquillo Hummus, Marcona Almonds, Migas, Chicken Liver Mousse, Pork Belly, Mushrooms a la Plancha, Pulpo a la Parrilla, Beef Tartare, Mussels al Ajillo, Blistered Shishito, Monkfish a la Plancha, Chorizo with Sweet and Sour Figs, Prawns a la Plancha, Grilled Hanger Steak, Gambas al Ajillo, Seared Tuna, Pan con Tomate, Grilled Morcilla, Potato Tortilla, Spinach and Chickpea Cazuela, Jamon and Manchego Croquettes, Boquerones, Spiced Beef Empanadas, Albondigas, Patatas Bravas, Spicy Eggplant Caponata, Truffle Bikini, House Marinated Olives, Butternut Squash, Crispy Puffball Mushroom, Haricot Vert, Jamon Serrano, Fuet, Salchichon de Vic, Sobrasada, Speck, Chorizo Picante, 6-Month Aged Manchego, Idiazabal, Drunken Goat, Delice de Bourgogne, Ibores, Valdeon, Mahon, Cana de Cabra, Garrotxa, Lomo Iberico de Bellota, Jamon Mangalica, Chorizo Seco, Charcuterie and Cheese for 3, Ensalada Mixta, Pickled Beets Ensalada, Baby Spinach Ensalada, Kale Ensalada, Paella Verduras, Paella Mariscos, Paella Salvaje, Chicken Pimientos, Parrillada, Whole Roasted Branzino
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No
reviews: Update: The manager, Bella, reached out after my horrific first experience at Barcelona. The food was good but the customer service was horrible. THIS time, my friend really wanted to celebrate at Barcelona, so I gave it another shot. Before I asked for Bella, I wanted to observe first. Upon arrival, we were greeted with friendly hostesses. My friend made a reservation for 2 people when it should have been 3 but the hostess was very professional and nice about it and seated us in less than 3 minutes. No, this was not a special treatment because the reservation was made under a different name. Once seated, our waitress Marla, came over almost immediately with water and explained the menu with enthusiasm (unlike the first time where the waitress was annoyed). Marla also came to the table every time our water glass was nearly done. For a booked evening, I was very impressed that Marla was so attentive to all the tables she waited, making sure that the needs of the customers are met while eyeballing the glasses on the table, and taking action. Top notch! The food came out relatively quickly despite a very booked evening! Each dish was intricately made with impressive sauces to accompany it. The only thing that I didn't really like was the paella. The first and second time had the same issue, it was quite burnt on the bottom. My friends and I love paella so we order this every time but we all agreed that it wasn't the best. I asked for Bella and she came out to chat with us. She was super nice and friendly. Like someone with the utmost customer service, she thanked us for coming back and checked on us to see how things were. I'm glad I came back to Barcelona. Their dishes are yummy and customer service was professional and great! Thank you for the warmest Barcelonian hospitality!> Ambiance:  - It was definitely busy! As you would expect from how quickly their reservations go. - However, despite all the tables being full, the noise level was ideal, an underratedly very important aspect of a restaurant. Loud enough to feel fun, but quiet enough to have companion/date/friend/relative/enemy. - The decoration is rustic and Spanish themed yet they were playing electronic and dance music. Odd combination! Drink: - They have an extensive, if not overwhelming, wine list with several moderately priced bottles. If you order a glass, you also get a choice of two different sizes.  - The cocktails looked good and were surprisingly cheap. None of the flavors particularly stood out to me. And with Boston's all star drink culture, I've seen better. Food: - I will admit that I'm not a huge fan of tapas or small plates. When I'm hungry, I feel much more satisfied after eating an entire plate. However, I enjoyed everything we ordered. My boyfriend and I ordered: the spicy eggplant caponata; the tortilla; the hanger steak; the empanadas; and the shishisto peppers. And the free bread is so good. Our favorite tapas were the EGGPLANT, the TORTILLA, and the SHISHISTO PEPPERS.  - We also ordered dessert, the flourless chocolate cake. It was a circular cake with a warm molten, chocolate interior and crunchy almonds on top. What more can you ask for! Service: - Fine. Could've been more attentive, but we were never struggling to get their attention. Good for: Dates, Girls night Out; Drinks and Apps> I previously gave Barcelona's a glowing review a few years ago. It used to be my go-to in Boston during the PAX East convention each spring. We used to easily be able to get in without long prior reservations and it was always a great experience with top-notch food, great service, and lovely ambiance. Last year we tried and could not get in any day of the long weekend, even though our group was pretty small. I chalked it up to being more popular and vowed to make reservation for 2020. This year my assistant and I both tried to book for a larger group about three months out. It literally took about 15 phone calls and then we were offered either a full room buy-out or a very small group very early or very late in the evening as our only options. And that seemed to be the offering pretty much every day of the week and weekend. Rather than bringing a group of 16 international dignitaries from the Brazilian embassy with us, I opted for a small team dinner of my 4-person leadership team, and took my Brazilian partners to a lovely Italian place (which had no issue seating us or delivering an amazing food experience that all participants loved). Upon arrival at Barcelona's, we waited about 15 to 20 minutes past our reservation time. During the prolonged wait, I attempted to address the difficulty in getting reservations with the host and hostess, to try and figure out if there was a better way. I couldn't have felt more like I was annoying them, with really no practical answer. If I understood correctly, they simply can no longer accommodate mid-sized groups of 5-15 people unless it's very early or very late in the evening, or you're willing to buy out a room with a $1-2K minimum consumption guarantee. Finally, we were seated at a very small table that fit the four of us -- but barely. There was just about enough space for two tapas at the table at one time, so their relatively slow and spaced out arrival might have been by design (or vice versa). Our waiter was attentive but rushed, and everything felt very hurried. Food and drink started coming out fairly quickly, but then we received one dish we hadn't ordered, while another was apparently given to another table and had to be remade. This took about 15-20 minutes. We then waited for at least 20-30 minutes for a single order of paella to share. The waiter brought out two free tapas while we were waiting, apologizing each time for the delay. We actually declined the second. At this point, we all were full and really didn't want the paella anymore. I asked if we could just cancel the paella and call it a night. The waiter insisted on checking on the paella and five minutes later it came out. As anticipated, we all tried it, but most of it was left uneaten, which is a shame.Barcelona's still offers some of my favorite food in Boston (although having visited Barcelona in Spain last fall, I've had equal and better tapas there). However, the service was chaotic, the atmosphere feels as if this once amazing restaurant is now too busy to offer the previous standout service, with a very loud main area supper-club feeling and a smaller private table area. Bundled with how difficult it now is to actually make reservations, we'll look to some of the other great food destinations in Boston, including the amazing Italian food in the North End, for celebrating with our clients and partners when in town.> This is the last time I'll ever eat at a Barcelona establishment. My husband brought me here for my birthday and it was hands down the worst dining experience we have ever had. I'm a restaurant manager and he is a chef, both in downtown Boston, we know proper food quality and service and this place was below subpar. Our server forgot about us after we got our first round of tapas. We continued to order three more times and all we heard was excuses that the kitchen messed up or it was someone else fault.... It was clearly the servers fault. Everytime we asked a question on the menu he didnt know the answer and just read the menu back to us.... Gee thanks.Our first two tapas were bland and nothing special. Hoping the food would get better but it got worse and we had to send back a steak dish. We kept waiting for food that obviously never got rung in so we just got the check and decided to leave. There was no way this experience was worth the $200 tab. The server took our credit card and right after we flagged the manager down who was helping us before with wine. We expressed how bad the experience was and she was accommodating and took care of the food on the tab. Meanwhile the server rushed over to try to grab the original check off of the table to close the bill.... another no no and petpeve of mine. We weren't even done with out drink yet and he was rushing for the check....The only positive thing about coming here was the managers responsiveness and the custom menu for gluten and dairy free items. Too bad it took over 10 minutes for me to get a menu back to order food.Sad to see such poor quality all around here. Will definitely be going to Toro next time.> I came here with a group of 4 on a Saturday night. Definitely make a reservation ahead of time. This place will be PACKED especially on the weekend.General impression: This is the third time I've been to Barcelona. It's full of people mostly in 20s -30s. On Saturday night it gets really loud. You have to shout a little bit to talk, which worked out fine for our group of 4. Very nicely decorated; eclectic space. The food: Specialty in tapas or small shared plates, which makes it ideal for a small group. You can also get larger entrees to share, which will take a while to cook (we were told 45 min for seafood paella), and charcuterie (meats, cheese). We opted for the tapas. Favorites: Lobster risotto - the lobster was so TENDER, and risotto flavorful. You get thumb-sized chunks of lobster. It is a small portion but worth the taste for me Crispy rice - very unique as well. Again small portion shape of a short column, maybe the size of your palm and less than an inch in height. The TRUFFLES and sauce make this dish. Thin thin crispy outside layer, but most of the dish is risotto consistency Blistered shishito peppers - a surprising welcome in the meal. Slight heat but kind of just refreshing Churros with chocolate sauce - THICK airy churros, full of maybe cinnamon sugar, to dip in chocolate sauce. Very sharable THE BREAD: one of the best complimentary bread we've ever had. Warm and fluffy on the inside, crispy outside, thick, and slight sourdough feel. Just wonderful to dip in their olive oil. Good, but probably would not get again: Jamón & manchego croquetas - small, 4 pieces. Nothing extraordinary Albondigas - meatballs, also not unique Chorizo with sweet & sour figs - I liked the sweet figs better than the chorizo, which was too hard/dryMussels al Diablo - you get surprising amount of mussels. I generally just prefer white instead of red sauce. Thin chorizo again pretty dense Service: Very friendly, attentive, and prompt. No complaints. Cost: Bit on the pricy side. You're of course paying for the atmosphere as well. For 8 tapas it came out to $~90 for our group of 4 pre tip. Good choice for a nice night out with friends. Tl;dr: Great experience and food. The bill shows it.

This is a review for the little takeout restaurant in the store.  Just polished off a combo plate and damn, it was tasty.  The food is authentic, flavorful and cooked perfectly. The people working here are super friendly and the portions they serve are certainly generous and priced fairly.I will be back!> This place is really convenient and is my go to place to grab a quick bite to eat. It is a family own business and the management is super sweet. If you are hungry and craving some Middle Eastern food this place is it. They are Halal too.> Great little spot on the south shore! They get fresh pita bread daily & have a nice refrigerated section including a wonderful feta cheese in brine. Family who runs the store is welcoming & kind.> The International Food Co. is a little mom and pop store that's easy to miss. Being on the South Shore, this market is a God send because it's not far from home and is one of the only Middle Eastern markets in the region. The owners are a delight and very helpful and although their store is a bit small, they are willing to bring in items that you request. The other good feature is that they are a halal market and you can get a variety of fresh meats there. I remember calling late at night right when they were about to close and they were kind enough to wait for me!> Great kibbeh and falafel. Their stews are also excellent. They also have the best lentil soup and it's all so inexpensive! I had their lamb from the butchery too, very fresh and tender.

Fast casual Mediterranean focused on quality, taste and price.  We were so excited when this place opened, as it doesn't lead with the traditional the frills and prices of most places in the South serve up.  Just quality food at a competitive price.  Also, they serve beer and wine at the bar, and there's always seats.  Nice place get a pita and drink without a wait.> Service 1 star - would not dine in, take-out might be okay. Staff was inattentive and unfriendly, didn't know basic prices of items. Also slow for how few customers they have.Taste 3-4 stars- Okay, but not exceptional. Chicken was pretty dry.> I had seen them all over instagram, so I was super excited to come try this out on the weekend. I came during a slower time and the staff was really friendly and helpful.The wrap I got was really fresh, and prepared quickly - they have a big selection but it doesn't feel overwhelming.Knocked off a couple stars because the baklava cookie I got seemed like it had been sitting out for a couple of days...it was dry and brittle. Most places will offer discounted day-olds or at least be mindful and let their customers know if something wasn't prepared that day but I wasn't told anything of it. Slightly disappointed by this, but overall I had a good experience here.> If you're in the mood for Mediterranean, anoush'ella is the right choice. Their mezze are out of this world, very fresh and packed with flavor. We got the platter for two, as well as a side of chicken. The platter featured cold mezze, and the employee was very flexible about making substitutions for us.The walnut harissa was my favorite part of the platter - hearty, with just enough spice to keep things interesting. But honestly, every cold mezze we had was great, we cleaned the plate!The restaurant is a fast casual setting, maybe slightly fancier than a Cava; there are seats/booths in the back for a more sit-down experience, compared to the bar and communal table in the front. Food comes out super fast, to make up for the line that forms during busy times. This place is popular but well worth the wait!> Fresh tasty food. Friendly staff. Good ambience. Came here HUNGRY with a few friends and ordered everything on the menu!What I LOVED:Walnut Harissa - OMG this is a side, but oh so tasty and full of flavorful. You can add this to anything you have there. (5/5)Chicken Zatar - chicken is well cooked and goes well with any salad, wrap or lentil bowl (4.5/5)Lamb kofte - delicious and well cooked (4/5)Chickpea fritters - pretty good if you're vegan or vegetarian. (4/5)Lentil soup - tasty, light and healthy option for those looking for a snack.MEHH:Lentil kofta - this was quite bad. Wouldn't recommend having it even if it were free of charge (2/5)Tahini Mocha - I almost threw up after a sip of this. Not sure why it's even in the menu. So so bad. (-1/5)

Absolutely amazing. I am from Boston and now live out of state. Every time I fly home Cathay Pacific is one of the places I must eat at before I depart the city. The food is amazing. Always fresh. Perfectly seasoned. The staff is friendly and the establishment is clean. They also have Karaoke some nights and it's funny hearing them as you eat. This place is perfect for a date or a friends night out.> Food here is classic American Chinese food. Had the pupu platter and pork fried rice. Pupu platter was generous for the price. Fried shrimp was delicious. Boneless spare ribs soft and tender juicy, not hard like some places. Came with two crunchy egg rolls and fresh crab ragoon. If your hungry get the large its only two dollars more than the small. Service was also prompt Negatives: the pork fried rice was bland not very fresh. Lighting very dim and decore very outdated although that may be what they are going for. All in all a decent place for American Chinese.> 3/16/2019 - CP. I've been going there since before I was a teenager. I swore it off a few years ago, because the take out I ordered was AWFUL!! I felt that the dining room had to be the same, so Nope. No longer. But...I'm back. If I'm in the area. The girls (Ladies Night) decided to go there wanting to find a Jazz spot. Efforts came to a screeching halt. We knew CP had a live band on Saturdays. L.G. said, "I was here not too long ago and the food was good". She was correct. We each ordered from the dinner plate section. The plate was huge. Large portions. Rice, wings, fried shrimp, Crab Rangoon and Egg Foo Young which both I Love Love was great. My girls said that the Lo Mein and Seafood delight dish was good too.The band was good. DJ as well. The Soul Train dancers lol (shade) Sorry. They were the highlight of our evening.....Just had a flash back. LoLMy Pina Colada (Virgin) was delicious. S. G. Strawberry daiquiri she enjoyed. Mai Tai was tasty. I don't drink, but if you do, you'll enjoy I'm sure. So what I didn't find cool, was they being short staffed. We had to walk to the bar to put in our food order and pay there, then walk back to our table. A waitress finally arrived, but never came to our table. We found the restaurants water fountain close to the kitchen and got our own. Dirty dishes was pilled up on a table in the dining room instead of going to the kitchen. We were on our own. I should of asked for my Pay Check. All in All, good atmosphere, good food, good drinks, good time out. Happy Eats> I came here tonight for their hot and sour soup. Everyone in my house is sick with a cold and this soup helps a lot. My husband and I came here after we got married and they were so kind to us. We eloped but we're still in our wedding outfits. For many years I worked right across the street and came here to enjoy a meal every Friday night. There is such a variety!> Omg....havent been for a while because last experience was not ao goos. Went back today. Brought food home amd absolutely disgusting. Just threw away. What happened to you ccathay? Saying bye for good this time. Minus 5stars!

popular_dishes: No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: One of the best places to go to for Mediterranean/Turkish food. Their kebab plates, lahmacuns, and chocolate baklava are simply DELICIOUS. I've went with my family and friends on multiple occasions! Would 10/10 recommend.> Ate early dinner here on a Saturday night. The place was pretty much empty except for 2 other tables when we got there, but by the time we were done it was jam packed. The service was very good. We had the Mixed Vegetarian Plate (4) with Hummus, Babaganush, Jajik and eggplant in tomato sauce. All the sides tasted really fresh. Our favorite was eggplant in tomato sauce, the flavors were great and eggplant was cooked to perfection.We also shared Falafel Wrap and it was delicious. It came with a side of this Garlic Toum sauce that was so good that I wanted to dip everything in that and eat. We also had Cheese Pide that was good but it was huge (see the photo). They even make so many kinds of Baklava. Overall a good meal!> 3.5 stars We came here with a large group and had a few tables attached. Unfortunately the table I ended up at was so wobbly that it made eating unpleasant. Plus, I had set my sleeping son down in his car seat in that area, but the workers kept bringing their cart there to hold dirty dishes and such. Sure enough, my son woke up as we began eating, so we couldn't eat in peace.Expectations were set high for this place by the locals, but not quite met. I found the food average compared to some of the places we have in Chicago. My wife and I shared a lamb & chicken kebab plate; I found the kebabs to be less juicy and flavorful than I hoped for. The bulgur wheat was flavorless. The price was also higher than similar dishes I've gotten in Illinois at al-Bawadi Grill and Fattoush.I tried a grilled piece of meat from someone else's plate, but it was also bland. I did like the "ground beef pizza" that was ordered, though.> Tried the mixed grill, hummus and chicken Adana kebab. The Turkish meat balls and the meat gyro were amazing so I might skip the mixed grill and just get these next time. The hummus was also nice. The chicken kebab was alright. Overall the food is nice but it's a bit pricey.> It probably took me at least 15-20 minutes to figure out what I wanted. Everything on the menu sounds so yummy - I couldn't decide! I kept going back and forth between a salad or the dinner plates... Ultimately, I went for the dinner plate because it's a great deal ($12 for chicken gyro, salad, bulgur wheat, bread....), whereas the salad is $10 + another $5 for meat. My friend liked her salad, but said my chicken was tastier. I DEVOURED this. There was not 1 bite left and I enjoyed every single bite. The bread was disappointing - we didn't get the "homemade" bread that looks awesome in the pictures. We got pita, which was a bit dry (I was better off without it, but still).I will definitely be getting from here again - so many things I want to try!

menu_dishes: Beef Patties, Veggie Spring Rolls, Crab Rangoon Rolls, Wings, Macaroni and Cheese, Candied Yams, Potato Salad, Rice and Peas, White Rice, Cabbage, Fries, Oxtail Dinner, Fried Porgie, BBQ Rib Dinner, Fresh Wing Dinner, Baked Chicken Dinner, Fried Chicken Dinner, Curry Chicken Dinner, Chicken and Waffles, Cheesecake, Slice of Cake, Banana Pudding, Cookies, Orange Mango Nantucket, Red Plum Nantucket, Apple Juice Nantucket, Peach Lemonade, Passion Fruit Lemonade, Bottled Water
popular_dishes: No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: It doesn't look like much. But the chef made these crab rangoons into an egg roll and now I am obsessed. This is me on a "healthy" life style change. I think i will chose to eat this as my indulgence. It is also quite homely. Folks are nice. I ordered the ribs and it could be better. But five stars for their at good egg rolls and being so damn friendly. I can't wait to move next to their location. Support local businesses always!!!> Great service and food! I ordered the chicken and waffle which was really good especially the waffle. Will definitely come back again.> Service is great! Location is small. Maybe 6-8 tables. Not an issue for me as I prefer takeout. I went in the middle of the day on a Friday. I ordered fried chicken dinner with Mac and cheese, yams and cabbage. The cabbage was very flavorful. The Mac and cheese is not the baked Mac and cheese i expect from a soulfood spot. It's more macaroni with a cheese sauce poured on it. Cheese sauce is a tad runny. Flavor is ok. The yams were really good. Very sweet, but that's how I like mine. Chicken was fried good. If you don't like dark meat, let them know when ordering it. Dark meat is the standard for the fried chicken meal. The kitchen was clean. The music was uplifting. I wish there was parking, but it's a major city. Overall, decent food and experience.> If I'm sentenced to death row I'd like this team to cook my last meal. We swung by while in town for my sons soccer game. Everything was incredible. Macaroni and cheese, BBQ ribs, rice and peas, chicken wings, steak and cheese egg rolls, and red velvet waffles. Amazing. Sensational. Wonderful.My son said "the chicken wings are on fire." Eat here. Portions are really big so you'll probably have leftovers. Blondie was delicious too. Has walnuts so be careful if you have allergies.> Great food. Even better atmosphere and ambience as the staff and the clientele were enjoying the food. The only drawback is the parking. I look forward to coming back again.

We visited Amelia's a couple of weeks ago for a birthday celebration, but it's been lurking on my bookmarks list for quite some time! The restaurant is absolutely gorgeous, and done up in romantic mood lighting, handsome wood and leather booths, and a gracious bar that provides a vibrant social scene in suburbia on any given night of the week.The birthday festivities took place in the fireplace room right next to the bar area, and even though it was quite cozy, it was also super loud from the Friday night hordes that gathered to imbibe and hang out just a few feet away from our celebration. However, I really liked the comfy couches and chairs that were positioned just so to encourage chatting and mingling between guests. For a cocktails n' munchies gathering, this was an ideal setup, but the acoustics of the room made the event a bit more hectic than I would have liked it.Our generous hostess ordered a bunch of appetizers that were shared amongst the guests. I especially loved the Philly Cheesesteak Eggrolls, which were as decadent as they sound - loads of cheese and meat wrapped in a deep fried egg roll skin. So good! We also tried the Cheese Plate, which was a large portion of domestic and imported cheese and charcuterie, plus fig jam and grapes that were perfect for sharing. My personal favorite bite of the evening, though, were the Crispy Brussels Sprouts, which were fried to perfection and tossed in a flavorful balsamic sauce. OH EM GEE. So good.I look forward to returning to Amelia's for a full meal in the very near future! They are participating currently in Dine Out Boston, and the menu looks awesome, so it's definitely on my radar!> Horrible. Think twice before planning your special occasion at Amelia's. I set up a dinner reservation on OT for this past Friday to celebrate my wife's birthday, specifying in the reservation that we were celebrating her birthday. We ended up getting the the restaurant a little earlier than our reservation time given the current situation going on across the US and World, so when we spoke with the the two hosts (1 gentleman and 1 woman) we let them know that we had no problem waiting if the table wasn't ready. The hostess said that she could seat us and we were brought into the backroom and were given a table right inside the door, in fact the door was propped open in such a way that it was right up against our table. Had there been a lot of people in the restaurant and no other choices, my wife and I would have made it work but at the time (6:10pm) the restaurant was less than full and we looked around and asked if the hostess would mind putting us at another table. She made it out to be a problem since it would be in another servers sections so we said never mind. Our waitress came over and could tell that we weren't comfortable sitting where we were and asked if we wanted to move, we told her that we would like that and that we wouldn't mind sitting at a different table where she would still be our waitress (there was at least 7 or 8 open tables in the backroom and I doubt that this was the only table our waitress had). Our waitress left and back came the hostess who grabbed our menus and said "follow me", before we could get up from the table she disappeared. We finally spotted her across the dining room, went over to the table where she threw down the menus and rudely said "enjoy your meal". At this point the night has been ruined, we ask our new waitress to speak with the manager. A young lady who does not appear to be the manager comes over and asks us if there's something wrong, we ask her if she's truly the manager and we're finally told she isn't. We asked to speak with the manager again, the other host comes over and asks us whats wrong. We let him know that at this point we are frustrated because now we've been treated rudely on a night that was supposed to be special, when we asked to speak with a manager we were sent someone that wasn't. The host does not seem to care about what we were saying and instead of being sympathetic to the situation, his attitude was more 'what do you want from me' as if we were the ones inconveniencing them. We decided to leave, ultimately ruining what should have been a great night. By the time we got to our car, the restaurant had changed our reservation from arrived to 'canceled' through OT, my thought would be to avoid a negative review being left. Again, I would avoid Amelia's for your special occasion or even for a dinner that you're looking to enjoy.> I was really looking forward to this place because I love Italian food and also a friend raved about how good the food is. We went in during dinner and sat at the bar. I have to say the staff was very friendly and service was fast. We ordered the philly cheese egg rolls to start. They were actually really good. How can you go wrong with anything deep fried with cheese in it. With an opening like that I was very hopeful for my main course. I ordered the penne pasta dish, basically their chicken parm. It might just be a preference thing but I wasn't impressed with the fact that the pasta was not coated in the sauce prior to serving. However, That could have been overlooked. Honestly the dish lacked seasoning. Adding some salt didn't save it. You are better off ordering something else for dinner. They had some good options. My friend's dish was actually tasty. Price wise, I'll say medium price range. The portion of the chicken was pretty generous. Pasta not so much. I am hopeful that there is something else to try from this place that will "WOW" me. So I will go back and give it another try.> Pasta for dayssss! Amelia's is my favorite restaurant in the Boston Area! I had the Pappardelle pasta dish which was Beef short rib, sweet burgundy glaze, and Grana Padano cheese. ⁣⁣⁣> So I don't have the best camera, but what a lovely experience. All the food was delicious, service great, restaurant was lovely with plenty of parking.  Steak cooked to perfection!

restaurant_name: The China Restaurant and Sports Bar
reviews: We met family that frequent The China often.  Staff was prompt and the food came out hot.  Part of my general chicken came out burnt but the rest was hot and fresh and the rice was good.  Everyone had warm and hot food which to me, is a huge deal with food anywhere you go to.  My daughters sweet n sour chicken came out first and was hot and fresh and she enjoyed it.> HORRIBLE!! HORRIBLE!!The female owner/manager who was there tonight needs to go back and get train for her customer service skills. If you dont like your job or if this business is so miserable then i suggest you to do something else with your life. She also needs to learn how to treat her customers with respect or be prepare to shutdown the bar for her rude and disgusting attitude. Yelpers take your money elsewhere and get more better service because this place sure don't deserve it!!  The one star is for the waitress who kept apologizing over and over again for her awful owner/manager stupidity. She is a sweetheart and this one star is for her great service otherwise this place dont deserve any star. Other yelpers who warn about this owner/manager is so right about her disgusting attitude and horrible behavior!!> My friend and I went here a few weeks ago for dim sum. We ordered* beef tripe* taro dumplings* chiu chow dumplings* beef balls* xiao long baoThe dim sum was made fresh to order. Some of the dim sum were humongous. I didn't particularly like the beef balls because it had way too much parsley. Otherwise, the dim sum was not bad. Seating was comfortable.> My son moved to Quincy a few months ago. Whenever we stop by to have lunch/dinner with him, this is where we go. We've been here a handful of times. The last visit, it was kind of slow. And we came in around 4pm. I was pleasantly surprised to be offered regular menu dining or dim sum. We chose dim sum!!  Some of the specialty dishes (ha cheurng fun for example) cannot be made without the dim sum chef, when he leaves to go home (3pm I believe). The bill came out to about $32. We were totally shocked to see how affordable it was to fill up or bellies here. The 4 of us (one 19 year old and one 8 year old included) ordered : Siu Long Bao / soup filled dumplings- Great flavor... but I am so spoiled because I was introduced to soup dumplings from Joe's ShangHai in Flushing, NY. And Joe's is sooooo delicious. And a ton of soup inside.  At The China I would give it 3/5 stars. But not order it again.  The dough is a bit tough (like dumpling skins) but I am totally comparing these to Joe's. I've tried making these by myself and I know how hard these are to make and master. It comes with 4/$4. Fung Jao / fried chicken feet. 3/5Lau saa Bao / quicksand buns- I never realized that it LITERALLY translates to quicksand buns. But it makes sense. It's a soft pillowy bun filled with a delicious lava of salted egg yolk filling (think - like a savory custard). Similar to a lava cake... the filling will ooze out. 5/5Gauhn Chao Gnow Hoah / dry pan fried beef with flat-wide noodles- 5/5. Very generous sized serving. Perfect for 4-5 people. Costs about $11. Loh Mai Gai / Steamed lotus wrapped sticky rice- sticky glutinous rice (which weirdly enough I read somewhere that it has no gluten) wrapped in a fragrant lotus leaf. It comes with 2 -quite large- and each of them is filled with savory meats like chicken, lap cheurng / Chinese sausage, salted egg yolk and other stuff. I think this came to about $7.50. 4/5Dofu Fa/ Silkened tofu dessert - 5/5 I think one of the best dofu fa that I have ever eaten. They had to check for availability because the kitchen staff eats this everyday after the lunch rush has passed. If the staff eats it, you know they're going to make sure it's yummy for themselves!!  This place is always very friendly. And much less of a wait than Windsor. I also like their tea's flavor. They have a ton of TVs.  Even in the bathrooms. Lol. Nice full bar. And new expanded dining room. Parking in the rear. A++> PERFECT Sunday morning dim-sum experience. We arrived at 9:30am, seated promptly. This time the manager was welcoming; as last time the waiter was kind. The ladies pushing the carts were warm and delightful. ( Ma'am - no need to apologize for your English - it's way WAY better than my Mandarin ;) The pace of the varied offerings coming around was exactly right for a leisurely breakfast. We mentioned we would like something (Har Gau) and -bam- three steamer baskets were brought straight to our table 5 minutes later. ( We gratefully accepted two of them :)  All the dumplings were absolutely fresh and appetizing. Yum. Thank you!! We'll be back!!

Still exceptional.  Value is outrageous. No need to order sides. All entrees come with at least two sides included.  That said, the quality is - hands down - the best in the area. Creative - balanced -delicious food.I hate to share such a great place, but they deserve all the business.> Stopped in on Christmas Eve Day for lunch.We tried appetizers. The antipasto was good. Loved the meatballs.Service was excellent!> One of the things I am missing the most about regular life is eating at Sorelle. This incredible place offers the most wonderful menu, a great variety and a relaxing and updated atmosphere. I would put this food up against any outlandishly expensive meal in the city. I love the inventive drinks, the Tuscan wings, and they have a delicious gluten free bread for those that need it. The gluten free menu is not a few random things. It is thoughtful and extensive which makes this an easy choice when wanting to go out in our family. This place changed how I felt about Brussels sprouts! My birthday is falling during this "Social Distancing time in out history". I will not be celebrating it until I can celebrate it here.> Went to Sorelle in Abington tonight. Spectacular.  Parking lot is easy to get in and out and it's a fairly big lot. As soon as we walked in we were asked if we'd like to sit in the dining room, the bar room or outside. We chose the dining room. Very comfortable booths and chairs. Our waitress was Nicole and she was fantastic. All 3 of us had waters right away and ordered some wine and beer. Also, she told us there was fresh bread just coming out of the oven.  It was amazing. Nice and hot and came with dill olive oil with cheese to dip in. We started with the Arancini and the crispy Brussel sprouts. Wow. Who knew brussel sprouts could be so delicious. Arancini was great too I just would of like a tad bit more sauce with that. 2 of us ordered the Bolognese which was amazing. Pappardelle (egg noodles) with braised beef short ribs, pancetta and red wine sauce. Incredibly delicious! The other order was the scallops which I got to have one and loved it! Then we ordered 2 desserts for the 3 of us to split. The Tiramisu and the chocolate fudge cake. The Tiramisu was great but that chocolate fudge cake was out of this world delicious!!  Wow! Can't wait to go back here again to try more of the menu and maybe sit outside. Ladies room was very clean and there's a hook on the inside stall for your purse. Highly recommend!> This place has a great atmosphere and phenomenal food!  I tend to find a lot of restaurants on the South  Shore are hit or miss, but we've been here  several times and the meals are always spot on.  Their scallops (not typically my favorite dish) wowed me.  I loved the vibe in the bar area and the seating is nicely  separated if you are looking for a quieter evening.  My only complaint is that they don't take reservations- we had to wait more than an hour on a Saturday at 6.

I've been hearing a lot about this new establishment in the last couple of weeks, so I was eager to check it out, mainly because of their Sunday brunch/day party, so I gathered a couple friends together and made a reservation. Although I must say, I was a little worried that I wouldn't be able to get a seat because most of the yelp reviews I've read suggested reserving weeks in advance due to the popularity of the restaurant, but I had no troubles whatsoever making a reservation a few days before hand by calling the restaurant and leaving a message. Someone returned my call the next day and I was able to set something up without any problems. I did try to book online before calling, but the system didn't appear to be working correctly. I actually ended up getting to the restaurant about a half hour early and was seated right away. I believe because of COVID-19, the restaurant was at less than half its capacity. The entire bar area was empty and besides my friends and I, there were only three other tables being served. I didn't mind that it wasn't too busy. It was nice to just be able to hear each other talk and receive pretty consistent service. The decor itself is a five in my book. The color scheme in the restaurant is light and airy in a way, but still has the dramatic flair of Cuban culture. I also like the uniforms the waiters wear. It was a very breezy and carefree look that was reminiscent of the islands. As for the food, it was pretty good. I can only comment on my own dish rather than what my friends ordered. We all split the guava coffee cake as an appetizer, and that was large enough to share with at least 4 people. It was warm, sweet, and light enough to eat without becoming too full before the main entree. I ordered the la bandeja which is probably best if shared between two or more people. I couldn't finish my plate nor did I want to bring it home. For me, personally there were too many items on the plate and most were very heavy (rice, fried cheese, French fries, plantains). I really only ordered it for the rice and pork, but both food items were overcooked and way too dry for my liking. I would give this overall dish a 3, and I probably wouldn't order it again if I came back. My friends enjoyed their dishes though, so that definitely is a good thing.> I'm not sure how this place could have only a 3.5 star rating!   We had a great meal and service this week.   The Mariel mojito was great with a huge sprig of peppermint leaves.  They are a small plate place.   We had the empanadas, amazing guacamole,  black eyed pea fritters which are basically falafel, steak, tuna crudo.  All amazing.  The ice cream sandwich for dessert was very creative and excellent.  Will definitely return.> Mariel exceeded all my expectations. I recommend going with more people so you can try more dishes - everything I had was amazing. I made reservations in advance for brunch on Sunday and was surprised to be greeted with a live band. The music was a nice touch to their beautiful themed restaurant. Now on to the food - we really did feast that afternoon and no regrets here. I would honestly reorder everything again but here were my favorites ranked from top to bottom: - Arepas - Empenadas - Le bendejas - Smoked Kingfish dip- Cubano - Mozzarella Waffle Sticks This was more than enough food for four people. We devoured everything and were (happily) stuffed at the end of the meal. It's disappointing that the overall rating of this place is not as high as it should be. If you read through the reviews, a majority of the reviews agree that the food was amazing and gave poor reviews due to the wait times, price, etc. Make sure to make reservations in advance and check the menu & prices before you go so there are no surprises later.> Um, YUM.  The night started off a little off as we had to wait a bit for our table (yes, I made a reservation for 6:30pm on a Thursday).  However, the ambiance, friendly service (Randy you are awesome!) and delicious food and drinks made up for that wait.  It was a fun GNO and we are still taking about the food the next day.  I highly recommend to ask your waiter/waitress their favorite picks and I'm glad we did - the recommendations Randy had were amazing!  I highly recommend the fish dip, the fritters, the octopus, and the gnocchi - it's like nothing you've ever had before....and I want more!Very fun night at a delicious and lively restaurant - I can't want to come back.  PS - make a reservation!> The atmosphere deserves 6/5 stars. Every detail of the decor is thoughtfully thought out and so beautiful. It's fun and elegant at the same time. For drinks I had the Guava Daiquiri it was so good! It was super flavor and the perfect hint of cayenne. For food we had the pan queso frito, avocado con mojo and fufu gnocchi. For desert we got the coffee and Doughnuts. It was so good! I am not a huge sweets person but it has the perfect amount of salty.They all were great but the fufu gnocchi was exceptional it is a must have. I would definitely come back. Worth noting they were vegetarian friendly!Tip: 100% need a reservation online

Street level! Very friendly staff! Huge lot with hp parking! Food is good!! Great views and dinner!! Accessible bathroom! Tables chair height all around great experience!!' Great atmosphere!!!> Parking is available, nice view, service was good, bread that was served was delish. I came here during dine out Boston during lunch time. Here's what I ordered... Polenta farcitaA napoleon of grilled polenta layered with molten gorgonzola, walnuts and baked quince, cream of porcini.....(did not like, it was strange combination) Eggplant BakeA Parmigiana-style eggplant lasagna layered with mozzarella, marinara and fresh basil.... (I really liked this dish and usually I don't eggplant but I think I've converted)ENTREESCapellini ai ScampiWild harvested black tiger shrimp, garlic, lemon, parsley and evoo, tossed with angel hair pasta...(it was okay, wasn't bad but it just didn't wow me. I think I could've made this just as good)Bourbon Double Glazed Short RibSlow braised boneless beef ribs with a bourbon glazed barbecue sauce,served with a creamy mushroom and asparagus risotto...(although the short rib was tender, I just couldn't handle how sweet it was. Risotto was eh, I'd rather have it served with mashed potato or rice) DESSERTPumpkin Layer Cake (not as moist as I like, mom and I thought it was eh)Molten Chocolate Cake...(must get this!!! This was my favorite from all of the dishes, I normally don't like chocolate but this one I can really dig into! It's warm and moist and I would just come here to get this again!)> When I come here I instantly remember why I'm not surprised it's only three stars. Every time. Came here with a group of nine people and we did have a good time. The food was good, the view amazing but the waiter was lucky I wasn't responsible for his tip. Rude, short tempered and arrogant for someone who didn't know a lot about the ingredients. I honestly think he didn't care! I'm gluten free and was stuck with either the chicken piccata or the filet mignon. That's it, those were the only two he suggested. All the appetizers  were glutenous and I'm not a fish person. That said the chicken piccata was good with roasted potatoes and  asparagus. The wine  selection is reasonable with good prices. Others loved everything they ordered and aside from the waiter it was a good night. Would I pick this restaurant, no! Would I come again if friends were going yes. It's an out of the way destination but reading above, you'll know what your getting yourself into and then you can just enjoy the good.> Went to the Venezia with a group from work for our holiday luncheon. First the good. Nice decor inside, and great views of the bay from the huge windows on that side of the restaurant. This is a great place to go with a large party, no matter how large your group if you call ahead they will find the space for you.Now the less good. I ordered the Capesante, i.e. the "Pan Seared Scallops". In every high end restaurant that serves Pan Seared Scallops, they are always Jumbo Sea Scallops, usually you only expect Bay Scallops if you're ordering a Fried Scallops Plate. The menu didn't mention "sea scallops" but I figured surely that's what they'll be. When the meal came the plate had five small scallops on it that sure looked like your average bay scallops, if they were sea scallops they were the smallest ones I've ever been served. Typically if you get a meal of pan seared sea scallops you will usually get 4 monstrous sea scallops, and that's a full meal. But to serve someone 5 bay scallops as a meal is pretty lame. Have you ever ordered a Fried Scallops Plate anywhere and been given just 5 fried scallops with some fries? If course not. So what's the excuse in getting cheap just because they are being "pan seared" rather than fried? Other than that it was a nice meal, just remember, if you ever order Pan Seared Scallops there, fill up on the bread first or you'll go home still hungry!> A beautiful venue that knows how to accommodate a crowd, but for me felt a little stiff. I was very lucky to be able to attend a wedding here for a couple I didn't know that well. (I was a plus one!) The views of the harbor were beautiful and it was very easy to grab an Uber to and from the Best Western Adam's hotel.The ceremony room had a divider that eventually transformed into part of the reception room. It was all very pretty, but again a little stiff. You got the feeling that this was a wedding factory.The food was not very good. Tasteless sides and an undercooked stuffed chicken breast. The bartenders were short and brief and couldn't crack a smile. Now, never have I ever complained that drinks were too strong, but this was crazy! You could hardly enjoy them because they were too boozy.It was a great wedding for the bride and groom, who seemed to love the whole evening. I'm so so happy for them, but would reconsider this venue.
