reviews: Overwhelmingly surprised by this place.  It's a long and narrow restaurant and bar.  At the entrance, the modern-chic bar is what greets you immediately following the host(ess) station.  Walking through the somewhat crowded bar, you pass stools with a long table overlooking the kitchen staff, into the dining area.  I like how it's set back from the hustle and bustle of the bar area.  I was very pleased that the tables weren't crammed in there atop each other, like many other restaurant/bars in the downtown area.  We were seated at a half-booth table, with plenty of room from our immediate neighbors.  Our waitress came over promptly to share evening specials, and pour water. We started with the biscuits and butter, with baked in blue cheese, as well as the smoked chicken empanaditas.  While $8 for biscuits seems a little pricey, these were worth it.  The biscuits were warm, with tasty blue cheese, and delicious butter.  The empanaditas were good.  For main courses, my wife ordered the pulled pork & slaw sandwich, I ordered the ricotta dumplings with mushrooms.  The sandwich was piled high, both with pork and fries, the meat was perfectly tender & flavorful.  The dumplings were great, almost like gnocchi, but even more soft/plump/tender.  The mushroom & cream sauce was spot on. 10/10 would order this again.  We saw a few desserts in passing, but nothing jumped out at us.  They had a special pre-fix menu that had assorted pastries that looked delectable; we asked our waitress if it was possible to order that, but were told it was only available with the pre-fix menu.  Mixed drink prices were on par for Boston (~$14 each).  We thoroughly enjoyed every dish.  We liked the upscale casual atmosphere.  Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  Trying to find the place may be a bit challenging, as it's at the intersection of several one-way streets just on the outskirts of Chinatown, with limited street parking.  But seek them out and enjoy a wonderful meal.> Nice experience, I had steak Pita, it says Blu, as in blue cheese, but it is light on the liquid like dressing, I put my wife horseradish slaw she didn't want on it and it made the sandwich a solid 3.5.Wife had Turkey - Rach- coleslaw on side- she love it, solid 4.3.Easy walk from South station (5 min) would go back.By the way- you pass Tate on the way, another good spot, but I liked Stillwater a bit more better.> Stillwater knows what brunchers want: visual plates and drinks that'll bring out your mean girl Gretchen when ordering and consuming. Case in point: there's a rotating menu special called Chefy's Panks that I will eternally roast for name and name alone. (Side note: on our trip, they were Reese's Cup pancakes with the candies, uh, griddled inside and the cakes drizzled with chocolate and sweetened peanut butter syrups. Cool, whatever,)I like their soles pulled pork, and I loved the construction of the 421 (ha, weed humor) - a cast iron amalgamation of poached eggs, spiced potatoes, said pork and some wild west hollandaise I know they made for the menfolk. How can I be so sure? Only one guy at our ten top didn't get it. They're smart, the Stillwater folk are. Cary Mary is a dope, Trumpian spin on the bloody and not for any other reason than it's orange. No tomato, just the carrot juice, along with a house spice blend and a sweet skewer of bacon and pickles. Get an order of the biscuits, too. The rasher bits are palpable. Nothing was bad, although some plates and cocktails fared better than others and our server was very absent. We though to may have been because of the auto tip on a party of six or more, but when we got the check, it wasn't added. So, gain attention however you see fit.Secret street parking along the entrance and a sizable footprint for brunch crowds, add Still water to the short list.> This place is out of control. Deliciousness? Out of control. Portion size? Out of control. Niceness of staff? Out of control. Inventive cocktail selection? Out of control. The only thing that wasn't out of control was the pricing :)Everything we tried was excellent. The smoked buffalo chicken wings are some of the best I've had. We couldn't stop eating the pulled pork mac n' cheese. The ritz chicken was fabulous and those mashed potatoes, yeah. The cucumber melon salad was bright and fresh -- it reminded me of a similar Vietnamese or Thai salad. The pomodoro was good, although not quite as good as the other dishes (adding some red pepper flakes made a big difference). We were also fans of the cocktail menu, which had some fun twists.Super convenient walking and T location near South Station, Downtown Crossing, and Chinatown; parking can be a bit tough though. An excellent upgrade from Townsman!> I cannot say enough amazing things about Stillwater. Every bite is better than the last; the space is HUGE; the staff was nice and attentive; and the drinks were strong, and cold. The location is great, too; easy to get to from Chinatown and downtown area; just a few blocks from Boston Commons/Public Garden.If you get one chance and one chance only to eat at Stillwater, here's what I'd recommend:Appetizer: Biscuits + Butter and/or Shishito Peppers. (I don't even like bleu cheese and I'm still dreaming of the biscuits...)Meal: RITZ Coated Fried Chicken with Mashed Potatoes. The oniony butter sauce takes this to the next level.Dessert: PB+J Creme Brulee. I'd go back and just order this dessert alone, it was that good.Other showstoppers: Everything Bagel Popcorn, Smoked Pork Mac and Cheese, and the Pavlova.No doubt one of my favorite restaurants in Boston. Get your reservation in now, because they're booking up quickly.

Nothing like a romantic dinner on the water where Slick grew up.  We so love Jakes and tonight the service couldn't have been any better along with yummy seafood. Why expect anything else? Our cedar planked salmon was incredible along with the best calamari for our appetizer. You just can't come to Nantasket Beach and not eat at Jakes!Bravo!> Really 4.5.  I didn't know until this afternoon that they are a seasonal restaurant until today because their website doesn't mention it.  But it makes sense because of their location. Today was my second time here, my last time being in August.  Then I got the littleneck clams with chorizo and lobster roll. The clams were the standout.Today I had the salt and pepper shrimp appetizer.  Very tasty.  Spicier than I expected but still very good.  I think the shrimp were cooked a minute or so too long but nothing terrible and jumbo shrimp would have been nice.I enjoyed my entree.  I forget the exact name but it was a variation on linguini with clam sauce.  Fettuccine with littleneck clams, still in the shell (be careful, two shells were broken and one of the pieces got messed up with my pasta), tomatoes and olive oil.  The clams were amazing.  The only down side was they gave you the Parmesan cheese you get in the supermarket that you shake out of the plastic canister. I usually don't use it but I tried it, in case I was wrong (fresh Parmesan has a distinctive smell.  This had none at all!). It tasted, seriously, like nothing.  And it didn't melt on the hot pasta.  I wish they had more selections on the dessert selection, especially something light if you don't want something heavy after a big meal.  Seasonal fruits would be perfect, and healthier for diabetics than the cakes, pies and ice cream they currently serve.  But I settled on the chocolate cake.  Not a bad choice!> Wicked pleased with Jake's. Well above average of its type. It has all the hallmarks of a typical New England seafood shack plus a few perks and bennies. It is very clean inside and well decorated and well maintained and everything was in great/new condition. There is a parking lot and a nice view and an outdoor deck. Often times these seafood shacks are trashed and hygienically neglected and naively mistaken as "rustic" when they are, in fact, just plain beat-on and gross. You've been to these places, YELPers. I do recommend going to Jake's on the off hours to avoid crowds and ensure a quiet dining experience. We went at about 2:30 in the afternoon and there were folks there but everyone cleared out at about 3 p.m. sans a few old people who eventually split leaving us alone in the dining area at our beautiful window seat with a view of the bay and a cool breeze. The waitress, Katherine, was excellent. Very prompt and attentive and did everything right and was uber-friendly and ultra-smiley, almost emoji-like. She provided deets on the oysters and was wicked well familiar with the menu and went the extra kilometer to make sure things were to our liking. We got PEI oysters and deep-fried lobster with sides and white wine. She also provided our requested aquas which came with lemon in them and lots of ice and old-school paper straws. The DFL was TDF -fresh and perfectly fried. It was pricey, as were the oysters, but the food was all wicked HQ. My only suggestion is that they offer a "hungry-hippo" upgrade option of a more bigger lobster portion. It was quite small and only leaves you craving more. I, as a YELPer, do highly recommend Jake's. They got it going on.Bonus Tip: When you are done dunkin' all your lobster in the drawn butter, shoot the leftover butter cup like a shot for a burst o' flavor.> A visitor to Hull. Impressed with lively atmosphere! Great seafood in Hull! I enjoyed the Parmesan crusted swordfish. It comes with two sides- choice of fries, mashed potatoes, garden salad, cucumber salad, broccoli, or coleslaw. I chose mashed potatoes and the broccoli. The swordfish was delightfully prepared- thin crispy Parmesan crust brings out the soft texture of the swordfish. No complaints out of me!> Had lunch at Jake's while visiting a friend in the area, we were up from Ft.Lauderdale. Everyone in our party enjoyed our entrees. I had the Jake salad with grilled shrimp. The shrimp were large and cooked to perfection. Great atmosphere on the water and pleasant, friendly server.

menu_dishes: Ono Special Bowl, Hawaiian Classic Bowl, Spicy Salmon Bowl, Spicy Tuna Bowl, Classic Chicken Bowl, Ahi Tuna Bowl, Green Mountain Bowl, Teriyaki Bowl, Build Your Bowl with 2 Protein Choice, Build Your Bowl with 3 Protein Choice, Seaweed Salad, Edamame, Miso Soup, Miso Soup with Chicken, 1. Jasmine Green Tea with Mixed Fruit, 2. Jasmine Green Tea with Orange, 3. Jasmine Green Tea with Grapefruit, 4. Jasmine Green Tea with Lemon and Lime, 5. Jasmine Green Tea with Mango, 6. Jasmine Green Tea with Strawberry, 7. Honey with Green Tea, 1. Mango Smoothie, 2. Strawberry Smoothie, 3. Avocado Smoothie, Water, Can Soda
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Best poke I've had in Boston! Ordered from ONO - Hawaiian Special bowl and a make-your-own bowl with tuna, salmon, spicy aioli and other toppings - via Uber Eats. We had our food in 20 minutes and it was great. Overall, a win. Looking forward to another poke bowl from ONO again soon...> Ever since a distant trip to Hawaii, Poke has been such a toss up. It seems like the further you get from the Pacific, the further you depart from the fresh, simple goodness that is poke.Fortunately, ONO really does check all the boxes! I got the signature bowl, and it was a really great dinner. Having tuna, salmon, and shrimp would cost a small fortune at chain poke stores, but here it was affordable and way higher quality than anywhere I've tried in Boston.To top it all off, the folks at ONO are super friendly. They offered me a free fruit tea which was a great way to finish the meal. I would say this is Cambridge's go-to poke spot, and hope the best for business to come! I'm a fan, will definitely be visiting again. Thanks, ONO!> Pretty good bowls here! They have an assortment of premade poke bowls that you have made to order and they have a build your own bowl option where you can customize every part of the bowl. Additionally, they have braised beef bowls that you can select multiple slices of meat from a list. We got the Ahi Tuna bowl and the portion was plenty and reasonably priced compared to other poke places in the area. The ingredients were fresh too! For the braised beef bowl, I got the soy braised eggs, tripe, and the standard slices of beef. It was a bit salty but everything was super tender and flavorful. Note that this place has limited seating so your best bet is to take to go!> This place is delicious! The tea was so flavorful you can taste the muddled fresh fruit . The poke and topping options are amazing. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful. The staff is also extremely nice and friendly. They have recently opened and I would gladly return.> Cozy, solid poke spot near Porter! Loved the fruit tea and service was nice & quick. One of the better places around for Poke.

UPDATE: i am so sad to share that there is actually fish powder in the tteokbokki sauce. but the chicken poppers are next level amazing!!!i'm allergic to seafood, so my korean restaurant prospects are usually pretty bleak, but there's no anchovy water or paste in the stock for the tteokbokki!!!! and they have always been extremely thoughtful and accommodating about my allergy. honestly we just love this place so much and go every time we have the opportunity. def recommend> small interior and not many actual seats but worth it to come in and try out the food, especially since it's so easily accessible via the t or buses! definitely more so of a take out place. this is a fusion place; coreanos is actually korean is spanish. it's clean, fast service, decently priced and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. i got the coreanos bowl and my friend got the chicken poppers and a chicken taco. i loved my bowl and they didn't skimp on the bulgogi. the sauces are so nice and they really make the bowl better. was not overly spicy or anything. it was great for the price and the portion is satisfying for dinner. my friend loved the chicken poppers and was pleasantly surprised that it had fries although she thought the actual chicken of the chicken taco was a tad bland.i don't come here as often as i'd like but will swing by more often. saw some pictures on yelp of kimbap that they had and would definitely love to try it out. +1 for having purell with covid-19 in full swing in boston!> This was the first time I've tried Korean infused Mexican food and it was surprisingly good! I initially came here for the kimbap rolls; however, they've removed it from their menu. We tried their bulgogi beef taco ($3.50), kalbi short rib taco ($5.00), chicken poppers ($10.95), kimchi fritas ($5.95) and small yang yum flavored korean fried chicken ($8.95). Our favorite was the chicken poppers; the portion was large for the price. Our least favorite were the tacos because they gave us little to no meat and was unseasoned; the tacos were stuffed with homemade slaw than anything else.> Chicken Poppers, Coreanos Bowl, miso soup. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! One of the Coreanos bowls had beef and the other had tofu, VERY flavorful and filling. Worth the prices without a doubt!> One of my favorite korean places in boston ! A little on the expensive side but the coreanos bowl is amazing ! Sweet and spicy. Tteokboki was little expensive for an app, and didn't come with much rice cakes but it was really yummy. The plain fried chicken was great, super crunchy and juicy at the same time. Personally I like it better without any flavoring. Ordered to go, and it was ready in 20 mins on a friday night. Would def order again.

menu_dishes: Chicken A LA Plancha - Fill it, Black Angus Beef Meatballs - Fill it, Black Beans & Beets Patties (vegan) - Fill it, Chickpea Zucchini Falafel (vegan) - Fill it, Sliced Roasted Eggplant & Hards Boiled Egg - Fill it, Chicken A La Plancha - Plate it, Black Angus Beef Meatballs - Plate it, Black Beans & Beets Patties (vegan) - Plate it, Chickpea Zucchini Falafel (vegan) - Plate it, Sliced Roasted Eggplant & Hards Boiled Egg - Plate it, Chicken A La Plancha - Toss it, Black Angus Beef Meatballs - Toss it, Black Beans & Beets Patties (vegan) - Toss it, Chickpea Zucchini Falafel (vegan) - Toss it, Sliced Roasted Eggplant & Hards Boiled Egg - Toss it, Chicken A La Plancha - Scoop It, Black Angus Beef Meatballs - Scoop It, Black Beans & Beets Patties (vegan) - Scoop It, Chickpea Zucchini Falafel (vegan) - Scoop It, Sliced Roasted Eggplant & Hards Boiled Egg - Scoop It, Shakshuka, Cheese Borakas
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: The place and the food is great here. Right entering into the door, i looked lost. The owner saw me and explained everything to me. From the choices of meat to the sides. He was so kind. And a great added bonus that the food was amazing. I had the salad with chicken, hummus, and chickpeas> Bona Pita is soooo good! Check out the awesome bowl in my picture, all fresh ingredients. I love this place! Highly recommend the hummus, meatballs, anything really!> The West Roxbury location is a great place to eat. Cool atmosphere and place for smaller groups to hang if you are looking for something quick and good. Almost has a Chipotle like feel. Overall, I thought the food here was great. It was about what I expected. Not anything out of the ordinary in my opinion but still done well. I thought the falafel lacked a little flavor, but surprisingly it was the vegetables and potatoes that they give you when you order the "Plate It" option that I really liked. Also, probably my favorite part of the meal. Pita bread was fluffy and not too dry. You should be able to walk away from this place fairly content with your meal. The staff was great and helpful at helping us through the menu after we mentioned it was our first time eating there.> Best pita bread in the entire Boston area and beyond. Also great falafel, and the meatballs are delicious!! The kids get healthy options every time, plenty of space for the kids to enjoy while we continue eating.They also have a full espresso bar and great ice  cream!> Worth a try!  Im so happy a healthy fast food option came to West Roxbury!  This is a traditionally a burger, pizza joint kind of town.  I had a bowl with rice, veggies, lentils and meatballs.  It came with a fresh baked pita and I didn't feel bad after I ate it!!They have a bar with coffees and smoothies.  It's also a clean nice place to eat.Do your grocery shop at Star and reward yourself with this fresh and yummy option!

You guys, the Sake Aisura Don salmon bowl was just.....perfection. Perfection, I say! I would gladly eat this bowl several times a week if I lived in the area. The 3 types of salmon in this bowl were each so delicious in their own way. The salmon sashimi: a perfect texture, gorgeous color, not fishy at all, incredibly fresh. The salmon belly: fatty and succulent and indulgent. The minced salmon: imparted with a yummy savory flavor. All over a bed of soft white rice. Miso soup on the side, and 2 pieces of very small but delicious pickled veggies. All for $18, a bit of a splurge but for a quality sashimi bowl it's actually quite a steal.Not to mention the gorgeous ceramic mugs, bowls, and plates here that we ate and drank out of. I admired their subtle colors and shapes. They looked handmade and represented Japanese culture beautifully. And the wooden soup spoons had the restaurant logo engraved on them. Such delicate thoughtful touches that made the experience more personal. The vibe is down to earth, not super fancy, but feels very new and clean. I sat at the sushi bar with a friend, and service was great! I will definitely come back to try other sashimi bowls. For now, I will have to settle for dreaming of Tora Sashimi bowls.... :)> I actively crave the Kaisen don from Tora probably every other day because the fish just tastes that good. The first time I came here, I agonized over the menu for a solid 15 minutes and decided on K13 (Nagahama Don), which is a mix of spot shrimp, salmon, yellowtail, squid, mackerel, and uni, and I also added a side order of ikura. The bowl had a really generous portion of fish / seafood, and everything tasted (and looked) so fresh and amazing!The entrance to Tora is a bit hard to find (hint: it's underground), but the smaller space make for a pretty cozy / intimate vibe. I'm really looking forward to coming back!> Located in the basement of Chinatown, I wouldn't have expected to find a restaurant with high quality sushi! Though the portions look small, it is definitely a very filling meal. It's hard to find parking around Chinatown, but definitely worth the trip.The Itadori Don was a mixture of salmon, tuna and assorted seafood. There's a little bit of salmon roe, scallop, octopus which is great for someone that wants to try a little bit of everything. Sake Aisuru Don is a salmon laid on top of a bed of rice. I went on a Friday night around 7 and it was packed and the wait time can be around 1 hour since tables are limited. The bowls are not only aesthetically pleasing, but you can also taste how fresh the fish is. 10/10 would recommend to a friend!> I came with my boyfriend on a weekday evening for dinner. It was very crowded, so we had to wait 10 minutes before being seated.I ordered the sake aisuru don because I LOVE salmon sashimi. The miso soup it came with was delicious and perfectly salty. I LOVED the sake aisuru don! The three variations on the salmon sashimi were all so delicious and fresh! I especially loved the slices that made up the rose, since they had the most fat! We also got the takoyaki to share. They were all wonderfully crispy on the outside and super flavorful on the inside! The sauce and toppings that it came with made the dish so much yummier! The service was a quick and efficient. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely come back!> This review is only for their vegetarian Tofu & Avocado Sweet Ginger Poke bowl because I'm not a huge fan of meat or seafood. This is my go-to bowl whenever I'm in the mood for something filling and delicious!For $11, you get diced plain tofu, sliced tomatoes, avocado, corn, boiled edamame, seaweed salad, and cucumbers on a bed of flavorful sushi rice. The finishing touches? Fried wonton chips, nori, and an abundance of sweet ginger sauce!!! This bowl may look plain at first glance but each bite is *SO* flavorful. I was blown away when I first tried it back in the summer. All of the toppings they use are fresh (overly brown avocados? nope, not here) and crunchy and the sushi rice is out of this world! It's mildly sweet and goes so well with all the ingredients. The sweet ginger sauce is literally the best thing ever. I could probably drizzle it over anything, tbh. I'm always so full and content afterwards. My co-workers really love the salmon, salmon roe, and uni here. They always comment on their freshness and good quality! Take note, seafood lovers!I've never dined in before because my co-workers and I always do takeout via the Ritual app, but it's pretty bustling around lunchtime. The space is quite snug and houses a few tables and some seats by the sushi bar. Just a tip- if you're ordering around lunchtime on an app, make sure to do it well in advance since they can get pretty busy sometimes!

This place is located in the Common Market food court.Here you can order from a variety of chicken meals and fish meals.My personal favorite is the Baked Stuffed Chicken Supreme which is a delicious piece of chicken loaded with stuffing and topped with a very creamy and delicious tasting supreme sauce. It comes with your choice of two sides.There are many good sides to pick from but I usually will go with the oven roasted potatoes and green beans for my two side choices.If you are in the mood for rotisserie chicken they also have that here and it is very good as well.Once you order your meal it always comes out pretty fast so the speed of service is terrific here.The help at the counter is always very friendly and pleasant to deal with.You can either do takeout here or there is also a large seating area where you can enjoy your dinner.I will be ordering from here for many years to come!> My first time in. Picked the "hot" chicken sandwich. Lemme tell ya. Bangin food. Truly boss.> This place is always a go to whether you were looking for a fully prepared meal or something healthy on the grill it is all good but my HIGHEST RECOMMENDATION GOES TO THE PIZZA!!! This is probably the best pizza in Quincy other than Angelos Coal fired pizza which has actually recently closed. Love the staff as well> FISH N CHICKEN? MORE LIKE FISH N CACHOW! Best PLACE I have ever been to. Best FOOD ever. I actually cried a little bit and started shaking after I had a bite of my cheesecake!!!!! LIKE OH MY GOD I'm not even allowed to eat cheesecake but Fish N Chicken? You make me wanna go crazy and just break all the rules!By the way where is the fish and where is the chicken? Looked for them both and when I asked for them the lady started typing on the cash register and asked if I wanted a receipt. Like no I want to pet the fish and chicken!Great water> I love this place. This is a self serve food court style place where you order and then take the food to a table. There is a big selection of cuisine inside. From Pizza to salads to Asian to traditional hearty American cuisine. My favorite is the bourbon steak tips with a side of rice pilaf and corn.

menu_dishes: Ricotta Fresca, Baby Arugula Salad, Burrata, Tuscan Kale Salad, Carciofi alla Romana, Zuppa di Ribollita Toscana, Fettuccine ai Funghi, Rigatoni alla Norcia, Veal Saltimbocca, Spaghetti and Meatballs, Grilled Grass Fed Flank Steak, Chicken Parmigiana, Tagliatelle Bolognese, Roasted Potatoes, Sautéed Escarole, Roasted Mushrooms, Broccoli Rabe, Vanilla Panna Cotta, Cannoli
popular_dishes: Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No
reviews: Cinquecento honestly exceeded my expectations. I had come once before for brunch and remember thinking it was just fine. However, I came back with a friend for dinner and was really impressed. We got the warm ricotta with toast and a bruschetta as appetizers. Both were really delicious. My friend and I also shared the fettuccine with mushrooms as an entree. I was really impressed with this dish. So flavorful, the mushrooms were great and the pasta was so well cooked. For dessert we shared the banana torta with salted caramel ice cream, and the panna cotta. The panna cotta was SO GOOD. So creamy and sweet and nutty. I loved it. The service was also pretty attentive, and for what we got I wasn't too upset at the price either. Highly recommend!> PROS:- Beautiful decor!- Great GM- Food is filling, and good (if warm)CONS:- Food is very slow (~1hr)- Food comes lukecold- Service dreadfulI may not have come on the right day but I'm willing to try it again to see if they take criticism and improve.> I went to Cinquecento a few years back and it was great. Without checking yelp, I made reservations for me and my girlfriends first Valentine's Day together. The day of the 14th I decided to check yelp, and was a bit concerned from some of the recent reviewsMy experience was fantastic. Even on a busy night like valentines I was seated within 15 minutes of my reservation and we loved the food, service and experience. We will be eating at Cinquecento again and soonI never do yelp reviews but my experience vs what I was reading was so different I felt compelled to say something. Highly recommend!> Although I've been coming here for years, our trip on New Year's Eve with a party of 6 prompted me to write a review finally.Reservation: booked online about three weeks before NYE. I received a friendly call about a week before to confirm which benefits both is and the restaurant on a busy night. Location: The location is cool, not only for NYE but also for a nice dinner out during the week. You walk down a long alleyway and enter through the back of the building. Private space for parties downstairs that can accommodate about 50 people, but the main restaurant is upstairs. You walk up a lit stairway and see hundreds of bottles of  Aperol Spritz used against lighting for decor, and it gives a very chill ambiance as a result. Drinks: The drink selection is pricey for what you get. We ordered a pitcher of Aperol spritz and received 60% ice. Disappointing for what we spent. Two bottles of wine, average price each for nothing special. I'd stick with the beer - it's a reliable place for a nice authentic Moratti Italian lager. Food: Simply put, the food used to be better. The appetizers, bruschetta, and burrata came with very little bread - we ran out. I asked for olive oil also, and they missed the plate and poured it on my arm (accidents happen). The roasted chicken was delicious, but the pasta was terrible. Ordered a straightforward Pomodoro, and the spaghetti was not al denti, it was complete mush. The sauce was without taste. Staff: generally excellent, I've never had any issues, but if you like to take some time to catch up with friends, then you will feel rushed. Sat down and immediately the question comes up - what do you want to drink? Which was a stretch because we hadn't opened the menu yet, but what killed me was they also squeezed in "any thoughts on appetizers" as well. It was NYE, but this is generally my experience always.> A solid choice for any meal of the day. Dinner is my favorite but brunch is very good too. Two of my cousins have had baby showers in the private room downstairs, and they are always attentive, food is fresh, drinks are delicious, and it's a really great space for private events with its own private bar space. I would definitely recommend dinner over other meals, as brunch was good but not terribly memorable.To start dinner, we got prosciutto with figs and ricotta. Simply amazing. Such a generous serving served with bread, the figs were flavorful, and the prosciutto seemed never ending. Love.You can't go wrong with any of the pastas, but I always try the bolognese wherever I go and theirs did not disappoint. It came out piping hot, the sauce was hearty and substantial, and the tagliatelle was perfectly al dente and chewy. So fresh and so yummy.We have yet to try the dessert since we're always too full by the end of the meal, but I will certainly be back!

Came here for the first time just yesterday. May I recommend the potato wedges. I'm so picky with my fries that I don't normally go for wedges because I find them soggy. WOW not here. They were perfectly seasoned and crispy. But you're not going to come here just for fries.. are you? The PIES ARE TO DIE FOR. We split a beef and cheese and it was classic. Came with two sauces and a fork. If I had more time I would have tried everything on the menu. Great taste, texture and steaming hot!> In my opinion KO Pies is just OK. My sister and I had just finished sampling ciders at Downeast next door and we both decided we needed something more substantial than pretzels to satiate our hunger. Yelp led us to KO Pies. The place itself has an odd setup. You walk in through the patio-like area and then there is small indoor are with limited seating. It wasn't too busy so my sister and I placed our order at the counter within a minute or two of walking in. We decided to get the Braised Lamb Shank pie w/ floater (mashed potatoes, peas, and gravy), Szechuan wings, and the pie of the month: Buffalo Chicken and Mac. For the Buffalo chicken and Mac pie there was an option to have it served with a 'chicken tender' on top for an additional charge. They have pitchers of water and cups available at the counter which I  liked very much. The food came out within minutes which was very nice.The first thing I tried were the wings. They were good, but they tasted nothing like Szechuan, they were not even spicy. To me they tasted like salt and pepper wings. I swear they were listed as Szechuan on the printed menu right at the counter. The skin was crispy and the meat inside was nice and moist. Not the best, certainly not the worst. Solid wings. I was disappointed that they weren't Szechuan though. The lamb shank pie was decent. I'm glad that we opted to get the floater; otherwise I think it might've been a little bland. The lamb itself was very tender but it was kind of shredded up so that was to be expected. The base pie did have gravy but the floater added an extra amount. The extra gravy added a good amount of saltiness. The mushed peas and mashed potatoes kind of just blended together and were otherwise indiscernible.  I don't think they added much to the pie. I was pretty disappointed by the Buffalo Chicken and Mac pie. There certainly was macaroni but it's like they skimped on the cheese. The chicken tender that was added was laughable. Volume-wise it was probably equivalent to 1.5 McNuggets. Taste-wise I'd consider it a 0.25 McNuggets. It was tough and chewy and not flavorful. Frozen Tyson nuggets taste much better. I will say that the crusts of the pies were quite good. They were flaky and flavorful. The food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great. Considering everything came out to $35 without drinks I was pretty disappointed. I would go back if I'm with a group that REALLY wants to go, but I don't think I'd come back on my own. Service was quick and friendly which is always a plus.> Wanted to finish our quick tour of the NE with somewhere notable to eat in Boston, KO Pies At the Shipyard seemed to match the challenge. The husband and I had never had Australian food and the reviews for this place are great! Scanning other Yelpers reviews, it seemed like we needed to order two things: the beef stew pie and the potato wedges. We did both!So when you get there you order and then find a table either indoor (limited) or in the "outdoor" but enclosed space. Our orders took all of 5 minutes before we had hot pies in front of us. Now, I don't really have complaints about the food. Point blank period, the pie was good. It tasted like roast beef in a flaky pie crust. The wedges definitely lived up to the hype, they were fabulous, especially when dipped in this Thai chili sauce they gave us. Given everything, I wasn't blown away by the pie. I liked  it but wasn't blown away. I kept asking myself would this pie compel me to come back next time I was in Boston. The answer is probably not, but not because it wasn't good. It just wasn't notable. Maybe because I make pot roast at home that tastes similar and so it didn't knock my socks off. Anyways, give them a shot, we loved the energy and experience of coming here.> I had been meaning to go to this restaurant for some time now. It's a little far from where I live and so I just had to commit to making the drive down. I finally did this on Saturday afternoon. Originally from South Africa these meaty types of pies remind me of home. I was super excited when I arrived. The place is Australian themed and is really cutely decorated. I was so excited when I got there that instead of just buying some to go, I sat down and had a whole meal. I ended up ordering the pie floater. Which consisted of the pie I chose (veggie curry) topped with mashed potatoes, mushy peas and lamb gravy. Absolutely divine. The peas were sweet, gravy smooth and flavorful and the pie crust was perfectly crispy. My only disappointment was that they didn't have any chicken options and with just one vegetarian option I needed a bit more variety. Especially because I decided to take 3 frozen pies home. Regardless it's totally worth it to drive down and enjoy the delicious savory pastries. I will be back. Also in a really pretty area right on the water.> KO Pies is a hidden gem. We ordered a bunch of food over the last few visits and here's how I'd rate them:-Wings: 8/10. We crushed these. You'll probably crush them too. I am a great writer, aren't I?-Spicy green beans: 5/10. They are, in fact, spicy. -Braised lamb shank pie: 10000/10. I would eat a million of these and then probably a million more. -Curried vegetable pie: 10/10. You know how sometimes you feel bad because you know your vegetarian friends totally get screwed over with options? Don't worry, they will love this pie. They may even end up loving it more than they love you. -Pie floater: 10/10. You basically order this as a topper to your pie. So when your food arrives, your pie will be buried in mashed potatoes, mushy peas, and gravy. It's super filling, but ohhhhhmygerrrrd.   -Potato wedges: 9/10. Crispy and perfectly seasoned.-Chickpea salad: 4/10. meh. Bonus - you can order pitchers of beer. Limited seating, but turn around time is pretty quick.

My go to place. Pub food very good. Pastrami the best! Service is ok friendly people little loud but very good> This place is down the street from me and I try not to eat takeout food at all and just do my own cooking because I used to be very fat it's incredibly hard when I take the bus that goes by there the 221 drives right by it and the 225 drops you off nearby and walking home all I can do is smell the wonderfulness of everything coming from there I might as well go there in a void Pete's bar because the woman that's a bartender there hates any girl that's pretty she shouldn't even be working there because the bar is empty and I'd rather go to this place here cronin's which I was told is owned by a retired Quincy clock in the food is off the hook the crowd is awesome and nobody has a chip on their shoulder.> When you serve alcoholics, how much pleasure should bartenders really have? Don't blame themAt times being a little crude. Some of themNeed delicate loving. They put up with imbeciles and fools as myself, but I'm no fool today. Maybe tomorrow? They got a decent menu. Never heard of "Irish Pizza" before with mash potatoes, bacon and scallion @ 10.95? But I got a burger instead. Time to cater the Paleolithic carnivorous cravings lurking within. It seems it's a neighborhood style pub with nice older folks in their 50's and upwards. They have a touch tunes juke box that probably averages 3 songs a week? If that? It would be a good betting pool to see how many songs are played in a week? I'd say 15? They got about 16 bar stools surrounding the bar. And a dining room with a little seating arrangement behind the bar. And alongside the wall, there are roughly 4 "two toppers" (if I know what I'm saying) alongside the wall. No Karaoke and thank God! They have a "Keno Lottery" screen and they boast of nearly 600,000.00 dollars of winners in 2018 amongst other accumulative games. Oh yeah, no free refills with food, so I ordered a club soda with no ice and had to remove a star to 4. The server was cordially pleasant as well or.> The food is great here, but the service can be sketchy.  The blonde bartender last night completely ignored us so we left.  She was continually putting empty beer bottles away while there was a bar full of people.  It was bizarre.  We waited a long time, and she never even looked in our direction.  I guess I can't take it personally since a few other people left because she was ignoring them too.  They really need 2 people to serve on busy nights.  However,  I have been going here for years so I would go back, just not on a Friday night when she's working.  The steak tips and turkey tips are delicious though, and I have never had a bad meal here.  It was really disappointing last night, and I felt bad for my friend who was here from out of town.> Looks can be deceiving. You walk into this place, you're thinking oh, it's one of these places. But then you get the food and you're like, oh, dang that's pretty damn good. They usually have a lot of seafood offerings for the daily specials too. It's a great local place to get some food and drinks.

Stumbled upon this place in Jackson Square. The food smells so good.  You can smell it above all the exhaust from the busses.   It just smells amazing.They have a large variety of Foods...all fresh and many made to order like the coconut shrimp. The meat  patties are AMAZING!!!  Get them.  $2 a pop packed with flavor...buy one for everyone you know.  They heat up well and are delicious hot or cold.I had the jerk chicken with the mango chutney with sweet plantains and beans & rice.   It was solid!  Plenty of food for leftovers.   So good and so affordable.    They also have fish,  soups and vegetarian options.   The food isn't overly Spicy but packed with flavor.  I wish I could cook like this, but instead I can come here.Staff is also super nice and helpful.> This place has been getting a little under-the-radar mention in various local publications, so we decided to check it out. Excellent!A very tasty and well-prepared fast serve menu served in generous portions. Lots of flavor as might be expected for Jamaican cuisine. Jamaica Mi Hungry has the look and feel of a generic local fast food or pizza joint which belies the well-prepared creative menu items. The environment is bright, clean and reasonably attractive -- the food is delicious, spectacular and absolutely wonderful.The food is prepared on an open grill and the chef seems quite skillful in making the various house specialties. We had the Jerk Pork Shoulder which was made with a amazingly intense sauce. Also the Pulled Pork sandwich which comes with a unique and spicy slaw and roasted plantains.Expect to spend $12 to $15 for an entree (with sides) or for a huge sandwich. Good for take out -- or just take home the portion which you can't finish.The location is next to the MBTA Orange Line Jackson Square station and has convenient free parking in back of the building, between it and the station. The entrance to the parking area is up the entrance driveway from southbound side of Columbus Avenue. (It looks like you're driving into the MBTA's busway but the parking lot entrance bears off to the left.) This is definitely a place to which we'll return.> Street parking only, quality food and great community feel and service. Really good authentic  Jamaican dishes that reminds me of being back home one the Caribbean. Really awesome story of them starting as a food truck and not opening their first of many resturants. Would highly suggest coming here to get so good warm homemade Caribbean food.> I've never had Jamaican food before and this exceeed my expectations. First off, the location is super convenient, being right off the Jackson Square stop. The inside is sleek, new and clean.  The menu has a variety of options, even for my vegan and veggie friends out there. Most meals were 12-15 dollars, with PLENTY of food. (I only ate half and took the rest home for leftovers) I personally got Jerk chicken as an entree with side of rice beans and plantains. The chicken was plentiful and Delicious. It was slightly spicy with a tropical mango-y chutney on top. The plantains were perfectly fried with just a touch of sweetness. 10/10 would come back to try more of their food!> Please please please just go here! The food is incredible and cheap. The jerk chicken is SO tender and amazing and the sauce is to die for. Seriously. Nothing fancy at all about this place, located right off of the jackson sq orange line stop. Anybody near Roxbury or Jamaica Plain needs to check this fairly new restaurant out to make sure it stays in business for a very long time (mostly for my selfish reasons because I love it so much!)

Great dinner with friends at Giacomo's!Visiting Boston for just a couple days, Giacomo's was highly recommended by a friend as a must try and it did not disappoint! Be prepared for a long wait since it is a small restaurant but the atmosphere feels like you're at home with family and the food was great! My orders for the night:Burrata Calamari Lobster RavioliSpinach Fettucine> Very disappointed in takeout tonight. We got the house special Zuppa Di Pesce for two, and very certain the lobster was not fresh (strong ammonia taste and smell). I hope this is a one-off during coronavirus, but I have to question this restaurant's competence and/or ethics after this experience.> I was looking on Yelp for a not-too-expensive Italian restaurant in the North End, and Giacomo's seemed like an amazing place to try. I stopped by with a friend on Wednesday evening at 6pm and waited outside for around 10 minutes. Walking inside, I realized how small the space was. We were seated by a very friendly waiter in a small table crammed by the windows and door entrance. I ordered the mussels & calamari linguine with fracomo sauce, & my friend ordered the fettuccini with salmon in a tomato cream sauce. The portions are very filling & the waiter would come to check up on us often.Only one star docked off because I was quite uncomfortable squished in the corner. I tried to move the table, but the waiter pushed it back in to make way for people entering.> We were by TD Garden and a friend wanted to take advantage of being by North End to stop by for an early dinner there.  I was game.We stopped by an ATM at the CVS ($3 fee) since Giacomo's is known to be cash only.  There were already lines formed outside both Daily Catch and Giacomo's, down the street from one another.  At least 4 parties were ahead of us, but the wait wasn't long.Once seated, we somehow managed to make our selections off the chalkboards posted on the walls before our waiter came by again.  Giacomo's is indeed generally rather affordable, with regular entree prices ranging from $16 (particularly for their vegetarian and chicken dishes) to $20 (for their grilled fish and fruitti di mare), and their House Special seafood dinner for 2 at $65, with a split plate charge of $10 per person (which we figured was for additional people sharing the house special).  Their Specials board was a different ballgame, pricing at $20/$22/$24/$30 (for a lobster pasta bake).We ordered an entree apiece to share:Fusilli Siciliana with eggplant, onions, mozzarella cheese in a plum tomato sauce $16Shrimp and Scallops served over linguini $18, with the Giacomo lobster sauce.Veal Marsala Prosciutto, Mushroom $17 with ZitiMy findings -Their pasta was cooked a bit long for al dente.The veal was a little tough.There were 3 shrimp and 4 scallops.The Giacomo sauce was the bomb!  5 stars.Service was responsive to my requests and refilled our water several times without our asking.   But we didn't get the pasta side to the veal till I asked, and when it came, the ziti was linguine.Next time, something with their Giacomo sauce again, and perhaps give their chicken parm a shot?> Love how small and cute the restaurant was. This place is a bit small so don't be surprised if you're side-by-side with another table. Employees are super friendly as well and don't rush you to order despite people waiting outside. My friend and I came here on a Monday night around 6:30pm and there was only one party ahead of us so we got in pretty quickly. I got the frutti di mare with fra como sauce. It was delicious and the price was great as well. The sauce wasn't that spicy fyi. There was a generous amount of seafood too. I think the only thing that they can improve on is providing different past options. The sauce I ordered didn't adhere well to the pasta noodles. My friend's sauce was less runny and didn't seem to have that issue. (I forgot what her sauce was). Note: this is cash only but there is an ATM across the street. They charged me a $3 fee to use it.

This is a handmade udon spot you ought to taste at least once. The best time to go is right when it opens because the line starts up pretty consistently during busy meal times and they're limited in seating - when one person leaves, the next person in line can get seated.They have a few Udon dishes, and all of them are good - it just depends if you're in the mood for a hot broth or a cold but just as flavorful dish. I've tried them all several times, so much that I've gone here solo just to get a really satisfying meal. There's no takeout of leftovers so come hungry and bring cash!> I went a few months ago on a weekday at around 6ish and the line was so long. Even though the line moved fast, prepare to wait for at least 30 mins or more. You will be given a menu while you are in line. Menu is simple, theres only 3 items: cold niku udon, spicy cold niku udon, and hot niku udon. And when it's almost your turn to get seated, you place you order and pay for it upfront before you get seated! (Cash only!)Spicy Cold Niku Udon:I can't handle spicy but I can totally handle the spicy udon here! It wasn't spicy at all. Udon texture is chewy and the beef goes really well with the "spicy" sauce. There's also a crunchy topping and scallion to enhance the texture of the whole dish! its honestly so good! :) The only thing i would say is the portion is relatively small but you can add-on extra udon/beef according to your preference.  Takeaway:- There's ALWAYS a line. Prepare to wait at least 30 mins or more in line but its definitely worth it! -  Service is super efficient and quick- One of the best udon places in Boston> this is a long overdue review and you've probably already heard about this place from friends. it's the udon equivalent to yume wo katare down the street and i love this place a LOT more and will always come here instead of ywk even though i actually am more a fan of ramen than udon. i've waited 15 min here (arrived at 5:10p on a weekday) and i've waited 1.5 hours here (arrived at noon on a saturday).if the line is super long, you'll usually get asked your order when you're waiting in line and near the front so they can prepare everything. you pay (CASH ONLY) before you sit. not many options to choose from but each is amazing. i've tried the hot and the spicy cold and i would say the main difference is that the hot really seems to fill you up a lot more than the cold due to the extra broth. when i'm really starving, i opt for the hot and when i don't feel super hungry, i go for the cold, which is still very filling. i just feel generally better after eating the cold than the hot, probably because i don't feel uncomfortably stuffed (because i go for that perfect each time, FLEX). udon consistency is great. the spicy cold is not actually that spicy even though it looks like it. the beef is sometimes fatty, sometimes not; really depends on the day you go there. love the little fried pieces on top and i try to get extra portions of that when i order. broth for both hot and cold are amazing. staff is out of this world and the view is great when you get to sit at the top row. and for the diehard fans, yga has yearly cards! this place is an experience.> Love the consistency of the udon here. It's chewy and so fresh! Tried the spicy cold niku udon and the sauce was lovely. I would've preferred it without the mini shrimp pieces though. Pay the extra $1 for extra noodles!!!! Wait isn't terrible especially since it's indoors.> This udon spot is super hyped up and worth the fame it gets! The wait in the line can get up to an hour since they also have two rows of seating in the shop. I recommend coming close to the opening time to skip a long wait but even if you end up at the back of the line, the time flies. If anything, it might help increase your appetite! The point of this shop is just to eat and then leave so if you plan on looking for a restaurant to socialize in for a long time, it wouldn't be the spot for you.As you move up in the line, a staff member will ask you for your party size and what item you want to order. It definitely is harder to be seated if you come in a bigger party so I would recommend sticking to 4 people or less. As for the menu, it's really simple. There are only 3 types of udon options: cold niku udon, spicy cold niku udon, and hot niku udon. When it's time to be seated, you will be asked to pay first before grabbing utensils and water/tea to your seat. Keep in mind that they are also cash only! I ordered the spicy cold niku udon and it was perfect. The udon was smooth and silky, making it fun to slurp. It also had a perfect chew. The chili mixed well into the broth and the noodles caught the flavors of everything perfectly. I also really enjoyed the crunch of the tempura topping which added a different texture to the overall dish. They don't give a lot of beef so I recommend getting extra.This udon spot is definitely worth trying out. The entire process is efficient, despite the wait, and the udon itself is delicious. You can also watch as the fresh udon noodles are made!

This bar is a small jewel in Quincy. Great atmosphere and fantastic chowda! Perfecto pan pizza and quick /friendly service for a busy place!> The service here is so bad it's almost comical. Food is ok. Not great but not bad. It would be better is the wait staff wrote down the order to ensure you actually get what you ordered. On a happy note the drinks we got were strong which was good because we were never offered a second.> The waitresses are friendly. I thought all the food was okay. I tried a few different things and nothing stood out as DELICIOUS. Beer was cheap and there was trivia which was nice. I like the atmosphere and music. Cool place to hangout.> Read before you even step in into this hall: This hall overcharged us 3 times, after we asked a receipt they told us to get the f*** out here f*** immigrants.  Filling a police report on discrimination!> You can put lipstick on a pig... changing the exterior is not an indicator that things got better inside. Used to be a "good" place to for steak tips, service was "ok" but I'd say everything has gone down the urinal. Honestly, they should just make it a bar only, or cut back on the food to burgers only. Certainly not a destination spot for dinner.Sadly, the only Anglo business left in Wolly is not worth the visit. Virtually no parking.  The crowd inside are professional drinkers.  Service has gotten worse over the years. Very disappointing; if this were "Chopped" it would have been cut in the second round.  2.5 stars overall.

This place has had renovations on the inside since the last time I remember. The inside looks beautiful and is always spotless. My husband and I really enjoy the buffet lunch option on weekends because there's more than enough options and everything looks and tastes fresh. I really love how clean the buffet always looks and it's one of the reasons we always come back. I apologize if my spelling of these words are wrong because I'm Hispanic and not Brazilian. Haha! One of my favorites at the buffet is the salpicao which I believe is like a Brazilian chicken salad with carrots, raisins, potatoes sticks etc. It sounds crazy but it's sooo good! I also really like the feijoada which is like a black bean stew with fatty meatparts. It's perfect over white rice. Hispanics have a similar dish, but I think Brazilians do it better. Shhh! Don't tell my Abuela! If your new here I would just try a little bit of everything from the buffet. I've never tried anything here I didn't like. I don't even like kale and I tried a kale salad they had at their buffet and I loved it. I would just recommend weighing your food because I personally think the unlimited meat rodizio option is too much meat. The only thing I don't like about this restaurant is the parking. The parking lot looks a little abandoned and the lines for the spots has faded so the cars just park wherever they think the lines should be. It would be nice if this were fixed since this is the first impression new customers have of the restaurant. I didn't take any stars off for that because the food, cleanliness, and customer service are more important to me than parking. It's just something to mention for new people. Don't judge the place by the exterior because the food and cleanliness inside is great!> Food is priceyFlavors are so-soStandard servicePlace was clean. I appreciate clean.> Who doesn't love meat on big huge skewers!??  Place is actually pretty good!  It's a little confusing about how pricing is at first.  Once you figure it out you're all set!  I had chicken that was absolutely amazing!   I'd definitely go back!> Yikes. I would not recommend this place unless you were an animal in which case you wouldn't care about what you were eating. The meat was not properly cooked and 8/10 servings I had were not hot temperature wise. Either the meat was too well done or absolutely raw. Also concerning was that the salad dressings were not refrigerated all and there was absolutely no toilet seat in one of the restroom toilets. I suggest you spend your money somewhere else where service is fast and the quality is better.> With the city's burgeoning Brazilian population, this place came in, and we thought we'd try the rodizio.  Ugh, and again, ugh.First off, there were only four different meats, which varied from underdone to overdone to gristly.  The only decent meat was a sausage, which I like, but my wife doesn't.  I don't remember now what we first ordered for dessert, but it was ghastly, and after taking a bite and a half each we asked the waitress to take the sludge back and bring us an alternative.  The price of the dinner was quite high, in the end, and we were charged for the terrible desserts we'd returned.  $60 so I could eat some sausage and we could get some Table Talk pie slices is way out of line, given that we could have had a terrific dinner at The Fours for two-thirds the price.Stay away from this hack joint.

We've been going to Rozafa for quite a few years now.  The food is so consistently good !  The food is fresh and portions perfect !  With the full bar, now I can get an excellent Margerita with my meals !Try the Saltimboca and the Bruchetta-so good !> I have been here several times , I never leave disappointed! The  Mediterranean grilled vegetable salad is out of this world, especially when you add the steak tips (which  are Always  tender). The tzatziki and grilled pita are so fresh. This is my go to place for an amazing lunch!!> This place surprised me - really good food and exceptional service!  Our waitress Kat was wonderful.  I've been here two weeks in a row and am impressed by the quality of food.  You can't beat the vegetable platter to start.  I've been on a pasta kick and this place satisfied my cravings.  Both visits I had the eggplant and it was delicious - tough to get good eggplant parm that hasn't been prefrozen (or taste like it).  This weekI had the Bolognese and it was delightful.  Check out this neighborhood restaurant- I think you'll be surprised.> FIRST IMPRESSIONOur first impression was with Gabriella, what an energetic and delightful soul. Her attentiveness and friendliness were TRULY appreciated!DRINKS: Gabby made our cocktails, I went with the Cosmo and my lovely companion went with a pear Marttini, absolutely some of the best cocktails so farFOOD: We ordered two Greek gyros, something we order a lot these days and I have to say that no other eatery has even come close to the quality and the flavor these. The dill slice was a perfect match and the homemade potato chips were awesome!Marlon, Claudio and Gabriella, thank you for serving some of the best food we've had so far. A charming and delightful experience. Decorated in a cozy style. We highly recommend this place to everyone!Zac and Pat> My dinner experience was adequate.  Not great.  Not awful.  It was clean.  Servers were very friendly.  The noise level was quite high, to the point of retarding conversation in my group, therefore I would definitely not recommend it for a hot date.Agree with a prior review that the onion soup tasted bland.  Even the color was a bit washed out.  In my opinion it needed more beef in the broth, and a dash of brandy.The steak au poivre was not what I was expecting.  The cut of meat was nice and it was cooked to temperature.  But normally the meat is accompanied by a luscious peppercorn/brandy/cream sauce.  No sauce here.Unlikely to return.

menu_dishes: Grilled Salmon, Grilled Chicken, Thai Chicken Salad, Apple Walnut Chicken Salad, Southwest Wrap, Teriyaki Chicken Wrap, Turkey Burger, Wasabi Salmon Burger, Potato Chips, Mediterranean Bowl
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: This restaurant should be rated higher. 1 staff was friendly. 2 chowder was great, both seafood and clam chowder. 3 stuffed shrimp with dressing was amazing. Truly amazing.4 salads were fresh. Table clothes on all tables with cloth napkins.> Horrible customer service and hospitality, but at least the food was palatable. This establishment features a rude manager and staff who provide only attitude and no solutions. Quite appalling that the manager "Dickey" was nothing but a dick to the members of my family who chose to use The Common Market for a bereavement reception. If looking for a decent dining experience (at best), I recommend taking your business elsewhere.> A professional organization I belong to had a luncheon for about 40 folks here today, and everything went very well.This is a big restaurant with quite a few private rooms. Our room was upstairs and it had a bar which worked out great for us.  Our bartender, Teresa, was super nice and hospitable, and she mixed up a mean Bloody Mary ($8.75).Our buffet lunch was very good - salad, mixed vegetables, rice, ziti, chicken marsala, baked scrod, and a dish of ice cream with chocolate sauce.I thought the food was excellent- the chicken marsala was tender, the sauce was flavorful, and the mushrooms were plentiful.Thank you for a very nice luncheon experience..> Cyndy's Bottom Line:  Decent food and valueStopped in for dinner and did not know that it is a maze of different restaurants in one building.  We walked into one restaurant looking for our dinner party only to find them on the opposite end.The restaurant was quiet and comfortable.I ordered a medium rare cheeseburger.  The hamburger was cooked to order with cheese, lettuce and tomatoes on a brioche bun.  A decent burger.> This is a great restaurant!- The Chicken Marsala, Angus Burger and Haddock were as good as we have had anywhere. - We found the staff to be friendly and attentive. - The restaurant was clean and inviting with plenty of parking.I wish it was closer to home because I would have a new go to place.

come here for very special occasions :) Of course I had to visit here since people in Cambridge tend to spell my name (Olena) as Oleana, which just confirms how famous this place is.~Inside - cozy and inviting. Nice interior and warm dim lights.~Usually for two people we order Chefs choose of meze and one main dish. Lamb gyro was ordered by us again :)I like that some items stay on menu longer while others change. It is probably the vegetables cooked in the best possible way. ~The service is nice as well even though last time they caught forgetting to bring one out of 4 meze but we got it in the end so...count how many dishes you order and how may you get :) Desserts are small but very rich in taste. ~Again, it is a must visit place!UPD: came there again and they forgot fourth meze out of chefs choice set again :( be careful!> More like 3.5, although the score varies depending on what you order and your preference. A cozy, trendy middle eastern restaurant that pushes the wine heavy and offers a hit and miss menu that frustrates and delights. The fatteh is a beautiful construction of a dish. The layout looks like it could be a modernist house for an insect! The textured are well thought out, as there's three different types of crunch. The yogurt has a lovely tang that ties everything together. Every bite felt like a chamber orchestra in my mouth. Definitely make sure to get this.The spinach falafel was good, but not as amazing as everything else. If anything, this would be something id eat for a healthy lunch. As a vegan, this will strike your heart as hearty, nutritional, earthy vibes. I would have dialed the cumin down by one notch, but thats just me.The lamb tortellini is delicious. Each tortellini feels like a small package, specially wrapped under the Christmas tree. The flavor of the lamb shines like a pattern from a boat surrounded by a lake of labneh. The labneh itself comes off like pimento cheese sauce but in a good way. The mint oil adds a brushstroke of freshness while further anchoring the oil profile of the dish, although it never gets overwhelming. I'm glad they dont serve it piping hot, but it does get lukewarm fairly quick.The Quail kebobs were quite underwhelming for being the last item of my meal. I expected this to be small, but I wasn't expecting it to taste like chicken breast covered in a nutty parmesan pesto crust. Out of all the dishes, this one fell flat like a middle schooler's voice breaking halfway through the final note of his cadenza. The birds nest dessert was not as good as other bird's nests Ive had at other places. It felt like everything was its own separate part, rather than a total sum. The cheese board like layout of some of the ingredients feel compartmentalized, as well as incomplete as a "nest of a bird". The redeeming factor is everything was solid in how it tasted. No cheap chocolate, no flat flavors. The honeycomb is candy and not real honeycomb, but I honestly didn't mind since it was more about texture (and I didn't want a sugar rush as I was already full). Im really glad I didn't order the Sultan's delight prix fixe option. I have a feeling I would have scored this place much more harshly than I am now. Granted, I didn't eat every item on the menu. I think overall it's a hit or miss experience. If I lived in the neighborhood, perhaps I would be able to fully explore the menu, but alas I don't live in Boston. This would not be my first choice or recommendation to come here if you have a limited stay in Boston, but for locals, Id say its still worth going to. Just make sure you do plenty of research ahead of time.> So I'm visiting Boston and everyone says get a lobster roll...eat the clam chowder...order cannoli...and while those items were good, nothing really felt special in Boston until I ate at Oleana.   This was such a small, cozy restaurant tucked away in a residential neighborhood that we couldn't find the restaurant until we literally walked in front of it.  I don't even remember a sign...if there was, it was small.Two favorite dishes of the night were the lemon chicken and the mini butternut dolma.  For the dolma, the goat cheese and sumac work so well together and then the tomato brown butter mellows it out.  The lemon chicken was moist, had a flavorful za'atar layer on top and the cheese pancake was the perfect piece to go on the bottom.  The one disappointing dish was the hummus.  I like my hummus smoother and this one was a bit dry (which it had to be to hold the shape it was in I assume) and almost grainy.  Taste was only okay.  If I'm ever in Boston again, I will definitely hit this place up again and skip getting another lobster roll.> I had been meaning to try Oleana for a birthday or anniversary celebration for a couple of years but never planned ahead enough to get a reservation. You really need to plan four weeks in advance if you want a weekend reservation, maybe not quite as far out during the week. Recently, we finally actually visited Oleana for dinner while my in laws were visiting. We were a group of five and shared a number of small plates and a few desserts. We were very pleased with our experience at Oleana. There are a number of nice restaurants in the Cambridge area for a fancy dinner, but Oleana with its Mediterranean-inspired fine dining is definitely unique and a great option for something a bit different. When we arrived, the free parking for Oleana customers was the first thing we appreciated. When we went inside, our table is ready and we were seated right away. The dining area was cozy and pleasant, and the staff were very helpful in terms of recommending what and how much to order. With five people, we were able to try a lot of the small plates on the menu, and everything was delicious. We would definitely recommend this place for a nice night out. They also have a vegetarian dinner option with a chef's choice assortment of small plates, although we chose to just select our own from the menu.> I'm so happy I finally was able to come here!  Oleana is the real deal.  I loved it!  Our table wasn't ready when we arrived at the restaurant, however, we went to the bar and sipped on some wine to pass the time.  The restaurant is very warm and homey with Mediterranean inspired decoration.   it appeared the restaurant guests were locals in the area.  Our waiter was very friendly and offered suggestions of her favorite menu items I came for a date night and suggest ordering small plates for your meal .  We were pretty hungry so we ordered 5 plates, not including dessert (the more the merrier right?!).  We ordered strictly off of the hot meze section of the menu and got the honey nut squash,spinach falafel, fateh, mini butternut dolma, and lamejun.  For dessert we had the chocolate marquise!  Here is a breakdown of our favorite items.Lamejun- my favorite dish of the night! This was like a mini Mediterranean pizza of goodness! The lamb and sauce on top paired perfectly together! Mini butternut dolma- WOW! The lamb in this dish was amazing.  It was so tender and was easy enough to cut with a fork.  The goat cheese on top hit the spot!Chocolate marquise- who would've thought pear sorbet paired well with chocolate? Not me but it was delicious!  The spiced pecan katif offered a nice crunch!

Amazing fooood. The area was small and the parking situation was a little confusing but I loved it. I definitely think this is a great place to go for a date night. It had a great few, great service, smiles all around and the staff are so great about  complimenting people (flattery will get you an extra star from me lmao)But seriously, this was a great experience. Food:Bread to start. It was soft and melted In my mouth and they had different flavors. I can be very critical of calimari and this one did not disappoint. Perfectly crunchy and just the right consistency. For my meal, I had Duck and sweet potato . I'm not a huge duck person but I became a true fan after.> My original experience with Alma Nove was a lackluster lunch, spiffing a caprese salad on a dry turkey sandwich that had me legitimately avoiding a return visit.Then I stopped in for drinks, and found myself eyeballing passed plates with aplomb. So, it was time to give it a fair shot at a proper dinner.So, so glad I did. The bar is appropriately sceney, catering to Hingham Shipyard regulars, families and large groups alike. Food caters to a seafood-forward Italian (duh) cuisine, and sharing a few starters with cocktails at a near-bar hightop makes for a great date.Views are delightful, and the approachable elegance won't make anyone feel out of place.> Friendly, often eat at bar, friendly. Always get Mediterranean salad.. which is so nice, fresh, tomatoes onions cucumbers feta cheese, Olive's, it's a 5.0.. I like their appetizers best. Extra nice restaurant in summer with outdoor eating. White cloth restaurant.---UpdateDowngraded from 4 to 3.6Decided to have dinner at bar. Started with good bottle Twenty Rows Cab 44.00. Appetizer , we shared a Suppli, excellent, it's nice, 2 ' logs' I like it. Call it a 4.0. My wife ordered baked rigatoni the short rib and spinach tomato. Very disappointing. No short rib detection but aside from that the dish is way to cheesy , a bit soupie- not appetizing  presentation from my lens. Taste - at best a 2.9-3.0 Definitely would never order again. I had a lamb shank with mashed potatoes. Very good, 3.9-4.0 better than Tosca's over sized/ plated of the same.  Just affirmation in the Mediterranean salad which is a solid 5.> Amazing bday take-out!! Made the weirdest bday ever so special! Thxs to the team and McKenzie and Leslie.> This place is amazing. From the interior, to the service, and most importantly the food. So so good. Happily enjoyed every bite. For starters we had their handmade cod cakes butternut tahini, eggplant caponata, little different from what we expected for taste. Not sure why because they boast of being Mediterranean & that definitely came across. The best was my meal, I had the Homemade gnocchi wild mushrooms, Madeira, truffled Pecorino, unbelievable. Best gnocchi I've had in while. My fiancée had the Wood-grilled swordfish riso venere, caramelized fennel, lobster, charred Meyer lemon herb salsa. Also very good. For desert we split the Bourbon Banana Bread Pudding house-made vanilla ice cream, caramel pecans, candied bacon. So so good. Definitely worth the 8 min wait they let you know it will be. Over all. Was very satisfied. Pricing was decent. Not overly priced. With good size portions.

Stopped in for brunch around 11 am on a Saturday morning with a group of 5. There is a validated parking lot right across the street and it is a huuuge plus. The place was not too busy so we were seated right away in a booth with a chair placed on the end so it was kind of cramped but not a big deal. The waitress was friendly and did a great job of keeping the coffee flowing and patient as it took us a while to look at the menus and order.Everyone got the pre-fix brunch which were all pretty solid. Came with a coffee cake, coffee, omelet with fries or french toast. The food wasn't out of this world but definitely a great deal and very satisfying. It was great to have this option with a medium size group!> So to start off, I'm French and let me tell you this place is an insult to be called French food. But let me start with the PROS:- Decor and drinks/bar very good- Fun Fact: this place shot a scene of Ted here.- If they know how to serve Suze or similarly Pernod correctly, you're off to a good start, sadly this is where to buck stops.Now the CONS: - It's soo Salty I spat the food and could not taste my breakfast the next morning.- The concept of the food is there, but the execution and presentation is dreadful. - The marinade they use for their steak is the same as their escargot... unbelievably lazy. I'm a huge proponent of reusing parts of food but to not alter them, disgraceful.- The portion size of protein - smaller than Michelin started restaurants. I like my main platter (Steak) to be bigger than the sides (French fries/salad)- Please be more consciousness of the sauce, when my béarnaise sauce separates or the escargot marinade separates... that's a problem.- Oh and way too loudOVERALL:- If you're looking for a nice French restaurant whether for a date or - please choose from the 3 other options around the area- Great drinks, horrible food- Brunch is meh, lunch is dreadful, dinner is dreadful^2> Atmospheric as all get out, and the menu screams Parisian bistro but the execution is fairly plain Jane.Been for crepe et oeuf brunch (a solid prix fixe deal, true to the Aquitaine Group's legacy as a destination for midday mealers), dinner and drinks and find the casual, not too large bar scene is where it's at. Brass and browns aplenty, and there's a sizable lot adjacent to the restaurant if street parking is rare.For classic French specialties, I prefer eating at Ma Maison, Frenchie or Bar Lyon. For socializing with mis amies and agreeable light bites, Gaslight is an easy go-to.> We came here for brunch and it was lovely! We unfortunately missed the pre-fixe brunch which looks like a steal, but we ordered from the regular brunch menu. We ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, French toast, and Berkshire pork hash. Smoked salmon eggs Benedict was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. French toast was surprisingly not too sweet which we enjoyed. Our favorite was the pork hash topped with an egg, very flavorful and rich. We also ordered the drink called Grey't Expectations. Very cute name and would probably be tasty, but they did a heavy heavy pour on the gin. Technically very worth the money for the alcohol content, but probably equivalent to just sipping on straight gin. Overall, would recommend for brunch! Interior is very comfortable and cute.> Honestly this is one of the best places to grab brunch in all of Boston. From the exemplary service to the absolutely delicious food this place deserves all 5 stars from me. The berkshire pork hache is possibly the best hash I've ever had in my life. It was crispy on the outside and so tender on the inside. You can see the strands of pork and potato perfectly mixed on the inside. The eggs and toast on the side only added to delicious ensemble. The egg with its runny yolk delivered a creaminess that elevated the pork hash to another level. When you put all three together, the toast, the hash and the egg, it becomes pure bliss. A perfect mix of texture and flavor. The toast provided the crunch, the creaminess of the eggs and then the flavor and impact of the hash. Great place for mimosas as well! They do not skimp on the champagne. I've also had the croque madame and the crepes. They are amazing as well and I highly recommend them.
