popular_dishes: No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Ordered popcorn chicken from here for delivery from Ubereats! Definitely can attest to it being the best popcorn chicken I've ever tried!Also to the comments about the bubble tea not being incredibly wow - I thought the one I had was pretty amazing. I got the green milk tea and added milk foam and herbal jelly. The milk foam really packs a punch :)> ViVi does the $1.99 promotion at least once a year on selected drinks and food. I would totally recommend taking advantage of this deal for times where you're looking to try a new drink.Also, I would highly suggest getting their popcorn chicken!> I don't usually come here, but whenever I do, I am still not impressed. For a boba spot, this place is very bland. I've probably only tried 3 drinks here, but all 3 drinks I have tried had absolutely no taste. It literally tasted like water or straight up milk. The popcorn chicken here is probably the only thing I like ordering. The egg puffs here are okay..I have definitely had better. If you are new to the area, you should give it a shot. I however am not a big fan of this place and will only come here if my friends are really craving it.> As a disclaimer, this was based on an Über Eats order. I guess I am a tough crowd... Don't get me wrong, the stuff I had was solid, but nothing worth writing home about. I write here because I got to keep the Yelp game strong.Ordered some popcorn chicken (Cajun variety) and bubble tea. The bubble tea was alright, no complaints. There was nothing super spectacular about it, but then again, bubble tea by nature is not Something which brings the fireworks.The chicken though, I was hoping for a little bit of fireworks, especially considering the Cajun flavoring. What I liked was that it wasn't overly greasy, and it was delightfully moist. On the other side however, I found it having an inadequate amount of breading. Also, while I did feel there was some Cajun spice in there, it was more like a hint then something that helped give it some oomph.I might give them another shot with some of their other options, just not the chicken.> Great spot to get bubble tea they have a lot of fun drink options, The gyoza is great and the popcorn chicken is great as well! The egg puff is a fun dessert to try also

The restaurant is nice - nice layout and feeling. The food we ordered were two sets of rolls and two of the rice bowls. The portions were larger than expected and the food was good. It is a bit expensive but nice overall - definitely would go back.The best bit for me was that my child has a food allergy and the server & chef completely took care of it and instilled complete confidence that they could cater to that - much appreciated.> I have been to Earl's a few times and have had a positive experience. Today I went with a group of 9 for brunch and all was great UNTIL the bill arrived.  For wine, there are three pour options- 5 oz, 7 oz & 9 oz and I ask... would it be a best business practice to ask which a customer would prefer or am I crazy?  I ask this because the bill arrived and I had drank two $19.75 9oz pours! I asked the server they noted that their default is 9 oz unless otherwise specified. I get it, you pay for what you get and I got a 9 oz but really, ask you customer what they want- that just feels like the right thing to do.Update:  3.15.20- I was quick to do a review and having been in customer service for many years, I should have known better than to post a review on a public forum. I appreciate the follow-up from Earl's and anticipate their staff will start asking people their choice vs. assuming we want the most expensive option on the menu.> The drinks and food here were really good. I'd highly recommend the Marilyn Monroe drink and the steak with sushi. The toffee desert was delicious as well. The restaurant is pretty good and has a great atmosphere for really any dinner situation.Our server was good at the beginning but kind of forgot about us toward the end, which is why I gave this 4 stars. For example, my friend had ordered spicy mayo and a second drink and she never got them. But I thought she was really nice and offered great suggestions.> I was very impressed during my first visit here a few weekends ago. My girlfriend and I sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by several bartenders, every one of them were friendly and attentive. We ordered a few appetizers as well as a few drinks. Allof which were delicious. I highly recommend the chicken tacos, the hot chicken sliders, and the clam chowder. We almost ordered a second round of tacos because they were so good. I recommend checking this place out if you're in Assembly Row.> I have been coming to Earls for years. This place is another perfect date night spot or for parties with different food interests. They offer a variety of different cuisines. From burgers to sushi they have a great menu selection. However I wouldn't call their asian cuisine dishes "authentic" but still so tasteful! If you're coming during busy hours I would recommend making a reservation. They do also take your phone number and text you if you want to walk around Assembly Row. They also offer a $6 drink deal that changes every month. This is one of my favorite things about Earls. Especially when the Mules are the drink special of the month!! Their drinks aren't diluted or cheapened during these specials either (at least not that I can tell) which is mind blowing to me.My absolute favorite thing to order here are the Blackened Swordfish Tacos. They're a little zippy, so beware if you're not a huge spice person. They come with two tacos and always taste super fresh and bursting with flavor. They also serve the Impossible Burger. So if you're looking for that, this is the place! Another absolute MUST whenever we go are the truffle fries or garlic fries, their fries are on the thinner side but taste so good! Other notable shareable options are the Hawaiian Coconut Shrimp, Spinach & 3 Cheese Dip, Sushi, there are so many great options!If you're looking for a relaxed vibe to meet up with friends or bring someone who's visiting from out of town. This is your spot! Get a couple shareable dishes and then your own entrees. The ambiance is very relaxing and clean. As the franchise grows the quality of food still seems to stay the same. They opened another location in Boston, but both locations have outdoor seating. I like coming to the Somerville location since there's a little more space to breathe. The service is also great at both locations!Our First Experience:When my boyfriend and I first started dating this was one of the first restaurants we went to. Our first impression caused quite the laugh, we had coincidentally ordered the same exact order as the table sitting next to us (down to the truffle fries). Right after putting our order in the food was brought to our table. Impressed with how fast the food was, our waiter came over and apologized that this order was accidentally taken to the wrong table. However he let us keep it and I'm sure the couple next to us got some compensation.

menu_dishes: Dolmades, Melitzanosalata, Okra Horiatiki, Tyrokafteri, Melitzanosalata, Dolmades, Greek Fava Dip, Zucchini Crisps, Feta Saganaki, Tzatziki Trio, Fried Calamari, Tyrokafteri, Leek and Feta Pies, Olives, Spanakopita Spread, Calamari, Caridez, Zucchini Crisps, Keftedakia, Red Snapper Kontosouvli, Souvlaki, Lobster Kataifi, Patates Tiganites, Artichoke Moussaka, Manti, Octopus, Grilled Whole Shrimp with Risotto and Lemon, Mediterranean Quinoa Salad, Greek Caesar, Roasted Beet, Okra Horiatiki, Horiatiki, Spanakopita Grilled Cheese, Shrimp Pita, Committee Club, Burger, Falafel, Loukaniko Pita, Gyro, Braised Brisket, Branzino (Greece), Poikilia Kreaton, Paidakia (Per Kilo), Shrimp Skordo, Caridez, Artichoke Moussaka, Short Ribs Stifado, Paidakia, Paidakia, Poikilia Kreaton, Branzino (Lavraki), Baklava Cheesecake, Galaktobourekakia, Sokolata, Cappuccino, Greek Coffee, Espresso, Coffee, Sokolata, Baklava Cheesecake, Galaktobourekakia, Green Tea, Black Tea, Espresso, Coffee, Greek Coffee, Cappuccino, Black Tea, Green Tea, Herbal Tea
popular_dishes: No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: I really enjoyed the cocktails at the bar, seated dinners, and overall ambiance the times that I've been here. There is a 10-15 minute grace period for you to make your reservations so aim to get there on time.To be honest, most of the drinks that I've enjoyed here were just unique concoctions the bartender mixed up by request. I like fruity cocktails, tart sours, or something like a French 75, so they're usually around that flavor profile.> My friend and I have this thing where we take turns choosing the place to hang out. It was my turn, and initial thought was "boring", so we decided to get some Greek/Mediterranean instead.To start, they bring out some warm pita and veggie hummus. The pita was warm and the hummus was mild yet flavorful with just the right amount of oiliness. Both tasted fresh and homemade, and weren't over-the-top, but still a notch or two (or three) above store-bought.Okra Horiatiki was alright. A pretty basic salad with a little flair. The dressing, if any, wasn't overdone eiither. My suggestions for improvement: I did find there was a little too much feta, and the okra crisps, while a nice touch, were out of sync with the salad. It may be a good idea to have the strips be smaller, if not integrated in the salad.Bao was an interesting experience. Overall, the Baos was more in line with baos found in Asian restaurants, with just a little greek flair by way of the slaw and sauce. Because they were advertised as "gyro" I expected the meat to be a little closer to the meat you shave off those large rotisserie machines. My gripe is that the meat wanted it to stick together, so biting into the gyro, the rest of the meat followed, leaving me with mostly steamed bun and some slaw/sauce. These flairs of slaw and sauce were nice, but didn't put too big a dent in the flavor. Having a little more crunch would be appreciated. Great Scott! cocktail was an interesting mixture, but all the additions didn't really shine through. Reading about the brown-butter washed whiskey, Cynar, vanilla, saline, creole and chocolate bitters I expected something out of this world. Instead, I got what was just a really solid old-fashioned.Dessert-wise, Galaktobourekakia (think baklava only with custard) didn't really do it for me. On the plus side, the dough was amazingly flaky, and the custard was tasty. On the minus the balances were off, and it seemed heavy on the custard for something intended as an interpretation of a baklava. Where this place shines though, is the service. Not only was it the usual "quick and polite" I write so often, but exceedingly attentive. When I needed to find my server, and another saw me looking around, they came over and offered their help. Teamwork... it makes the dream work, because the dream without food... well... is less tasty.> Came on a Sunday morning for brunch. Great ambiance, modern decor, a little loud, perfect for groups. Service is kind of slow, we waited over 30 minutes for our waiter to take the order, and ended up flagging down a random (but helpful) waiter. The food was underwhelming in terms of selection and taste (not bad, but not something to return for), so combined with meh service and higher prices, this place is a three stars for me. Ordered:- Trio of Dips: yummy, but we ended up ordering too much, and in hindsight, should have omitted this. - Greek Pancakes (half stack): great texture on the pancakes, but personally the greek yogurt threw me off. I kept expecting it to be whipped cream so the yogurt tang was a surprise every bite. A half stack is still MASSIVE, so don't underestimate this. - Shakshouka: not the best shakshouka I've ever had, but decent. The eggs were cooked well-done, and the flavor overall was weak. Drinks: - Red Ruby Sipper: true to name, nice to sip on and tasty. - Disco Juice: STRONG. One of my favorites was their complimentary bread with fig jam -- delicious. Unfortunately they don't sell the jam separately for take home.> Solid brunch spot in the seaport area. The place was busy when we showed up, but for a party of 3, they did have seating in the communal table area. They offer solid cocktails. The bloody mary was one of the most delicious that I ever tasted. The mix tasted fresh and wasn't overly salty or spicy. The zucchini crisps were like a healthy version of potato chips. The burger that I had was a juicy mess, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. I told my fiancee that we definitely need to come back for their dinner offerings.> Organized a birthday brunch here for my friend. They are able to accommodate large groups in advance, we had 12 people. Our server Jordan was phenomenal and friendly.  They even allowed us to bring an outside cake in and sliced it for us without a fee which I've seen elsewhere.  The restaurant is a bit loud as we heard a continuous stream of top 40 hits so may not be the best place for a quiet outing. While not listed on the menu, they do serve both mimosas and bloody Mary's for brunch. My mimosa was $8.  They do have a cocktail menu as well. I take away a star since the food is not always up to par. My Greek omelette was pretty bland and overcooked.

What a wonderful way to start off our Boston trip. A friend suggested we go to north end for some good food and good food we certainly did find. In fact, incredible food! Our wait time: There was about a 30 minute wait to be seated but entirely worth the wait. This is a very small restaurant so don't expect to be seated immediately. The kitchen takes up half the space! The food: We ordered Aglio Olio (the squid ink pasta with olive oil, calamari, and garlic) as well as the Monkfish Marsala. Both dishes were delicious and absolutely a must order. The monkfish Marsala was some of the best fish I've ever ordered. My husband and I couldn't get enough of that dish. I highly recommend it. The portion sizes: My husband and I ordered the entree portions of both aforementioned meals, had the bread to start, and had gotten the salad instead of the pasta that comes with the fish. We were both full but didn't have to worry about taking food home as we finished our meals and nearly licked our plates clean then and there. The service: Great! They were friendly, quick, and helpful with our questions about the menu. They even split our salad for us without us having to ask which was great foresight on our servers end. This restaurant is worth the wait! I also suggest dropping by Mike's after you finish your meal if you still have room for dessert.> One of my fav spots in NE.  Limited seating, small  tables, fast service.  If there s a line outside, it ll go quickly.  My fav dish there is the Black Pasta w Putenesca sauce.  They serve it right out of the pan.> I literally planned a trip to Boston because the fra divolo pasta in Strictly Dumpling's video looked so amazing so The Daily Catch was a must go. We came around 7:30 pm and we had to wait an hour not because there were a lot of people in line but because the space is so small and there are only 3 people running the entire thing - a chef, a dishwasher, and a waiter/front of house.The table arrangement sucked because my boyfriend and I had to sit with another couple but it was only ok since they were so nice. We ordered the fra divolo for 2 and a full order of the squid ink pasta with ground calamari. The squid ink pasta is a must get - so delicious and a pretty unique dish. The fra divolo actually disappointed me a bit because I wanted the tomato-y sauce to be thicker or chunkier or to have more flavor/spice. Just a little more umph and it would've been perfect with the pasta and seafood. Maybe I should've been like Mike and brought some of my own chili oil.> The first time I came here, I waited 1:30 hr in the freezing cold for a table... and it was totally worth it for the ink pasta! This time around we got lucky with everyone being afraid to be out because of the coronavirus. No wait and the food was just as fabulous! For any foodie visiting Boston, this place is a MUST! Last time we came we tried more of their menu, EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!> Is this place worth all the hype? YES! Absolutely! This is a no frills, cash only, very small restaurant, but the food is wonderful. I highly recommend the black squid ink pasta with aglio olio sauce and fried calamari. The pasta was one of the best dishes I've had in a while. This place clearly knows how to prepare pasta and seafood and everything is super fresh. This restaurant is truly worth checking out if you're in Boston.

We had such an amazing evening at Gustazo. We had been wanting to check-out this place since we saw it on many of the top 50 lists, but we decided to stop by on Wednesday night around 7:30. Try to get a reservation earlier! We tried day of and they did not have ideal options and we were encouraged to try for the first come first serve bar or high top seating. The high top and bar would be ideal for 1-3 people but with 4 it would have been harder to talk across the wide tables. We waited about an hour to be seated. I was a little hesitant to wait a full hour, but I'm so glad I did. So here is a full breakdown of our feast! All of the dishes were brought out at a timely point of dinner. We never had more than 3 at a time and they were always hot. The platting was gorgeous, we almost did not want to touch the food. I would have been taking pictures if I wasn't with the others!Berenjena Frita: these sweet eggplant crisps were a nice way to start the meal. They were crispier than I expected and tasted similar to sweet potato fries.Ensalada de Frijoles: this black bean dish was tasty, but nothing incredibly unique. I do wish it came with some plantain chips like the guac does.Costillas a la Guayaba: these baby back ribs were incredibly tender. The pineapple purree was a nice touch to the dish. We were scrapping the plate! There were three ribs, and we could easily have enjoyed more!Vieiras con Azafran: these scallops were recommended by the waiter. The fried sage was very interesting and a unique texture. This might have been our least favorite dish in terms of price and overall flavor. The saffron sauce tasted very similar to lobster bisque! There were five scallops and plenty of Serrano ham. The ham was very very salty and wasn't necessary in my opinion - the salt overpowered most of the flavors.Empanadas: these were very tasty and I loved the sauce on the side. They were smaller than we expected, so we ordered two dishes. They were steaming hot which we enjoyed because we knew they were fresh and ready for us! Ropa Vieja: one of our favorite dishes! Who knew you could make beans and rice so flavorful. The flank steak was very tender and the sauces all mixed perfectly. I do wish there was a little spice in this dish - I think that could have taken it over the top! The portion wasn't what I would say large, but it was enough after all of the other split dishes. Serrucho: This dish was Mahi Mahi last night. It was my favorite by far! It as a beautiful dish and the fish had so much flavor! It wasn't too salty and the malanga purree, black quinoa and bok choy all paired wonderfully. This dish is a must try!We ended with two desserts. The crepes were something from my dreams and were incredibly doughy and sweet. We could have passed on the cuban cigar I think - the cigar was more novelty than flavor.> I'd give this place 3.5 stars overall but 5 stars for the cocktails. I would come here just for the cocktails alone. How creative, well-balanced and nearly medicinal they were! Afterwards, I remember thinking, "oh yeah, you should feel good after having a cocktail, not queasy". The balance was perfect! Overall, there seem to be some really amazing dishes here and some that don't quite fit the concept of the creative and elevated take that I think this place is striving for. The tapas  ranged anywhere from deliciously creative to good in a basic, home cooking sort of way. The star of the show for me were the ribs (costillas a la guayaba). Just wow! So tender, you could chew right through the bone. The guava was a great balancing touch. Second favorite was the tamale. This was an elevated tamale, so delicate and fluffy, that it nearly melts in your mouth. The pork belly crisps on top were a nice touch; they too melted in your mouth. The other tapas I tried--the picadillo and the vaca frita taco-- had more of a basic, home cooking sort of taste. Good but nothing special, especially given that it's a fourteen dollar taco! Plus, I was not a fan of the barely cooked slimy egg jiggling atop the picadillo, personally. I know the idea is that it cooks gradually from the heat of the food but it was a bit much. Also, the side of rice and beans might as well have come from a can. It wasn't bad-- it was okay, just not what one would expect at such a place for such prices.> I went to Gustazo for the first time tonight and had one of the best meals I've had in a while. I don't know how more people aren't talking about the Cauliflower because it was incredible-- best cauliflower I've ever had. The empanadas were delicious and the bartender was so friendly. It was packed and she still managed to check on us a lot. Only downside is there are reservations only to get a table. Otherwise you have to sit at communal tables. This was fine for us albeit a little disappointing.  We didn't expect to not be able to get a table on a Wednesday, but now we know.> I'm writing to the server who waited on us downstairs, long hair and great personality, we love you!!! We walked in on a Friday night and were able to get seated pretty quickly. This was a second meal for ya so we couldn't go all out, but the empanadas, octopus and the coconut seafood stew were very memorable. The waiter recommended me the celery cocktail which reminded me of the presses juicery celery juice I had earlier in the day, but more tolerable with the alcohol. The desserts were delicious and the small cups of tttthiiiccckkkk hot chocolate were an amazing way to finish the meal.> We loved everything about this place! Was definitely a treat for my wife's birthday. The drinks were excellent. Lots of choices from old-fashioned drinks to tropical. The bartender was very accomplished. We tried everything on the menu. Plenty of options for carnivores and vegetarians. Interesting fresh ingredients and sauces. Service was excellent and our waiter provided lots of guidance. Great atmosphere and music, but not too loud. Good place for groups. Loved it!

We happened upon this spot accidentally. After parking to go try Passport Sips and Tapas we found it was closed. So we wandered down the street and found Four Square. We grabbed 2 seats at the bar and noticed that the persons to both our right and left were having pizza. It looked really good and the woman next to me confirmed that it was as good as it looked. We decided to give it a try and we were surprised at how very good it was. This is one of the best pizzas on the south shore. It's not a bar style pizza, but more of an Italian style with a rim of crust. This pizza has it all: good sauce, good cheese, great crust. All together it's a gem of a pizza. The bartender was very nice and attentive and the atmosphere was friendly. We will definitely go back.> My husband and I had been waiting to go here. We heard amazing things so when we noticed it was open we finally went and we were so disappointed. Let me start with the good though. The new look is great. We loved the color, bar, restrooms and high tops. The French fries and the pretzels are a must. I would love to see a spicy or grain mustard option for the pretzel or even a nachos cheese sauce. One thing, it's not a giant pretzel, it's two medium sized pretzels. Which is fine but keep it transparent on the menu. Ok, now the main reasons for the score. First, plastic picnic style plates do not have any business in a full service restaurant. I hope the dishwasher was out or not hired yet to justify using them. Second, the burger is clearly from BJs or Costco. Why even ask me how I want it cooked if it's a cheap/thin piece of meat? It's literally a burger you'd get in a high school cafeteria. And for $9?? Absolutely not. Third, many of the sandwich options have additional add-ons for $1. Just cost it out appropriately so it doesn't look like your scraping for cash. Finally, service was really slow. There were maybe 6 people there at different stages of dining and it took us almost an hour. I think this place has potential but we won't be returning anytime soon.> I am so sad to see what had become of my favorite local restaurant.  Four square had amazing food. The menu was very unique with an Italian flare, I enjoyed everything including the pizza and the four square sandwich.  Each menu option was a step above basic and we returned week after week.We visited a few weeks ago with high hopes and were quite disappointed.  The menu is basic to say the least.  Had the calamari that came with blue cheese and carrots and celery...it wasn't buffalo.  My husband had a burger that looked like a smaller burger than a McDonald's burger microwaved.  He was very disappointed given his love for the burgers at the old Four Square.  I had a bar pizza which was nothing to write home about, didn't compare to any legendary bar pizzas in the area.  I'm impartial to their old pizza as bar isn't my favorite but this bar pizza was subpar at best.  Again, the menu is basic.  'Burger', 'chicken sandwich', 'pretzel', 'basket of fries' etc.  it's missing that step above that used to be.  One other comment is that I feel it's missing it's identity.  Is it a bar or is it a restaurant?  It's too small to be a bar but only had about 5 tables, all high tops so it's not family friendly anymore.I'm not rushing back, as sad as it makes me.  I'll give it a few months and hope for improvements.> Four Square has changed hands. We had pizza; bar pizza size, with a nice crust and a flavorful sauce.  The menu is limited right now while the new menu is being set. The word is that there's a new executive chef coming.The service was good, and attentive.  The TV's, taps, lighting all show an intention to provide a pleasant experience.Looking forward to coming back in a few weeks.> Ordered ginger soy wings, arancini, and poutine from Grub Hub yesterday. The wings were way too big, you know, like the unfortunate chickens raised in industrial facilities to be abnormally large. Sauce was great.The arancini were also way too big and lacking any kind of oooomph. The fries and gravy for the poutine were fine, but the menu stated poutine cheese is gruyere, though it tasted like blue. I would say stick to curds. One star for fast Grub Hub delivery. One star for assuming at least the beer is cold in the actual restaurant.

menu_dishes: King Salmon, Torched Madaj, Tuna, Kanpachi, Day Boat Scallop, Sea Urchin, Smoked Atlantic Salmon, Pastrami Smoked Salmon, Smoked White Fish Salad, Smoked Trout, Smoked Fish Platter, Small Plate Holy Trinity of Clam Chowder, Small Plate Boston Lettuce Salad, Small Plate Heirloom Tomato Salad, Small Plate Warm Spicy King Crab Roll, Small Plate Charred Octopus Empanada, Small Plate Torched Salmon Belly, Large Plate Fried Lobster and Waffles, Large Plate Rock Shrimp Scampi, Large Plate Bar Harbor Mussels, Large Plate Wild Striped Bass, Saltie Girl Burger Sandwich, Toast Snow Crab, Toast Smoked Salmon, Toast Boquerones, Toast Fole Gras Terrine, Toast Hand-Chopped Dry Aged Steak Tartare, Diver Scallop, Roasted Mushrooms, Saltie Girl French Fries, Hot French Bread, Cheese Plate
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, No, No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: One of my favorite Boston spots, Saltie Girl is a treat to be able to still order over delivery! It's hard to go wrong with one of their classic rolls, but it's no secret that fries don't travel well, so don't be surprised if they don't match the rolls in quality.What we enjoyed for delivery: Lobster Roll and Fried Clam RollWhere to order: Grubhub and DoorDash (Search: Met Back Bay). For takeout orders, call (617) 267-0691> You wouldn't think it, but the Fried lobster and waffles here is pretty dam tasty and savory.  Imagine a crunchy waffle, lobster chunks fried perfectly, lobster bisque used as a gravy, a few dallops of creme freche, and maple syrup all melding in your mouth at the same time.  Yeah, its umami bro.  They have a Brown sugar/butter Old fashioned on the menu.  While it was solid, ask the bartender to make an manhattan version of this cocktail.  Thank me later.  4.5 stars.> He sent me here. Earlier that day, I was giving a talk to the bright minds of MIT students at one of their conferences - on Innovation. I'm pretty good at speaking in public if I may say so myself. But I'm not good at waiting in line at a restaurant. Luckily for me, the 1 hour wait turned to be only 30 minutes or so because it's easier to seat one person, and I got lucked out. A word of advice. Don't be showing up at 5:30 PM on a Saturday in a winter evening if patience is not your virtue, it's not mine, neither is enduring cold New England winter evening. I squeezed inside and did some work while waited. When my name was called up much earlier than I thought, I had expected attitudinal wait staff per the prior yelp post. Not at all. Super friendly staff. Very accommodating and excellent service. Everyone seems to be suggesting the same dishes. Skate cheek, oysters, and fish carpaccio. But what really made me happy was the cool looking cocktails. Mine had a smoky bubble. The popping of the bubble was fun with that Hawaiian flower. Tiki bars need to take notes. Oysters were excellent. So was the carpaccio. Light. The skate cheek felt very meaty and definitely something you don't see very often. Finally I had to do it. The fried clams. What an excellent add. Though I was super full and I had one bite. I packed the rest of the clams to go - figure I'd work out before I consumed some more later that evening.Quite surprisingly, there were approx. 30% of Asians dining there when I was there, which I found a bit curious. I had expected the ratio to be a lot lower, but if you are an Asian and reading this, well, you should definitely go because Asians in general tend to appreciate good seafood (see I can stereotype too and I often to), and this must be way better than the average for it to attract so many of us.I would definitely ask the bartender to suggest a cocktail instead of trying to figure out what to drink. And if you don't know what to order, just ask. The friendly servers will tell you exactly what to get, and all you had to do was to say "Okay, I'll get that."He just arrived in Boston tonight for work. When he called I said, "Hey are you going to Saltie Girl? You should get the cocktails."> Food is solid. Service is meh. Customers with large high ends branded items should at least be offered to store their items somewhere more reputable or, at very least, by some one with better common sense; I'm opposed to simply placed it right in front of the bathroom when every toilet users just have to kick on it. And no. We're not talking lack of space. There's a huge space that can stored our branded purchase easily. But the hostess chose not to do so, or lacked the common sense thereof as the case may be. A bit common sense can get you a long way. Try getting accustomed to the modern day mode of making reservations. It's modern practices and though your business is doing well from passerbys, it's be good to invest in long term customers.> I have mixed feelings about my experience. Everything was good but felt overpriced which makes expectations higher. I went at 5:00pm and was seated immediately. To start, we had the radicchio and endive salad, bread, and crab roll. The bread was very good and served warm. I could have eaten the basket myself!  The salad was a satisfactory salad- we enjoyed it. The crab rolls were very spicy and I don't like spice so that was a bad order for me. However, the size vs price was out of whack.For my entree I got the lobster roll. I've only had one other in my life so I'm not the best judge here but I found some pieces particularly chewy. It still was enjoyable but I wouldn't order it again. The chips that came with it are served cold in a bag and I thought they were a weak counterpart. Cape cod chips are crunchier and better in my opinion. We ordered french fries too and I think they would have been better paired with the roll than the chips. They were salty and flavorful. Would I go back? If it wasn't so expensive I'd say yes, but I am not sure.

Very cool atmosphere. The staff couldn't be nicer. Great bar areas- gets packed in the courtyard. Fun vibe- great colors and decor. Would like to see the menu expanded a bit of changed up a bit but there is enough there to choose from for sure. Definitely recommend.> I encourage everyone to check their bill before leaving. You will get charged with multiple extra items in hopes of you not noticing. Otherwise the place is definitely fun and the food is good.> Came for a friend's birthday dinner. Food was great, but drinks and service were lackluster. When our server came over to take our order, we asked for a few minutes due to a member of our party arriving late and she rolled her eyes at us and walked away. Getting her attention after we were ready to order also took forever.The Blood Orange Mule, which is advertised as a 'Super Sized Cocktail' for 4 or more people, was ordered by my friend as an individual serving. She was not impressed; it definitely tasted it was made in large batches ahead of time in anticipation of the larger serving sizes it usually comes in. The Luchador was lighter and more refreshing. The 3 of us shared the Gnudi as an appetizer- so delicious! The dumplings were so light and fluffy; I could've eaten a whole plateful. For entrees, we had the Chicken Asado (upon the server's recommendation), the Publico Burger, and the Pan Seared Cod. The burger was nothing to write home about, however, the chicken was perfectly moist and the cod was cooked to perfection. Desserts were an apple tart and chocolate mousse which were both very good, however, there was no acknowledgement by our server that we were celebrating a birthday which I had indicated when making our reservation. While I don't necessarily expect a complimentary dessert, adding a candle or birthday message to the plate would've been appreciated. At the very least, verbally saying happy birthday would have gone a long way. Getting the check took forever and we also ended up having to flag down another server to run our card. If we ever come back, it would be to check out the patio/lounge area (which was closed for a private event when we visited), but it probably won't be anytime soon.> TL;DR: Delicious food but atrocious wait times. Brunch for a group in a deserted restaurant was a 3+ hour ordeal. I'm unlikely to come back here unless bribed.I went to Publico with a large group of friends to celebrate a birthday. We had reservations for ~8 on a Saturday and were seated in the garden area. It feels like a patio but it's enclosed with a glass ceiling. While it was beautiful, it was actually quite chilly. I ate with my coat on even though there were numerous firepits that they didn't light. Food and drinks were delicious. I got a French Press coffee which was good, but I wish they had the option of espresso beverages too. We all split a magnum "Bubbles by the Bottle" which is the best deal if you have more than 3 or 4 people who want to drink mimosas (regular bottle rather than magnum is available). They come with three fruit purees so you can make the "mim" of your choice. I liked the blood orange the best but they were all good.I chose the chorizo benedict for my breakfast with a side of avocado. It was super tasty and a reasonable portion; I was able to finish but was very full. We also shared some donut holes for the table and I loved them. The rest of the group had similarly positive things to say about their food. Now for the ugly: service was painfully, PAINFULLY slow. When the first person arrived the waitress left water glasses and a couple of carafes of water for the table, then disappeared. For 45 minutes. Truly. She didn't come back to the table for over an hour. Everyone had arrived within ~20 of our reservation time so it's not like she was waiting for the full party. Even if that is the case, at LEAST take drink orders while people wait for the rest of your party. Once we finally ordered, it took another 40 minutes for our food to come out so we were all starving. At no point in the meal were the water carafes refilled so I started drinking the water bottle I thankfully always keep in my purse. At the end of the meal the waitress asked if we wanted anything else and we said, "no thanks, we're good." Typically that means, "we'll take the check." After 30 minutes, no check, and no sign of the waitress again. We finally brought a credit card to a busboy who was stocking the bar to pay. Absurd.> Publico is a trendy and fun spot to grab a bite in Southie. In the lounge area, you will find big comfortable couches, fireplaces, and a garden area. My friend and I ordered the chicken fingers and a Margherita pizza. It was essentially perfectly breaded chicken breast. It was delicious! I also ordered a hot chocolate in one of those cute antler mugs! Our servers were all incredibly friendly and attentive. The reason for 4/5 stars is the fact that it's almost impossible to find parking. Otherwise, I have no complaints.

The food and hospitality here are amazing to say the least. You can tell Eddie has a passion for his food and his energetic approach to customers is contagious. I'm here on a business trip and will be back again and again until I leave.> My wife is from overseas  and was missing her home cooked food.  We  decided to try this as it  was close and had good reviews.  Wow the food was spectacular just like "back home".  And the drinks were like we Had it overseas at home also.  Definitely another place we will go to on a regular occasion now to feel more homey> I was originally headed to little Italy.  That area was a mess, torn up streets, mobbed and no where to park.  I decided to heada back to my hotel in Winthrop Beach where I found this gem.  I ordered the whole Bronzini with roasted vegetables.  It came out of the kitchen perfectly done.  Then to my surprise the chef came out of the kitchen and offered to debone it at my table.  He was very skillful and quickly removed all the bones.  The fish was cooked and seasoned to perfection.  The grilled veggies were very flavorful and included sun  dried tomatoes, squash, artichoke hearts and capers.  The server was also very friendly.  I'm so glad I fled the  hustle and bustle of little Italy and instead had a wonderful meal in a much more relaxed environment.  Thanks for the great meal!> We came here from the reviews and I guess u can't really believe what u read. My GF and I will never return for sure. We ordered mussels which were suppose to come out with tomato's and bread. They came out with nothing and on top of it were so under cooked. For dinner I ordered steak tips and mashed potatoes with asparagus, it literally looked like bloody meat on a cloud. She ordered the salmon which looked amazing but when cut open was as raw as sushi. I really don't understand how u can under cook fish so badly. All I know is stay away and try something else. They need to hire a new cook. Out of the 10 of us here 6 returned there meals.> Had dinner with my husband on the deck last week.  My salmon was cooked perfectly (I'm picky about salmon and feel like it's always dry).  The veggies were delicious and my cucumber martini was awesome.  The waitress was super friendly and the view was beautiful.  Best place in Winthrop.

menu_dishes: The Our Burger, The Double Decker, The Triple Decker, BBQ Bacon Burger, O.F.D Burger, The Super Melt, The Melt, Thanksgiving Turkey Burger, The Impossible Burger, Our Burger Wahlbowl, Jenn's Chicken Wahlbowl, BBQ Bacon Wahlbowl, Jenn's Chicken Sandwich, Crispy Haddock Sandwich, Crispy Chicken Sandwich, Housemade Chili, Mac 'N Cheese, Crispy Yukon French Fries, Thin Crispy Onion Rings, Tater Tots, Sweet Potato Tots, Grilled Cheese, Smahlburger, Chicken Tenders, Kid's Mac 'N Cheese, All Beef Pearl Hot Dog, Kid's Soft Drink, Mac N Cheese, Fountain Drink, Bottled Mexican Soda, IBC Root Beer, Housemade Lemonade, Arnold Palmer, Aquahydrate, Fresh Brewed Iced Tea, Fresh Brewed Tea, Hot Coffee
popular_dishes: No, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: Fast friendly service quality burgersFavorite Tater Tos  Reasonable priceJob opportunity for neighborhood> The hamburger was ok ....The service from Jake the waiter Was the WORST I have Ever had.The cupcake was TERRIBLE !!!I have had day old pastries better than this.I So Very Disappointed.> My first time there. Been wanting to go so long since I was raised in Dorchester and LOVE NKOTB and Marky Mark.  I have to say I was disappointed. The burger was okay, but raw. Had I known I would have told them well, well, well done. They didn't even ask how I wanted my burger. I think they should ask and not just serve the raw hamburgers to everyone. I'll probably give them another chance - the menu looks interesting, but right now, I'm good with Five Guys.I did buy the chili and will update if the chili is AWESOME!Updating: the chili WAS AWESOME!!! I'll email you... thank you for paying attention to lil ole' me and my comments.> I come here often during my lunch breaks. I love getting their crispy haddock sandwich. Some of the items on the menu have been hit or miss for me. The employees there are super friendly but they have tendency to get my order wrong whenever I order through their mobile app which is disappointing. Luckily I work around the corner so I can just come in if there is a mistake but definitely should improve on getting orders correct. I have never sat down to eat here because it's always busy during the times I have come but if you like burgers then wahlburgers has a good selection of good burgers. They are pretty expensive so I wouldn't come here all the time. Burger will cost you anywhere from 8-$13. They have a good selection of salads if you are vegetarian and they just recently introduced the "Impossible Burger" to their menu that is worth trying out.> Don't waste your money! Just Spent $50 on lunch- curbside pick up , the staff forgot to put any plastic forks or spoons , essential for Mac n cheese.  Their phone rang out and I had to walk back in where the staff stood about and I requested plastic forks and napkins- burgers were disgusting and fries were not much better. We won't ever eat here again!

menu_dishes: ENGLISH PEA SOUP, TRUFFLED DUCK PATE, SALT ROASTED BEETS, SALADE BOUCHERON, ENDIVE SALADE, ESCARGOT BOURGIGNON, FRENCH ONION SOUP GRATINEE, BRAISED GARLIC SAUSAGE, SEARED SCALLOPS, STATLER CHICKEN ROTI, PAN SEARED GNOCCHI PARISIENNE, ROAST ROHAN DUCK BREAST, SOLE MEUNIERE, STEAK FRITES, BRAISED LAMB SHANK, FILET MIGNON AU POIVRE, CHARRED ASPARAGUS, FORAGED MUSHROOMS, HAND CUT POMMES FRITES, CHOCOLATE MOUSSE, CRME BRULEE, CHEESE CAKE, Saget la Perriere "La Petite Perriere" Sauvignon, Banshee Chardonnay, Saget la Pierre Marie de Beauregard Chinon, Averaen Pinot Noir, Trimbach Reserve Pinot Gris, Domaine Fournier Les Belles Vignes Sancerre, Cuve Felix de Biac, Centered Cabernet Sauvignon
popular_dishes: No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No
reviews: I'm a sucker for French restaurants and this one was no different to me. It has a really inviting but peaceful ambiance, an extensive wine selection, attentive and nice waitstaff, and a delicate touch to the foods they serve. I recently returned for Boston's Restaurant Week and it was just as good. My favorites from their menu are the Lemon Sole Meuniere and Bittersweet Chocolate Mousse. I also really enjoy their Cabernet Franc by the glass.> Dime out Boston brought us here on a crisp Sunday night. The setup going in was old timey and unique. The bar is located up front (where it should be) and dining in the back and they have a small parlor room to the side with nice on-street views. Host was very kind and seated us immediately with dine out BOS menus. Good selection and better yet a good price. We aren't the biggest earners out there so it's nice for restaurants to expand their cuisine access with Dine out Boston. Our meal:Drink: Old fashioned with Rye was well done. I cannot tell you how often I get mediocre old fashions. This was not one of them! Kudos to the bar as I got 2. Rye selection was pretty good too. Entree: The short rib was cooked to perfection and coupled with fine potatoes and veggies. I am a big rare meat eater and short ribs are hard to win me over so this was a nice delight. The cheesecake dessert was heavenly. I also want to mention the courses were well paced and not rushed in any manner. Service: Phenomenal. I forget my servers name (I usually don't so I greatly apologize!). She was incredible and funny making my partner and I feel at ease. In all I would welcome a return and very much hope they continue Dine Out Boston menus in the future.> Aquitaine is a cute little spot in the South End specializing in French cuisine. We had reservations for a group of 6 on a Friday night and were seated immediately which was great. The staff was so helpful in answering all our questions since most of us don't eat French food regularly and the menu, although descriptive, didn't provide much insight as to what each dish was.We started with the frog legs, escargot and mussels appetizers. The mussels were by far my favorite and served in such a cute little pot - perfect for our group. The other 2 apps were good, but nothing special. I ordered the butternut squash casserole for my entrée and again it was good, but nothing spectacular enough to order again. We also tried the bread pudding dessert which was perfectly crispy, chocolately and came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream which balanced out the meal. I'd have to say the drink I had was the best part of the night. I can't remember the exact name, but it had rosemary and gin. I ordered 2 over the course of the night and both tasted phenomenal - would definitely come back for another.Overall Aquitaine was a fun experience, but the food just isn't my thing. Everything was tasty, but if I do come back in the future it'll probably be to hang out at the bar and try some fun cocktails.> Solid brunch. My wife and I sat at the bar and it was a really nice experience. I got the western omelette and my wife got the Benedict with bacon on the side. I also got t he Rise and Shine and it was really flavorful. The bartender was great and we got out of there without breaking the bank on a Sunday for a place i thought was pretty pricey even for the area. Will go back.> Aquitaine is a small beautiful French restaurant in the South End. A couple of my girlfriends and I visited during Boston Restaurant Week, so our three-course meal was only $33 dollars. It felt like we were in Sex And The City. The music and the atmosphere were both modern & chic. I ordered the duck confit ravioli as an appetizer, the coq au vine rouge, without pancetta or bacon, as an entree, and the raspberry cheesecake for dessert. A lip-smacking experience to say the least. This heavenly meal was lovingly prepared. The succulent chicken retained a lot of its flavor and tenderness. Everything was unbelievably delicious! Our hostess and waitress were both incredibly friendly! It's worth the experience!

We found this place open in these uncertain times. The place was Super clean and the food was fantastic. Plus the water glasses were really cool. Thank you!> Hidden gem in Milton. Their maki rolls are unique and most importantly, fresh. The Taki Maki is perfect for fried oyster lovers like myself. Highly recommend the Owl and Four Seasons Maki!! Salmon sashimi came in thick cuts that were extremely satisfying. And last but not least, the uni nigiri was 10/10.> A rare find in Milton! Salmon sashimi came in thick, fresh pieces. Totally worth the price. Uni for $4/piece was creamy and sweet. Loved all of the rolls we ordered..especially the Four Season Maki, Owl Maki, and Taki Maki!!! Would recommend ordering take out, yum.> Best sushi spot in Milton! Perfect for lunch. My boyfriend and I came for lunch before our hike at blue hills. Parking may be a challenge we were lucky to find street parking. The restaurant was empty and quiet on a Saturday but don't let that deter you. My boyfriend and I got a booth by the window and we ordered a Sake Ikura Don (Japanese rice bowl with salmon sashimi and salmon roe) and a chirashi don. The meal came with a salad and miso soup. They served us water with lemon. Overall we would rate it a 4.5/5.> Rock solid, old school sushi and sashimi. Nothing is bad. Hot sake and cold beer. Hi Tojo!

One of the best Korean BBQ restaurants in Boston. It's also the ONLY pure All You Can Eat (AYCE) Korean BBQs in Boston. The selection of AYCE can be option A (limited menu) or option B (the whole menu). The side dishes consists of traditional korean dishes (kimchi, pickled radish, etc). They have the best steamed eggs in all the Korean restaurants in the area. Their Soon Tofu is refreshing and pairs well with soju. The meat selections are great--- ranging from pork belly, to brisket, bulgogi to kalbi. High quality.We've been regular customers for years. They've definitely gotten very busy during the years, especially the weekends. The 1 thing I can recommend improving on is the service on the weekends--- it can be slow at times due to high volume of customers. Other than that, great price for a quality AYCE Korean BBQ meal.> 2 minutes agoAbsolutely horrible. Second time coming first time was amazing second time absolutely horrible, they treated us like peasants our pot kept getting too burnt. Our server even went to Dunkin donuts, barely ate one round there was not checked up on. Waited like 15 minutes for the bill, had to get up and just pay. Manager did not apologize or offer any help. Bad customer service wont recommended unless you want a burn hot pot or bad service.> I am a reoccurring customers for sura bbq. Every time when I crave kbbq, this would be my go to place. It is an all you can eat kbbq. Service was always great and if you pay in cash you can get 5% off. For those who are new to kbbq, I HIGHLY recommend this place! They bring you raw meat and you grill your meat yourself! It is an great experience for those first timer. Food is great and they also sell korean alcoholic beverages. They have different flavor soju (Strawberry, Peach, Plum, original, maybe grape too?...and my all time favorite Apple) with price of 15$ per bottle. They also have makgeolli (rice wine) and imported beers!> Hands down my favorite Korean BBQ place of  all time. I don't typically love Korean BBQ because I feel the sauces lean sweet and I am 110% a spicy food person but here when you ask for a spicy dipping sauce they DELIVER! I chose option B to have access to all of the meat and I really recommend the beef ribs with and without sliced bone and the thinly sliced beef and the spicy chicken thighs. PHENOMENAL! The meat cooks fast. The spicy tofu soup was delicious and flavorful. My date really loved the garlic sauce and I recommend it as well. I love when you first come in and sit down they provide you with kimchi/tiny appetizers right away to munch on. Hands down my all time favorite Korean BBQ place in Boston.  I appreciated the decor of the place with Korean music videos and comfy booth style seating. The bathrooms were very clean. This is a good place to bring families for sure. I had a young waiter and waitress and I wish I caught their names they were both attentive and helpful and patient. The bus-man who came to switch out our hot BBQ metal trays was also very sweet and smiley so kudos to management for hiring three great workers.> I love this place. Word of advice, come to this place hungry cause the portions are HUGE. If you're worried about cooking the food yourself and need assistance, the waiters are more than happy to help you! PSA, wear clothes you intend to throw in the wash immediately, the smell of BBQ will be on your clothing. The Korean BBQ menu has 2 options, Course A is limited to basic meats and course B that consists of everything they have to offer. (Splurge on course B if you want better beef options.) They have a "5 meat" selection limit per order just so no food is wasted, you can always order more. I recommend the marinated thin beef, beef short rib, LA beef short rib, steamed egg, bean paste soup, and the black pork belly.Food: 4Service: 4Ambiance: 3Value: 3Overall: 4

menu_dishes: Chopped Salad, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Bolognese, Fusilli, Pomodoro, Spaghetti & Clams, Lobster Fritatta, Grilled Salmon, Chicken Cutlet, Chicken Parm, Steak & Cheese, Seafood Stew
popular_dishes: Yes, No, No, Yes, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, No, Yes
reviews: Amazing food.  The best oysters in Boston.  The best lobster pie in New England. Cocktails have room for improvement but Il Molo makes up for it with an extensive fantastic wine list.  Is definitely a hidden gem right off the main track of the north end.  A must dine!> I took a group of 13 to IL Molo. We shared 12 dishes and asked to have them served 4 at a time. The first 4 came out barely warm. After complaining the next 8 were nice and hot.The bread we were originally served tasted like it had been sliced long ago as the exposed surfaces were stale. After complaining, we received delicious fresh bread for the rest of the mesl3 of our dishes contained lobster but all I found were the claw tips. When asked, they admitted 2 only had the tips but said that the lobster pie had tail meat but I couldn't find any.The scallops were delicious as well as the spaghetti and clams and lobster pie. The seafood stew was plentiful and tasty except for the tough lobster claw tips. When I have lobster at home, the tips go to my dog. It seems that more and more restaurants only serve claws which leads me to believe they are not cooking whole lobsters but just buying pre-cooked claws which are most likely far less expensive than tails. (This is my hypothesis and not a verified fact for Il Molo.) The service was good and our party overall liked our meals.> The service and food was fantastic. Our server had great recommendations for wine that both my husband and I loved. The mussels were beautiful done with a great broth that made us ask for a second round of bread to sop it up. We then split an order of linguini and clams that was perfectly seasoned with al dente pasta. I would return here in a second!> Such a good italian/seafood destination! Came for dinner to meet up with some friends in the area and was surprised I had never heard of it while living in Boston for 6 years for school. It's a little separated from the rest of the North End and has a slightly more modern and sea-themed feel/decor. Don't let the seashells and starfish fool you though, you still get amazing quality pasta and italian flavors!Prix fixe menu: $32 for 3 courses, and you get a lot of food! I took home leftovers. I had the grilled lamb skewers, the lasagna, and the rum cake (as they were sadly all out of the gelato and the cannoli that night). The lamb was cooked really well, the lasagna was super flavorful and cheesy, and the cake was moist and delicious! Oysters: not pictured, but we went for a selection of 3 total, one of each variety they had that day. They came with lemon, tabasco, and two sauces-one of them was raspberry flavored which was kind of fun!Swordfish: really really good! The cook on the fish was perfect and it had a good crispiness on the outside. Definitely worth it and the quality you would expect with the Boston Harbor basically right outside.> Awesome experience here. Lovely fruity olive oil with crusty bread to start, tasty lobster rangoon with nice chunks of lobster in it, and beautiful main dishes. The only negative was the bar tender- who was not nice. The waitress and hostess were over the top helpful and attentive though. I got the pasta arrabbiata with mussels and octopus, and my friend got a fish dish which had salsa and lobster in top. They make the pasta there and the seafood is extremely fresh.

These guys know how to do ramen! I have never been here and not experienced some sort of line. But don't let that turn you away! You can add your name to the waitlist ahead of time through Yelp or if you forget, they move through the list pretty quickly. (how long does it take to eat ramen anyway?!) I always order the Tan Tan ramen because it is so flavorful and fulfilling and tastes like it should be super rich, but it's not fatty or heavy at all. Their prices are a little higher (~$12) than another ramen joint that I equally love, but it is so worth it. This restaurant is located in a little shopping center with several other businesses. Parking is on the street and has never been a problem.> Definitely a hole in the wall kind of restaurant. The restaurant is inside of a plaza and its actually pretty small, but it has a vibe where you eat and go rather than stay and socialize. The hostess was very kind and you order before you are seated. The menu is fairly small with about 6 ramen options and various drink options like soft drinks and beers. We ordered the shoyu, spicy miso, gantetsu shoyu, and dumplings. The food came out very fast and the dumplings came from their other restaurant right across (Gantetsu-Ya I believe). The flavors were very rich and it came with the right amount of ramen. My only problem was that the broth was salty for me. I love to drink the broth, but I couldn't do it with this. It tasted great with the noodles, but was too much on its own.The pricing isn't too bad either. Would definitely come back for a quick meal!> I had heard so much about this place and finally visited for the first time! Fun fact: they own the takoyaki+okonomiyaki place across from this ramen restaurant so I would try there too after my experience last night!My friend and I were looking for simple dinner and came across this place on Yelp. We got on the waitlist, said 30-45 mins. We drove over and parked but there was still a wait. Its THAT popular! We got there, the bathrooms here require a key from the host. Theres a small fenced area for waiting. The host gave us a menu to look at while we waited. The great thing is that there's legit 6 ramens to choose from, quick, simple and easy for us. We ordered before we got seated. Once we were seated, we were served within 15 minutes. The ramen there are not only photogenic but super tasty and flavorful! The inside is a bit tight in space but def worth the wait!> Make sure to use the waitlist on Yelp before coming here or else you can easily wait up to 2 hours during peak times (Friday night and weekends).Came here twice and loved it both times.Ordered:1) Gantetsu Shoyu - Comes with sliced cha-shu, bean sprouts, ajitama, menma, onions, and scallions. This is a shoyu broth. The broth is super rich and garlicy so if you love garlic, you will love this ramen. This one is probably the most popular one here, and you can't go wrong with it. I usually get this if I'm not feeling spicy.2) Gankara Miso (Spicy Miso) - comes with sliced cha-shu, bean sprouts, cabbage, ajitama, pork, scallions, and corn. This is a spicy miso broth. I LOVE this one, especially on a cold day when I just want that spicy tingle in me to get the blood going. It is not super spicy so if your tolerance isn't that high, don't worry. It's just enough spice to get you fired up.Honestly, I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The ramen here is darn delicious! This is a must go-to for ramen lovers in Boston.> I came with my boyfriend on a weekend evening for dinner It was SO FREAKING full, and the restaurant space was so small, so we had to wait around 1.5 hours before being seated. It was so bad I almost walked out right before our name was called. Even using yelp to get on the waitlist early didn't help this time. I ordered the Gantetsu Shoyu, my boyfriend ordered the Tan Tan, and we shared a plate of takoyaki. I'm a huge fan of big flavor, so I went for the ramen that was advertised to have the richest flavor. I really liked the Gantetsu Shoyu, but I didn't think the flavors were as prominent as I had hoped they'd be. It still still tasted great, but wasn't as flavorful as they had hyped it up to be. My boyfriend said his Tan Tan broth was too spicy, but I found it to be really delicious! The takoyaki was definitely my favorite part - I don't think I've had better takoyaki anywhere else! The service was decent. The waitress was relatively attentive. Overall, we had a really great time! I'll be back next time I'm in the area!

I honestly don't know where to start, I've been ordering here for over a year now, the food is amazing! There isn't any soul food in Boston, as good as there's. The portion size is enough to fill you up twice. I always get the fried chicken and Mac n cheese but their oxtails are certainly good too. If you want southern hospitality and flavor, definitely highly recommended!> This food took me back to my roots! The embodiment of Soul Food and southern beginnings. The owner treated my husband and I with kindness and welcoming southern hospitality. I'm so excited to take my friends and family to this black owned business. Amen!> Next Step should be your next stop...if you're looking for soul food. This place did not disappoint. I came across their site on a day when I just needed something to stick to my ribs, and the food did just that! I called in my order before arriving and it was seamless. A very pleasant guy answered, helped me understand the menu options and placed my order with ease. When I arrived my food was ready and smoking hot. I didn't plan to eat in but the food smelled so good I had to try it. I probably finished more than half my plate lol! To make it even better they had every kind of hot sauce I could've wanted in the restaurant. Next step gets 4 stars from me for great food and great service.> Michelle is an absolute treasure. We used her catering services for multiple community events and she never disappoints! Even better food in person at her amazing storefront.Don't miss out, go here.> I asked, "What do you recommend?"... She answered, "Everything!!".  I had the fried chicken dinner with collards and yellow rice. My friend had catfish and cabbage. Both meals were super. The woman (owner?) was so friendly. Stop in and enjoy yourself.

menu_dishes: Chau Gio Sai Gon saigon Rolls, Goui Cuoan spring Rolls, Salmon Taui Chanh salmon Carpaccio, Tuna Taui Chanh tuna Garlico Jalapeno, Bo Taui Chanh - Beef Carpaccio, Mama Chicken Wings, Chau Gio Aunh Hoang aunh Hoang Rolls, Chim Cuut Quay roasted Quails, Hoanh Thaunh Soup, Soft Or Crispy Shrimp Wonton Soup, Soup Maeng Taay Cua, Asparagus Crab Meat Soup, Chauo Bo, Beef Porridge, Goui Bo - Beef Salad, Goui Sen Toam Thot pork & Shrimps Lotus Salad, Salad Ga chicken Salad Dressed In Ginger Sauce, Huu Tieau Aunh Hoang combination Rice Stick Noodle, Mi Aunh Hoang combination Rice Egg Noodle, Phou beef Noodle Soup, Toam Rim - Sauteued Shrimps Lemongrass, Ga Xao Xao Out - Sauteued Chicken Red Lemongrass Sauce, Ga Ram Gong - Sauteued Ginger Chicken, Bo Luuc Laec shaking Beef, Ga Cari - Curry Chicken, Cari Noa Biean seafood Curry, Cau Kho Toa salmon In Clay Pot, Com Tay Caam clay Pot Combination, Chaio Toam Baunh Houi chaio Toam, Toam Thot Nooung Baunh Houi - Grilled Pork & Shrimps Baunh Houi, Bo Cuoan Toam Baunh Houi - Beef Shrimps Rolls, Ga Nooung Baunh Houi bbq Chicken W/ Rice Cake, Thot Nooung Baunh Houi bbq Pork W/ Rice Cake, Bo Lau Loap - Beef W/ Lot Leaf Rolls, Bo Mou Chai - Beef Sausage, Bo Nooung Xao - Beef Lemongrass Rolls, Bo Ba - 3x Grilled Beef Platter, Bo Chau Num - Beef Meat Balls, Baunh Xeo vietnamese Crepe, Cau Nooung Da Gion roasted Whole Catfish, Com Ga bbq Chicken Rice Plate, Com Bo Naii Han bbq Short Rib Rice Plate, Com Naec Bieat combination Rice Plate, Com Thot Nooung grilled Slices Of Pork Rice Plate, Mi Xao Don Thaap Caam crispy Chowmein, Mi Xao Meam Thaap Caam soft Chowmein, Vegetarian Eggroll, Vegetarian Fresh Wrapped Spring Roll, Tofu Cari -
